The next stretch goal is another ambitious one with several parts, but I’m confident we’ll get there!

Hi everyone, 
Thank you SO MUCH for your incredible support! We're getting very close to meeting our first stretch goal at $3k to add 6 scenarios for the game! I wanted to talk about these for a moment and why I'm particularly excited for the writers we've got lined up.
TOKEN, like most games branching off of Trophy, is designed to be played with a bare skeleton of game setting—players build on the theme and fill in details of the world as they go. Each of these scenarios will include an of the story being framed, some which might be included, and . This lets the players pick a few things that sound interesting and dive in to the game with .

campaign.story:
Coral Island is a re-imagined farm sim game inspired by classics. Grow crops, nurture animals, and befriend the islanders. Decide whether to revitalize not only the town but also the surrounding coral reefs.  
Promising to keep intact what makes classic farm sim games fun, Coral Island aims to modernize and make the experience more inclusive. We feature a large cast of diverse characters and weave environmental awareness into the core game loop —  all the while keeping it a wholesome good time.


There are over 50 islanders living on Coral Island. Coming from all walks of life, get to know these people by chatting them up — extra brownie points for gifts!

Transform your overrun land into a lush and lively farm. Find your play style by deciding what crops to grow, which animals to nurture, or what structures to build.
Choose from a variety of crops, flowers, fruit plants, and trees. There are over 75 plantables in the game, ranging from age-old classics to the exotic and obscure native to Asia.
Crops are seasonal, which means they only grow in a specific season. However, some crops can be planted in multiple seasons and be re-harvested every several days. 
Fruit plants take 11 days to mature. They are bi-seasonal, able to grow 2 seasons out of the year, and will wither offseason. Does not need to be watered after maturity.
Fruit Trees take 28 days to mature and will not wither off-season. They bear 1 fruit a day, every day for the season, and will continue to bear fruit every year.

Make a living by caring for animals and raising livestock. Though you'll first need to build a coop or barn to house them! These farm animals can be left outside during the day and will return inside as night falls.


Poultry are farm animals that live in a coop. If fed daily, mature poultry usually produces 1 egg, and sometimes, a feather.

Barn-dwelling animals range from the traditional Sheep and Cow to Luwak and Llamas. They need to be brushed and fed daily to keep their produce flowing.

Dive into the ocean to restore the coral reefs! Select a diving spot around the island, and unlock deeper levels to explore. Unravel all that the ocean has to offer.
Clean up the sea bed to make a home for rare fish, and collect ocean kelp to hone the quality of livestock and crop.
Bring processed kelp to Ling's Lab to permanently upgrade the quality of your products. Decide which you'll upgrade first: seeds, saplings, seedlings, fodder, or bait.
16 singles and ready to mingle. Sweep them off their feet and find the one. Find out what their personalities are like, take them on a date, and fall in love!
 Unlock various relationship scenes and when you're ready, build a life together at the farm — perhaps even have children. Yes, no, maybe?
Go deep into the caverns to mine precious gemstones — use the loot to upgrade your tools and farm. But beware, monsters protect rare finds so bring a weapon or two!
Packed with a variety of outfits, accessories, and options to choose from, you are armed with plenty of styles to express yourself. Conform to the community or be different! There is no wrong answer because there is only one you in Coral Island.
Select 1 out of 3 starter houses. Upgrade, decorate… personalize! Purchase furniture, collect paintings and display exclusive decorations. Welcome home, Farmer.
Catch a variety of fish, starfish, and squid! There are also crabs at the beach. Fun fact! Several freshwater and saltwater fish can only be caught at specific seasons or certain times (i.e: at summer dawn, or rainy winters).
Coral Island was once home to an expansive variety of aquatic life. As you restore the island's ecosystem, more types of fish will be available to catch. Perhaps, you'll even cross paths with something legendary?
Level up! As you make your way around the island, you will earn skill points that can be invested into skills. 
Decide on a path and create an experience unique to you. Along the way, you'll unlock new, exciting techniques that might come in handy on the farm!
Get busy and immerse yourself in Coral Island! You can pick projects to work on or a fun skill to develop in your free time... or not. Your time, your choice. Here are some of the additional features in Coral Island worth noting.
Improve the town: Take part in community projects to build and liven up the town. Spare some extra gold to add a community garden for the locals or build a brand new museum and more…
Festivals: Join the local community in a Cherry Blossom Festival, annual beach clean up, and many more. There are 2 festivals each season that you can participate in.
Pets: Choose a companion. Decide between a dog, cat, monkey, fox & more! Your pet will play around the farm and come inside the house.
Weather & Time: The forecast includes sun, wind, rain, storm, and snow. Coral Island also features a day and night cycle with dynamic lighting.  Set the pace by adjusting the passage of time with a time slider.
Cooking: Build a kitchen and start cooking. With over 70 recipes to learn, including Popiah, Lodeh, and Cauliflower Casserole. Gather all cooking utensils and try them all.
Quests: Embark on adventures! There are elaborate quests that will give you cutscenes and storylines, and there are simple quests. Rack up relationship points and get paid!


Welcome to your new home, a small town with big personalities called Starlet Town. It's located on the coast of Coral Island. This tropical island features a setting loosely influenced by Southeast Asia. You'll see this come across the lore, world-building, crops, animals, and more. Nestled in between the equator and northern tropic, Coral Island is graced by four seasons per year.

This is Coral Island. Segmented into 7 different areas, your farm is located on the left side of the map, just on the outskirts of town.
 Starlet Town is the heart of Coral Island. Not only is it roomy and features a butterfly garden, but this charming little town also has stories hidden behind its townies.
The Beach is rich with sparkly white sands, seashells, and seasonal fruits. On the pier sits a handsome old Inn and a gateway to ocean exploration, the Diving spot. 
The Lake perhaps guards the most magical place in Coral Island. Find your way through the wooden bridge and discover the ancient temple. It’s believed to be the main source of water and where the island's rich soil originates from.
The Forest is a mystic sanctuary for wildlife, filled with ruins and who-knows-what. Underneath the musky floor, it's a hoarding place for messages from the past, the Cavern.
The Lookout used to be a place where locals prepared for battles of old and whatnot. As time passed, the Lighthouse is now solely used for navigational aid. Come here and enjoy wicked sunsets and pick some wild fruits on your way home.
The Woodlands used to be part of the Forest, but since the arrival of humans, it is now tamed and family-friendly, without losing its green allure. Walk alongside the river to see the School, Taco Truck, and houses belong to those who prefer quiet nights over paved pathways of the town.
 Hillside, sandwiched between the Forest and Woodlands, is the perfect combination of green and privacy. Take a peek at the Vineyard and familiarize yourself with the local Carpenters.

The Coral Three were said to be the Goddess of Flowers, Merfolk, and Giants. Once upon a time, they worked together to maintain the balance of Coral Island. 
The Goddess of Flowers was worshipped by both Merfolk and Giants. To this day, locals continue to believe that the Goddess is responsible for rejuvenating the island's water, soil, and well-being.
Submerged artifacts suggest The Merfolk Kingdom protected the oceans. It appears they were tasked with ruling the underwater world around Coral Island, making sure that order was maintained.
Legend has it The Kingdom of Giants existed to cultivate the rich soil of Coral Island. Ruins around the island depict Giants, and what appear to be humans, farming alongside one another.

Pufferfish Drilling Corp. is a disgraced company whose goal is to drill oil on and around Coral Island. Set to open this Spring, they plan to lobby their way into the community and collect properties to secure voting rights.


We hope to color your days in Coral Island through music. Please listen to several key tracks that can already transport you to the shores of the island:

Step 3: At the end of the Kickstarter campaign, a survey will be emailed to you. Please confirm how the add-on money should be assigned then.

The current plan is to release Coral Island for Steam on the Windows platform first. Since we've passed our Console Stretch Goals, Coral Island will also be coming to Nintendo Switch, Playstation, and Xbox! 

We understand that localization is very important. Coral Island will launch into early access with Bahasa Indonesia and English support. Shortly after, we will update the game to support the additional 8 languages seen below.
Based in Indonesia, our team currently consists of 20 passionate talents. This includes both permanent crew members and remote collaborators. Although this is our first game as a studio, our team is comprised of veteran and junior game developers.
You can learn more about us on our website: www.stairwaygames.com

Our goal is to release the best version of Coral Island. We believe the only way to achieve this is through community involvement. With Kickstarter, we hope to build a community of passionate backers and involve you all in the process of development. All in service of producing the best farming game we can create.  
So far, development has been entirely self-funded. Although we have enough funds to complete the game, there are several features we would love to add but don't have the resources to do so. It's always been our dream to play a farming game that features changing seasonal outfits for NPC's, or finally, having kids grow up! We hope Kickstarter helps us realize some of the stretch goals we have for Coral Island.
As backers, we invite you to join our Discord to see daily developer diaries and have a direct open line of communication with us. 

Development began in October 2019. Initially, we focused on preproduction and coding core features that now serve as the foundation of Coral Island. Over the last 6 months, we've shifted gears into full production.  
Our focus right now is finalizing and polishing content for the Alpha that will be released to Alpha Farmer tier backers and above. From there, we'll work alongside the community, releasing two content updates and iterating feedback into the game before eventually launching into Steam's early access.



This campaign is promoted by Backercamp. Since 2012, Backercamp has helped 5,000+ creators make their projects a reality, raising over $300MM through crowdfunding.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We've been working on Coral Island for close to 15 months now. 

The two biggest challenges we see ahead for the project are developing alongside community feedback and, provided we reach the stretch goal, implementing the multiplayer component into the game. 

Depending on the amount and type of feedback we receive, the dates for milestones on the development timeline may shift. Should dates shift, we'll openly communicate this to the community.

campaign.story:
I Am Hexed: is a 4 part series full color, original comic written by me, Kirsten Thompson.
Thanks to the magic of our amazing Kickstarter Coven our Issue #3 campaign was an amazing success!
This Kickstarter Campaign is for Issue #4, the final issue of our story. The fourth issue's script is complete and with your help we can go full speed ahead to commission art production and make issue #4 a reality!
Thanks for checking out my Kickstarter and Joining the Movement!
WE ARE NOW UNLOCKING STRETCH GOALS!!! SCROLL TO THE BOTTOM TO SEE THE MAGICAL ADDITIONS! 
 I Am Hexed is a supernatural political thriller. There’s magic, mystery, personal drama, and an accidentally carnivorous plant.
Witches have been a part of the political fabric of Washington D.C. since it was founded. It’s only since the 1960s that witches stood together and fought to take back the word “Hexed”. A movement was ignited when witches came out of the shadows and proudly showed off their broomsticks.
The witch-hunt for Charlie, Jaya and Florence continues as they find themselves on the run from malevolent forces both inside and outside the government. The three witches must harness their powers to defend themselves, while unraveling a mystery that could save the entire witching community.

Kirsten Thompson is a comic writer and editor based in the Pacific Northwest. In addition to being the creator and writer of I AM HEXED, she has been a consultant on such comics as Kim & Kim volume 2, a staff writer at The MNT and her writing has also appeared in Teen Vogue, Femsplain and Women Write About Comics.
Amagoia Agirre is a freelance illustrator and comic artist based in Spain. She is currently working on various projects including illustrated books, tabletop rpgs, and short comics. If she is not locked up in her studio drawing you’ll probably find her walking in the woods accompanied by her dog Iggy.
Paulina Ganucheau is a comic artist and illustrator based wherever her computer lives. She is the creator of Lemon Bird with an original GN out in 2022 and co-creator of Zodiac Starforce published by Dark Horse Comics. Her hobbies include watching pro-wrestling, cloud photography, and following cats on Instagram.
Jenn St-Onge is the bog witch/comic artist behind Dynamite’s NANCY DREW & THE PALACE OF WISDOM, IDW’s JEM & THE MISFITS, and Harper Collins' upcoming THE OJJA-WOJJA, along with a selection of cover work for companies such as Archie Comics, BOOM! Studios, Valiant Entertainment, Oni Press and more. Queer spoonie residing in a state of perennial spookiness (but who can be found corporeally manifesting around Ottawa, Canada most days)
Taylor Esposito is a comic book lettering professional, owner of Ghost Glyph Studios and teacher at the legendary Kubert School. A former staff letterer at DC and production artist at Marvel, he has lettered titles such as Red Hood and The Outlaws and Constantine; Interceptor, Heavy, Finger Guns (Vault Comics), Exorsisters, Jook Joint (Image), Babyteeth, Hot Lunch Special, Knock ‘em Dead (Aftershock), and No One Left to Fight (Dark Horse). Other publishers he has worked with include Line Webtoon (Caster, Backchannel) Dynamite (Elvira, Red Sonja and Vampirella meet Betty and Veronica, Green Hornet), and IDW (Scarlett’s Strike Force).
Bex Glendining is a biracial, queer, UK based illustrator and comic artist who loves drawing modern monsters and slice of life. When not working, they can usually be found building gundams, playing video games with friends or buying new plants.
Yoshi Yoshitani has always been inspired by cultures, histories, mythologies, and patterns from around the world. She uses this inspiration to fuel her concepts and illustrations.
Alane Grace is a Filipino-American Illustrator & Design artist living in Pasadena, CA. In recent years, she has credited work as a background painter for Crunchyroll's Onyx Equinox and Hulu's Solar Opposites. She loves to draw a certain winter spirit and a fairy queen.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The production and project management of this title is “in-house” and comfortably in my control, eliminating many variables that could cause delays. That being said, some of the things that rely on external production (The manufacture of rewards, logistics of packing & shipping individual rewards) may cause some delays. 

Depending on the print quantity, we may choose to print our books in Canada or overseas. If so, there could be problems such as our books being held in customs, and longer shipping times. 

I have spent the past eight months planning and refining this project. I have accounted for these potential problems and worked them into our schedule. 

Everyone will be updated every step of the way, throughout the entire production process. Of course, we will notify you of any setbacks that may arise. 

Thank you for casting your bit of magic on I Am Hexed!

campaign.story:
Weightless is a collection of illustrations from 2020. Each work inspired by an oscillating feeling of both quiet, rest, wonder and freedom, with a respect for nature and the ethereal. A purely visceral form of personal musings from paper, to screen, to book.

Within it are odes to the fantastical, natural, celestial and mundane, with an everyday touch. Some illustrations are present to send a clear message; others just silly doodles, but made with love all the same. 

Each illustration's goal is to bring the viewer a sense of peace, a wayward thought, or a nostalgic reprieve - weightlessness.



That's about it, really.
Hello, I'm Geneva! I like drawing and fantasy.
You see, I like being all poetic and deep and stuff, but have a hard time expressing it in real life through words and actions. So I try to express it and my fleeting thoughts as best I can through drawing. 
A proprietary focus is on people of color, most notably black women. I try to portray the true beauty and softness of black women especially, as so much of this is seemingly lacking in other forms of media. As a black woman myself, I feel as though it's my duty to showcase our grace for others like me and beyond, who longed to see fantastical portrayals of it our whole lives.
You can find more art on my portfolio HERE, Instagram HERE, and Twitter HERE. I also sell prints and other items on my self-run store HERE

*mockups
Prototype! Hardbound with a semi-gloss cover

120+ pages, 110+ illustrations, 8.5 x 11 inches
The book would contain illustrations from 2020-early 2021, along with sketches, process shots, tutorials on how I work, random musings, and a FAQ. 
My aim is to keep this campaign laser-focused on the book itself! If it lovingly reaches past the funding goal, then extra will go towards refining the book itself. This would include choosing finer paper stocks and a more striking finish for the cover! Basically, the goal of this campaign is to make this book itself as lovely as possible. 


*mockups

16 illustrations, 8 x 8 inches
The coloring book would contain both new/exclusive illustrations and old favorites! Each illustration would be outlined in bold black for easy coloring, on an extra thick paper stock.

*mockups
Exclusive print, Angelus. 8.5 x 11 with golden foil accents! 
Each print is signed, soft to the touch and accented with gold. This artwork will only be available to acquire through this campaign.
*mockups

This cloudy-nostalgia themed mini notebook and postcard set comes with every artbook tier upwards!
Process / Shipping:
The vast majority of the budget is printing of the book itself (70%), with the remaining going to making the prints and other extras, and shipping.
The book's components are nearly complete, with a planned full completion during the duration of the Kickstarter and funds waiting period of about two weeks post-campaign. 
 Then it's off to the printers! If everything goes as planned with a little wiggle room, books will start going out late May / early June. Shipping of the books would be done in batches every few days (frequency depending on state of the pandemic, to reduce exposure at that point).  I will give frequent status updates on the whereabouts of the books, prints, etc until shipping from me to you is completed.
International Shipping:
United Kingdom - currently, due to new VAT rules, I am sorry to say I will not be able to fulfill books going to the UK, as I am not currently able to comply/apply to new regulations. Backers with shipping addresses to the UK will have their pledges refunded. I apologize for all the inconvenience!
International: Worldwide books will be sent via USPS First Class International with tracking. As of now, the shipping speed could take between 2 to 8 weeks for arrival. A clear, triple-checked address is crucial to getting your book safely! Please contact me if you have any extra questions about shipping.
Thank you for your incredible consideration and support. With everyone's help, this book can really uplift and inspire.

campaign.story:
The Year is 2069...
The setting is Great Britain. The Tories have been in power since 2010. 
Due to National Health Service cuts, trans healthcare has become increasingly hard to access. The waiting list for a first appointment at a gender identity clinic is now 300 years. They don’t want to outright refuse you; that would imply that the health service is over capacity or underfunded. Instead they will simply add you to the end of the list and wait for you to die. 
But they are fools. For you have learned the secrets of immortality. And you will get to the end of that waiting list, even if it means waiting another millennium.

cover image


The Game
Lichcraft is a rules-light tabletop RPG set up to be played with 2 or more players. The play is inspired by Forged in the Dark systems, with a simple D6-pool resolution mechanic. Instead of choosing classes or players, characters begin by choosing their politics, hobby, day job, and magical source, and use attributes from these to add to their dice rolls. 
Give this game a try if you like dystopian settings, collaborative world-building and play,  magic wielding queer characters,  interesting and individualistic ways of spellcasting, and undeath as a metaphor for... something.

Premise
In this game, you play trans characters in dystopian Britain,  50 years in the future.  You have been trapped at the bottom of a waiting list for vital gender affirming healthcare. The list is far longer than a mortal human lifespan. 
As a result you have decided to pursue lichdom. Over the course of the game you will gather all the components for the ritual necessary to become an undead creature of great arcane power, at which point you may either transform yourselves however you choose, or wait things out in your new immortal bodies- you have all the time in the world.
This is a game about spite, necromancy, being trans, and a 300 year long NHS waiting list. Although the game itself deals with serious themes, it is set up to be tongue-in-cheek, satirical, super queer, and intimate. 
a basic character sheet
What You're Backing
The core game has already been written and is available to download on itch.io. Backers will all get access to the digital PDF, available as soon as I can send you a backer email. This kickstarter will enable new layout and art for the current game, as well as the printing of a physical zine for #zinequest3. 

The zine itself will be printed on A5, with one colour (neon pink) and interior and exterior illustrations.  It includes core rules, play examples, safety tools, a character sheet, and adventure generation tables, as well a a set of rituals to help with your ascent into lichdom. 

You are also backing a cool project produced by  a trans writer and contributed to by trans and disabled artists and writers. That's it. 

Stretch Goals
£900 : More art! Interior illustrations for Lichcraft will be added to by Ema (@spookymeal) Ema is an amazing trans artist and game writer who draws beautiful characters. You can check out her work here: https://spookymeal.tumblr.com/ 

£1000: Expanded Rituals page by Sam D (@sdunnewold) Sam is the  writer of Doskvol Breathes, and their writing is incredibly thoughtful, emotional, and reflective. The ritual pages for Lichcraft already offer a chance for players and characters to reflect on the game, their own identities, and their experiences in the process of lich ascension. An additional rituals page from Sam would expand this and give more options for the game's conclusion. You can find Sam's work at https://stone-arch-bridge-troll.itch.io/ 

£1,600: More art by Kristen (@KristenChin8) Kristen is the cover artist and, if we meet this stretch goal, I'll be able to pay her to illustrate each title section of the zine. Any more money raised after this will just go towards paying everyone involved in the project more.  

And our new 10k stretch goal: 4 alternate quarter page settings for th game!
At £10,000, the final zine will include four quarter page alternate settings for lichcraft- each with their own unique vibe and one additional d6 table. Lichcraft 4069: a Wargamepunk alternate Britain, featuring an immortal queen ruling with an iron fist, and many, many trans orcs. LICHCRAFT IMPERIUM: The Year is 269 AD. Long have the romans held dominion over your province. But you and your super queer gang of raiders are going to change all that. And also become liches. Lichcraft 1869: A Western version of lichcraft, trans cowboys* robbing trains and taking names. Lichcraft 200069: Trans space pirates taking on the space tories. It’ll work, I promise .
Spotlights
One of the amazing things about Zinequest are all the fantastic creators and projects involved. I want to take a second to highlight some of them: go check out, and back, these pages. I'm gonna be adding more to this list throughout ZQ: please send me your recs!

Crescent Moon  is an adventure RPG about brave children and their dreams, shadows, and discoveries.
This Night on the Rooftops is a game about gazing out over the smokestacks after dark, with the wind in your hair and a friend at your side and a thousand lights of progress on the streets below.
Tomb of Immolation is an exploration of an ancient prison-tomb that has been partially flooded with lava.
External Containment Bureau is a tabletop roleplaying game of paranormal investigation and bureaucracy.
High Speed Low Drag is a solo journalling TTRPG that follows the career of an elite soldier on and off the battlefield.

As we hit the last 48 hours, we're 2k off hitting that last stretch goal. Hi everyone, I’m gonna start this update by saying IF YOU HAVENT ALREADY FILLED OUT YOUR BACKER SURVEY PLEASE DO! Especially if you are an EU resident, more on that below. It’s nearly time to start shipping out orders.

First things first: I am waiting on one writer to finish off a few bits, then the whole game text is complete. I went ahead and got some proof copies and printed all the bookmarks that I’m going to need.

Hi everyone, 

You should all now have got your backer surveys, please let me know if you have not!

What this means is that we are hopefully on track to finish everything up by late May, and deliver slightly ahead of schedule! Of course, this is subject to change but we are definitely on schedule :) We still have a small amount of layout, some art, and the alternate settings left to write, but I wanted to give people a little time to fill out their surveys- and it also gives me time to get this information to the wonderful people helping me out with fulfillment, and ensure everything is sorted on their end.

Hi everyone! In the last month since the kickstarter ended I've started putting together the final zine. As you know, all the main game text is already written,  but we have got together a team of all the people working on the art and stretch goals and are getting everything ready to lay out the game in a zine friendly format.

We are well on track for an August-July deadline, and hopefully your zines will arrive even earlier- those deadlines are to allow lots of time for an editing and redrafting process.

Hi all. We funded on Thursday and hit our last stretch goal. Then I went to sleep for nearly a week in celebration, but don't worry, I haven't disappeared. 

From now on I'm going to start posting updates on art, layout, writing etc, as we start putting the final touches on Lichcraft and preparing to ship it out. I'll also start getting back to some of your messages on Kickstarter.  Don't forget, all backers can download and play the game pdf in its current state of completion- there is a dropbox link to the pdf in a previous update.

Hey folks, I never thought I'd be saying this, but I think this project could shoot for £10,000. 
So I've come up with a £10k stretch goal. I'll be so impressed if we get here but if we do, I'll write (and get a couple other amazing mysterious collaborators to write ) four quarter page alternate settings, each of which will come with their own d6 adventure generation table.

campaign.story:
THANK YOU FOR BRINGING THE DECK TO LIFE!
I am deeply grateful for the community support behind this Kickstarter.  Due to your help, this deck will be making its debut out in the world. A profound thanks to all of you - our backers here on Kickstarter.
This Kickstarter is one piece of a larger vision. If you are interested in getting a deck after the Kickstarter or learning more, visit www.herorise.us. Check out the
Free online guidebook
Archetype Quiz
Free Archetype eBook
Also, follow me on Kickstarter if you want a notification of future projects.

 Archetypes can be used to recognize, develop, and connect to positive Masculinity. 
The Masculine Archetype Deck gives you a tangibly way to explore your psyche and break free from unhealthy patterns.  The deck uses images, words, and symbols to help you connect to different aspects of your Masculinity. Furthermore, awakening your connection with the Masculine Archetypes can help you move past the hidden patterns that hold you back, and give you the momentum to grow into your highest potential.
Men seeking to find strength and balance in their Masculinity
Women in search of their masculine energy
Non-Binary people looking to explore the complexity of gender
This deck can help anyone connect with the Masculine Archetypes - regardless of biology, gender identity, or sexual orientation.  How you come to this, can be as rich and complex as Masculinity itself.
Working with Archetypes can give you a tangible way to explore your psychological makeup and break free from unhealthy patterns. 
The Five Major Archetypes within the HeroRise system are; Warrior, Wizard, Father, Lover, and Sovereign. The Archetypes represent different psychological patterns that you use to make up your identity. Creating a conscious relationship with the various Archetypes can help you embody mature and balanced Masculinity.
You can read all the books you want, but there's very little to help you connect, evoke, and work with these aspects of yourself. That's where the deck comes in. it's a tool.  
The deck goes beyond the Five Masculine Archetypes by including two Shadow Aspects and four Sub-Archetypes that are associated with each — giving you a deeper range of understanding of your psyche.
The Shadow Aspects are the repressed parts of your identity. They can be behaviors you have learned as coping mechanisms or reactions to past trauma. Working with the Shadow Aspects will give you a deeper understanding of your internal process and patterns— allowing you to grow beyond past wounds.
Sub Archetypes are expressions of the Major Archetypes For instance, the Warrior has the Sub-Archetypes of Activist, Athlete, Hunter, and Soldier.
This is the full suite of cards for each of the Five Major Masculine Archetypes.
The Hero's Journey
The deck also included the Hero's Journey Cards, based modeled after Joseph Campbell.  Working with the Hero's Journey unlocks the power of story. You can use it to change the stories of your past or write new ones about your future. The HeroRise Masculine Archetype Deck comes with twelve cards based on the Hero's Journey.
These cards add another layer of depth when working with Archetypes. Use the Hero's Journey cards to rise to the challenge.
 The Cards
Traditional Tarot card size - 2.75" x 4.75" (70mm x 120mm)
47 cards (35 Archetypes and 12 Hero's Journey Cards)
350 Premium GSM cardstock
Semi-gloss Lamination
Gold Metallic Ink Backs
The Box:
Premium two-part box
Matte Lamination with Spot UV
The Guidebook:
4.13 x 5.83 in. book for easy reading.
85+ pages of card descriptions, spreads, and stories.
Matte Lamination with Spot UV
 The deck is 25% off for the list price for Kickstarter and will be more in stores when it's released. Get more savings if you get more than one deck.
Special Reward Added:
I now added an extra reward called "the Gift." By adding $23 dollars to your reward, I will print an extra copy and gift it to therapists that help shape the youth of tomorrow and organizations that promote positive change.  I will be sharing the list of organizations through updates as they are being gifted.
Pledge at the $23 dollar level or ad $23 to support the cause. 
NOTE: This pledge will only cover some of the manufacturing costs, and I will cover shipping, taxes, and other expenses to gift the deck. 
Instead of doing a lot of complex tiers and variations, I am using a reward add-on system for this campaign. First, pledge for the highest-priced item you would like. After you pledge, it will show you the following add-ons. 
If you already pledged, click here to manage your reward tier and add-ons.
The Online Course is an introduction series I created for the Masculine Archetypes. It includes over an hour of video content, activities, meditation, and resources to help you embody the Masculine Archetypes. The course price will normally be $97, but I am offering a discount to Kickstarter supporters as an add-on when ordering a deck.
Hopefully, at this point, you like the deck, but you might be wondering why I am doing a Kickstarter— it's because of better printing cost with volume.
To create this first edition of the deck at the quality I would like, I need to print at a large scale, 1,000-2,000 copies. To lower that initial risk and investment, I am doing a Kickstarter to raise funds. If the minimum amount is reached, I can ensure higher quality and better pricing for everyone.
I also love the community aspect of Kickstarter. When you join this Kickstarter, you aren't just receiving a product - you are making a difference in the world. By being a part of this Kickstarter you help our culture reclaim masculinity, and empower personal growth.
I am grateful for your interest in the Masculine Archetype Deck and tried to make the pricing for rewards reflect that with discounts for Kickstarter supporters. The deck's price and other rewards will be going up by 20% when I am selling decks after the Kickstarter.
What are the perks of backing our project? 
You'll help us get this unique and innovative deck into print
 You’ll get the exclusive 'crowdfunding only’ price 
All Kickstarter-backed decks will also get exclusive Stretch Goals added to their order.
My name is Isaac Cotec and I am the artist, writer, and creator of the HeroRise Masculine Archetype Deck.
For most of my life, I was full of angst and confusion about becoming a man. Without a map to navigate my transition into manhood — nor a plethora of positive masculine role models— I found myself pushing my Masculinity away.
When I turned 30, I knew I was missing something. I spent years on personal growth, therapy, and spiritual development but something was still missing.  During a moment of despair, a friend shared a book about Archetypes. It changed my life.
Archetypes gave me a template to recognize, develop, and mature my Masculinity. The deeper I connect with Masculinity, the more clarity of will I feel. It gives me the energy to make my dreams manifest and become the man I always wanted to be.
I see the internal crisis I went through mirrored in our society. There is a great opportunity, a great calling for the positive aspects of Masculinity to rise.
This is what gave birth to HeroRise and the Masculine Archetype Deck. This project is the culmination of 20 years of study. Exploring the works of Carl Jung, Robert Moore, and researching the power of symbols on the subconscious. 
I feel honored to share the tools that helped me find purpose, balance, and a deeply rooted Masculinity.  Thank you for joining me on this journey and helping make this project a reality.
Preparing for this campaign, I ordered a small run of prototypes and currently have a hard copy proof from the printer. To speed up the fulfillment process, I already set up shipping, manufacturing, and services needed in order to get these rewards in your hands.
The timeline estimates are based on the printer and past campaigns that I have been a part of. This is not a guarantee, but each of my previous campaigns I've sent rewards ahead of schedule. Here is the timeline if this project is funded:
 March 2021: The campaign ends, and Kickstarter begins collecting pledge money. Digital rewards are sent out as soon as pledges are received (usually a week after the campaign).
 Mid-March 2021: Money is transferred to my account (usually two weeks after the campaign ends), at which point I’m able to place orders for all of the separate items. Decks should begin shipping for processing by the end of March.
 May 2021: Except for multiple unforeseen delays or drastically long overseas shipping factors due to the pandemic, backers should have their rewards by mid-to-late May. Be sure to fill out your backer report as soon as possible to get your rewards in time!
To make getting your rewards as easy as possible, we are working with Gamefound. Shortly after the Kickstarter ends, we will be sending you a link where you will be able to complete checkout for your backing. This will include the option to purchase additional Add-Ons as well as shipping.
Shipping
Shipping can be tricky to estimate, especially when the difference of an ounce can cause a huge price difference (I discovered that with my last Kickstarter). To ensure the best price, I'll be charging for shipping using Gamefound once the campaign is completed.  Orders will be DDP when shipped internationally and the receiver will pay VAT.
 Here are some shipping estimates, so you know what to expect (not including VAT):
Please note - this means you will be charged twice: once for the rewards you chose, and when the campaign is over for the exact shipping cost.
One of the reasons I love Kickstarter is because of the Stretch Goals. When working with manufacturers, you get big discounts if you get a higher volume. What that means is if we get more backers I can put those savings into making the deck more epic.  By reaching different goals we will add a premium two-piece box, additional sections to the book, and gold metallic ink. More stretch goals will be revealed as the campaign progresses  
Time spent on the artwork, prototyping costs, and video/promotional costs has already been provided through personal funds. This Kickstarter is to get the funds needed to manufacture the first run of the Deck.  

PARTNERS:
We have partnered up with PrintNinja for high-quality manufacturing and Gamefound for the fulfillment of rewards.

Due to the ongoing COVID-19 crisis, shipping may be delayed in some countries. We added extra time in our estimate to account for this uncertainty and aim to ship the product before our stated goal.
 
Our biggest hurdle is getting the word out there and getting awareness for the campaign. Share with your friends, whisper it in the ears of your loved ones, heck, tell your enemies, help us make this as big as it can be!

campaign.story:
On our last trip to Arabia, me and my family stumbled upon a local store selling handcrafted jewels in diamond shapes. The owner,  an 81 years old man named Mahu, told us the jewels had ties with ancient myths and magical abilities. The narration of the stories inspired me to create a collection that has a pinch of Arabia's beauty. The Majik Dice collection.
Handcrafted by masters of the art, these dice sets have sharp edges, attractive combination colors so the numbers are always readable.
The collections are offered in two different fonts and are available as your option. Square font and Standard round font.


With your help, you will motivate us and push us forward to more complicated projects, the board games that we have designed. Thank you for your support. We look forward to your feedback.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Every set is hand crafted with numerous materials and then polished to get their sharp clean appearance. Since these materials are mixed and poured into the shaper, differences of color and material layers will be visible. 

Please understand that due to the fact that no machines will be used, it is impossible to ensure that they're absolutely perfect or identical to the ones that are presented in the project page.

COVID-19: Unfortunately due to unpredictable situations throughout the world some delays may come up. As of today we don't see any reason why it would affect our ability to fulfill this kickstarter. However we understand the situation is constantly changing. What we can promise is that we will keep you updated on new changes.

Like any kickstarter timeline, our project production timeline is only an estimate and we will try our best to ensure that we stay on schedule. The timeline may change due to unforeseeable events. Thank you for your understanding.

campaign.story:
Dames, Warrior Women of Legends is a collaborative artbook, gathering 60 artists around this theme and a love for badass women and illustration. 
Inside the book, you will find more than 60 exclusive illustrations, each representing a different warrior woman from legends all around the world. You will find at the end of the book a quick introduction to each artist and the woman they illustrated.
We have a line up of 60 amazing artists, who have each personally chosen the warrior they wanted to illustrate for the book.
Dames, Warrior Women of Legends is the second volume funded and edited through Kickstarter by FlohGna and Trèfle.
Our first book, Dames (2018), was funded in three hours and, thanks to 1594 backers, gathered 62 836 €. We’ve also worked on a smaller book, Bushidoge, a Dogs in Armor zine (2019), released through pre-orders on an online shop. For each project, we’ve released original merch too.
Dames and Bushidoge
 The book is A4, with a matte finished hardcover and 100 pages.
As for the first volume, both the front and back covers were lovingly illustrated by Vulpetrope, who picked Hua Mulan as the subject of her work.
Hardcover book with gold foil, A4 (21x29,7cm / 8.3x11.7inch), 100 pages / Cover art by Vulpetrope, illustration shown by Dan Muangprasert
The layout art was created by Robofeather, and the assembling and graphic design were made by graphic designers FlohGna and Trèfle.
Illustrations shown by Leevolt and LemonJuiceDay
 Every physical order comes with a square print of our social media main visual, illustrated by Trèfle.
New! They all come with an A5 print by Faith Schaffer representing The Lady of The Lake, four postcards of book illustrations, including one by Jenny Park, as well as an A4 print with gold foil.
A5 (15x21cm / 5.9x8.3inch) print by Faith Schaffer, square print (15x15cm / 5.9x5.9inch) by Trèfle, four postcards, including one by Jenny Park and an A4 print with gold foil
 All physical orders passed in the first 24 hours will receive an A5 print of the cover by Vulpetrope.

campaign.story:
That Magical Horror Light Show hits its Grand Finale! 
The infection has spread beyond control, their quiet home a prison. Willow and the rest of the XII, incapacitated and injured, try desperately to make sense of the world they never knew they lived in. Trapped in the claws of the Headmistress and their necklaces confiscated - the only thing the girls have left: is escape. 

Volume 1: Monsters
Our mousy protagonist Willow lives in a mundane and restricted school, which ends up being the worst place someone could get gifted a magical necklace. Desperately trying to contain the magic within, this act of futility seems to just make matters worse. As the necklace crumbles the school’s secrets around her, Willow is left to wonder if it was a gift sent by friend or foe?
Volume 2: Mischief
Willow, Georgia and Emma have accidentally wrapped both Tillie and Aaron into their magical girl shenanigans much to their chagrin. However, things seem to be getting even harder to keep quiet as these magical powers have turned from intriguing to infectious.  Between daylight daydreams, tanking a track star, bathroom breakdowns and betrayal from within - our quarreling quintet might be in bigger trouble then they ever thought possible.
XII: Of Magic and Muses has been published online as a webcomic since 2016 and after 5 magical years we're finishing off the trilogy in print - before the website finishes Volume 2! It is currently updating 6x a week - Mondays to Saturdays.
This comic is rated for a Teen Audience due to language, partial nudity, and scenes of violence, as well as content warnings for blood and strangulation.
This will be the final book of the Magic and Muses Trilogy.
Praise for Magic and Muses
'XII has a slow but promising start. The setting is eerie and mysterious enough by itself and things only get more and more strange as magic enters the scene. Definitely an original take on the magical girl genre.' - Goodreads

Become a part of the ✨ magic ✨ and help Kickstart this project today!

Don't see anything you'd like? Missing a bundle? Don't hesitate to drop a line and request a reward - we make no guarantees but feedback is welcome!

 The Breakdown
The vast majority of our funds will go to Shipping and Printing similar to our Volume 1, 2 & standee campaigns. These will be printed & shipped out from Canada, so things may take a few weeks depending on your location.

K. Kiomall-Evans has been making comics since 2009 and has been self-publishing her own work since 2015. She works as a solo force as writer, artist, letterer and publisher; as well as web developer and marketer. Born out of a maple tree like most Canadians, she spends her time ranting on twitter, reading sapphic stories and playing video games badly.

campaign.story:
Hi! We are Eugene Leong & Justin Saw from Singapore and it brings us great pleasure to introduce you to the Hybrid Tarot deck.
This is a 43 card deck themed around how the Tarot and Lenormand systems could work together. Each card is also dedicated to a deity, ascended master, angel, or elemental guardian, whose story inspires the illustrations.
Being fans of both the Tarot & Lenormand systems, we were fascinated by the Lenormand symbols in Tarot. For example, the Hierophant in the Rider-Waite-Smith deck has a set of interlocking keys and the Temperance card has two irises in the background.
In Lenormand, the Keys represent solutions. While irises are not in Lenormand, we felt it appropriate to switch it with a bed of lilies. Lilies represent wisdom, ethics and morality in Lenormand.
For the Hybrid Tarot, we aimed to give both the symbols of Tarot and Lenormand equal emphasis.
The 42 cards in the Hybrid Tarot therefore consists of:

In a traditional Tarot deck, you will find 78 cards, consisting of 22 major arcana, 16 court cards and 40 minors. However, in this deck, you would not find all the minor cards,. Each full suit is now represented by a single element card. For example, the 1 to 10 of Pentacles are now represented by The Earth card.
22 major arcana + 16 court cards + 4 element cards

In a traditional Lenormand deck, there are 36 cards. In recent years, creators have extended the vocabulary in Lenormand to consider LGBTQ relationships and created additional cards. From the lens of Lenormand, we’ve added the main four elements found in Tarot minors to create the additional cards and bring the card count to 42.
36 standard Lenormand cards + 2 LGBTQ representation + 4 additional cards

We have already completed the illustration for all 42 cards + 1 enigma card (hence 43). Below are some of the finished work:
Follow our instagram: Leong Yu Jing (@hybridtarot) • Instagram photos and videos
to learn more about the thought process behind each card. 
The booklet to this deck provides a detailed write up on how the three systems come together in one card.
The deck is designed to allow you to switch from one system to another seamlessly with the use of spreads.

Example
Step 1: Deal 5 cards for  how things came to be, the situation now and how it is most likely to develop. Collect back the cards and shuffle.
Step 2: To move forward, consider messages from our Higher Self, Analytical Self and Emotions. If contradictory messages appear within the three aspects, it means there is a need for alignment. Collect back the cards and shuffle.
Step 3: Based on messages you received in the previous steps, think about your course of action. Declare your  intentions and plans, then draw 2 cards from the Lenormand system to see if it’s a good idea.

There are also two designs for the card backing. The main design is Unicorn design. However due to the colors not working well with gold edges, we have also designed the Crane version to better match the deck with gold edges.
We have also incorporated the 9-card spread on our reading cloth design:
We hope you find this to be an interesting deck to work with, and THANK YOU for your time and support!

campaign.story:
Hey again!  I'm Hannah / @omghanners and I'm a pin designer and all-around creative person! Making pins independently is expensive and I can usually only put a few designs into production each year.  This is my second Kickstarter and this campaign will put a bunch of new pins into production!
Some notes about pledging:
Pledging helps unlock designs!  Pledging for all the items you want - even locked ones - helps fund more designs for everyone. Additionally, you get the Kickstarter price of $10 per pin.  After all the Kickstarter orders are filled, these designs will be $12 in my shop.
Pledge now, Pay later. The initial $400 goal will fund the first 2 pin designs but you can increase, decrease or even cancel your pledge at any time the campaign is live. You will only be charged when the Kickstarter campaigns ends, provided the original $400 base goal is met. If we don't reach this base goal by the end of the the campaign date you will not be charged. Note: you cannot change your pledge amount or add items after the campaign ends.
All pins will be hard enamel, gold plated pins, with two posts and rubber clutches.
There might be slight differences as the designs finalized for production - any major design changes/alterations will be put to a vote for the current project backers.
Late Jan - Campaign starts
Mid Feb - Campaign ends, surveys sent out
Late Feb - Pins put into production
Late March/April - Pins arrive and ship out
Pins will be shipped with backing cards in padded mailers. *Please not some unexpected shipping delays due to COVID may occur*
US packages will be shipped via USPS First Class Mail. This service includes a tracking number.
International packages will be shipped via First-Class Package International Service.  Tracking for this postage method varies by country. Most commonly, tracking ceases once the package is in possession of your country's postal system, but sometimes tracking continues to delivery. Generally, packages arrive within 3-4 weeks but can take much longer. I will do my best to track packages as they go out. Note for International buyers:  Backers are responsible for all taxes and fees associated with their packages. Packages will be marked as merchandise with accurate value declared. I will not mark packages as 'gifts' to circumvent these fees.
Some samples/examples of my other pin designs. Shop can be found here

Shipping delays due to COVID are still a possibility - please keep this in mind once rewards have shipped

campaign.story:
Omni Tarot by Olivia M Healy
I am an illustrator creating bold figurative work that aims to empower feminine identities and the explore the diversity of gender expression. My Omni Tarot Deck is a modern take on tarot which draws from ancient and occult influences, as well as contemporary subcultures. The deck explores identity and self-discovery and our relationship to nature and the universe.
I first started researching and designing tarot cards back in 2016. I finished the first cards for the Omni Tarot in 2018 and got the chance to complete the deck during lockdown in 2020. Finally I am ready to share this deck with everyone who has been patiently following its creation and can't wait for you all to enjoy these cards. 

See more from me on instagram

The Deck
 Rewards
Please note that the following image is just a mockup and final designs for guidebook, card box, and altar cloth are subject to change. 
Omni Tarot Deck - The Omni Tarot Deck is a 78 card tarot deck at standard tarot size (2.75" x 4.75") printed on Black Core Premium paper (310gsm)  and comes with small keyword booklet of card meanings. The deck is packaged in a matte two-piece heavyweight box with thumb cuts. 
Guidebook - The Omni Tarot Guidebook delves into the possible meanings of each card, providing a helpful framework for beginners of divination. The guidebook also displays card artwork in full colour and lists each cards corresponding element, planet, and astrological sign. The guidebook will be softcover perfect bound and A5 in size (210 x 148 mm) 
A3 Signed Giclée Print - Signed Giclée art print of tarot card of your choice. Printed professionally on high-quality Hahnemüle Etching paper. Will be A3 in size (297 x 420 mm)
Altar Cloth - Cotton Altar Cloth (700 x 700 mm) which can be used as a surface for your tarot spread, to wrap your deck, or however else you like. The final Altar Cloth will be professionally printed in full colour on cotton and will feature colourful contrast stitching along the hem. I will be collaborating with London-based designer Rhi Dancey to bring these Altar Cloths to life! 

Stretch Goals
Indigo Stamped Back

£17,000 - CARD UPGRADE - INDIGO GILDED EDGES 
The cards will be upgraded to have Indigo Gilded Edges.
£22,000 - CARD UPGRADE - INDIGO FOIL STAMPED BACKS
The card backs will be upgraded so the back pattern is Indigo Foil Stamped rather than  blue ink
£25,000 -  FREE REWARD - VINYL STICKER 
A free Vinyl Sticker of The Fool card will be added to every reward pledge. 

Shipping
All UK rewards will be shipped first-class tracked with Royal Mail. All international rewards will also be shipped tracked with Royal Mail. A survey will be emailed to you during spring/summer requesting your address when the decks will begin shipping. Please keep an eye out for this email! 
International Orders: Please note that you are responsible for any international customs or fees that may occur.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
So far the entire deck is completed and ready to be printed once the kickstarter goal is reached! During the course of this campaign I will be finishing up writing and formatting the Guidebook as well as designing the Altar Cloth. 
My goal will be to get all rewards shipped to backers during the month of September 2021 though it is likely that they will be ready even earlier. The deadline of September will allow ample time for the production of the decks and other rewards and also accounts for length of time it will take for the decks to be shipped to me and for me to package all orders. Of course production and shipping may experience delays due to stress on shipping from coronavirus or other complications. I aim to keep everyone updated every step of the way!

campaign.story:
Makan at Mum's – A Family Cookbook is now a Kickstarter "Project We Love"
Makan at Mum's – A Family Cookbook
makan
/ˈmakan/ noun.
Food; Feed; Feast etc.
About Katrina:
In 2016, my daughter was six months old and I felt something odd like a small piece of gravel in my left breast. A blocked milk duct, I thought. It soon turned into the whole breast feeling rock hard. One day I was hand expressing and there was a tiny drop of blood in my milk. I texted my mothers’ group and one of them said, “Katrina hon, you’ve got to go get that checked out.”
I was 34, young, fit and healthy. I was an ESCF Paris-trained pastry chef who had worked for Yotam Ottolenghi and Sami Tamimi in their Soho restaurant NOPI. I’d worked for Jason Atherton at Pollen Street Social, his one-Michelin-starred restaurant in London. I’d cycled a clunky oma fiets through sleet and snow to get to my early morning bakery shifts in the Netherlands. Back home in Sydney I was a mum to a three-year-old and eight-month-old as well as being a freelance food photographer, food technologist, and recipe developer. I was reluctant to see a doctor, but I knew she was right.
I went to see the breast specialist who took three excruciating core biopsies. She said to me, “We can wait for the results, but I’ve seen enough to tell you that you have breast cancer”. I had no family history of it. I was gobsmacked.
Fast forward four years of relentless cancer diagnoses and cancer treatment, and I am currently battling further progression of my metastatic (stage four, advanced) breast cancer. I may not look sick, I may have a smile on my face, but I combat treatment, medication and side effects every day.
Mum doing what no mother should have to do — watch their child endure cancer treatment
After my initial diagnosis, I wrote a picture book to help explain cancer to young children aged 3-8 years; something that was missing when I was first diagnosed. The metastatic diagnosis gave me the kick up the butt to get the book out there in the world. You know, in case I died before it was finished. The book is currently with the publisher, awaiting illustration so it’s ready for release in 2021. After finishing the children’s book draft, I found I needed to let my creativity express itself again. That’s where this little project comes in.

About Mum:
My mum Jeanie has Chinese heritage and was born and lived in Malaysia through her childhood and teenage years as one of five kids. Her parents had a Chinese supermarket that sold imported foodstuffs and exotic fresh fruits from different countries. Food has been in our blood for generations.
Jeanie emigrated to Australia when she was 19 and settled into her new home. Our family have owned and run multiple restaurants, Asian take-away outlets (noodle bars, Chinese takeaway, satay, sushi, steamed buns), juice bars and cafes in Sydney for more than 30 years. After decades in hospitality, they should be retired, but they're  still feeding Sydney!
(L to R) Mum's brother Bernard, granddaughter, Jeanie herself, and sister Jenny at 1Ton Chatswood
My mum turns 70 this month. She’s an excellent home cook and her cooking is famous among our family and friends. Mum is the type of seasoned cook who cooks by instinct; shops almost daily; rarely follows a recipe but is always looking at recipes for inspiration; tweaks the food every time; and comes up with what to cook that night, based on what looks best at the market, or what she has available in her always fully-stocked fridge, pantry or freezer.
Driving home after a long family lunch up at my brother’s place at Lake Macquarie, the cookbook idea came to me. Mum’s 70th was coming up. She wasn’t really a party person. Instead, I decided I wanted to photograph Mum’s very best dishes, attempt to jot down her forever-changing recipes, and create a cookbook for her as a birthday gift.
I told her I had an idea for a project. She was a little uncertain at first, but once we got started, bam! We surprised ourselves and fell in love with the concept and the process. The original idea was to print five copies. One for her and Dad, one for each of her kids and partner, and one for each of her two grandchildren.
Mum Jeanie and Dad Eddie show their grandchildren how to make wontons
How we made the cookbook:
Every Wednesday for five months I went to her house after dropping my kids at daycare and school. Mum would cook the dishes – she always multitasks and never makes just one thing at a time – she’d plate, I’d style and photograph them (and try to keep up with her). It turns out we work really well together. We captured over 70 magical photos and recipes. After each week, Mum would scribble down how she had made that dish on that occasion.
Each week was an opportunity to share and connect with my mum. After shooting, we’d eat a late lunch with my dad of all the food she’d just cooked, and I got to spend solid, quality time with them. And the family enjoyed sampling the leftovers.

What this book means to us:
Working on this book together has, for the first time, celebrated my mum’s food. It has validated her keenly developed cooking instincts and shown her how amazing her talent is. Mum would never consider what she does as anything remarkable. It’s just what she does. She nourishes the family. She shows love through her food and through her cooking. While we were shooting, she said “I never knew my food could look this good!” I replied, “It’s always tasted this good; it’s now just making it look as good as it tastes.”

Why this suddenly means so much to me:
Around the time of wrapping up the photoshoots, I developed breathlessness to add to five months of unexplained, debilitating, burning pain in my left scapula. This has led to my current situation – the cancer has progressed further to my lungs, brain and spine. I’m now on a new third generation chemotherapy drug (for the fourth time) and just finished more radiation therapy (for the third time).
Katrina receiving radiation therapy for the third time round in the last four years
 I’ve recently had surgery to drain 600mL of fluid from around my heart. The urgent hospital admissions for my heart and breathlessness made me question my mortality and wonder what the heck I was doing on the cardiac ward with all the middle-aged men having heart attacks.
It immediately made me think of my two young children who I would be leaving behind and not be able to guide, nurture and support, as I watch them grow into adulthood. It made me wonder if I would ever get my dream of wanting to meet my own grandchildren. Things are getting serious for me, who really knows how many years I’ve got left with my family. It made me want to give my kids something to hang onto – a piece of me. So let’s get it finished and out there!

What types of recipes are in the book:
The recipes in Mum’s cookbook are mostly Chinese and Malaysian home-style cooking. It’s packed full of generous, humble, nourishing, welcoming and comforting food. The food that fuelled my childhood.
Some of my favourite dishes in the book are Assam Laksa, Har Mee and Chicken Satay. There’s humble home food suitable for the whole family such as Wonton Soup, Caramel Chicken with Potato and Shiitake, or Steamed Silken Egg with Pork. Mum is also a fabulous baker and we have captured her flawless Chiffon Cake, as well as Asian desserts such as Nine-Layer Kuih Cake and Mango Pudding.
Draft mock up of Makan at Mum's — A Family Cookbook, by Jeanie Lau and Katrina Lau Hammond
 There are over 70 recipes in the book, to celebrate her 70 years of a wonderful life, full of family, friends and food. There is a full colour photo for every dish, so we can make them how she made them.

Cookbook dreams:
My hope is that this cookbook we made together is something enduring, that my children can flip through and maybe even cook from. A family memento to pass down memories and old favourite recipes, so they may remember us even after we have moved on to the next place.
Perhaps boosted by my mum’s lifetime spent cooking for others and refining her recipes, you’ll find that you can makan some nourishing, comforting, home-cooked food too.
Recently, The Guardian published an article about mum and I and how we came to create this cookbook, in a piece "as told to" food, travel and lifestyle writer Lindy Alexander. 
The Guardian article about Katrina, Jeanie and their cookbook
How you can help:
The full suite of recipes have been written and tested (over decades) by my mum Jeanie. I’ve relished in the challenge of styling and photographing each dish. I’ve adored being able to use my styling props that I have collected from around the world over the last 15 or so years. I’ll be completing the photo editing and recipe editing in the coming weeks. Cookbook design, typesetting and layout will be executed by graphic designer Mei, my sister in law. Website, Comms, Marketing and IT are being driven by my marketing pro / computer whiz brother Colin. My father Eddie is the best PR person you could ever hope for.
We don’t need funds for those tasks listed above, as this is our family preserving a part of our history and culture.
The Kickstarter project funds would allow us to professionally print the first 500 hardcover copies of the book in the high quality it deserves, and have the books shipped and fulfilled to the wonderful backers who believe in our project and in sharing a home-cooked meal with those you love. 
The Kickstarter funds will not be donated to charity, they'll be used for project costs such as printing. However, proceeds from the future sale of each cookbook may be donated to the independent charity Australian Cancer Research Foundation, to help them continue to back the brightest minds in ground-breaking, life-saving cancer research.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
All of the recipes have already been written and all of the photos have already been taken. We are just tweaking now to make them truly perfect for you. All design and marketing aspects of the project will be driven by my sister in law, my brother and I. We control our timelines and workloads. This project is a priority for us right now.

We have evaluated a number of different printers, assessing their pricing, timings and print quality and are confident we can find the right match for us.

Funding is one challenge we face, which is why we are asking for a goal amount of AU$15,000 to help us cover the cost of an initial print run of 500 hardcover cookbooks. We have based our print run quantity on the significant interest we have already gauged from people wishing to pre-purchase the book. 

Fulfilment, shipping and other sundry costs are not included in the total goal amount. The relevant reward tiers include shipping to the backer.

There is a risk of delay in shipping our printed books after printing and before fulfilment. These would be delays that are beyond our control, but I believe we have allowed enough scope for this in our proposed August 2021 delivery of printed hardcover books.

Get ready for the creative collaboration from Trader Brandon and Todd Stashwick's Nerd Circus: MYSTIC LIBATIONS, Critical Cocktails for the Thirsty Adventurer! The book is a collection of over 100 delicious cocktail recipes, even non-alcoholic mocktail recipes, fun in-world stories, and it even includes a playable RPG adventure AND an all new player sub-class created exclusively for our readers!
Trader Brandon, aka Brandon Kleyla, is an award winning themed entertainment designer, as well as Tiki enthusiast. He’s spent the last thirteen years designing experiences for Universal Creative and Walt Disney Imagineering, where he worked on 30+ attractions and was the lead decorator and writer for Trader Sam's Enchanted Tiki Bar & Trader Sam's Grog Grotto. Most recently during quarantine he has created "The Untold Adventures of Trader Brandon," a pulp comic series.  He also fell down the rabbit hole into the world of D&D, playing regularly and attempts to lead his adventurers as he learns to be a Dungeon Master. Find out more about Brandon at traderbrandon.com
Todd Stashwick is an actor and writer, as well as a notable Dungeon Master. Since long before he was biting necks on Supernatural, terrorizing Gotham City in Gotham or fighting his way through time in 12 Monkeys on TV, Todd has been an action-figure-collecting, comic-book-reading, dice-rolling, video-game-playing, Scifi-fantasy-loving, Tiki-drinking, Con-going, nerdboy. Todd has recently opened "The Nerd Circus" online, an assortment of groovy wares and nerdy paraphernalia that personally make Todd smile! Visit www.thenerdcircus.com

campaign.story:
My name is Cathryn Perry; I am a former Zookeeper, Conservation Education Specialist, as well as a Special Education teacher. Now, I am creating beautiful children’s books to raise awareness of the amazing animals of our planet through story.

I find it difficult to read stories that contain inaccurate or out dated animal information. When my children want to learn about a particular creature, I’m often forced to chose between a dry, fact-filled reference book or factless story that features an animal character.

 I know we can have both. Animal stories can be fun, educational and help inspire a love of conservation in the next generation.

My stories help make unbreakable connections between children and wild animals. By teaching them how unique and amazing they are and how they are worth saving.

All of the illustrations for these two books are complete, ready to be printed into 8.5 x 8.5 in high-quality hardcover books to share with the world. Perfect for Families, Teachers, STEM lessons, Animal Lovers and Supporters of Conservation!

This Kickstarter will bring TWO wonderful animal stories to life for your family:

 The Legend of the Tasmanian Tiger 
Book Cover

 The Legend of the Tasmanian Tiger was inspired by my children. They were excited to learn about this animal, until finding out they were pushed to extinction. Then, we discovered that even today, people report sightings of Tasmanian tigers, and that filled my children with HOPE!

Two young Tasmanian tiger cubs asking to hear the legend of their elders. As their story is told, the young ones learn about the effect explorers had on the land of Australia and the Tasmanian tiger population.
Conflict between humans and animals will always exist, we can teach children to understand the natural world -- not clash with it.

On their journey they encounter other incredible native animals that have had a different, positive experience with these humans.
Can a platypus, a koala and a crocodile convince the tasmanian tigers that humans can do good?
...and run into a little bit of excitement!
CRIKEY!
After hearing of all the good things humans can do to help animals and environment, the book ends with a message of hope.  Maybe one day, they could show themselves again.
There have been over 3,800 sightings of the Tasmanian tiger on the Australian mainland alone since 1936, many people believe one or more small populations of Tasmanian Tigers still exist. A MESSAGE OF HOPE!


The Illustrator : Nana Qi
Art by Nana Qi
Nana Qi (pronounced: Key) is an avid animal illustrator and sculptor. She lived on three continents by the age of 2, & grew up in a small New England town. Her mother was an international translator who visited dozens of countries, and told her Nana is a name in many languages. Growing up as a person of color,  battling life events, and rare health issues, she seeks to make art that comforts and heals. She finds peace with other creatures, and hopes to share that escape of happiness with the world.
  Since finding a new style in March of 2019, she has worked on books, toys, merchandise & more. Her work has been featured by by Procreate, natural history museums, & other publications. She’s also had the opportunity to work with conservation groups like the Jane Goodall Institute, furthering wildlife education to better protect them. See more of her work at http://www.puffygator.com


I Became A Zookeeper
Cover Art for I Became A Zookeeper - How many animals can you find?
I Became a Zookeeper is a story about my journey to a zoo career that started when I was just an animal- loving child. I put in volunteer hours at animal rescues and wildlife rehab centers. I got a bachelor's degree Life Science and Animal Behavior. After, I tried to apply for over 200 zoo jobs around the world, I believed I was ready but --I didn't get hired! 
While most little girls wanted to play dress up, I was pretending to discover new species. I studied, and volunteered, even took an internship in South Africa to follow my dream! Written with some rhythmical and fun alliteration, I describe all of the responsibilities and experiences in the daily life of the zookeeper.
I didn't let my lack of experience get me down. I took an internship in South Africa and continued to dedicate my days to learning all I could about being a zookeeper. After a few unpaid internships, hours of studying and volunteering, I finally got my dream job --
I BECAME A ZOOKEEPER!

This is a story of staying humble, having presistance, and working hard for your dreams!
Readers will also discover all the important work that zookeepers do- educating zoo guests, general husbandry, and other important tasks like... 

Enrichment:
Special enrichment toys help animals stay stimulated and encourage them to use their natural adaptations. Bucket feeders encourage giraffes to use their long tongue to reach food - just like in the African savannah!
Husbandry Training:
Husbandry training can help keepers do vital health checks on their animals without having to sedate them for a trip to the vet!

I BECAME A ZOOKEEPER is the perfect book for your little animal lover!

Watch our tiger illustration come to life:

The Illustrator: Martith Arts

Martith Arts!
Marta Stachowiakis is a  freelance artist from Poland. Currently adventuring abroad - at the moment she is located in Santiago, Chile. She loves the wilderness, mysterious woods and mountain tops. Probably the biggest dream of hers is to someday own a cabin in some dense forest, and to one day be able to somehow participate in local wildlife rescue.

I started writing books four years ago while dedicating myself to raising my future generation of animal lovers. I couldn't sit back and only dream of connecting more kids to the natural world and its amazing animals. I knew I could use my writing talents and love of nature to inspire others and contribute to conservation efforts in a big way. You can read more about my projects and family at www.wanderingrootspublishing.com

YOU’VE BEEN SUMMONED ! 
Hello ! We are Marine aka Muune, a 2D Illustrator and Alix aka Sostegaria a writer and roleplayer.
Thank you so much for reading about our project The everlasting tales Tarot Deck.

After months and months of research and illustrations, 40 original cards for the Tarot and Oracle are now completely drawn. The biggest part, that will come soon, is the colorization . I have learned a lot about myself as an artist and illustrator during this time and I am very grateful to my family, friends and followers who have encouraged me to continue. The Everlasting Tales project  is a big step forward for us ! It's the beginning of a great adventure full of different stories that connects with each other. 
Tarot Cards are a tool used for introspection and divination.It is a form of fortune-telling that uses the Tarot of Marseille cards. The interpretation of its tarot cards or oracle, is sometimes referred to by neologisms, as tarology. This practice is based on a set of beliefs, specific to occultism, about the existence of mysterious forces or invisible links between things.
Through association with the characters and themes of the cards, the reader may peer into the subconscious mind and assess the direction that one is taking their life to. The lessons these characters learned and lived serve us well in our own interpretive reading.
 All decks will be delivered with a book that will help you with the interpretation of each card

Hello everyone ! 

I thank you again for your interest in my project. Although the project has not been completed, I still intend to complete it. In the meantime, during the month of September, I will release my 95 pages full color nsfw artbook of my illustrations. More information will be published in the next few months.

The Kickstarter has closed its doors! 

But this is not the end of our project. In one month we have grown up a lot and advanced in our adventure.  The Everlasting Tales will become great!

I will keep you informed via the Kickstarter news and as soon as the Oracle is released I will put the visuals online so that you can show them!

There are less than 48 hours left in our campaign!
Thanks again to all of you! 
Our goal is still far but it will not stop our project!

For the same occasion I wish you all a very happy new year!

Merry Christmas!

Many thanks again to all the contributors of the campaign! 
We wish you a very merry Christmas and a happy end of the year.

OMG! 16 days left before the end of the campaign!
