campaign.story:
Here are the add-ons! All you need to do to get the add-on items above your tier is to over-pledge the amount listed above. In the backer survey after the Kickstarter, you can tell us the item you pledged for, and we'll tact that on. Remember to add $10 for shipping for each physical item if your current tier doesn't have shipping included. If you already have shipping in your tier, just add a one-time $10 shipping fee. 
 Greetings, Portians and newcomers alike! Welcome back to the Alliance of Free Cities, and to the rugged mining town of Sandrock in My Time at Sandrock! In this much-anticipated follow-up to our award-winning simulation RPG, My Time at Portia, you will build up a brand new workshop and help out a struggling town in the most epic and legendary ways imaginable! But before you go on this unique adventure, we need your help to build My Time at Sandrock into the best experience it can be! We’re so grateful for your support on the Kickstarter for My Time at Portia back in 2018; it really helped propel that game into what it is today. So here we are again, hoping we can pull off the same magic!

 Quotes About Our Last Game
When we started working on Sandrock, it was supposed to be a downloadable addition to My Time at Portia. But as we delved deeper into game production, we realized that in order to fully express the tale of Sandrock, we needed to start from scratch. We required better graphics, better optimization, more story, and more satisfying gameplay systems: basically, we needed better production values across the board. On top of that, we really wanted to include a form of multiplayer that would really meet expectations for our players, and My Time at Portia’s programming structure just didn’t support that.
So, we set a few goals. First, Sandrock will have a similar pathos to My Time at Portia, but offer a completely new experience with new types of gameplay. We’re still aiming for a Miyazaki-inspired kind of world, but with a few other surprises thrown in... Second, we wanted to have the overall story arc be more satisfying, but also with more focus on each individual NPC. Third, we’re going to have a dedicated single-player RPG and a special mode where friends or strangers can play together. Fourth, optimize it and make it as bug-free as possible (we learned a lot of lessons from Portia). Fifth, make sure the sound and voice-acting in this game are up to standard. Finally, we’re going to self-port to the consoles so that we can make sure all the content is consistent across all platforms.
Recruited to Sandrock to be a Builder, you’ll arrive to find the town in a sad state. Shops are run down, buildings are empty, and people are looking to leave. It’ll be up to you to use your wits and skills to unite the townsfolk and rebuild the city into a beacon of prosperity.
My Time at Sandrock will maintain the simulation versus RPG balance that My Time at Portia had, with more depth for both. We are aiming to give the player a truly satisfying feeling when the game “ends.” We’re also working to give you a beautiful open world to gather materials, explore, and maintain a homestead. There will be mesas, deep canyons, vast deserts, endless salt plains, breathtaking ruins, and more!
Returning Portia players will find plenty of familiarities, but still just as many new things we think will only add to the workshop building experience. We’ve added enough gameplay tweaks in to keep things fresh, and also reworked some of the things players didn’t like about Portia. This is not a simple reskin and rewrite of Portia with new NPCs.
Chronologically, this game takes place around the same time as My Time at Portia; returning players will be able to enjoy seeing certain events that influenced Portia’s development from a new perspective.
Sandrock is a city-state located in the Eufaula Desert within the Alliance of Free Cities. It was founded beside Martle’s Oasis on top of an ancient metropolis. At first, the city attracted many prospectors interested in an extensive supply of relics hidden beneath the desert, but, as time went on, the oasis dried up, leaving the city unable to sustain a large population. Many people left, leaving the place in its vagarious state found today.
Water is a premium in Sandrock, with the only source being from Martle’s Oasis. Wood is also a rare resource, as not many trees grow in the area. Most of the trees around the oasis were cut by the original settlers: nowadays, you’ll have to find alternatives. The good news is that there are vast amounts of relics around these parts, some of them even hidden in plain sight!
There are numerous unique characters for you to discover in Sandrock, all with complex personalities and intricate backstories. Many of them can be romanced, and almost all of them can be befriended to unlock quests that will reveal their hopes, dreams, and personal goals, or maybe just a fun storyline to achieve something together with that character. We’ve written a new AI system for this game so that the characters will behave more “alive” than in My Time at Portia. For example, we’re planning to have the NPCs interact with each other more instead of keep to themselves like they do in Portia.
Speaking of Portia! Being that Sandrock and Portia are neighboring cities, it seems more than likely a few familiar faces will be stopping in, though we can’t exactly confirm who that will be yet…
Storyline – Just as in Portia, Sandrock will offer a deep and open narrative. There will be villains and heroes, comedy and tragedy. We also try to expand upon the lore first explored in My Time at Portia to give players deeper insight as to what the world of the Free Cities is like. The themes of the new storyline are similar to Portia’s: that people can overcome any adversity when they work together.
Multiplayer – We’ve heard you, and we are aiming to have a specific game mode for multiplayer, without interfering with our development of single-player. Much is still on the drawing board or in the design phase, but the aim is to support at least 4 players in an open world map, separate from the single-player map. Players will be able to work, fight, and dungeon dive together. We’re also looking to create multiplayer specific missions and storylines. Much of this is dependent on your support!
Workshop – You’re still in the role of a Builder in Sandrock, so the workshop is still the central focus of gameplay. You’ll need to gather materials and relics from all over the map to support your workshop and finish commissions from local townspeople and government. There will be lots of new upgrades for the machines in the workshop, as well as some customization features involving the homestead and furniture, i.e., drawing your own designs for things. Being the #1 workshop in the region will still be something for players to shoot for, but it may be hard to pull off without first attracting some industry to the town.
Farming – You’ll still be using planter boxes for farming in Sandrock, but with some new elements. We realize that in Portia we had a problem where almost the only thing players could get out of farming was a little extra money through selling crops. We’ll try to remedy that in Sandrock by making sure that there are multiple ways to utilize the harvest.
Relationships – All characters in the game will be more interactive than before: almost all of them will have character-specific questlines and have much more dialogue. Initially, fewer NPCs will be romanceable, but we are working to make each romanceable character unique and memorable with several personalized quests for each, in addition to giving them their own unique behaviors. The relationships are, once again, more than just something extra to do in the game; they’re tied together with the overall game loop: if you have a good relationship with a specific character, you’ll unlock perks such as new missions, stat boosts, cheaper goods, or a more willing hand to help out when you need it. Going the romance route will allow you to go on dates with the NPC, and eventually you’ll be able to marry the character and have kids.
Battle – The battle system is still relatively simple, but it feels and plays much better than in Portia. We’re looking to add more depth to this battle system before release, as well. You will fight an assortment of enemies: monsters, robots, bandits, and more. Enemies will behave more intelligently, and their attacks will be more coordinated, allowing for better counterplay. Larger enemies can collide with the player, and even send you flying with a strong enough hit!
Skills - There is leveling in the game, like most RPGs, but rather than gaining flat experience points for completing tasks, specific skill points will be earned by doing those activities (i.e. mining gives you points for mining skills, fighting gives you points for combat skills, etc.). These points can be distributed to give custom enhancements to your abilities.
Dungeons – There will be three types of dungeons in Sandrock. The Abandoned Ruins are dungeons without enemies, and you can dig safely through voxel terrain to find minerals and relics. The Hazardous Ruins are dungeons that are still classified as dangerous;  they’re filled with enemies leftover from an earlier age, as well as some platforming challenges. Finally, we have the all-new Half-Explored Ruins, where there are spots to dig through as well as enemies to fight.
Mini-games - We’re trying to add in as many different mini-games as possible. They will include sand racing, sand fishing, sparring, gun fighting, and more.
Holidays - There are several holidays and events that happen throughout the year in the game, some returning from Portia with a fresh take, some all new and unique to Sandrock! From the Day of the Bright Sun, which is celebrated all over; to the Day of Warmth, where people dance around a bonfire; to First Rain, where people celebrate the first rainfall of the year; each holiday will make for a fun and immersive experience that keeps the passage of time meaningful.
Weather - The game has four seasons as well as a full day-night cycle. Rain doesn’t come very often; but do watch out for the sandstorms!
Cooking - The game will have an elaborate setup for cooking. The player will be able to make many different recipes found throughout the world. The food can be sold, given as gifts, or eaten by the player to gain stats.
Animals - There are many different animals in the game world. Depending on the time of day, weather, and season, different animals will appear. Some of them can be captured and domesticated. We will have animal husbandry involving a multitude of farm and ranch animals with a fuzzy cow creature unique to Sandrock, the Yakmel, being the most prominent.
My Time at Sandrock will release on Steam Early Access in March 2021. We’re aiming to release the full game in Spring 2022. After that, it’ll be released on GOG, Epic Store, WeGame, and other PC platforms. The PS4, Switch, Xbox One, and next-gen console versions will release in Summer 2022.
Thank you pack! - Our big thank you for helping us in any way you can, it's really appreciated. You will get a wallpaper pack for your desktop.
Early Bird Pack - The first 50 people can have a Steam key at a very cheap price!
Digital Starter Pack - Receive a Steam key when the game launches, you can get the game at a lower price! We'll also list your name on our website!
Console Starter Pack - Receive a PS/Xbox/Switch key of your choice when the game launches on Console platforms. We'll also put your name on our website!
Steam Beta Access Pack - Steam Key and passcode for the Closed Beta test branch on Steam, you can start your journey earlier! Beta is planned to begin in January.
Digital Apprentice Pack - You'll get previous rewards, plus a Steam Key + Beta Access password, and you'll get a Steam key for the original soundtrack. Beta is planned to begin in January.
Multiplayer Early Access Pack - Everything from the Digital Apprentice kit, plus you will receive early access to the multiplayer branch at least three months before the game launches.
Name in Credits Pack - Everything from the Multiplayer Early Access Pack, plus your name will be listed not just on our website, but also in the in-game credits.
Double Steam Key - Everything from the previous reward tier, plus an additional Steam Key for Sandrock! You can share one with a friend and play together. Also includes the digital artbook from Steam.
Steam and Console Pack - All rewards from the Name in Credits Pack, but you'll get both the Steam key and the Console key (choose from PS/XBOX/SWITCH). Also includes the digital artbook on Steam.
Exclusive Weapon Pack - All rewards from the Name in Credits Pack, but with an additional Steam key and an exclusive in-game weapon. 
Exclusive Clothing Set Pack - Everything from the previous tier of rewards plus an exclusive clothing set for your Builder.
PC Digital Deluxe Pack - You get two Steam keys for the game, a key for the OST on Steam as well as an exclusive in-game clothing set, an exclusive in-game weapon, an exclusive in-game pet, and an exclusive in-game accessory. You will get the digital form of the Artbook. Your name will be listed in the game credits!
Console + PC Digital Deluxe Pack - The deluxe pack for console player; includes not just a console key, you'll have a Steam key and the OST key on Steam. You can play with us through beta (starting January) or wait for console release. Also, you'll have an exclusive in-game clothing set, an exclusive in-game weapon, an exclusive in-game pet and an exclusive in-game accessory. You will get the digital form of the Artbook. Your name will be listed in the game credits.
PC Backer T-Shirt Pack - Everything from the PC Digital Deluxe Pack, plus a special T-shirt only available through our Kickstarter. 
Console Backer T-shirt Pack - Everything from the Console Digital Deluxe Pack, plus an exclusive T-shirt available only through our Kickstarter.
Blind Box Figurine Pack - You'll everything from the PC Backer tier, and get an additional in-game weapon! Plus a Blind Box that contains a random Sandrock Figurine. (A character from Sandrock, but which one depends on your luck!)
PC All Digital Pack - You'll receive all the digital rewards and more: 2 steam keys, an OST key for Steam. And you'll get all exclusive in-game clothes, weapons, the pet, and the accessory. In addition, you'll have an extra Sandrock Blind Box Figurine (someone from Sandrock, it depends on your luck)!
PC + Console All Digital Pack - All digital rewards, including the two weapons, plus special Wedding attire! Additionally, you'll have an extra Sandrock Blind Box Figurine (someone from Sandrock, it depends on your luck)!
Physical Deluxe Pack - Beyond all in-game digital gifts, you'll receive 3 Sandrock Blind Boxes, an exclusive physical Sandrock Map, and a physical signed Artbook. (signed by Sandrock director, producer, and artists) 
Name in Sandrock Pack - In addition to all the exclusive digital and physical gifts from previous tiers, you'll get one more blind box figurine, and you'll have a chance to let other Sandrock players call your name! Your name will be mentioned in the game somewhere! Finally, you'll receive a cool space punch T-shirt.
All Blind Box Figurines + Design Starter - You'll have all blind box figurines (a complete set of NPC figurines from Sandrock), and you can work with us to design a Melee Weapon! We will also put a custom drawing or piece of art from you somewhere into the game. 
Supreme Physical Gift + Voice Actor Pack - Other rewards plus the highest tier of physical gifts: a 1000 piece puzzle of Sandrock, and the super limited Ginger figurine! Additionally, you can design your own hairstyle, and also contribute your voice to a monster in-game; threaten other Sandrock workshop owners with your cool new 'do!
Honorary Designer Pack - In addition to other premium rewards, you can help us design a monster and a feasible side mission to be placed in the game, using assets we supply.
Supreme Designer Pack - You receive all premium benefits, help us with the honorary designer aspects, plus you can help us design a pet and a dungeon Boss to be placed in the game, using assets we supply. You'll also receive the intriguing magic floating Power Stone!

Ultimate Pack
In addition to every single reward we have to offer, in addition to all the designer input,  we'll custom create an in-game clothing set for you and only you to wear! All the developers will sign a unique physical custom artwork and send it just to you! Finally, you will be able to choose a name (within reason) for one of the NPCs in Sandrock!

Why We Need Your Help
We’re a small studio, so we never have enough funding. But the reason we wanted to do this Kickstarter is because there are a couple of features that we really want to do well this time around, and any extra funding would go a long way to ensure that.
The first thing is multiplayer. Multiplayer is hard to do well, and we want to create a multiplayer mode that people would actually be excited to bring their friends in to play. To do that, we’ll need to hire more programmers, designers and artists to specifically craft that experience, and that’ll significantly increase the budget.
The second thing we want to do is to self-publish. We feel like that if we handle all the publishing duties ourselves, we’ll be better positioned to service all the different platforms in a timely matter. This will also take some extra budget.
Overall, we do have the funding to finish the game in a timely and fully realized manner. If the Kickstarter somehow fails, we’ll probably only have a basic version of multiplayer until the sales of the game pick up.
About Pathea Games
Pathea Games is an indie game studio based in Chongqing, China, made up of a team of individuals who want to make fun games. Our last Kickstarted game, My Time at Portia was successfully released on Steam in 2019.

You can contact us by emailing: Sandrock@pathea.net

You can join us on Discord: My Time at Sandrock Channel

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Risks and Challenges
Pathea Games has been developing My Time at Sandrock for close to two years now. The game is about 35% complete, with many of the main systems in working condition. All the developers needed for the single-player are already in place and working hard.

We’ve delivered the Kickstarter-backed My Time at Portia before, and we’re using the experience gained from that project to create a better game out of My Time at Sandrock.

We invite you to join us on this adventure.

campaign.story:
Hello, I'm Arkestar and I'm an illustrator from Paris (France). I really like to draw weird girls with bold colors. Perhaps you know me from Twitter or Instagram.
This is my very first project on Kickstarter.
I decided to create a tarot deck called Memento Mori. It will feature young girls in school uniforms in a dark atmosphere, inspired by the japanese movement ero-guro.
Memento Mori is my reinterpretation of the Tarot of Marseilles, in my own style.
I hope you'll enjoy it and I am counting on you to make this project happen. ✨
"Remember that you must die" translates to Memento Mori in latin.
Expressing the vanity of life on Earth, it refers to the "art of dying", or Ars Moriendi. 
This motto embodies this project because it highlights different symbolisms of death in an aesthetic way.
This topic has inspired many works since Antiquity, in Christianity, in various media such as literature, cinema or visual art.
Through my tarot project, I reinterpreted this saying in a modern way, with a contemporary aesthetic, influenced by Japanese pop culture and Western esotericism.
Features of the deck :
78 cards (22 Major Arcana cards + 56 Minor Arcarna cards)
Large format cards (70 x 150 mm)
High-textured premium paper (400 gsm)
A magnetic box
For this tarot deck, I wanted to use the best quality material I could. That’s why I picked heavyweight textured paper for this, a mat finish, as well as an unusual card shape.
(The cards are longer than regular tarot cards, which sets this deck apart from others which usually use standard sizes)
Each card has a singular design, with its own title and number. 
Card Back / Judgement
Death / The Hanged Man
The Lovers / The Moon
Major Arcana / 22 cards

About the minor arcana cards :
There are 56 minor arcana cards, stemming from 4 family of designs (Wands, Cups, Swords and Pentacles).
Their designs will be revealed throughout the campaign on my social media!
I have developed different type of rewards, for the ones who are interested in the tarot deck, in the tarot deck and goods or in the goods only.

So, here’s a little presentation of the different rewards :

 ✨  The Booster ✨
A booster with 3 random cards, wrapped with glassine paper.
(For people who want to play with chance)

✨  Silkscreen Prints ✨
 Small Silkscreen Prints in limited edition (50 ex.), 4 colors, screenprinted and signed by me. Size,10 x 21 cm. Heavyweight, 350gsm paper.
Each print is homemade. Because I make all prints by hand using screens, the process can cause small variations. The design of the shapes and the choices of colors were carefully planned, and every print will be produced in limited edition. This makes every piece unique and high quality.
Screen printing, also known as serigraphy, is a method of creating an image on paper by pressing ink through a screen with areas blocked off by a stencil. The technique is used for making fine art prints.

✨  The enamel Pin ✨
An exclusive enamel Pin from the tarot card "The World". 
All rewards will be shipped in February / March 2021. Shipping details are all specified under the pledge you pick.

campaign.story:
FREE BOOK FOR ALL SUBSCRIBERS!
We've only gone and complete and utterly FULLY FUNDED the entire next year of F(r)iction! Thank you all for your support in achieving this incredible goal!
As such, we have unlocked our final stretch goal: all backers who  have pledged at a subscriber tier (subscription mania and above) will received a FREE PRINT COPY OF F(r)iction #15: Identity!
GORGEOUS BOOKS for a GOOD CAUSE!
F(r)iction is a compendium of all things unexpected: gorgeous, art-drenched books that raise money for charity! Helping global literacy has never looked so shiny!
Photo by Lauren Renner for Kickstarter
Working with diverse creators from around the globe, each issue of F(r)iction encompasses stories, poems, essays, comics, and custom art that dare us to think differently. 
From speculative fiction to daring memoirs, we seek voices that are often silenced in the industry, elevating the weird, the controversial, and the captivating literary misfits.
But we don't just publish them. Oh no! We make sure our books are as visually stunning as the stories within, soaking each issue in specialty—“oooh, shiny”—printing effects, bold design choices, and custom illustrations!
Started as a passion project by a ragtag group of passionate—and oh-so geeky—editors back in 2015, F(r)iction has since grown into an internationally distributed, celebrity-studded collection of art and literature.  
But we've never lost our roots. 
We still champion brand-new, bold, and diverse voices by offering free mentorship to hundreds of new creators a year, paying and supporting all our contributors, and never, ever shying away from the works that challenge our conventions.
Art for "Summer Home," the short story by Brett Riley that opens F(r)iction #11, the ISLAND issue (art by Michelle Lockamy)
 Our Nonprofit Mission
F(r)iction is the imprint of Brink Literacy Project, a nonprofit that teaches storytelling in prisons, increases literacy rates worldwide, and offers a unique publishing internship for the industry’s next best editors. 
So, not only does our shiny little journal harness the power of storytelling and serve as the key teaching tool in all our education programs, it also serves as part of an even greater project: to give a voice to those on the brink.
 What Makes F(r)iction Different...
Breaking into the publishing industry is hard. Really, really hard. So we use this lovely book to help new voices break through. 
Thus, more than 30% of each issue is content taken from our slush pile. Translation: We heavily focus on publishing new and emerging authors, working with them through multiple rounds of edits to get their work into pristine condition. Then, we put their stories right next to bold, experimental work from celebrity authors.
From Lev Grossman, author of The Magicians series, to the illustrious Charlie Jane Anders and poet-extraordinaire Kwame Dawes, we publish a celebrity pioneering writer feature in every issue, with original work, behind-the-scenes peeks at their process, career timelines, and exclusive interviews. By opening space for boundary-defying works by big-time names and newcomers alike, we galvanize our mission to change the literary landscape, one curiously strange story at a time.
Uncommon Stories, Unique Inspirations, &...
We don’t shy away from work that makes us uncomfortable. In fact, each issue takes a theme and delves deep. Identity, Obsession, Taboo, or Monsters, we publish content from the outskirts of reality to help us do what literature does best... see the unseen.
…Unexpected Perspectives
We’re only as strong as the people who share our vision, which is why every issue features work from one of our Community Partnerships. These organizations use literature as a way to broadcast voices that need to be heard.
Innovative Reading Experience
By now you’ve probably noticed the vibrant, immersive pages that make up our journal. Thanks to our international team of artists, we illustrate each piece and redesign every journal to soak the reader in the theme.  
Art for Upcoming Legacy Issue (by Zach Meyer)
For example, take a gander at our Monster Issue, which we printed with all black pages so that the stories—like their imagined monsters—would seep out from the darkness, ready to pounce....
PLAY

Not only that, but look at how damn beautiful our covers are! Spot gloss, embossing, and holographic printing make each issue glimmer, shine, and dazzle the eye. 
Stories Aren’t Just Written…
…They’re drawn, too! In an industry that undervalues the glorious (and accessible) universe of comics, we say “Nay—objections!” Graphic stories are just as compellingly powerful as prose and poetry, and we’re here to prove it by publishing an original graphic story in every issue.
 The Future of F(r)iction 
The editors are already busily working to bring you the next era of epic storytelling. This fall, our newest creation, F(r)iction #17: MEMORY, will explore everything remembered, forgotten, and reimagined. Hot on its heels, we’ll be releasing F(r)iction #18: Legacy and F(r)iction #19: ARCANA next year. Yes, we can hardly wait too!
PLAY

Where the Money Goes!
No surprise, but making a super shiny book full of art, comics, and stellar voices (while actually paying creatives) from around the world is, well...expensive. So expensive, we made this terrifying chart: 
Note on What you Don’t See: Notice how there’s no money going to admin or staff? That’s because F(r)iction is almost entirely volunteer run. Our boss ladies, editors, marketeers, designers, and art directors all donate their time to mentor our creative community and make these lovely books. In fact, it takes a whopping 30+ volunteer staff donating more than 9,600 hours a year to keep this beast going.
We’ve been surviving through this model since our inception—with a hefty dose of fundraising projects manned by our boss ladies on the backend!—but now we have a Barnes & Noble/COVID-shaped hole in our income ($8,000 per issue, $24,000 per year!).
That’s what we’re hoping to raise with your help. This funding will work to enable us to:
 Continue Paying our Authors & Artists: We wouldn’t have a journal without the people filling our pages. Creators are the backbone of everything we do, and we believe WITH ALL OUR HEARTS, that they should be paid for the magic they cast!
 Print the Darn Thing And Print it Right: We’ll pay our lovely printer to make three shiny, color-soaked issues—with no swanky expense spared—and ship them to you (and hopefully everyone you know)!
 Donate the Proceeds: You’d think we’d stuff any remaining profit into our pockets, but you’d be wrong! All proceeds go directly to Brink, so that the nonprofit can keep using F(r)iction to support creatives, equip educators, and inspire students from underserved communities.
 Reward Tiers 
Just reopened this tier! Enjoy all the holiday fun!
Just three available!
ALL GONE! (Sorry!) 
Please note to keep an eye on the stretch goals to see when we unlock more exclusive celebrity tiers like the ones sold out below!


STRETCH GOALS
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Let’s be real, there are always unexpected issues in publishing––seriously, how many times CAN InDesign crash? *Slams laptop closed* Pirates stole the boat that was shipping our journal? That doesn’t even make sense!

We’ve been at this for years, and we have a team more resilient than a pack of rubber bands. We’re dedicated to putting out the biggest and most bizarre fires. (That pirate thing is a true story.) We’ve never failed to deliver a high-quality product on deadline, because who needs sleep? NOT US!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hello again, lovely Backer—
The Literary Tarot Kickstarter is now LIVE!
That's right, we have just, just, just launched our latest Kickstarter campaign. It's wildly ambitious and unlike anything we've done before. Working with some of the greatest authors and illustrators of our time, Brink is tapping into the magic of classic literature to bring a whole new kind of tarot deck to life with The Literary Tarot.
Dearest F(r)iction readers,

Helllllooo dearest backers!
As it’s been a few weeks since our last update—and we’ve covered a lot of ground in that time—we thought we should pop in for another update!
DIGITAL PRODUCTS & REWARDS

Helllllooo dearest backers!
We are popping into your inboxes with further updates and intel about our fulfillment progress. If you backed us for no reward or selected a tier with only digital goodies, read no further! You, dearest readers, are all done!

updates.update_content:
Happy New Year to all you lovely backers!
We are here with an update about fulfillment and more digital goodies that we’re sending your way!
Fulfillment Continues!

Hello lovely backers!
We are popping back into your inboxes on this merry Christmas eve for the quickest of updates. A few of you flagged that you had issues with the digital issue download links sent out on Tuesday to those backers whose pledge tier included a digital download or who purchased a digital issue add-on.
We’ve been beavering away with BackerKit to get this tech issue sorted and we’re happy to say that a few minutes ago you should have received another email with a new link that should now work. Apologies for the inconvenience and enjoy these luscious literary treats!

Hello lovely backers!
We are popping back into your inboxes with another update, so grab a coffee/tea/G&T/mince pie and dig in!
F(r)iction #17 Mayhem… and Holiday Tier Backers

Hello lovely backers!
This is it! We’ve locked all your survey info and the order details have come through to us—which means we’re prepping to ship! And THAT means pretty soon you’ll have your glimmering F(r)iction goodness to adore and admire. Oooo la la!
We will therefore be locking shipping addresses tomorrow morning. That means you have 24 hours from now to update your shipping address in your BackerKit survey.

Hello lovely backers!
We’re just popping in with a quick reminder that Monday 14th December (i.e. in just 3 days!) is the last day to make any final updates to your order!
Even if you pledged for “no reward” during the campaign, please complete this very short survey—it helps us to make sure that we have got everyone’s orders and details correctly sorted at our end.

Hello all you lovely backers!
We hope you all had the most delightful of holidays (or, for you non-Americans, just a normal November week). In lieu of turkey (or faux turkey) feasts, we’ve been hard at work getting the fulfillment worked out with BackerKit. After a slew of back-and-forths with their tech department, we are close to having the system up and kicking!

Soon you’ll each receive an email from us with a special link to your BackerKit survey. We know you all are slammed, but if you could respond to your survey as quickly as you can, we’d be MASSIVELY grateful. We can’t lock the system until EVERYONE has completed their survey, and we need to get those Holiday Extravaganza backers their gift-wrap-ready Monster issues in time to slide under the tree.

campaign.story:
BEHOLD!
We're back with a brand new cooking adventure! This is a quest to soup-up your soups, sturdy your stews, and work your woks! We are part of the Legend's Cookbook crew and this project is all about producing the Hero's Ladle, a custom-molded and beautifully laser-engraved wok ladle envisioned, designed, and made by working closely with a small manufacturer. It is ornately-crafted and even comes with a rotating, removable coin charm on the handle. Not only will we be producing this heroic kitchen utensil, but we'll be sweetening the pot with a few extra items: a 5-recipe companion cookbook featuring mouthwatering dishes to use the ladle, a Hero of the Ladle Enamel Pin, and a new Legend's Stealth Apron! All of these things are brand new and made just for our backers. It will be something special for all of your culinary adventures.
Is that a black radish?
This is our first quest into custom kitchenware and we want to make sure the end product is something both special and useful. Depending on the success of this Kickstarter, there may be a possibility of doing more kitchen utensils and other kitchen accessories in the future.
I can smell the fresh-cracked black pepper.
As for progress, all of our new soup recipes have been made and taste-tested extensively. The Hero of the Ladle enamel pin and Stealth Apron have been designed with samples already ordered and received (as pictured below). There are a few minor tweaks to be made with the samples so the designs are definitely not final but these have all been communicated to our manufacturer and are ready to go!
I moved the pocket down like an inch on the final version.
The last piece of our quest is to produce the Hero's Ladle. This is the one that is going to take the most amount of time to perfect and produce. We're working closely with our ladle manufacturer on designing the best ladle possible for our backers. To be completely transparent, ordering a custom mold is expensive, hence why the Kickstarter is needed in order to go any further in production. We will be updating the Kickstarter every step of the way to keep everyone up-to-date on the ladle and all other backer rewards. We don't have a sample produced quite yet but we have been working on mock-ups and think that this will be something special, hitting the points of being both practical and incredible.
Shiny!
Another note about the Hero's Ladle is that it will be a limited run, which is why almost all the reward tiers have a backer limit. Since this is our first time working on custom kitchen utensils, we want to keep this project on the smaller end of things. As mentioned earlier, if all goes well, maybe there will be future items. Maybe an entire set. 🤔
First let's talk about our Hero's Ladle! We aren't just bulk wholesale buying ladles, we are working with skilled kitchenware engineers to design a custom mold for this ladle. The ladle will be made from food-safe 18/8 stainless steel meaning the steel contains 18% chrome and 8% nickel. This is one of most common materials found in kitchens today.  It's used in appliances, cookware, dishware, flatware, and utensils because it is durable, easy to sanitize, and corrosion resistant from acids, meats, milk, fruits, and vegetables. Stainless steel is one of the safest materials to use when it comes to food. Our ladle will have a matte finish and a laser-engraved handle featuring some of our art. On the end of the ladle there will be a special, rotating charm that can be removed and used as a keychain.
Why is blueprint paper blue? Legit question.
Removable coin keychain on the end of every ladle. It spins!
The Legend's Cookbook: Hero of the Ladle digital companion cookbook will include 5 soup recipes to test out your brand new ladle. Each recipe will feature beautiful art and exquisite food photography, a feast for you stomach and for your eyes! Not only that, but there are chances to add additional recipes to this little cookbook by unlocking stretch goals!
I went overboard with the carrots, don't make my mistake.
Want to show off how much of a foodie nerd you are? Take the Hero of the Ladle with you on your culinary adventure with our enamel pin! This hard enamel pin is .9" (23mm) in size and has a shiny gold finish. Wear it on your backpack or on your favorite apron!
Lastly, the Stealth Apron is a new type of Legend's apron! The fabric was specially printed in order to incorporate a full coverage design. This utility apron also has a pocket, adjustable neck strap, and is made from absorbent fabric to help clean up any kitchen messes made along the way.
Aprontastic! (Is that a word?)
For this project, we have some old friends and some new faces. Check out their socials and give them a follow!
Peter J Abreu - Co-Chef & Project Lead - Pilot, Chef, & Tea Connoisseur, Peter is a man of a wide array of talents. For these recipes, Peter draws inspiration from the many places and cultures he has visited throughout his life. He believes that sharing a good meal is a great way to bring people closer together.
Alyssa Browning - Co-Chef & Artist - Lovely Alyssa is currently a culinary school student. She has an affinity for finding and trying out cursed food recipes so we don't have to. She's also good with a pen and paper and is the artist of the ladle sketch seen in the Kickstarter video.
Patrick Deasy - Videographer & Photographer - Funny, cursed meme man, Pat works out of the Midwest and is the genius behind the Kickstarter video!
Rose Jackson - Editor - Rose is a professional in the world of administration and keeps our project compass pointing the right way!
Dyguren - Artist - A freelance artist and graphic designer from Venezuela. His work can be found throughout our project. He's the designer of our 'Chefkah Eye' logo, our pin, and our apron!
ケLV - Artist - ケLV's main love is monsters and comics but they set that aside for some cookbook shenanigans. Their work can be found throughout the digital cookbook in various page assets and food drawings.
Cornage - Artist -  Line art, line art, line art. Tony is great at making lines pretty. He also has a great sense of humor. His art can be found in some of the ladle mock-ups, specifically the blueprint mock-up.
Prism - Artist - A stunning pixel artist. He's worked on OTHER: Her Loving Embrace and many other neat video games. He's the creator of the Legend's Cookbook's short lived mascot Nana-Chan (RIP 🙏). He is the sprite artist for our Cadence of Calamity Reward Tier.
Li Kovács - Voice Actor - Li wears many hats: dedicated gamer, amazing artist & photographer, talented cosplayer, loving wife, caring mother, and now voice actor! She's the voice of Impa in the Zelda Universe's upcoming Breath of the Wild dub. She was kind enough to lend us her talents for our Kickstarter video!
JOBJOB LLC - Publishing Company - The publishing company helping make this project a reality.
 $5 - First Course: Chip in a little and get your name in the Thank You section of the companion cookbook AND a digital copy of the companion book!
   $35 - Soup Chef: The great soup journey starts with taking up this ladle. Get your own Hero's Ladle as well as a digital copy of the companion cookbook and your name in the Thank You section!
   $48 - Pin It To Win It: Take a companion with you with the Hero of the Ladle Enamel Pin. With this pin you also get the Hero's Ladle, a digital copy of the companion cookbook, and your name in the Thank You section!
   $62 -  Sneaky Chef: Pair this Stealth Apron with a Sneaky Elixir and no one will be able to catch you grabbing a midnight snack. With this apron, you will also get the Hero's Ladle, a digital copy of the companion cookbook, and your name in the Thank You section!
   $72 - Full Set: Fully equip your kitchen so it's ready to take on any challenge with the Full Set. It includes the Hero's Ladle, the Hero of the Ladle Enamel Pin, the Stealth Apron, a digital copy of the companion cookbook, and your name in the Thank You section!
   $125 - Cadence of Calamity: Get on beat with a 32-Bit Sprite art piece of you or your avatar PLUS a sticker of the sprite! Send us a photo, tell us what adventure you want to be on, and what your weapon of choice is and we'll give you the sprite treatment. It also includes the Hero's Ladle, the Hero of the Ladle Enamel Pin, the Stealth Apron, a digital copy of the companion cookbook, and your name in the Thank You section!
 $500 - Champion's Treasure: This is the ultimate backer reward! With this tier you will get a Paperback and Hardcover copy of The Legend's Cookbook with a personal message from the author Peter J Abreu, a 2-piece magnet set featuring a conversion chart and the cover of the companion cookbook, a 32-Bit Sprite art piece PLUS a sticker of the sprite, the Hero's Ladle, the Hero of the Ladle Enamel Pin, the Stealth Apron, a digital copy of the companion cookbook, and your name in the Thank You section of the book! All these items (except the digital ones) will be packaged and shipped out in a custom stained wooden chest. Use this chest to store all of your adventuring tools!
We have some stretch goals planned should this project get funded! We hope you are as excited as we are to see some of these items come to life.
 $10,000 - Calamity Recipes: Five (5) new recipes, not necessarily related to soup, will be added to the digital companion cookbook. These will be recipe only.
   $12,000 - Get Stocked: A section in the companion cookbook on how to make various soup stocks and other useful soup making tips!
   $14,000 - Picture Perfect: Photos of the five (5) additional Calamity Recipes will be added.
   $15,000 - Spider Cider: The companion cookbook will now include the recipes from the previous Curse of the Golden Skullspatula project, but this time with photos!
   $15,600 to $18,000 - Reel It In: Every $600 passed $15k will add a professional video tutorial by our chefs Peter and Alyssa will be made for one of the five soup recipes. A QR code will be included on the recipe page that links to the appropriate video. (Amounts: $15,600, $16,200, $16,800, $17,400, $18,000)
Help us cook up more recipes!
PLAY

Not only do we have this Kickstarter going on, but a Calamity is upon us in the Calamity Cookoff! This social media contest has been extended to run until Tuesday, December 1st and there are still 2 chances to win a unique Royal Chef Apron. 
The Royal Chef Apron will only be available as a prize!
Check out the graphic below for more details! The winner of the actual Calamity Cookoff and winner of the Fall Craft Fair have the opportunity (should they so choose) to have their recipe or their art included in The Legend's Cookbook: Hero of the Ladle companion cookbook! So far we've been blown away by all the amazing entries we have received!
Thank you all for your continued support! We love creating and sharing new things for this little community and hope everyone is as excited as we are! These projects really wouldn't be possible without everyone chipping in to help make something special 💖
For updates and sneak peeks on other projects we have in the works, be sure to follow us on social media @LegendsCookbook on Twitter, @Legends_Cookbook on Instagram, or join in the fun on our Discord!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Every quest has its pitfalls and this one is no exception. We will be working hard to ensure that the ladles, pins, and aprons are of the best quality we can muster. We are working with manufacturers to make something special and unique for all of our backers and there will be a lot of trial and error. We plan to be open and honest with you all. We have had problems with delays before and COVID-19 is still a major issue in our supply chain. Make sure to check in with us through our social media and backer updates so that we can all stay on the same page about the project progress. If anything happens, you will know!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Since its first Kickstarter in 2012, the Smut Peddler series of sex-positive comic anthologies has been leading the charge of cool, consent-driven porno in the comics small press. Our five previous installments have established not only a fantastic precedent of killer collections, but literally invented the gold standard of anthology payouts, rewarding artists with big, BIG page rate bonuses when the project takes off!
Smut Peddler Presents: Sordid Past is...
Our sixth Smut Peddler anthology,
Our fourth FULL-COLOR anthology, and
Our fourth themed anthology!
And this time, the theme is: HISTORY. Sordid Past's stories are set all all sorts of different points in history, from Neolithic Britain to Pharonic Egypt, ancient Sumeria to Renaissance Italy, 80s America to 13th century Finland!

✧THE STORY✧ 
Hi it's me, posing with The Devil. Photo taken by Gayatri
Hi, I'm Charlotte, the girl behind cmuins and bananarolls.
When I was fifteen, I found my aunt's deck of Rider-Waite-Smith cards and began my journey into reading tarot (with help from my witchy aunt). While I loved to read for family and friends, there was always something missing when I used the RWS cards – it just didn't resonate with me as much. 

Creating my own deck of tarot cards has been a dream since 2010 and it was only in April 2019 that I painted the first card of this deck. It's a very personal deck and project, where every card was painted with specific memories and scenarios in mind, and are filled with whimsical yet dark symbols that illustrate the nuances one faces in life.
Major Arcana Exhibition in November 2019. Photo taken by Emily.
Between April and November last year, I finished the first section of my deck; the Major Arcana, and under very fortunate, albeit rushed (I had two weeks to prepare) circumstances, I was able to hold my first proper exhibition at a gorgeous flower shop, betabularasa, thanks to the generous Tabu, Jam, and my mediator, Lydia. 

The exhibition was a fundraiser for my city, Hong Kong, and all proceeds went to Spark Alliance, a charity organisation that provides legal aid for people who were arrested during the 2019 Hong Kong protests. I sold 20 out of 22 Major Arcana original paintings, as well as ran a pay-as-you-like onsite tarot reading table.  
We raised a total of $30,000 HKD.
Tarot reading table at the exhibition, 2019. Photo taken by Emily.
By the exhibition opening, I had already made my first Major Arcana-only prototype of the 22 cards and have been using it to read for family, friends, and strangers over the past year. 

It's also because of the first prototype that I decided to complete the deck and subsequently spent the next 10 months painting the last 56 cards of the Minor Arcana.
Ace to Ten of Cups
It's been a struggle throughout this one and a half year painting all 78 cards while juggling a full-time day job, freelance projects, and life in general, but...
 I've done it! 
And I couldn't be prouder of this deck and I am so, so excited to be able to present this as a very possible reality to you. 
November 2019 Exhibition. Photo taken by Emily
✸✸✸✸✸✸✸✸✸✸✸✸✸✸✸✸✸✸✸✸✸✸✸✸✸✸

✧ABOUT THE DECK✧ 
First full-deck prototype, will update when second prototype arrives.
78 card deck, 70mm x 121mm
S33 Superior Smooth Cardstock with Black Core 
Tuck box
Digital and Physical zine to guide you through the first steps of your tarot journey (work-in-progress, will be done over the course of the campaign)
✧ UPDATE:  Due to backer and funding goals being completed, this is now a 86 card deck at 70 x 120mm with 400gsm cardpaper (I like my paper thick), with a lidded box, matte-sprayed gold gilded edges, and a physical printed zine! 
PLAY

L'Œil de L'Âme (French, in which the transliteration means Eye of the Soul, but in cantonese, we refer to this synonymously as 'the Third Eye'), refers to both the intuitive elements within each card as well as the method in which you need to read them.
The cards, based on the RWS deck, are delicately illustrated with watercolor on paper over the course of two years and are the illustrative manifestations of how I view the world.
Back of the card which I re-designed very recently, after the I've already ordered the second full deck prototype
A minimalistic tuckbox in comparison to hold the vibrant cards -- will upload photographs of the tuckbox when I receive the prototype
I've divided the deck into three major sections as an easier way for myself to understand the cards as well; The Major Arcana, The Minor Arcana, and the Court Cards.
- all images are print-ready thumbnails and therefore have wider borders because of bleeding- 

The Major Arcana
The Major Arcana is a set of 22 cards that explain the larger truths of the universe and therefore rule the major turn of events in our lives. It's also why the cards are a lot more brighter and detailed to aid in describing the nuances.
One of my favourites and is now sitting in the home of my dear friend Karen
The Minor Arcana
 For the Minor Arcana, I've further divided them into two sections; Aces up to Tens, and the Court Cards. The first ten cards of each suite are in black and white due to their nature of being small, minor events and details in life -- in a way, they're to help explain further the interpretations from the Major Arcana. 
The Court Cards (Part of the Minor Arcana)
The Court Cards, instead, do not really illustrate events or situations, but people. They are personality or 'face' cards as they call it. Which is also why I did them in monochromatic colours according to which suite they're from.
Moreover, each of the suites represents one of the four elements; Cups for Water, Pentacles for Earth, Wands for Fire, and Swords for Air. Therefore, I've also selected corresponding mythical creatures for each suite; Mermaid for Cups, Satyrs for Pentacles, Salamanders for Fire, and Angels/Winged Beings for Air.
✸✸✸✸✸✸✸✸✸✸✸✸✸✸✸✸✸✸✸✸✸✸✸✸

✧HOW TO USE THE DECK✧

What Do You Use Tarot For?
Tarot cards are traditionally used for divination (at least, since the 19th century). But like many modern-day decks, the L'Œil de L'Âme Tarot is made with the intention of helping you with your shadow work. Shadow work, rooted in Jungian psychology, is essentially the introspective practice of understanding and embracing who you are.

Deck Personality: No-Nonsense but Kind.
After spending a year reading with my 2019 prototype deck, I can safely say that the cards have no time for any of your bullshit. However, while they aren't afraid to tell you the things you need to hear, the L'Œil de L'Âme Tarot, unlike the traditional RWS deck, are gentler in how they explain your situations. 

I Don't Know How To Read Tarot, Can I Still Use Them?
Anyone can learn to read Tarot. With this deck in particular, due to the abundance of symbols as well as a guide that I'm working on to help you learn to read the cards, reading for yourself and your peers should not be an issue. This is a deck suitable for complete newbies, beginners, and people who've already had experience with tarot. Trust your instinct and let the cards tell you what you need to hear.
I am currently also working on a zine that's included in the deck to explain the basics of each card and examples of how to read the deck.
Also for those who are based in Hong Kong, I am also very slowly planning workshops on how to use this deck.

Kickstarter is also an ALL-OR-NOTHING platform; if I don't reach my funding goal, your money will automatically be refunded. So it's a very backer-oriented campaign platform.

Printing & Sourcing: 
I prioritise printing and sourcing my reward items locally in Hong Kong, with a preference to support small and local businesses. Due to this, manufacturing costs are higher than if I were to source them from Mainland China factories. 
Shop small, shop local, friends. 

Fulfillment and Delivery Date: 
I've set the delivery date to April 2021 to give myself a (huge) cushion for production.etc. But these dates would be moved up if this project gets funded! 
I'm so sorry but I will probably not be able to make these decks available in time for Christmas this year.

Funding Breakdown:
Prototyping and Production 80% / Kickstarter Fee 10% / Labour & Other Fees 10%

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is my first crowdfunding campaign as well as the first large-scale print production project I'm setting out to create so I'm learning as I go. However the full deck design is complete and ready to go with my only risks being the following:

1. Exposure 
I work a full time day job as well as freelancing work which means I only work on my art in the after-hours and on weekends. Also I do not have a large following on social media which also poses a risk for a successful Kickstarter.

To tackle that, I am learning to reach out to media outlets to promote my project but there's only so much one pair of hands can do. 

Your help to spread the word about this project is essential! Just sharing, reposting, and telling your friends about this deck could be crucial to bringing in more backers which will contribute to you getting your rewards as well! It's a win-win for all!

2. Unexpected Shipping Delays
2020 has been a wild year and no one knows what will come for us next -- I cannot guarantee shipping on time due to unexpected Co-Vid19 delays but that's also why I've given myself such a large time cushion for estimated delivery dates. Other than that, I will also keep everyone updated should such issues arise. 

3. Guide (Digital and Physical Zine)
I am currently still working on the guide as to how to use the deck, read the cards, and each card's explanations but I am confident that I will finish it over the course of the Kickstarter campaign. Should there be any delays, I will keep everyone updated. 

The illustrations of the deck is fully done.

If you have any questions, you can shoot me a message or even find me on Instagram.

Hi y'all~ I hope you're having a good May and that with the blood moon eclipse and THREE (?!) retrogrades aren't taking too much of a toll on you <3 
It seems as though the first batch of international orders and many of the local orders are arriving! I hope you all love the deck as much as I do <3 
Due to popular vote on my Instagram, I made a small timelapse of me packing some of the Third Eye reward tier orders:

Hi, hope you're all doing well, and now for the round of updates!
The decks have all arrived and are now stored in my grandmother's storage room:

Hope you've had a great Easter/Ching Ming/Children's Day weekend! 
For those who haven't seen it on my Instagram, I come bearing good news as the samples from the deck have finally arrived!!! 
LOOK AT THESE BEAUTIES:

Hi guys, I just wanna thank you all again so much for supporting this Kickstarter project and I hope you've been having a good 2021 so far in spite of the pandemic. 

I'm knees deep in the process of getting the cards printed; we've gone through approving digital drafts, selected the shade of gold foil, laminations, the ribbon that will go inside the open-book box.etc.

Hi y'all (And Happy Chinese New Year!)~ If you don't want to miss any update, you might want to follow my Instagram account @cmuins. With balancing everything my Instagram is probably the only social media that I remember to consistently post on (it's also really the easiest way to find me).

 Things have been rather busy on my end since the end of this Kickstarter campaign as I'm busy fulfilling/designing/prototyping all the lum sum (miscellaneous) items I've promised you <3 But now, onwards to all the updates I have for you!

1 month of crowdfunding on Kickstarter, 1 month of drafting and preparing for its launch, 1.5 years of painting the first 78 cards, we're done with the campaign stage of this tarot deck and it's all thanks to YOU. 

Thank you so much for choosing to be a part of this journey to help me make this tarot deck a reality.

Hello~ 
Just popping in to announce that I've finished the first four bonus cards; WITCHES!

Hello, hello, hello! It's been a week and quite a lot has happened (though still not yet set in stone), but first things first...
WE ARE 200% FUNDED IN NINE DAYS!!!
I can't say it enough but it's an absolutely overwhelming experience to have your incredible support to make this deck a reality. Thank you so much for supporting the project and I cannot wait till you meet the cards!

I'm late to my own party but WE'RE 100% FUNDED! OVER 100% FUNDED! 
AND IT ONLY TOOK A DAY AND A HALF (rambling something semi-poetic about taking a year and a half to paint and then taking a day and a half to fund...)

And with that, our 7th Bonus card has been unlocked!! All the Witches and the first three Guardians will now be added to your deck for free if you've pledged for a deck!!

campaign.story:
This Kickstarter recognizes and supports the Kickstarter Union!
WHAT IS THIS GAME?
Spindlewheel is an interpretive tarot-like storytelling game where you weave your story from card to card. It is a roleplaying system built on the foundations of interpretation, procedural generation, and collaborative storytelling.
WHAT’S THE OBJECTIVE?
The objective of the game is to tell a satisfying story.  Your character might win wealth and respect and come away from the adventure a better person; they might crash and burn, and end the story as a warning to others.  Both of these are victories if they fit the arc of the story you’ve told, and bring satisfaction to you as a storyteller.
HOW DO YOU PLAY?
Fool: wide eyed and open hearted, unfettered by cynicism or context/close minded and stubborn, faith borne of spite

Spindlewheel’s fundamental verb is interpretation.
Each card’s text evokes an idea.  The upright and inverse text are different. Sometimes they’re diametrically opposed; often, they’re two sides of the same coin.
Use the card as an anchor for the part of the story that you’re telling.
A card can be a person, an event, an attitude, or a physical object. You can use as much as the entire card, or as little as a single word. A card is interpreted twice: once when it enters your hand, and again when you play it. It does not have to be the same interpretation.
FOR EXAMPLE: I might draw the Hearth card and reflect that I feel like people closed their doors to me; but I might engage that card later, declaring I won’t do the same to someone else, and play it to invite someone into my home.

Hearth: A crackling fire, a hot meal, a roof overheard, a comfortable silence // closing doors, turning a blind eye, keeping your head low, weathering the storm

Begin the game by interpreting a spread of cards together, and collaboratively building a World. These cards become the Arbiter's deck, a simple Game Master AI which anyone can draw and play cards for (and everyone should).
Individually, interpret a spread of cards to create your character, reading their strengths and weaknesses, their methods and their heart’s Desire; take a glimpse into their history, and potential end, with their Clotho, Lachesis, and Atropos cards.
These cards become your hand.
During the game, scenes are seeded by story Events like An Invitation or Acts like Act III: The Big Showdown; cards played from the Arbiter's deck complicate the situation. You’ll play cards from your hand to describe what your character says, does, or what details you add to the story; or, draw from the deck to introspect, and reflect on how your character feels or changes.
Use the concepts in the cards as anchors to justify your actions, as inspiration to add details and color to the scene, or as the jumping-off point for an idea you’re excited to explore.
Spindlewheel is a loom on which you weave stories, placing cards like threads to intertwine and complicate the tale. It’s also genre-agnostic: The deck might give you a Princess, a Plague, a Witch with a Cursed Sword, a Trickster, and a Tin Penny; whether it describes the fate of a kingdom or a bizarre encounter at a bus stop is up to you!
What's the Kickstarter for?
This Kickstarter is for the very first official print run of the Spindlewheel deck! Up to this point, Spindlewheel has only been available as a print-and-play deck, or through surreptitious prototype copies during its open beta. Now that the system is finalized, it's time to make it available for everyone!
The deck includes: 
103 unique tarot-like cards with text prompts and evocative art 
one X-card
One beautiful box to store everything in.
Also, it's for the Spindlewheel rulebook! You may be familiar with Spindlewheel from the open beta, or from the Microgames collection on itch.io.  There are also dozens of other games by other designers who use Spindlewheel as their resolution mechanic!
What will it look like? How is it being printed?
We're glad you asked! Spindlewheel will be printed through Board Games Maker, on S30 cardstock, gamer standard size, and with a rigid box to store it all in. We don't have a picture of what that proof will look like, but here's a mock up of a current proof we have
 The basic rules will be included in the deck itself, on an 8 fold pamphlet. This is all you need to play the game. If you're interested in the nitty gritty of how Spindlewheel works, we will also have the digital SRD and Festival/Longform rulebooks that go into rules in depth.
Who's Involved?
Sasha Reneau (they/them or en/ens) is the designer and illustrator of Spindlewheel. En is host of Spindlewheel Stories and designer of Spindlewheel Microgames as well as a bevy of other games on en's itch.io. Find them on twitter at @sasha_reneau or ens game design meanderings @teacabbage.
Ash Pana (they/them) is a Los Angeles based editor, writer, and illustrator.  They can frequently be found creating sapphic speculative fiction, if needed for a rousing intergalactic adventure. Find them on twitter at @somuchpanash.
Riley Lyra Hopkins (he/they) is the kickstarter producer. They've run two separate kickstarters that have funded and shipped, and create their own games at www.linksmithgames.com! They can be found on Twitter @RevRyeBread and on many podcasts!
Hear it played on Spindlewheel Stories, or featured on these wonderful podcasts:
Party of One: part 1 / part 2 / Detective
You Don't Meet In An Inn: Festival / Detective
Games Closet interview!
If Not Us, Then Who? Season 2 - One / Two / Three
How's the money shake out?
Our current Kickstarter funds are set up to be distributed like this!

A graph of where the money is going!

Since the game is already entirely done, we don't need to worry about art production or anything like that. This is a completed product just waiting for the shipyard!
This is mainly just to print the game and get it shipped out to you!
What are the backer levels?
$1: VAGABOND - you want to see what happens! you don't get a reward, but you get thanks.
$15: MERCHANT - digital play edition! A digital playspace on roll20, Tabletop Simulator, and Role, and the updated print-and-play pdf's with the new pretty art on it. This will be on a different timeline than the physical product, but will work as a preorder so you will already on it on your platform of choice!
$35: SPINSTER - the Spindlewheel deck, the spread cards, and a lovely box to keep everything in.
$45: WITCH - digital PDF rulebook for festival and longform, Spindlewheel deck, spread cards, updated pdf's, lovely box for the whole thing. 
$60: PRINCESS - the full suite! deck, digital rulebook, box, digital play edition!
$63: KNIGHT - You receive the benefits of Witch and add one copy to the community pool! 
$70: THE FOUNTAIN- You receive the Spinster level, twice! 
$83: ICEBERG - The same as princess, but also add one deck to the community pool!
$110: THE LOVERS - The Princess Level but twice! Get a copy for a friend!
$145: TENDER OF BLOOMS - The Princess level twice and you add a deck to the community pool! Generosity Abundant!
$170: BEHEMOTH - for retailers, you get four individual copies of the whole suite: the deck, the spread cards, digital keys for rulebook, and a lovely box to keep everything in. 
$400: DUCHESS - The full Witch suite and a one-of-a-kind board with the original card art on it(limited supply)!
An art board with the original card art on it!
What are the stretch goals?
5900 - At this stretch goal level, every past guest of Spindlewheel Stories will be paid for their work on the show!
6300 - At this stretch goal, Sasha will make back all of the money they spent on proofs and edits from companies!
9000 - At this stretch goal, we are gonna make these decks FANCY. Each deck will be upgraded to have a GILDED EDGE, to give Spindlewheel that regal and fancy look.
17,650 -   If we can hit this stretch goal, we will be reaching out to three ttrpg designers throughout the scene to make themed expansions of 15 cards each! These will be added into the game with art and unique card backs, they can be shuffled into the game at will! 
This stretch goal pays for the art, the editing, the contracting, and the printing of these new, gilt edge cards. 
31,250 - We will be reaching out to three more designers to add their cards to the deck! Same details as the last stretch goal, but MORE.

campaign.story:
If you missed the Kickstarter
In case you arrived here too late, go to the official website for the book to find out how you can order the book. Once the book is finished it will be published in a number of online bookstores. See also the Facebook page where you find the latest updates and news about the book.
Stretch Goals
All stretch goals are now unlocked!
Story
This is a cookbook with solid everyday recipes visualised using flowcharts for better readability/understanding and usability than what you get from a traditionally formatted cookbook.
Example of a flowchart recipe. Community Recipe #1: Chicken Tikka Masala
Do you ever find yourself frustrated or confused when trying to follow along with a traditional cooking recipe?
The more you cook the more you realise that cooking is often not as straight forward as a linear step by step instruction make it out to be. There is a fair share of decision making, probing, and parallel processing, which is not easily communicated in a linear text recipe.
And why are recipes online always buried under a wall of text blog post?
The traditional cooking recipe describes a step by step workflow as essentially a numbered list of actions to take in one long sequence. What you are unable to glance from a traditional recipe is what parts of the workflow can be prepared in advance or in parallel with other tasks. You can try to solve this problem by reading the whole recipe in advance before you start cooking and then keep your knowledge of what actions will come next in memory as you cook the dish. This of course put a heavy toll on your cognition, and the longer the recipe the harder it gets.
How can we improve the recipe format?
There are of course many ways to make recipes easier to read, and I have seen many well written recipes which get creative with the formatting using colour coding, margin notes, etc. but ultimately it still follows the same numbered list format.
Personally, working as an engineer in software development, I read and review hundreds of pages of technical documentation every year, and one of the things I often request for is for more visualisations of the often very verbose descriptions for better readability. A generally accepted assumption in the field of cognitive psychology is that people learn better if they are taught using more than one sense (or modality) (The New Handbook of Multi-sensory Processing, Barry E. Stein, 2012).
When you visualise processes, designs, time plans, etc. your teams mental image become more aligned. With a new angle, or view point to the topic you understand the problem domain in a new and deeper way and sometimes a good visualisation reveals issues which you were completely blind to before.
This is where flowcharts commonly used in engineering comes into play. Flowcharts are a type of diagram which describe a process, workflow or algorithm which solves a task in a step by step manner. The beauty of a flowchart is that you can glance the “big picture” at any time and easily keep track of your progress. A flowchart simplifies decision making and visualise loops and forks (parallel execution). Something which is hard to convey in a purely text formatted recipe.
In this cookbook, every recipe is presented in two ways, with the traditional text format, and with a flowchart - so you can compare the two, and utilise the strengths of both ways.
This is a mockup, final layout TBD
Below is a Work In Progress sample spread from the book. Note that the sample is exported at low resolution and there are still many things which might change.
Click the image for a higher resolution sample.
Here I flip thru the pages of the current book draft printed with a black ink with a laser printer. Note that this is not indicative of the final print quality.
Who is this book for?
This book is for the visual thinkers, people nerdy enough to be fluent in flowcharts. This is for those of us who are fed up with Search Engine Optimised (SEO) food blogs where you have to scroll past useless anecdotes and ramblings to get to the actual recipe.
A good flowchart is like a form of humour to a certain type of people. I just find it oddly satisfying to look at. I imagine that this cookbook might be a good coffee table book for the office, the "man cave" or "nerd cave".
The perfect birthday gift for your engineer spouse or friend! ;)

Book Content
Since this is my first book project I am following the KISS (Keep It Simple, Stupid!) principle, and sticking to a condensed set of 20 solid and traditional recipes which I cook regularly at home to feed 2 kids and wife. I would say that the majority of the recipes are in what we in Sweden call the "husman" style (traditional Nordic home cooking). Many of the recipes are an inheritance from my own mother, so there are are fair bit of Finnish recipes as well.
Mom’s Pirogues - Finnish Pirogues which are baked In the oven rather than oil fried
”Raggmunk” - Swedish potato pancakes
Lasagna - kids favourite
I will also include 5 ”community recipes” which are popular voted recipes from the reddit forum r/flowchartrecipes. These five recipes are also the base for a couple of the backer rewards, the digital and physical posters. See further down for a preview of the posters.
Community Recipe #2: Night Rise Breakfast Bread (Note: this is a mockup. Final poster layout TBD)
The Author
My name is Sami Matilainen and I work with software development and I’m passionate about visualisation and usability. I'm born and raised in Sweden but my roots are in Finland so what I call "home cooking" is generally a mix of these two styles. Being a father of two (kids are 1 and 4 years old) means that any dish I make need to appeal to my two very picky eaters.
Prototype 1: The first ever flowchart recipe I made. I glued it to the book...
I have been using flowcharts as short hand notes when cooking for well over a decade now, but it was only recently when looking for a new recipe online, with the usual frustration over the numerous blog style recipe sites, that I came to think that maybe someone else also had thought to create recipes using flowcharts. I found some examples here and there, but not really up to the level that I was expecting. So this is where the idea to write this book came from.

Rewards
By pledging to this Kickstarter campaign you are not only supporting me with this project, you are also telling me there is a demand for more. If this project become a success, there are many ways this can be explored further. For instance, a website or app version could add some dynamics like the ability to tick off steps you have performed etc. Where this goes only time will tell, but I need your help to make it happen!
The eBook comes with free updates to the first edition, so if I correct some errors or add some minor content in the book at a later date, you will receive the updated version for free.
If you want to order more copies of the book, simply add 225SEK (10% discount) to your pledge for each additional book you want to order.

Pledge Reward Tiers
Note: Currency conversions shown here are a rough estimate. Kickstarter will show you an updated price based on the currency conversion applicable when you make your pledge.
Community Recipe Posters
These are the five posters you can chooe from if you chose a reward which included one or all of the posters. The physical posters will be printed in A4 size (210 x 297 mm | 8,27" x 11,69") and the digital posters should be high enough resolution to print up to A3 size (297 x 420 mm | 11.7" x 16.5").
Click the link for a larger preview
From left to right you have:
Chicken Tikka Masala

Shipping
The digital only reward tiers are available worldwide.
For the physical rewards I offer shipping to the following countries and regions, originating from Sweden. All fees are including any import duties and taxes.
Note: Currency conversions shown here are a rough estimate. Kickstarter will show you an updated price based on the currency conversion applicable when you make your pledge.


Time Plan
The Kickstarter campaign is projected to start when the book content draft is completed. That means that the majority of the work should already be finished. The final layout draft for the book will be completed around the time the kickstarter campaign itself finish. Then a print proof and extensive review will be performed before the book is printed and finally shipped.
The eBook and digitial posters will be sent out as soon as the pledges are processed.
The physical book and posters will be shipped no later than February 2021. This includes a buffer for unforeseen events delaying the process (see risks chapter), so there is a good change the physical rewards are shipped earlier.
Budget
The majority of the budget goes to the printing of the book. The project goal is set to break-even level, meaning that if the project is funded 100%, the profit margin is essentially zero.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Risk to Project Fulfilment:

I can not mention risks without mentioning COVID-19. I am 39 years old so I believe the risk of me not being able to complete the book is small. There is obviously a small risk that I might get sick for an extended period of time or I may need to care for family members which could lead to delays (see below), but other than that I strongly believe the project will be completed and rewards will be shipped.

Risk to Project Time Plan (delays):

All risks below are preemptively mitigated by including a buffer in the time plan.

- There is a small risk that an extended period of sickness (COVID-19) might affect the time plan.
- Delays from printing. The print shop has a policy to fulfil their duties within 15 business days, but you never know. I will print a print proof to check the colour gamut and check for any layout issues. This add up to 3 weeks to the process but I think it is worth it for a quality end product. In the worst case scenario this need to be repeated one more time, which is accounted for in the time plan.
- If there is a bigger demand than anticipated, the logistics of packaging and shipping the rewards might take longer than planned. I am doing everything on my own, but I have family members who could potentially be recruited if the task become overwhelming.

Risks and time plan need to be reviewed continuously thru the project. My experience is that there is always some unforeseen road blocks along the way, but I know we can get thru all of them eventually. I plan to be transparent and keep backers updated on any project status changes and the projected shipping date.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
