campaign.story:
My name is Alissa Miky and I am the founder of the sweets brand, Misaky. Tokyo.
All the sweets from Misaky.Tokyo (Click HERE to follow our Instagram) is vegan, gluten-free, and made with all-natural ingredients. I would like to invite you to join us on the journey of the modern take of Japanese sweets.   
Accomplishments      
Torrance Farmer’s Market
  Dream Work’s farmer’s market official vendor
  Created BLM Box and donated all the revenue $2387 to BLM foundation
  Donated partial profit to LGBTQ community during Pride Month 
 Crystal Treats are hand-made sweets created with love and care made from seaweed. It is perfect for a gift to give it to someone special, or a special occasion such as wedding reception. The texture of Edible Crystal is crispy outside and the chewy texture inside.  
Each piece made by hand (Photo taken before COVID, all the employees wear masks right now and carefully sanitize the kitchen space
Customer's Voice 
Crystal Treats are for everybody. Food is a crucial part of the lifestyle and some people follow a strict diet for various reasons. It is difficult to find the food they like especially in gatherings for people with strict diets or allergies. I wanted to create memorable experiences for people and create an opportunity for anyone to eat the same sweets. Crystal Treats are made to share.  
 Crystal Treats comes inside of the “jewelry box,” and opening this box is part of the luxury experience. Once you open the box, picturesque edible crystals will be revealed and it is time to enjoy those delicious crystals! We offer 5-piece and 8-piece box.   
5pcs box
8pcs box
We offer 8 unique flavors of Crystal Treats. For anyone to enjoy, Misaky.Tokyo fuses sweets with global food culture. We use lavender from Europe, mango from Asia, Hibiscus from Latin America, Rose from the Middle East, Match from Japan, and so on. By gathering different flavors from around the world in one box, anyone would feel nostalgia and peace of mind. 
Japanese sweets, also known as “Wagashi” , are traditionally served with Matcha at the tea ceremony. As part of the tea ceremony philosophy, no matter what their station is, people are treated equally inside the tearoom. This is how we came up with the idea of equality.   
We will provide an unforgettable experience with sweets and create social equality. Our goal is to make our customers happy with our Crystals.   
 About the Founder
Founder: Alissa Miky
 When the founder Alissa Miky was 9 year-old, she experienced 9/11. Just three days later, her family was waiting at JFK airport to fly back to Japan. She could remember vividly, the cold feeling sitting on the floor at the airport. They were waiting to get onto a plane not unlike the ones that had caused so much pain just days before. She was scared. A tiny bit of solace came when a Red Cross worker appeared in front of her and gave her a small piece of candy and she felt a sense of safety. This is the moment she looked back and made her feel recreating this feeling to others. 
Business Insider Japan "Game Changer" 2019 Alissa in red dress
 Years later in Japan, despite having a level of success in the marketing field that garnered recognition from both Forbes and Business Insider, she still felt empty inside. She was talking with her friend, she was sad to hear about how her friend often couldn't find many good treats to eat. She follows a vegan diet and has Celiac disease, keeping her from also consuming gluten products. 
 This all sparked a thought...Most Japanese desserts are vegan, gluten-free and beautiful; the desserts might be able to replicate that feeling of comfort she had experienced years earlier. She felt that I could not only create a dessert but a feeling of happiness and a better, safer world.

campaign.story:
Hello friends! You may call me by my pen name, Anton LaLune.
I'm a freelance illustrator from Denmark with a passion for intricate detail, celestial imagery, fantasy worlds, fashion and mythical beings. I've honed my craft since I was very young, most artists have, and I've always wanted to make a tangible product aside from just the pieces themselves, and now combining that love for art, my appreciation for card games and my interest in tarot, I present to you:
The Lunar Omens tarot is planned to be a fully illustrated deck, including full illustrations for the major and minor arcana. Each card will be drawn from scratch by yours truly, starring anthropomorphic animal characters, celestial imagery, fancy clothing and general prettiness.
I've chosen to kickstart this project, both to generate interest, and to generate funds to actually make it happen. As the team consists only of me, the production costs are well beyond what is achievable for me. So I'm turning to kickstarter in the hopes of making this deck a reality, and to eventually put an actual physical copy of it in the hands of whoever may want one.
What you can expect of the deck:
- 330 GSM casino quality on each individual card
- Two piece box for keeping your deck safe
- 78 individual cards, major and minor arcana all fully and individually illustrated
- Hopefully more than this should we go beyond our goal!


The first drafts of the first two cards:

Examples of the creator's work:

If you got this far, thank you for reading! I hope I've made you interested in this deck.

Radiant Scales Tarot - A Dragon Tarot Deck 
Radiant Scales Tarot is the passion project of 75 artists and writers brought together by our love for Tarot and our passion for all things draconic. The diversity of our artists are reflected beautifully in the diversity of the dragons within. A wonderful addition to your hoard, this full tarot deck serves as both a beautifully crafted set of art cards and as a divination tool for those who practice Tarot.
The Radiant Scales Tarot deck will be a standard tarot sized deck (2.75" x 4.75"/70mm x 120mm) with all 78 cards and a tarot guide. Cards will have a superior smooth card stock (350gsm) and a gloss finish. Each deck will come shrink-wrapped inside a custom box. Guides will be 5.5" x 8.5" and saddle-stitched. 
We also offer an art book option for those not interested in purchasing a tarot deck. Our art book will be 5.5" x 8.5" and perfect bound. All cards will be featured in this book without their frames.

campaign.story:
The Northern Animal Tarot Deck!
  Hello Welcome to Northern Animal Tarot! Northern Animal tarot started when I was l learning the tarot and was having a hard time connecting with tarot decks. I would get caught up in humans image. I found it hard to dive deep into the stories to find the messages.  I started dreaming about finding an animal tarot deck that I could still learn with and study books from! So then came the idea of making this Northern Animal Tarot deck! Ive been working designing and creating animal art for well over 15yrs. So off I went to the drawing board to make this come to life! Enjoy! Thank you!
 Enter a world full of magic where shunks ride mooses on sunny days, crows carry swords and raccoons become magicans beacuse of those thumbs!  While you use and read these fairytale animal tarot cards you can start to weave your own journey though the tarot with your new animal friends to help you. Childhood memories of building playful stories enter back into the tarot cards making them easier to read, less serious and you can dive just a deep into your questions.
Different stages of the creative process of making cards!
 About the deck and its Anthropomorphic animals, I wanted a deck I could connect deeply with and yet still very playfully. So I could learn, heal and tell stories would feel like fables and stories. Easy fun and magical clear in ways only animal art can make stories. These cards can make tarot spreads in to sweet fables or long sagas with many mountains and valleys! Adventure awaits with these animal tarot cards.
 Animals as characters can bring stillness and incongruity, making stories more enjoyable. But animals also add a degree of emotional distance for the reader, which is important when the story message is personal, painful or powerful.
Fire, Earth, Water and Air cards.
 I am finishing up the colouring of this deck, Ive sketched out all 78 cards. Im very happy with the colour samples I got from the local printer. Im also packing each card full of details, so the reader has lots of exciting things to unpack in each card! With the card still being finished up, the images shown in this campaign may change slightly before the finals are sent to the printer! 
Tarot Card Size: 3 x 5, full colour, gloss uv coated, 14 pt. 
The design for the back of the tarot cards.
 Back of the tarot deck cards! A littel extra magic for this dreamy forest deck!

How to make this deck a reality! Pick one or two!
Im printing the cards with a local company so that means no over seas stuff and more eco friendly! Locally printed and shipped to me, then I'll pack everything up all pretty and mail them out to you! The cards and box paper have 30% recycled content!

Also UNLOCKED!!! YAY! 
 These goodies now included in everydeck!


Shipping things: All Canadian and American mail will have their packages shipped with tracking numbers. To all my international friends the deck will be ship by Air mail as to have it arrive as quickly as possible, but no tracking available sorry. And for customs I’m sorry but I have no control over such things.
 Please make sure your payment is up to date, along with your right address! I dont want anyone to miss out on this limited edition run of decks!
All the pentacles and where they will be spent.
So my timeline is to mail out the decks in Feburay 2021!
On the rewards is the old date if i have launched earlier sorry! I missed changing those dates! So ignore Oct 2020 its going to be February 2021!
 Earlier would be great but I know making a good thing sometimes take more time. So after the new year in February is my mail out time line. But will keep you up to date on all the cards as they are each finalized. If in the event of any unexpected delays, Ill be completely transparent on the kickstarter page. And again all images of the deck and box are not yet finalized and may change slightly from what you see here. Thank you for understanding the creative process!
Thank you, Thank you!
Tarot card Size: 3 x 5, full colour, gloss uv coated, 14 pt. 
 Find me on Instagram to see more of the journey! @Northernanimaltarot

campaign.story:
VOLÜSPÁ
What is Volüspá? You probably know about runes. Other than being the ancient alphabet of The Norse, they're also used traditionally engraved in rock stones, wood or even bones to foretell the future.
I made this deck two years ago while working on a norse mythology inspired comic.
I have always loved the runes and as an european I've grown with myth and gods stories like probably  some would have grown with super-hero.
Why a deck?
I'm an illustrator, and despite not needing the drawing to speak, runes do have stories to tell and I wanted to let my imagination work with those.
The elder futhark
You might have notice on many runes decks, the names may varies. It's mostly due to the transcriptions that varies a lot and so the same rune can be spelled in many forms, it's pretty common to find published books about runes with different spelling (I own three with different names so I made a choice).
The deck:
The only item to order here is the deck, it contains 25 illustrated runes cards, plus some extra cards with the runes meanings and how to make a simple draw (instructions are provided in french & english).
Specs: The deck will be printed on a 62mm x 100mm cards and will come in a custom tuck box.
photo from the first edition deck (OOS : size was bigger on the first edition)
STRECH GOAL
I have two stretch goals ready if the campaign goes better than expected. The two stretch goals will up the quality of the deck.
SHIPPING
Shipping cost includes a tracking number for every packages, with the COVID-19 some countries might be delivered slowly.
ABOUT ME
I'm Rann, a french comic artist and illustrator ^_^.
You can find me on these SNS : Facebook |Twitter | Instagram
I've published the comics 'Memento Mori' on french edition Tonkam
I'm also the artist behind the 'Mystical manga' tarot published by LLewellyn.

campaign.story:
The Lubanko Tarot is a richly-illustrated tarot deck of 78 original paintings that traverse the surreal, the intense, the queer, and the divine.       
The Deck
The deck contains 78 fully illustrated tarot cards.  Each card will be lushly printed on 350gsm paper on traditionally-sized tarot cards (70x120mm), appropriately labeled with the title on each card ease of use.   
The Lubanko Tarot deck
Each deck will also include a 110+ page guidebook written by me that will delineate card meanings, both upright and reversed (for those who prefer to read with reversals), as well as an introduction to help usher new folks into the concept of reading tarot. 
The 6 of Swords. Mockup image - not final, but close!
 The deck will be held in a sturdy and richly-decorated hinge box that closes magnetically and securely, allowing for both display and transportation. I chose a sturdier box that still has a profile that is easy to transport— for those of us who are often in-between places, it is good to be able to carry our tools with us safely.     
Box design- cover (digital mockup)
Box design - interior (digital mockup)
 The Lubanko Tarot deck contains the standard 78 cards and is fully illustrated.  That means that all the Major Arcana and the Minor Arcana are full paintings— no pip cards.  
The Major Arcana art
 Every suit is a full journey, lushly-illustrated and packed full of metaphor, story, and the full range of the elements. The cards show beings of different walks of life, some closer to human and some far beyond, dipping into the diversity of life on earth and the divine of when we transcend our expected forms.  
The suits of Wands and Cups
These paintings have been lovingly and painstakingly perfected as both pieces of art and pieces to be used for reading. They were made to be read at both small and large sizes, with bright colors, strong values, and compositional movement—as well as minding good contrast for those who may be colorblind and wish to read as well. I have maintained a stylistic consistency that will ensure that every reading can flow together, no matter the combination.      
Suits of Swords and Pentacles
You can view some of the paintings at higher-res on my site, as well! 
   Updated: 12 pm EST, 8/24  

Stretch Goals - COMPLETE!
 $15,000 - SILVER EDGES -Silver holographic edges will be added to all decks. 
 $25,000 - BIGGER CARDS - Cards will be made slightly bigger for even more visibility of the art, and the box/book to match!
 $30,000 - ALTAR CLOTHS - A 22"x22" altar cloth designed by the artist will be included with every deck order!
 $75,000 - TAROT CLASS - I will teach and stream a FREE Tarot 101 class to help people learn to read the tarot, and answer submitted backer questions!   
  $100,000 -CLASS II - "How To Make Your Own Tarot Deck"  
 Stretch goals will be dedicated to making this the best deck it can be. 
The first stretch goal will be holographic silver edges, for that extra-special touch and shine. The second stretch goal will be to make the cards slightly bigger—since each painting started at 6x8” (and some as large as 13x19”, like the 7 of cups). They'll still be shuffling size, don't worry! 
I have a surprise or two as well if we make it past the first two! 
Any other stretch goals will be improvements to the deck and quality. My highest priority is making sure that this deck is an art object that is precious and usable. 
UPDATE: Altar cloth design COMPLETE.
Altar Cloth design
A reminder that altar cloths are only free with the deck at Deck level and above if you pledge on Kickstarter! All altar cloths sold afterwards will be sold for a separate price.
Budget   
 The 10k budget includes printing (with estimates from the printer), shipping from the printer, distribution and fees, and Kickstarter fees. It is very important to me to make sure that this gets made, so I have kept things as simple and straightforward as possible! 
Using The Cards
Mockup image. Everyone's altar is a little different!
So who can use this deck, and how? 
For those who are familiar with Tarot, there are many ways to use a deck. Some use them for reflection, some for divination. Some people just enjoy having a special art object and collection of 78 prints to lay out and admire. Some folks also use tarot decks as altar pieces, or isolate specific cards. 
I personally use tarot from anything to meditation to therapy tool, and thus I have structured this deck for a wide range of uses.  
 A good tarot deck has lots of metaphor to chew on, so that each card can be a moment of self-contained meditation. With this in mind, each card was heavily considered for readability, true-ness to the intention I had for the card, and how I wished to diverge or converge with common meanings. Though many of these cards will have a familiarity to those who are experienced readers, some diverge for the sake of the clarity and honesty of message. 
Each deck will have its own 110+ page guidebook written by me with explanations of each card-- the intent, the meaning, and the reversed meanings as well. Whether you read with reversals (when the card appears upside-down in a reading) is entirely your choice, but the option is there should you like to! In addition to card definitions, there will be a short introduction from the artist, as well as a brief explanation of how to use your deck. Whether you are a beginner or advanced, this should be a welcoming tool for you.  
The Devil card.
 And as an art object: This is the largest collection of prints I have ever sold (some of which have never been and will never be for sale elsewhere), all contained in a handy artistic little box! 
The Artist  
 I have been reading tarot for 18 years. Like many people, I started with a copy of the Rider Waite and many borrowed books from the library, journaling and noting. I learned to read tarot by asking myself “How does this art make me feel? What biases do I have, looking at this image? What is the story I experience when I look at this? What does the author intend, and how does that differ from my own story?” 
I believe that tarot is about asking those questions, understanding how our foremost thoughts and feelings inform our decisions— and as an artist, creating a lush artistic experience that allows for people to confront those feelings, perhaps receive new intentions, and most importantly grow their own interpretations that work for them. Though each deck will include a guidebook to help interpret, these cards are meant to help the reader grapple with their personal metaphor and mythos.      
  As a queer artist with a lens of the vivid-surreal, the sensual, and the pain-and-catharsis of life, I will be sharing that intensity, that queerness, those shocks of color with you. Where you take that is in your hands, and it is given gladly. 
The 8 of Swords (and my funky altar)
Shipping and Fulfillment
I am delighted to be partnering with White Squirrel, who have shipped many notable and successful Kickstarter projects before. I am excited to work with an experienced partner in shipping and fulfillment!
Since I will be shipping this to as many countries around the world as I am able, shipping will be charged separately depending on your country and rewards level. Please make sure that you fill out the Kickstarter survey when it is time! This will make it easy for me to get the decks and rewards to you as quickly as possible.  
Note:  All retailers interested in wholesale purchases, please reach out to me at emilylubanko@gmail.com.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I finished the deck before Kickstarting, so there’s no risk of the art not being finished. The guidebook is 95% done— I have a second round of edits to do, but the bulk of the writing is done and I’m just waiting on a quick editing pass. 

All the art for the rewards, both current and Secret Stretch Goals, are done. The box art is done. 

I waited a while to launch this Kickstarter because I wanted to make sure that it was doable and done. I have already been in long contact with and have a good relationship with both my printer and the good folks at White Squirrel, so both the printing and fulfillment talks are in motion. 

COVID-19 is the biggest risk for the printing, shipping and delivery section of this process, and therefore I have put a much later delivery date than I actually anticipate. Though I will likely be ready to start printing as soon as the Kickstarter ends, there is a likely chance of delays due to the nature of the beast there— in printing, but most especially in shipping. In a perfect world everyone would have their deck by the end of the year. However, I am printing my deck overseas and having it shipped to the US, and then back out to backers around the world. These delays and issues may especially impact international shipments. I have therefore opted for a conservative delivery date. If you get your deck before then, then that’s fantastic!

campaign.story:
Help us print the third book of Minna Sundberg's award-winning Nordic fantasy and adventure webcomic Stand Still. Stay Silent.
90 years ago, a cataclysmic pandemic turned the Old World into a place of silence and fear. Most of the surviving population of the Known World live in Iceland, now the largest safe area in existence, with a few smaller settlements scattered in Norway, Sweden, Denmark and Finland.
Hunters, mages and cleansers dedicate their lives to defending these settlements from the terrifying beings from beyond the safe areas, creatures from the Silent World. Before now, there has been no official attempts to explore the Silent World.
An underfunded, questionably selected, rag-tag team of explorers are assembled and launched into the unknown in a search for information and relics of the Old World - hopefully valuable relics. Stand Still. Stay Silent. follows six people (and a cat) on a journey filled with adventure, camaraderie and Nordic mythology. Who knows what they might find on their journey... and what they might lose.
Stand Still. Stay Silent, also called SSSS, began in November 2013, and can be read online on Monday, Tuesday, Thursday and Friday on sssscomic.com. In 2015, SSSS won the Reuben Award for "best online comic-long form"
SSSS is published online with the support of Hiveworks who also manages the store for the comic! 
Stand Still. Stay Silent. Book 3 will include:
A hardcover finish (with a textured cover).
Chapters 11 to 16 of the ongoing webcomic.
 300+ pages in full color in a 7x10 format.
 Bonus content (a little kitty adventure and illustrations!)
No cat hairs (not a guarantee).
The first book was first printed thanks to an Indiegogo campaign ran by the author, Minna Sundberg. It was then reprinted as a second edition, along with the first edition of book 2, following a successful Kickstarter campaign in 2018 ran by Hiveworks. A small print run of book 3 has already been produced directly by Minna to be sold to buyers in Finland and select EU countries through her personal pop-up online store. This Kickstarter is for the larger run of book 3, printed and shipped by Hiveworks anywhere in the world.
Backers have the possibility to not only grab the print volume, but also to select desired rewards. Here is a list of the available rewards.
The main two physical rewards beyond the books are the set of stickers and the bookplates. The stickers are a set of 3 die-cut stickers, two with a holographic finish and one with a color finish. 
The Bookplate reward exists in two formats - Signed and Sketched. The Signed bookplate is a stylish adhesive plate autographed by Minna. Bookplates will be received with a backing covering the sticky side. Backers can then remove the backing and stick the bookplate wherever they please in their book. The Sketched one is also adhesive and sent with backing, and includes a cat doodle alongside Minna's signature.
For backers selecting the tiers that include all three books, please note that book 1 is exceptionally sold at the same price as books 2 & 3 ($35 USD) in the bundle!
Due to current circumstances, this Kickstarter campaign has been kept very simple, with a limited set of rewards, and no stretch goals, allowing Minna to focus on her work, and allowing our team to get the books to backers swiftly. 
For backers who are only missing the second book, or are interested in other SSSS goodies, we encourage you to check out the SSSS Hiveworks store. Among other items, we still have many kitty plushies looking for someone to take them on a journey!
Thank you for your support!

campaign.story:
Let's Play Volume 2 Graphic Novel Cover
Hello everyone! I'm Mongie, the creator of the Eisner-nominated webtoon, "Let's Play!" And I'm back with a new Kickstarter for the second book in the Let's Play Print Series!

 If you are new to my work and like gaming, comedy, and romance stories, I've got over 125 episodes of my comic to sink your teeth in.  Head on over to WEBTOON.com (letsplaycomic.com) and join over 3.6 million Let's Play readers!

 Thanks to our awesome supporters, the campaign for volume one was a huge success!  And despite all the chaos of 2019 and 2020, we delivered all the goodies to our lovely backers.  And in this project, we are hoping to raise funds for volume two print edition!  We have several new addons and stretch goals planned!  And thanks to reaching the stretch goal in the last campaign, volume two has already been formatted for print, so we will be able to put it into production as soon as possible!

 I wanted to thank you all again for your incredible support in my comic, Let's Play! It's been an exciting adventure, and I have loved seeing readers share photos of their Kickstarter goodies.  If you'd like to share your pictures with me, please do so by tagging me (@mongrelmarie) on Twitter or Instagram!
ABOUT LET'S PLAY: She's young, single and about to achieve her dream of creating incredible videogames. But then life throws her a one-two punch: a popular streamer gives her first game a scathing review. Even worse, she finds out that the same troublesome critic is now her new neighbor! A funny, sexy, and all-too-real story about gaming, memes, and social anxiety. Come for the plot, stay for the doggo.
Let's Play is an ongoing webcomic on LINE Webtoon with over 3.6 million subscribers. This is your chance to be the first to get your hands on the reformatted print edition of volume 2, which collects chapters 24 through 40 of Let's Play - approximately 200 pages of content!
The goal of the Kickstarter is to get the comic into your hands as quickly as possible! The more we raise, the more content goes in the book, the more stretch goals are unlocked, and the more add ons we can offer. We'll reveal the stretch goal that's available to hit next, and when it unlocks, we'll reveal the next one. Ditto with the add ons, and we think everyone will be pleasantly surprised with each!
The other stretch goal we can tell you about now is to unlock volume 3; we're looking to hit 60k. That allows us to do all of the pre-production on reformatting and vendor work before the volume 3 Kickstarter. Meaning when that volume is Kickstarted, it will have already been sent to the printers, and we'll have approved proofs back.
So, what am I getting for my pledge? First, all backers at the $24 Let's Play Volume 2 Graphic Novel level will get the collected edition, printed at 5.7"x8.2" with a matte finish wrap around cover. Each page of the comic will be carefully reformatted to provide the same quality of reading experience many of you have already had online. Since we hit the Stretch Goal for volume 2 in the last Kickstarter, the entire book has already been prepped for print!
Let's Play Volume 2 Page Proofs:
 Scroll down for more pages! 
Please note that shipping costs are not included in your pledge. We are working with CRWN on fulfillment services and you will pay actual shipping depending on your region and the size of your order during the BackerKit survey phase.
campaign.risks:

There is little risk in that this book is being published and the art has been completed. The team running the Kickstarter have worked with the vendors and printers before and have confidence in the quality and timeline we've outlined. However, during production mistakes can happen and some of the vendors are overseas. Should something not arrive in time or as expected we will quickly communicate that to all backers and let everyone know when to expect items should dates shift. Due to the pandemic and the current state of the USPS there are possible interruptions or delays in shipping but we are working with CRWN on fulfillment as well as other overseas partners to mitigate any shipping risks.

campaign.story:
There are many theories on what happens in the afterlife. I like to believe that we live again and again, it makes it all seem more worth something. Different lives give us a full understanding and perspective on what it means to really be alive. 
I created this oracle to tell one story of what may happen in the space between lives, re-imagined upon the structure of classic 78 card tarot deck. I spent years thinking about creating a companion deck to Prisma Visions and now after nearly 2 years of researching, drawing, rendering, redrawing and writing it is finally here! 
Nothing about making Cosma Visions was easy, but it was a beautiful experience. It made me feel more whole, more connected and more inspired. All I can hope now is that it does the same for you and moves you along an elegant path filled of wonder and appreciation for the greatness of life. Thank you for your patience, I know for some of you it feels as if you have been waiting years for this deck, and I've teased you enough with it. So here it is, for you to hold and get to know and love, The Cosma Visions Oracle.  
Before you continue reading you should know that thanks to nearly 5,000 backers we have unlocked many many stretch goal items. Here's a look at what comes free with most pledges: 
Death. It is what we often fear most and know so little about. We imagine it as the soundless dark void where there is nothing, everywhere. But in this oracle, death marks the start. Perhaps, it is here that we can finally see death not as the impending force of doom we so fear, but rather an escort to our next chapter. It is the end of a cycle and opens a door for a new lifetime to unfold.
The oracle then begins with the five alchemical birds, thought to be representative of the few moments after death and the journey of the soul reconnecting to itself. 
After the five birds, we are taken to the Spirit Plane and are reminded of things once forgotten: the importance of Soulmates, The Spirit Plane, The Orbs, The Cosmic Tree, Life Maps, Karma and Sacrifice. We are taught about Past Lives and when we are ready we are taken back to the Maze to journey to a new life. 
In the Maze we find many Vessels, but only some are the right fit. Opening the Vessel takes you to the Shore until you cross the Veil and find the Bridge to Infinite Paths and the Unknown.
It is on the other side of the Unknown that you fall back into Life on Earth, and the beauty of another cycle unfolds...
After the journey of the soul through the Major Arcana, we are met with the Minor Arcana - 56 cards that all come together to tackle living a human Life on Earth. 
Like the Prisma Visions deck, in each Cosma Visions deck are elaborate panorama images that you can assemble by lining up the suits:
In the first suit, The Spark of Embers, the soul embarks on its first journey on earth after spending time in the spirit plane. It takes you on a quest that challenges and inspires the soul. During this suit we encounter the devastation of fire but also the ability to turn this powerful element into a force of creation.
In the Dance of Lotuses, the soul is reconnected to the heart. Dominated by emotions, the heart searches for balance and freedom to love. During this suit we learn about pain and love and the interconnectedness of the two. We celebrate unions and connections and personal empowerment through understanding deep emotions.
In the Flight of Birds, the soul and the heart are reintroduced to the mind. It is here at the base of Wise Mountain that the soul must journey through the cavities of the mind to reach a point of clarity and understanding. In this suit we witness frustration, internal struggles and mental anguish, but we also learn about rest, reflection and mental precision.
In the Growth of Trees, the soul, heart and mind are fused together with the body. It is during this suit that we experience labor, wealth, leisure and decay. Through hard work and dedication we learn to grow from our challenges and foster our strengths.

...But wait there's something else...
Cosma Visions panoramas connect back to where they started. For example, the tenth card loops back to the first card, creating an endless panorama. This means you can start the image at any point! I'm really excited by this new feature and I think it will allow the reader to break out of the box with creative readings. 
 The Cosma Visions oracle can be used like any normal tarot or oracle deck. My hope is that it will be quick to learn because of the various similarities this oracle has to tarot. 
The one major difference between this deck and a tarot deck, besides the names of each card, is the fifth suit - the suit of Beings. This suit is comprised of all of the court cards normally found across the standard four suits and instead creates the fifth suit. These are the court cards, transformed. 
The Sixteen Beings
I want this deck to be used just as if it were a tarot deck. I want weight to be held in the gravity of the Major Arcana and I want themes to unfold throughout the minors. There is just something systematically beautiful about the way Tarot is constructed.
Now I hope that this brief introduction has gotten the hairs on the back of your neck tingling, because the adventure you are about to go on is unlike any other.

 This section highlights the specifications and features of each item in the Cosma Visions Campaign. 

 1. THE COSMA VISIONS ORACLE: $40 
The Cosma Visions Oracle is designed similarly to Prisma Visions, which will allow you to use both decks together. If you are familiar with my previous decks, you are likely aware that these cards are of the highest quality. 
The cards are printed on high quality 300 gsm acid free paper and the finishing on the first edition cards of Cosma Visions is a hybrid between both Prisma Visions and Light Visions, they are smooth and matte but hold rich color and feel great in your hands. The edges are finished with a labradorite holographic blue.
PLAY

The box is an upgraded version of the Prisma Visions box. It's a fliptop clamshell box with 1/8" thick cardboard construction. There are holographic accents on both the inside and outside of the box and it is all printed on soft matte paper - it feels like butter in your hands!
PLAY


The booklet is included with all decks and is around 100 pages. It includes an introduction to the deck, a few example spreads and upright card meanings for all 78 cards. The booklet fits snuggly into the box just like previous editions of Prisma Visions.  
PLAY

If you want an in-depth look at all of the cards and the big book, Kelly has done a wonderful extensive review on the Cosma Visions deck, warning: spoiler alerts!
 2. THE HARDCOVER EXPANSION BOOK: $25
This book has nearly 400 pages of content and is an expanded look at both Cosma Visions AND Prisma Visions.There are 200 pages dedicated to Cosma Visions and 200 pages dedicated to Prisma Visions. I designed this as a dual cover book, on one side is Cosma Visions and when you flip it over you can read the Prisma Visions Book. 
PLAY

Each card has its own spread, on the left is a full color illustration of the card and on the right is the card meaning. The big book includes upright and reversed meanings as well as keywords to help you learn the cards.  
The beginning section of the book dives into the process of creating the deck as well as a few unique spreads that can be used with Cosma Visions and Prisma Visions together.  
Beside each card's meaning is a full color illustration of each card, making it not only easier to flip through but also an art book. The book itself is 8.5 x 6 inches (21.5cm x 15.2cm),bound in fabric and embossed with metallics. If you're backing this project, It's not to be missed! The book is 8.5 x 6 inches 
 3. THE SATCHEL: $10
The Cosma Visions Satchel is similar to the Prisma Visions and Light Visions Satchels, and comes in a beautiful teal color. This time the design on the satchel is embossed! This is a custom designed satchel and fits the full deck as well as the mini guidebook. The satchel is designed as a fold-over closure with an extended flap to do quick 3 card readings on the go.
4. THE ALTAR CLOTH: $10
A 22x22 teal faux suede altar cloth with a metallic printed image on both sides of the cloth - one side for Cosma Visions, one side for Prisma Visions - it's two cloths in one! It's not wearable, but it's sturdy and won't hold a crease!   If you would like to add an altar cloth to your existing pledge you can do so now by adding $10 to your pledge. Post-campaign altar cloths will retail at $25.
 5. COSMA VISIONS ART CARD SET: $10 
A set of 22 4x6 cards of the major arcana of Cosma Visions. Each card will be double sided and have the meditation written on the back of the card with gold foil. 
PLAY

   6. THE REGRESSIONS JOURNAL: 1 for $10, 2 for $20 
 There is a blank version and a regressions workbook version. They will both be 6x9 inches (the same size as the Big Visions Book) with a faux leather cover and a string closure with a custom metal charm. 
Workbook: six-ring bound , 80 brown kraft pages with designed sheets. Available in Teal or Light Grey. 
Blank Journal: six-ring bound, 80 cream pages with blank sheets. Available in Teal or Light Grey. 
The Regressions Journal is a $10 add-on item. If you want two/both versions it is a $20 add-on. Please see update #18 for more info on the Journals. 

 7. GEOMANTIC VISIONS: $35 
A set of sixteen 3D metal coins that represent the 16 different geomantic figures based on the suit of beings. If you are familiar with geomancy these coins are made for you, if not there is always time to learn a user-friendly ancient form of divination

updates.update_content: After seven (eight?) weeks of constant shipping, Cosma Visions is completely out in the world and 6,386 packages later we are collapsing on the floor. I could not have done it without an amazing team and an amazing support base like you all. I am floored by the outpour of excitement and the unbelievably beautiful praises you have all showered Cosma Visions with. It’s heartwarming to know that so many people can connect to this object that has been living in my head all my lives. My road here has been long, but I know for you it’s only the beginning with Cosma Visions. I hope you cherish it and it offers a little lightness to the heavier things in life. It feels bittersweet to call this the end, but I know that in this oracle the end is only the beginning.

I just wanted to make a clarification to yesterday's update - we haven't yet gotten to any Backerkit orders, so if you placed an order through Backerkit after the campaign ended we are likely going to start shipping those orders at the end of next week. This includes both domestic and international backers. Also, if your payment failed on kickstarter but was resolved on backerkit, the system recognizes you as a Backerkit order. There are a few domestic packages from the kickstarter that for whatever reason were not shipped in the first batch, we are sifting through these now as we wrap up international kickstarter pledges and then will be moving onto Backerkit orders!

campaign.story:
Finding Home 
Finding Home is a multi-award-winning LGBT+ romance comic that explores nature, magic, mental health recovery and relationships.   
The book
The goal of this kickstarter is to bring the third book of four in the Finding Home series to print as a graphic novel.
If you’re a new reader, the Prince & PDF catchup bundles include digital copies of the first 2 books, as well as a prequel comic not available on the webcomic.
The comic is also being gradually posted online as a webcomic (here!) but the free webcomic version is a long way behind - Volume 3 will finish posting mid-2021.
Backing this Kickstarter not only gives you the chance to support the comic, get a physical book, extras and exclusive rewards, but also lets you read Volume 3 early, long before it’s available as a webcomic, as well as offline and ad-free.   
Volume 3 sample pages
The story so far
In volumes 1&2, two very different people who met travelling grew much closer than either expected.
Janek, a human cook on a long journey home, finds himself falling for Chepi, a wandering fae healer haunted by memories of his past. But instead of slipping easily into a relationship - like Janek’s used to - Chepi’s emotional fragility keeps them apart.
After everything they’ve been through surviving the magical perils of the forest, Chepi can’t bear to part yet, and agrees to come stay with Janek at the end of their long journey.   
Volume 3
Now, in volume 3, Janek has finally made it home from his travels to his family and friends - but now he’s back, so are all his old problems he left to avoid. Worse still, his stressful new promotion in the family business suddenly keeps him away from Chepi.   
 Arriving in town, Chepi is swept up in a whirlwind of unfamiliar activity, new places and people. Desperately trying to keep control over his anxiety problems, and to avoid prying questions about a strange magic ritual he used on Janek, Chepi seems to be careening towards disaster.
The two of them are out of the woods. But can their new surroundings bring them together - or will it tear them apart?  
Rewards
For this kickstarter, rewards have been designed to help everything run smoothly in the current situation, and keep everyone’s safety and delivering the book itself the highest priority.
Times are tough at the moment - so this project includes an increased number of reduced-price earlybird slots for the book itself, as well as more digital tiers and special bundle prices for those wanting to avoid international shipping costs and wait times.
Each physical copy also comes with a PDF of Volume 3 free, so all backers can read the story sooner if they prefer - an estimated 9+ months ahead of the public webcomic.

For this kickstarter's physical rewards, bulkier merch items have been switched out to minimise manufacturing and shipping delays - instead focusing on working with some amazing artists to put together a really special art bundle that’s small but beautiful. 

 The Prince special bundle includes the book itself, along with a fold-out illustrated map and two A5 art prints by some of my favourite artists, with exclusive art made just for the kickstarter. The prints will be on card made from sustainably certified, 100% recycled fibres, and digitally printed with a silk finish.
Stretch goal extras
Any extra money raised all goes in to being able to make the next part of Finding Home. There’ll also be 2 stretch goals which are upgrades to the existing book and rewards if the project hits £7.5k and £10k...
£7.5k Stretch goal - UNLOCKED
Thanks to hitting the first stretch goal at £7.5k, The Prince bundle will also be getting an extra print added - a second portrait by Marlowe Lune commissioned as a companion piece to Chepi's.
£10k Stretch goal - UNLOCKED
Extra sketches and a flower guide added to the back of Volume 3 for easier reference!
 Guest Artists 
 Charlot is a Black artist, designer and author based in Dublin who often depicts minorities and underrepresented characters in challenging socio-political context. She’s illustrated for big name clients including Penguin Random House, the New Yorker and the New York Times, and her new graphic novel What We Don’t Talk About is out this August with Avery Hill Press. 
 Website | Twitter | Instagram | Book
I’m a huge fan of Charlot’s beautiful, vibrant, evocative work and the tender, expressive moments she creates between characters. I’m incredibly excited to be able to work with her on a special piece for this campaign!
 Marlowe Lune is a fantasy artist based in Cincinnati, Ohio. They specialise in beautifully lush and detailed illustrations exploring fairytales, book arts and queer stories.
Website | Twitter | Instagram | Book
I’m in awe of Marlowe's illustration as well as their tarot and book inspired framing - they're working on a character portrait for their print that explores some of the symbolism in the series, and I'm extremely excited to see what they come up with.
 About the author 
 Hello, I'm Hari - I'm both the writer and artist for Finding Home. I'm a queer, disabled comic creator based in the UK, and have been making Finding Home since 2016. Collecting and printing the story as graphic novels means a huge amount to me, and the comic really wouldn't be possible without reader support. 
As well as comics I'm also an illustrator for fantasy books & games - you might know me as the author of the choose-your-own-path book Into the Dungeon, the artist for the official Adventure Zone game, or possibly the person who made their entire animal crossing island forest. 
 You can find me on twitter & instagram, and my website here.
More info & FAQs
How many books will there be?
There are going to be 4 volumes in total - this is the penultimate book. (See FAQ tab for more info!)
Where can I buy all 3 books?
While the kickstarter is running, you can buy the first two physical books in a specially priced bundle here on Etsy, and get the third separately through this kickstarter.
For this project, there isn't a reward tier with all 3 physical books (FAQ tab has more info on why this was the best choice for the book!) But if you're a new reader, you can get all 3 books as PDFs in the specially discounted catchup bundle tier - and they also come free with 'The Prince' bundle. 
What age is this comic suitable for?
I describe Finding home as older teen+ or 16+, as a general guide - it broadly matches guidelines for a film rated 15 by the British Board of Film Classification.
The comic does not include explicit images, but the story does include strong language, themes about sexual relationships and touches on trauma and mental health issues. The Finding Home books (and PDF versions) have warnings on the contents page with relevant page numbers. Please message me on kickstarter if you have any questions or specific concerns.
Finance breakdown
The majority of the money will go towards printing costs for the book, followed by the cost of postage and packaging (including shipping overseas), then rewards (including guest art) and Kickstarter fees.
Who’s the writer/ colourist/ editor/ printer?
I do the art, writing and lettering for Finding Home.
- The comic is edited by Claire Napier
- And the books are printed by Comic Printing UK
Planning for COVID-19
This is a more streamlined kickstarter with a shorter runtime than some of my previous projects, focused on delivering the book itself in the most effective way possible in the current global situation.
Everything’s being planned for the project to be run with minimal disruption, with everyone’s safety and delivering the book the highest priority.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I've fulfilled all my previous kickstarters with time to spare, and will be using trusted printers, manufacturers and postal systems I’ve used many times before. I am expecting changes due to COVID-19 and have been making plans accordingly to minimise risks and delays.

- Safety

The project is being run in a way to minimise risk and keep safety a priority for everyone involved. I’m disabled and me, my family and usual assistant happen to all be vulnerable to the virus. Smaller reward parcels will minimise in-person contact at post facilities for everyone, and special precautions will be taken to keep everything absolutely clean and hygienic in the way parcels are packed and everything is handled.

- International shipping

Many countries' postal services are overwhelmed at the moment, notably USPS and Canada Post, which can take 4-6 weeks or longer to deliver international parcels at the time of writing, depending on your location. Please check online for details of your country’s postal system and any delays they’re currently experiencing! (If your country's postal system is not currently operational, it may not be possible to get a physical book to you - we'll do everything we can, but we may have to organise delayed posting or a refund. Please get in contact if you have concerns!)

As a result of disruption from COVID-19, estimated delivery has been pushed back to allow for delays with the post, as well as giving extra time to deal with any unforseen issues and fulfil rewards safely.

Backers will be kept updated on progress of any disruptions if they arise.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Final week! Updates, previews, and last-chance recommendations
updates.update_content:
We're now in the last week of the campaign, which has just gone over 200% funded!!
Here's a couple of updates on stretch goals, guest art, plus a couple of last-chance recommendations for other fantasy, LGBT+ and comics projects I'm personally really excited about.
Stretch goal updates & guest art preview

Marlowe Lune guest art reveal
Extremely excited to be able to reveal the final guest art illustration by Marlowe Lune which they just finished up - this is one of the prints in The Prince bundle!
We talked about using some of the motifs from the story surrounding Chepi's past, as well as flower meaning associations with erica and wormwood. Combined with Marlowe's beautiful tarot and book arts inspired framing, I absolutely love how the final artwork turned out.

Ok!! WOW!!! The project actually funded in the first 8 hours of it going live - thank you SO much for everyone's support, it’s what makes the comic possible. I’m incredibly excited to print this book!!
I definitely underestimated the interest in the physical book and extras, and almost all the limited tiers sold out in the first 12 hours. I’ve actually been running the numbers and I’m going to be increasing the slots available on The Prince bundle. This is because I don’t want all the extras (and extremely lovely guest art) to be unavailable to everyone after only half a day - especially given readers' different time zones and work schedules.

campaign.story:
Hello! My name is Jeana and this is my third Kickstarter Campaign! I recently drew a series of sharks doing human things, inspired by the Ikea shark and its memes, and decided to turn them into pins. I’m very excited to run this Kickstarter and I hope you’ll enjoy them as well!
My previous Kickstarters were great successes with a total of 500+ backers and over CA$ 20,000 total pledged. Now, this new project will feature 6 total pin designs and 2 mini pins to unlock! But I can't do so without your help. Supporting me through this Kickstarter will not only see these pins be brought to life, but will also give you a greater discount! Any left over pins will be sold in my shop at a higher price.
Kickstarter has a pledge now and pay later mechanism, so that you will not be charged for your pledge until the end of the campaign and only if the initial goal is met. You can upgrade, downgrade, or cancel your pledge at any time before the campaign ends! Surveys will be sent at the end of the campaign to collect addresses and choose pins.
For updates, future pin designs, and more of my artwork and merchandise, check out my Shop and Instagram!
Each pin will be 30 - 50 mm (1.2 - 2 inch), hard enamel, gold plated pins with 2x blue rubber backings and my logo backstamped. They come with a backing card and will be wrapped and placed in a bubble mailer. The initial goal of CAD $400 will go towards unlocking the Coffee Shark pin. Additional pin designs and rewards are unlockable as stretch goals!
As a thank you for being a kickstarter backer and helping me bring this collection to life, I've decided to add a few freebies for you guys!
For additional prints, add $3 CAD per print to your pledge
For additional sticker packs, add $6 CAD per pack to your pledge
For additional mini pins, add $10 CAD per pin to your pledge
For additional sticker sheets, add $5 CAD per sheet to your pledge
All pins will be attached to a backing card and wrapped. They will be packaged in a bubble mailer envelope and sent out via USPS First Class, which includes tracking. Sticker and/or print only orders will be shipped in a non-tracked envelope as letter mail.
For international backers, please note that you'll be responsible for any customs/VAT fees that may incur. It is illegal for me to change the price or mark the items as gifts on customs forms. If you do not accept the package and it is returned to me undamaged, I can refund you the costs minus shipping.
Due to the ongoing pandemic, shipping times cannot be guaranteed, especially for international packages as many countries are experiencing a backlog and delay in accepting and delivering packages. Please ensure that your country is accepting packages around the time the pins will be shipped! If you would like me to hold the package for you to be shipped at a later time, please let me know ASAP. 
To add on additional items, add the cost of each item you would like to receive to your total pledge amount!
To change your pledge tier, click the the "Manage Your Pledge" button (at the top of the campaign page or by clicking your current reward tier). Then click the "Change your pledge" button and select "New reward tier".
To change your pledge amount, click the the "Manage Your Pledge" button (at the top of the campaign page or by clicking your current reward tier). Then click the "Change your pledge" button. Add your add-on total to the current pledge amount and it will update!
★ Early bird spots are limited to the first 24 hours, once you miss it, there will be no way of getting a spot again. If you un-pledge during the campaign you will not be able to re-pledge for early bird deals, even if someone else drops!
★ Seconds grade enamel pins are flawed pins with noticeable imperfections, but they can still use some love! Flaws are noticeable at arm length and may include: Deep scratches and/or multiple pores/specks, overflow/underfill of enamel or missing enamel,  obvious oxidation/imperfections in plating, bent pin needle, etc.
★ When you pledge on Kickstarter, you'll not be charged right away, so that you will not be charged for your pledge until the end of the campaign and only if the initial goal is met. If the campaign is unsuccessful, you will not be charged at all. You can upgrade, downgrade, or cancel your pledge at any time before the campaign ends!
★ Your pledges helps to unlock new designs, so even if the design that you like is still locked, your pledge can bring us one step closer to unlocking it. Please pledge for ALL of the items you'd like, even if they aren't unlocked yet! It helps us reach the next goal!
★ You can choose which pin(s) you would like at the end of the campaign, after which I'll send out a survey to collect your shipping address and the pin design you want to choose
★ If you have any more questions, please don't hesitate to leave a comment, or you can email me at shop@jeanadraws.com
Rose gold sakura whale enamel pins
Gold and silver otter space enamel pins
Sakura otter enamel pin collection
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I've had experience running multiple kickstarter campaigns and have made over 20 pin designs. I have a reliable manufacturer that I use to ensure a smooth production process and quality products for you all.

However, there still might be delays during production due to unforeseeable circumstances or slight alterations in color and design of the final production. These shall be minimal and not affect the overall appearance of the pin. If the pins must be remade, there will be a delay in pin shipping time. I will continue communicating with my manu and update you all on the process as we go along!

With the current COVID-19 pandemic, there is also a risk of your country not accepting packages if you're international and delayed shipping times (both domestic and international). In the case your country is not accepting packages when the pins are ready to be shipped, I can either hold the package until your country accepts packages again or offer you a full refund.

campaign.story:
Hi, my name is Sylvia Strijk. I'm a digital artist living in the Netherlands. Thank you so much for checking out the Kickstarter for my first ArtZine!
During the Mermay Challenges in previous years I created several mermaid illustrations. For these I received such positive feedback from my audience, that it inspired me to start this project! You may have seen my work before on Instagram or Facebook.
The title of the Zine is "Siren Song" and is a collection of 20 Mermaid illustrations I made over the last three months. I hope to share these illustrations with everyone in a physical format.
Siren Song: mermaid artzine spread mockup (the final design may change)
Mermaids have always been my favourite fantasy creatures to draw. Did you know that over eighty percent of the ocean is still unexplored? This interesting fact makes my imagination go wild. I keep creating stories about the mysterious Merfolk with all their undiscovered secrets.
For example, I like to fantasize how mermaids don't age the same way as any other (non magical) creature. Instead of growing old they are slowly consumed by the sea. Turning into seashells and coral, returning to the ocean, not leaving a trace...⠀
Siren Song will be an A5 sized (14,8 cm x 21 cm) Artzine containing 20 full page art illustrations. The zine will be printed in full color on 170 gram high quality paper. To enhance a stylish presentation the Zine will have a 300 gram paper gloss laminated cover. 
Siren Song will be a limited edition print, so all zines will be signed and numbered. Backers at the highest tier will get an original & unique doodle inside their zine.
With your help I hope to turn this project into a reality.
I'm keeping this campaign simple with a limited selection of reward Tiers.

I'm able to ship worldwide! Simply select your pledge option and your location, Kickstarter will calculate the shipping for you. Please also be aware of customs fees in your country as this is out of my control.
All rewards will be sent out at the same time, packed with care and love.
We've reached all of our stretch goals! Meaning an additional eight new mermaid illustrations will appear in Siren Song. Plus everyone who has backed Tier 2 and above will receive a bookmark and a set of three postcards for free. 
*final designs may be subject to change
The primary costs for this project are printing and shipping. There is a small buffer for unforeseen costs. I'll only be making a profit from this project after the funding goal is met.
Sylvia is a digital illustrator living in the Netherlands. She graduated from Art Academy Minerva in 2012 with a bachelor in Fine Art. The ethereal and melancholic has always fascinated her. Currently she combines this with her love for portraiture and the fantastical, all with the goal to create work that lures you into an other world. 
For those who are not familiar with Kickstarter, it’s a worldwide crowd-funding platform for artists and their creative projects. Your payment is only collected at the end of an successfully funded campaign. If we don't reach the funding goal by the campaign's end date, you won't be charged anything. 
A month before shipping I'll send you a survey through Kickstarter, asking for your shipping address.

campaign.story:
Ambrosia is an erotic anthology of delicious, nourishing naughtiness, where each comic has at least one trans masculine or non binary main character.
Our theme is Food of the Gods: Sixteen smutty stories of indulgent deities and euphoric adventures, from ancient ardent explorations to modern day mischievous spirits.
With predominantly own voice artists, and content warnings before each story to help the reader decide if it’s to their taste, this collection is truly a feast, for body and soul. 
THIS KICKSTARTER IS SUITABLE FOR READERS 18+ ONLY! BY BACKING YOU CONFIRM YOU ARE OF AGE TO PURCHASE THESE KINDS OF MATERIALS IN YOUR COUNTRY. 

Find out more about them here:
(Warning, many of us create erotic content so some portfolios are NSFW)
A.C. Esguerra  | Aiden GD Moore | Alan Capes | Dante Luiz & H. Pueyo  | David Orión & Guillermo Saavedra | Defensetrain & Paperchimes | Elijah Forbes | Ethan X. Parker | Feardeer | Jade Sarson | Lonnie Garcia | Nero O'Reilly | Nora Scott | Steve Stivaktis | Tab Kimpton | V Griffin | And our back cover artist C.Bedford 
The stories are a mix of smutty, sweet and silly, with romantic arcs that twist your heart and sexual situations of all types of stimulation. 
Below are descriptions of some of our stories plus some preview artwork to give you a taste of our table of offerings!
(Final artwork may differ and it absolutely won't be censored in the book.)
A.C. Esguerra takes us to the high seas with fantasy Ming Dynasty pirates! A mischievous holy Emperor, pirate trickery abounds, and a poor Tailor gets his own (sexy) revenge. 
Alan Capes brings us to the swamp where Shapeshifter god, Rook, sighs away their woes to fungus creature Ysthaga, who is very eager to show his appreciation.
Aiden GD Moore summons up a super sweet black magic ritual, where two lingerie clad partners summon the god Pan to lend a hand in spicing up their sex life.
 Defensetrain & Paperchimes are bringing us a modern day story about two gods of weather who meet in a bar after both being banished from the heavens + sparks fly!
Eye of the Storm by Defensetrain and Paperchimes
David Orión & Guillermo Saavedra explore the heat inside the Volcano Teide where the guanche god Guayota is trapped.
 Dante Luiz & H. Pueyo are taking us to Brazil where a peasant woman thinks she’ll be sacrificed to a Jaguar deity... only to discover the man behind the mask is a god of ecstasy.
Arau by Dante Luiz & H. Pueyo
Elijah Forbes follows an urban explorer and photographer who finds (and falls for) a spirit of forgotten spaces in what should be a closed YMCA. 
Ethan X. Parker spins the story of a forest sprite who takes their lover on a journey through the spirit realm, in an exploration of senses and sensuality.
Feardeer enters the Temple of Kneeling and draws an encouraging tale of a pent up disciple who prays at the shrine of Keen, a god with half bird form, to help him explore sex in different ways.
The Temple of Kneeling by Feardeer our Cover Artist
Jade Sarson takes on the four auspicious beasts myths: tiger, jellyfish, peacock and snake. Avatars who have to ‘connect’ to balance the world (if they can stop arguing long enough to do so).
Four Auspicious Priests by Jade Sarson
Lonnie Garcia’s elegant backgrounds feature a sweet botanist, a reclusive estate owner (and secret ancient deity), a rare collection of night blooming cacti, and the sexiest consumption of dragon fruit we’ve ever seen.
Nero O’Reilly’s story is about a small-time luck deity who helps a petty thief with his heists... and all the romps they get into along the way.
Lucky Break by Nero O'Reilly
Nora Scott tells of a wandering injured soldier who slips into the inbetween space where a forest creature is held prisoner. Together they find a way to escape.
Tab Kimpton gets us squeaky clean in the Roman baths, where god Vulcan shows the mortal men a thing or two about pleasure, until Venus comes along and demands they pay her husband a more fitting tribute.
The Roman Bath by Tab Kimpton
V. Griffin treads familiar paths with an older pilgrim who journeys his own history. Along a path of statues he remembers each of his former lovers.
Sound tasty? Well don't just take our word for it, check out what people had to say about our previous Erotic Anthology Come Together over on Goodreads
We’re passionate about supporting our artists, so the bulk of the money for this project is going straight on their pay. 
Plus every £2,500 we go over our goal we’ll give every story artist an extra £50! So if we reach £25,000 they'll get an extra £100, £27,500 an extra £150... so on and so forth with no limit on these raises.
Jade Sarson is a Lincoln (UK) based illustrator and comic artist. They like tea, big dogs, and gut-punchingly passionate romance. They graduated from the University of Lincoln in 2011 with a first class honours degree in Illustration and started self publishing their teastained webcomic series Cafe Suada shortly after that. In 2014 they won the Myriad Editions First Graphic Novel competition with For the Love of God, Marie!
TeaHermit.co.uk
Tab Kimpton is a queer comic artist based in Manchester (UK). His previous anthology Come Together was his seventh successful kickstarter project. With works such as Minority Monsters and Sir, Butler & Boy, he attempts to fill in the gaps that slip down the cracks in the LGBT acronym, especially for erotica.
DiscordComics.com
This project also could not have happened without help from Aiden GD Moore, our first confirmed artist who believed in the project from the start and answered so many emails. We'd also like to thank Dean McKnight, Laura Blake, Nathan Blades, Alex Assan, Niki Smith, and Harry Anne Bentley for their support throughout. 
Ambrosia features characters, couples and pairings of many genders within the stories, absolutely including people on the trans femme spectrum. However wouldn't it be nice if there was a Trans Femme & Non Binary focused version of this anthology? We think so too, which is why we are currently opening submissions for our NEXT erotic comic anthology Nectar:
~>Nectar info and artist submissions form<~
(Closing date Nov 1st 2020. Submissions only require brief elevator pitches and examples of previous work, no finished artwork or scripts required. As well as own voice artists/full creative teams with at least one own voice member, for this anthology we are also inviting own voice script writers to be paired with our chosen artists, and artists of any gender to be paired with our chosen writers.)
