campaign.story:
On a film set, when lighting for beauty shots,  cinematographers use the biggest, softest lights we have, to make actors and models look their best. 
Why? 
A big light wraps gently around features on the face, and a soft light evens out skin tone and diffuses any hard shadows - so bumps and creases disappear. 
Created by Australian film professionals and based on these lighting principles, BIGSOFTI is a mobile, high quality, bi-colour LED soft panel that delivers stunning diffused lighting for better photos, videos and video calls on all your devices.
Universal clip fits all leading smartphone, tablet and laptop brands.
Shoe mount with 1/4"-20 thread fits all cameras, tripods and light stands.
3M Adhesive Mount for computer monitors and other general surfaces.
Check out the before and after below - which do you prefer? 
NB. This is an animated GIF - give it a second to load.
Late night FaceTime calls with the team overseas? Make sure you always look your best with soft bright mobile lighting. 
NB. This is an animated GIF - give it a second to load.
NB. This is an animated GIF - give it a second to load.
With a variety of different ways to mount BIGSOFTI,  you can use it all sorts of different places for all sorts of different purposes.
Do you shoot handheld on a gimbal? We know they can be tough to balance. BIGSOFTI weighs just 74 grams (2.6 oz) - it's so lightweight, you'll hardly feel it.
Aussie DOP Peter Eastgate ACS (Netflix "GO") on a recent FOXTEL TV commercial using BIGSOFTI as an eye light.   
Whether you're a cinematographer on an Arri Alexa or an influencer shooting content on your iPhone - BIGSOFTI will help brighten up your frames.
NB. This is an animated GIF - give it a second to load.
Simple 2 button function - for a combination of 9 different light settings:
Button 1 - Power On & Brightness Adjust - LOW - MID - MAX. 
Button 2 - 3 Colour Temperature Setting - DAYLIGHT - CLEAN WHITE - TUNGSTEN.
NB. This is an animated GIF - give it a second to load.
Match the lighting in your surroundings with the variable colour temperatures. Cooler daylight for scenes lit by the sun. Tungsten for indoors with warmer light globes. Clean White for when there is a mix in the scene, or those times when you're not quite sure.
NB. This is an animated GIF - give it a second to load.
Control your lighting angle by up to 45 degrees with the rotating barrel connector built into all accessory mounts.
Australian TV Journalist Jan Fran lighting a TV Skype interview. The Drum - ABC TV
NB. This is an animated GIF - give it a second to load.
NB. This is an animated GIF - give it a second to load.
Easily attaches to mobiles in seconds via the bowed flex of the universal clip. Over-moulded rubber edges for great grip that will never scratch your devices.
The design of the Universal Clip has been created to fit phones both with cases and those without. Flexible and resilient to fit all leading smartphone, tablets and laptops. 
NB. This is an animated GIF - give it a second to load.
Cutout designed into Universal clip allows BIGSOFTI to be simply placed directly above the webcam on laptops - for even, front lighting.
NB. This is an animated GIF - give it a second to load.
Quick and easy accessory changes with the custom rotating barrel mount. Each accessory simple slides in and out.
NB. This is an animated GIF - give it a second to load.
NB. This is an animated GIF - give it a second to load.
Cold-shoe attachment designed to fit traditional cameras. Plus 1/4" 20 thread mount in base allows for use on tripods and light stands.
BIGSOFTI has been designed for maximum big-ness but to still to have a footprint smaller than your mobile. Size compared here to the regular iPhone X.

NB. This is an animated GIF - give it a second to load.
BIGSOFTI is super lightweight at just 74g / 2.6 oz. For reference the iPhone X weighs 167g / 5.9 oz.
NB. This is an animated GIF - give it a second to load.
Whether for a night out with friends or off to a shoot with a client, BIGSOFTI is easy to transport. Super compact, super lightweight and super bright.
The battery on our prototypes was 1000mAh.  In testing we have measured run times at approx:
95 mins at MAX | 140 mins at MID | 240 mins at LOW.
And full charge from flat is around 2 hrs. *Subject to battery age and weather conditions.
But with our stretch goals achieved, we can now upgrade the size of this battery by 1.5X to a 1500mAh battery - which will increase these timings.
USB-C allows for operation while charging, so if a need ever arises the unit can be run from a power source.
As we are injection moulding the diffusion panel, we will have full control of elements that effect the panel opacity (we'll be experimenting with the mix of composite ingredients / diffusing powders that give a glow effect etc). Once we have the tooling complete and can experiment with these options, fine tuning will take place to balance the LED outputs VS the diffusion opacity. As a result run times may vary up or down slightly in final production model.
While CRI is a commonly cited score, as a film professional, a more important rating is the Television Lighting Consistency Index or TLCI.  It also runs from 0-100.  Our LED rating of 98+ puts us in the range where any colour variation is so small, a film colourist would not consider correcting it.  

We've been hard at work over the past three weeks confirming the final details of our tooling setup - we have paid and signed our contract and have been working on the finer points of the design, with tool cutting due to commence any day. We have opted to work with a higher precision tooling company as it will both allow us to produce more units faster, and also deliver a product with a higher quality finish.  
We're also excited to announce that since we can now order at higher volume, we have been able to negotiate some rates and add a couple of pretty cool features that will now be shipped with every BIGSOFTI.
And after hitting our $650K Stretch Goal today - every single BIGSOFTI shipped to every backer will now have a 1500mAh battery!

My name is Al Morrow, I'm a Sydney-based TV commercial director who’s worked with global brands in both Australia and the US for over a decade.  
I'm the guy who walks into a room and has to fight the urge to adjust the lights. Lighting quality literally affects how we see the world, and yet so many people hardly give it enough thought.
Al Morrow lining up the frame on recent Volkswagen TV Commercial.
I know how important lighting is when filming, well, anything and because I shoot photos and videos on my phone all the time, I wanted to bring the same kind of high-quality light that I use on my film sets to my mobile.
Even though I’d been thinking of ways to bring film lighting to my phone, my ‘aha’ moment for BIGSOFTI didn’t come on set or even during a shoot. It came one day in the car. My wife was driving and her sister was in the backseat; taking selfie after selfie. She was holding up a jacket to cut out the direct sunlight and complaining that her photos either had too many hard shadows or were being blasted by the phone flash.
I commented to her, that without her knowing it, she was cutting and shaping light in a similar way that we would on a film set and that if she wanted full control of her image, she’d need to have a small, powerful, soft light with her. Her face lit up (no pun intended) 'that would be great!'. Many months later, she was the first person we started our tests on, comparing our soft light to the hard light of the phone flash.
Note the harsh light and hard focussed shadow from the single point LED on the phone (top left) VS much softer spread from BIGSOFTI (top right).
That was when I realised this was not just a product I would use. Everyone (director or not), uses cameras and anyone shooting photos or videos needs good light.
The first thing I did when I got home that evening was to look at what products already existed in this space. There were phone cases that seemed cumbersome. Products that were made with cheap, low-quality LEDs. Lighting attachments that were too big, too heavy, too expensive.
There seemed to be a gap in the market! I was curious to see if we could address these design flaws and make something better - and the BIGSOFTI journey began.
BIGSOFTI began with me in my office pulling apart LED products I bought on ebay and hacking bits together but it really shifted gear when I brought on the team at Vert Design. 
I was impressed by both their enthusiasm and their experience (they had designed products for clients such as SONY, INTEL, BMW and DEUS among others) and, from the outset, our partnership was a perfect combination of my knowledge of lighting and photography and their passion for user-focused design.
We set off on two things: 1. Start on initial designs. 2. Find the right manufacturing partner.
Throughout the process, Head Designer Andrew Simpson spoke about product design being a 'swinging pendulum' between tech functionality and human interaction. Swing too far in one direction you lose the core practicality of the product, too far in the other direction and you lose the great user experience. We needed to make a product that was the perfect combination of both.
Initially, we created a light panel that would attach to the underside of a flip-out phone case. We found that while the function of the light module worked well, the user interaction with the design was lacking. We showed it to family, friends and colleagues who loved the effect of the lighting, but not the experience so we went back to the drawing board.
We explored fixed universal clips, magnetic blocks, locking rubber lugs, even a metal arm and shoe mount. We were split on the clip VS rubber lug and so decided to run some market research through the digital platform OnePulse, asking a focus group of 500 men and women 18-35, across the UK and US which design they preferred. A resounding eighty-five per cent said the clip-on design.
Our direction became very clear. Several iterations later, we now have a rotating, removable mechanism (patent pending), which houses a universal clip for all leading smartphone, tablet and laptop brands. Plus the additional features of a cold shoe camera mount with ¼” 20 thread mount and the 3M Adhesive Mount for general surfaces. It’s this simple versatility that helps put BIGSOFTI into its own category - being effortlessly transferrable across all your devices. 
We had our design, now we needed to get it made. After a false start with our initial manufacturer (bad communication, high costs, lack of knowledge and lack of passion about the product) we were put in touch with a man named Hunter Ho; an LED lighting product specialist.
During our first meeting with Hunter, we discussed the technical requirements of LED numbers, size, spacing and distance, colour temp,  CRI and TLCI ratings, the diffusing materials, batteries and charge times, circuits and regulatory approval checks. Hunter had an answer to all our questions and within a few days had sent us itemised quotes with unit numbers, costs, recommendations and timelines.
With Hunter’s input we were able to improve the lighting board and PCB layout, update the charge port to USB-C and increase the battery size and run time.  But most importantly, we were able to update the quality of our LEDs. We are now working with specialised, photography grade BI-COLOUR LEDs, so new that they may have never been used in a device this small before. They deliver changeable colour temperature functionality - with options for all scenarios - DAYLIGHT (5500K), TUNGSTEN (3000K) and a CLEAN MIX (4000K). Which means awesome colour reproduction for better images. We are super confident in our design and just as confident in our manufacturer. 
During these uncertain times in the world, shipping costs have gone up significantly, however, we believe these prices should return to normal as the global situation improves. To therefore minimise costs for our backers, we will not be charging the current higher shipping charges at the time of pledging.
Shipping, Taxes (and VAT / GST) will be calculated and paid for towards the end of the campaign, just before we ship out to our supporters.  This is being managed through BackerKit who will be in contact via email. 
We will be working hard to secure you the best shipping prices. The good news is that BIGSOFTI is small and lightweight, so any multipack purchases will be charged as only single postage fees, so please consider ordering for someone else too, to help us cut down on shipping costs and air miles.
We were always planning to launch BIGSOFTI in the first few months of this year, and obviously things have been a little held up by this very strange and difficult time out there.
We’ve stayed across developments of COVID-19 from the very beginning, as news of the pandemic first began to spread in China. We have adjusted our delivery timelines to take into consideration any delays that might be encountered as we move into tooling and production.
COVID-19 is certainly going to impact the way we work and communicate for the next little while. There is generally a movement towards remote working and this is only going to increase, and with that, comes adjusting to the new norm of endless video calls both for personal and business reasons. 
We know there is a lot about social distancing that has been difficult.  Never-ending video calls is just one minor impact of the current situation.  But if BIGSOFTI can help solve this one little problem then great.
We couldn't have got where we are today, without lots of help from family and friends. This whole thing has been done as lean as possible. From learning how to build a website, to hassling my poor friends to be in the videos. Harassing my brother Matt to help me film things. To asking my wife Jan for feedback during scripting. And a couple of favours finishing the content with Chris at White Chocolate in Darlington, and Tone at Rumble Studios in Chippendale. So to all those people - a huge thanks. Literally could not have done it without you all.
Chief Technology Cat analysing LED spectrum lab reports. LOL - No he's not. He's a moron.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have been working on developing BIGSOFTI for nearly 24 months now and have built some great working relationships with our manufacturing partners.

If we are successful with our campaign, the team are ready to push the button on the tool making. As soon as we hit our funding goal, we can afford to pay the invoice at the factory to begin tooling.

We have every element fully costed out - so know exactly how to deliver BIGSOFTI out to customers - but as professionals with very high standards, we have identified a few risks that you should be made aware of that include:


1 - Manufacturing Schedule
 
We know things are going to be a little backed up with the factories as China moves back to full capacity, and this has been factored into our production timings. We have outlined a longer delivery time-frame of 6 months in the hopes that we will end up being able to deliver earlier than expected. 

We are working with a very experienced mould maker to manage our injection moulding process and a top electronic engineer and LED consultant to drive the component acquisition and circuitry construction.

It is critical to fully 'tune' the injection mould tooling to ensure we deliver BIGSOFTI to our high standards. The process of 'tuning the mould' has been described as sometimes more art than science. It can be quick or a can take a few passes to refine. The time to do this has been factored in, but if they nail it quickly, then it might be faster. But we will not be producing the first run of product until we are happy with the samples to make sure you will be too.

We can guarantee however to be fully transparent with communication updates so you guys know exactly how things are moving along. We want to make sure you love BIGSOFTI as much as we do - and won't ship until we know you will.


2 - Shipping and Handling

We think it's important to get BIGSOFTI out to you guys nice and quickly, but at the lowest cost possible.
Global freight and shipping is currently under the weight of massive demand and the road blocks of fewer flights and tighter borders. As such, costs for shipping are up (sometimes 2-3X) - which unfortunately is driving up our material and manufacturing costs somewhat, but this is something that we are absorbing at this stage to get BIGSOFTI off the ground.

Our shipping team are set to pack and send BIGSOFTI as soon as it's ready to go - but as with any postage, we cannot control the amount of time it takes once it leaves our warehouse. Global freight is currently burdened during this health crisis so timings and costings will be effected. We hope by the time we are ready to ship, that access has returned to some level of normality. But our plan is to maintain good constant communication with all backers so everyone is kept well informed.

In order to give you the most competitive pricing on shipping, we will not be charging shipping and taxes through Kickstarter but will be charging it closer to our delivery dates through BackerKit. With costs far higher than normal at the moment, but the assumption that things should return closer to normal over the next few months, we hope to get BIGSOFTI out to you guys for the cheapest possible price. 

We're working through trusted partners here so we're confident things will be fine, but please be patient as sometimes little hiccups in their system can cause a short (but understandably annoying) delay. 


3 - Minimum Orders

Backing our project is not the same thing as buying an off the shelf photography light. It is about supporting our idea that professional lighting principles should be available simply and easily across all your devices. 

To make this possible, we need to build enough support here in the KICKSTARTER community to get us over the line. This support will finally help us bring all our hours of research and development to life in BIGSOFTI.

To help make this idea a reality, we need your help in spreading the word.

If you like the look of BIGSOFTI, please click the green button and back our campaign. And please share it with anyone you think might also benefit from better quality lighting in their pocket. 

Every pledge we get helps bring us one step closer to getting BIGSOFTI into your hands, as quickly as possible, and for the lowest possible price. Thanks again for checking us out.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
BIGSOFTI is manufactured with high quality components that are built to last. The universal clip design future proofs it for next generation mobile updates - so there is no need to replace BIGSOFTI even if you upgrade your phone.
Reusability and recyclability
BIGSOFTI is made with high quality components so our products will last. We utilise recyclable materials for shipping - so our packaging will not. It is compostable - after at least 5 weeks in soil. It is incredibly important to us that all our packaging is made with recycled materials. It does cost us a bit more to do it this way, but for us there is no alternative.
Sustainable materials
Our packaging is made with recycled cardboard that can be composted after use.

campaign.story:
Concept art for BULLISH.
BULLISH is a queer, monstrous, adult romance set in the mid-century Texas Panhandle. It is a story where fantasy and horror meet a torrid Western romance, full of betrayal, terrifying power, and the struggle of two men rebuilding their relationship.
CONTENT WARNING: While it is first and foremost a supernatural romantic drama, this book contains queer erotic content, light body horror, and physical violence (including moments of visual gore). I ask everyone to keep all responses, inquiries, and other communications appropriate. You must be of legal age to contribute to this campaign.
SHIPPING NOTE: Before you read any further, if you back this campaign, remember that shipping will be charged at a later date! I'll be using PledgeManager to gather surveys and shipping costs next year, so I don't have to charge you more than what's needed.
Concept art for BULLISH.
This campaign is to help fund the production and printing of the graphic novel. In addition, the entire process of this book- scripting, research, editing, art generation, and book design- will be documented for all backers. Bi-monthly updates will be used to show progress, all of which will be collected into a digital PDF for backers at the end. There are minimal stretch goals for this campaign to keep things succinct. Think of it like a pre-order system, but you also get a first hand look into how the magic is made every step of the way!
Our story focuses on the beginning of a new romance between two men in the fictional town of Labrinne, TX. Bill Black, a newly-arrived outsider in search of temporary work, meets Javier Rosales, the well beloved owner of the town's sprawling ranch. Almost immediately, the two men find in each other a curious rapport, and Javier hires him on to help at the ranch. Weeks turn to months...
Page excerpt from BULLISH.
...and a temporary hire turns into a budding relationship. However, when Javier discovers what appears to be his farmhand-turned-lover looting his safe in the dead of night, he's devastated. Pain quickly becomes anger, and Bill soon discovers his partner possesses terrifying magical power as he is brutally cursed into the form of the infamous Minotaur of Greco-Roman myth.
Page excerpt from BULLISH.
The next morning rises, and the fraught lovers must now grapple with one another's violent betrayals as they struggle to find a path forward. Javier wrestles with what he's done, and if he can ever forgive the man he trusted his heart to. Meanwhile, trapped within his new beastly form, Bill tries to avoid incurring further supernatural wrath as his secret life threatens to destroy their love and the town...
Rough page excerpts from BULLISH.
Key character concept art for BULLISH.
The original illustration of our protagonists came about from a warm-up exercise in May. I was immediately intrigued by the idea of a ranch owner and his beastly lover, finding myself drifting back to the concept over and over. Soon, more sketches appeared, thumbnails for a short scene were drawn up, and before I knew it, it had spiraled out of control into the campaign you see today!
Character sketches for Javier.
Javier Rosales is the owner of the only ranch in the tiny town of Labrinne. In his late 40s, he runs it by himself, much to the surprise of outsiders. A warm and welcoming man, he often holds gatherings and celebrations for the community on his property, earning him the title 'Papa Rosa' from many of the town children. Long separated from his last partner, Javier was content with sharing his affection with the town- until Bill arrives, and he takes a chance on love one more time...
Character sketches for Bill.
Bill Black is a man hiding secrets that he no longer wishes to hold. Always sought after for his brawn, he prides himself in his usefulness- no matter the details of the job. Now in his 30s and growing wary of those he works for, life finds him in Labrinne for mysterious reasons... reasons he fears will undo the unexpected love he's grown for Javier, the town, and the new life he's made.
The book itself is planned to be approximately 176 pages in black and white, 6.5 x 5.5 inches, with a matte finish softcover. Two stretch goals have been unlocked to help really make this book stand out with deckled page edges and french flaps, and will be applied to all physical reward tiers. 
A closer look at the book specs and design details!
A rough cover mockup for the book - not final.
The third stretch goal is a simple one - a 16 page, 18+ post-epilogue comic that will be exclusive to backers of the campaign. Now unlocked, all tiers will receive it either as a digital PDF or physical booklet, depending on the reward chosen! The content and mood of this stretch goal will be decided by backer polls later in the production cycle. Sweet and wholesome, dark and sensual, who's to know... 
Details for the bonus post-epilogue comic!
 Here's more info on the previously mentioned stretch goals, plus some more!
All the stretch goals for the campaign!
The Extra Scenes goal is straightforward- I had to edit stuff out of the story to cut costs, and this will let me add them back in! The Enamel Pin will be a soft enamel pin based on the book, and added to all Signed Bookplate, Screenprint, and Original Ink tiers for free. In addition, a different hard enamel pin will be available in the new Enamel Pin Edition tier. What's Next is a short excerpt added to the back of the book that teases the next installment in the series (remember how other novels would hint at a sequel?). BULLISH is a part of a trilogy I've been developing, all loosely linked by the themes of supernatural horror, queer romance, and messy relationships. I hope to reveal more about the other two stories in the triad soon- though I'm sure I've left vague concepts and ideas all over my social media. Finally, at $30,000... Stickers. A screenprint style sticker will be added to all physical reward tiers, in a similar theme to the screenprint design!
Page excerpt from BULLISH.
Let's take a closer look at these extra rewards now... check out these sweet, sweet enamel pin designs. I personally am a sucker for pins, and 2 of my previous campaigns have been to fund enamel pin sets!
The Minotaur's Lament pin from the Enamel Pin Edition tier.
The Minotaur's Lament:
is available with the physical book in its own tier, the Enamel Pin Edition ($25)
will be available as an add-on thru PledgeManager after the campaign ($5)
any excess will be sold online at full price after all KS orders are shipped
The Shattered Heart pin, exclusive to the $30/100/200 tiers.
The Shattered Heart:
is the 19k stretch goal pin, and is added to the Bookplate, Screenprint, and Ink Original tiers for free
will NOT be available as an add-on thru PledgeManager (only 200 being made)
In addition to the pins, there is an exclusive, limited edition screenprint being made for this campaign along with very limited slots for an original ink piece by yours truly! Both will be inspired by the themes and visuals from BULLISH (plus some backer input in the case of the originals). You can see the rough design for the screenprint and an example of my previous printmaking work below.
Rough design for the screenprint- black, white, and glittering terracotta red on a toned paper.
Examples of my previous screenprint work.
Finally, let's discuss the process art book, a look at the tier levels available, and my estimated timeline for this project.
The BULLISH Process Art Book will be delivered in two ways- over the duration of the book's production, and then as an assembled PDF for download. As mentioned earlier, bi-monthly updates after the campaign concludes will keep everyone in the loop on my progress. These updates will include how-to's, general advice, and detailed process documentation as I proceed through each step! I think this will be a very exciting way to share what my job entails to those unfamiliar, while also providing a map for comic artists who might need help getting started. My reward will hopefully be getting to read and support more comic artists in the future! 
SHIPPING REMINDER: if you back this campaign, again, remember that shipping will be charged at a later date! I'll be using PledgeManager to gather surveys and shipping costs next year, so I don't have to charge you more than what's needed. The prices listed below do not include shipping, which will vary depending on your location. Backers should expect around $5 for USA, $10 for Canada, and $12+ for anywhere else international, but trust that I will do my best to keep shipping costs down!
The rewards available for this campaign!
My current timeline for production of BULLISH is loosely as follows:
---> 2020
 AUGUST - Campaign ends, introductory process post of current content, etc.
 SEPTEMBER - Further research, scripting and rough drafts.
 OCTOBER - Thumbnails, misc. cast and costume creation.
 NOVEMBER - Thumbnails end, font creation, type design.
 DECEMBER - Break month! Enjoy your holidays.
---> 2021
 JANUARY to FEBRUARY - Pencils, pencils, pencils.
 MARCH - Pencils wind down, brush creation for inks/texture.
 APRIL - INK HELL BEGINS.
 MAY to JUNE - So much inking. 
 JULY - Final print PDFs created, book orders sent in.
 NOVEMBER - Books arrive, shipping begins!
As is the nature of comics, things can change radically- you will always get 2 updates a month about the project (except December), and any sudden upsets or changes will be communicated!
Wait, just who is this gu- what on earth was that? A goblin?
Howdy, I'm Cameron, the author and artist for this project! I'm also well known by my internet handle 'mancameron.' I'm a bisexual comic artist and illustrator currently based in the PNW. Hot pink is my favorite color, and I really, really like dogs. My work frequently varies in style and tone, but common themes range from the paranormal, autobiographical self reflection, ghostly horror, and queer love. I am very familiar with finishing large works of this scale and content. I've self-published Twenty Two & Alone, a 140 page collection of comics, poetry, and illustration in March of 2018, and I currently serialize my adult queer fantasy webcomic BAD MAGIK on Slipshine. You can find more work and examples on my portfolio site! 
The logo! Ain't it cute lookin'.
This book will also be published under my weird little micro-press, Dum Sucker Press. I've published a few zines under it, but this will be its first graphic novel! If this campaign does well, I hope to do other stories of queer romance and drama under this press in a similar format in the future. Thank you for giving this project a look, and I hope to see you in post-campaign updates!
Page excerpt from BULLISH.
 Before I forget, some thank you's to a few very important people!
My parents, for always being supportive of their hedonist son
 Hye M. for the help and advice in all things printing and kickstarters 
The Bi Legends group for their constant light, joy, and work energy
All my friends who encourage me and my work every day- love youuu
The book font, miscellaneous type treatments, and design elements featured in the above promotional images were designed and executed by myself.

campaign.story:
My Illustrated Life is an ongoing journal comic for all ages. This Kickstarter is to print the first volume, containing 100 pages, in paperback. Consider helping me make this come to life, and get a copy for your bookshelf!

My Illustrated Life started in December of 2017 from an assignment in college. I've had a ton of fun making more comics since then and this December is the comic's 3rd anniversary!
The comic is series of journal comics, so you can expect the usual slice of life comics in here. There's also some funny moments from my DnD sessions with friends and even some comics about video games. There's a little bit of something for a variety of tastes! There is of course, a whole lot of comics with my cats. (What can I say? I love the little quirky goofballs.) You'll also find the rest of my family in some comics, and even my friends starring along side me on occassion.
The main reward is, of course, the book! This book will be a 9x9" square paperback book with 100 pages. There's new art for title pages and of course, the cover. Every physical book will come signed as thanks for pledging towards the campaign!
PLEASE NOTE: These are just mockups for the book and not not 100% a representation of what the book will look like. 
Aside from the book being something you can get from this Kickstarter, there's also a poster made by me. This will be 11" x 17" in full color from CatPrint!
The other rewards besides the book, depend on how much you pledge. You could get a doodle on the inside of the cover, an A5 sized drawing (related to the comic) or even a digital commission!
I prepared some stretch goals just in case we surpass the original goal! Anything physical that's unlocked will be also available as an add-on when the backer-kit is sent out at the end of August 2020.
I'll also be putting out more information about these stretch goals as we gete close to funding them! So keep an eye out for updates!
I've never run a sucessful Kickstarter before, but I've been researching through Kickstarters I'd backed and through people documenting their process; as well as asking questions of my friend Bryan Ballinger - who sucessfuly funded his Animal Gas campaign.  Aside from asking questions, I am the only one running this Kickstarter. I've taken that into account and made sure I'm not adding too many rewards that would slow me down in regards to delivering things on time. However, we all know the postal system can be difficult at times, and as long as all the rewards get to me I will always update backers should anything get in the way of delivering this at my promised time.  As this is my first Kickstarter, I'm very open to learning how to make things better, especially for my backers. I can be reached in the comments and through messaging on Kickstarter, so I can make sure this process goes as smoothly as possible.
This image breaks down where the money is going for our initial goal of $1,900. Most of it, of course, is going towards getting the book printed. I have also set some aside to ship your orders to you and to make sure we have the kickstarter fees covered. There's some leftover as a buffer to make sure that we have enough to get everything printed and shipped out as safely as possible!
Thanks so much for taking a look at this Kickstarter. If you can't pledge any money to the campaign at this time, you can always share this with your friends and family. Maybe even ask someone to back it as a present for you? Any support is always helpful, and I appreciate you taking a look!
Kickstarter is a crowdfunding platform that brings people together in order to create things. Your payment is not taken out until (or IF) the project funds by its deadline. If the project is completed, I will send out a backer survey to get additional information from you, such as; adresses for physical rewards, emails for digital rewards, letting you add any aditional items and any other information that I may need to get your rewards to you. The rewards from this Kickstarter will hopefully be delivered by November 2020.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This project has four months for fufillment. A month after the Kickstarter ends for backers to add any aditional items to their pledges, and three months to produce the physical items and ship them out to backers. This should be enough time to get everything out to everyone, but if any delays happen - especially due to COVID - I will make sure everyone is updated as soon as possible.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Hello, Starlight!

"Steven Universe Forever" is a Fanzine put together by a group of fans who wanted to pay homage to this amazing show that delighted us for so many years. And who can talk about Steven Universe without thinking of your favorite song moment?
In Steven Universe Forever: I can't Believe We've Come So Far, +50 artists come together to illustrate ALL Steven Universe Songs - which yes, includes Steven Universe: The Movie and Steven Universe Future! From We Are The Crystal Gems to Giant Woman, Peace And Love On The Planet Earth, Here We Are In The Future, Being Human, Love Like You and so much more, we'll be illustrating a total of 80 songs!
Bring your ukulele and sing off-key with us, but put your heart to it.
Each artist brought their own vision and style to the songs we know and love, creating a 64 PAGES zine featuring 58 SONGS that is 14,8x21cm (A5 | 5,8 x 8,3 in). Our special cover by Doki Rosi has spot varnish finishing and our pages will be printed in matte coated paper.

This fanzine, such as all campaign merch, will be printed exclusively for Kickstarter backers and will not be reprinted. The money collected will be used to print the necessary amount of copies to supply this project demand and their respective packing. Within the asked amount of U$ 2,500 is also Tax Fees, Kickstarter Fees, and International Money Transfer Fees.
After the campaign period, some artists may sell the merch items they made in their respective stores, but not the full book.
All bundles presented in this project will be shipped to you from Brazil, which means it may take 15 to 60 days for it to reach you after the package has been posted.
Previous international shipping experience showed us there is no way to know if your package is going to arrive sooner or later. There is no faster or slower location. Two packages posted on the same day to the same city can arrive with a two weeks gap. This happens because some international packages may be randomly taken to a second verification before leaving Brazil, and how long it'll stay there depends on the demand the post offices have at the moment.
That being said, all packages will be sent with a tracking number and a timeframe. We strongly advise our backers to seek your local post office in case the package doesn't arrive until 30 days after the timeframe we provide you is over. We do not take responsibility for returned packages. We'll request the shipping fee to be repaid in case of reshipping.
More details about shipping will be provided to the backers during the Shipping Period.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We're confident in our planning for this project and that we'll be able to execute what you're pledging for!

Some delays such as manufacturing and shipping are out of our control, but we will do our best to communicate clearly, answer all questions and keep in touch. We are aware that the global health crisis may influence the timeline and took it into consideration while planning our Estimated Delivery. Any updates on the project status will be shared with the backers regularly.

This zine + all merch will be shipped to you from Brazil, which means it may take 15 to 60 days for it to reach you after the package has been posted. More details about shipping will be provided to the backers when we start packing.

We are counting with your support to bring this project to life and hope you can sing along with us!

Hey! EVERYTHING will be OKAY.
During these uncertain times, it can be especially tough to avoid falling into a pit of overwhelming gloom... Which is why we'd like to try and help you keep your mind busy! This zine is designed to provide distractions for bad days- Whether it's just for a minute, or a full rainy afternoon. The zine is full of original content, artwork, tips, fun and more to achieve that goal... Including:
 Puzzles: Word Searches, Spot The Difference, Cross Words and the like!
 Creative Outlets: Paper Crafts, Drawing Activities, Ad Libs and such!
 Journal Pages: Dreams, Aspirations, Memories and more!
The amount of rewards and the goal itself are relatively low, as the zine has already been completed- We just want to get it into people's hands (This also means you won't be waiting around long if we reach our printing goal). There are some fun stretch goals lined up (including increasing the page count), if we're lucky enough to go over-target!

campaign.story:
Legend has it that over 90% of the ocean remains unexplored.
For as long as humans have lived, we’ve shared stories of mysterious creatures who are half like us, and half like fish. Could the oceans really be home to mermaids and mermen? And how could you ever meet them?
You have to swim Beneath the Waves.
Plunge right in
Get lost in a sea of breathtaking art and prose.
Meet the fabled beings that inspire both love and fear. And submerge yourself in over a hundred interpretations of the enduring merfolk lore. 
Brave the tides
Beneath the Waves includes a broad range of digital and traditional media. Like the ocean - always changing and never predictable.
The book is divided into four chapters. They each represent a distinct art style or medium, and open with a fantastic story.  
Scales, Tails, and Tales. Explore the, at times whimsical, at times dangerous, world underwater.
Hold your breath
You’re in for a voyage of mythic proportions.
We are beyond excited to bring you a project of this scale. The book is perfect-bound with a HARDCOVER (upgraded for free due to stretch goal). It’s large, measuring 9 x 12 inches so you can fully immerse in its rich colors and vivid details. The book will be dressed up with silver gilded page edges (added by stretch gold).
Everything is showcased for maximum effect. So expect large, often full-page art and stories.
All 168 of its pages are thick and coated, ensuring the integrity of the works they contain. They are a joy to turn and an even greater joy to pore over.
Contributing Creatives
The lauded naval explorer, Jacques Cousteau said that “The sea, once it casts its spell, holds one in its net of wonder forever.”
And that’s how we found so many talented people, enchanted by the sea, to bring together in this book:

Do you want more than one book (or whatever else we end up offering as part of this campaign)? Don't worry, you will be able to add on as many items you want (as long as we don't offer a limited production item) during the Fulfillment Survey phase of the project. There is no need to try and calculate add-on costs, update your pledge amount, and any of the complicated things we sometimes have to do as part of the Kickstarter process. Just pick your Reward Tier, and the rest can be settled on the back-end.
...and if there is some type of Mer-inspired product that you would like to see as part of the campaign, jot it down in the comments and we will consider adding it as a stretch goal.
Where will the funds go?
ArtOrder is a creative-centric company. We bootstrap the development of every product, strive to keep our costs as low as possible and share the profits with the creatives that help make these books a reality. The funds raised through this campaign will be used to pay for:
production of the book
fulfillment of the rewards
profit-sharing with the creatives
marketing and promotion of the campaign and book
When can I expect my book?
We’ve swum a long way from the shore. The art and stories are complete and the layout of the book is in the final stretch. Once the Kickstarter campaign is complete, we will be ready to proceed to production.

ArtOrder is a testbed for a new Backer/Fulfillment management program. The beauty of this process is that everything on the back-end of the campaign happens on the ArtOrder website. You will be able to confirm your reward level, add-on additional purchases, and decide which shipping option you want (see more about shipping below). updates.update_content:
First look at the book, slipcover, postcards, and pin set.
So very excited to start shipping rewards out!

Greetings all!
We finally got the call this morning. The shipment has made its way to Denver and will be delivered to our facility later today. We'll take a few days to take in the order, do inventory, and inspect the items. If there are no issues, we should start shipping out early next week!!

Greetings gentle mer-lovers!
We've been waiting, not so very patiently, to receive all the printed goods for this project. Whenever we are dealing with the folks in Customs, they seldom give you any answers to inquiries about timelines, expected approval dates, etc. Finally, we got a glimmer of information. We received a notice that the ports are experiencing significant delays due to congestion, equipment shortages, and COVID-related staff decreases in the ports and customs. That made us grimace...but then at the very end of the message, Customs stated that they "believe" they should be able to release our project for pick-up by the 4th. If that is the case, then we should receive the shipment about 10 days after it's release.

Well, COVID has been reigning havoc on the manufacturing and shipping industries. That shouldn't come as any surprise...
The good news is - we received all of the Beneath the Waves pins today! We now have boxes of beautiful and shiny enamel pins. Additionally, we received notification that the rest of the items are in Customs right now and we are hoping we should receive them in the next week or two. Needless to say, that is just an estimate as you can't rush customs.

Hello, mer-backers
As you probably know, COVID is causing issues throughout the manufacturing and shipping industries. This is unfortunately true even in the publishing realm. We have been talking with our manufacturers and shipping brokers a lot the past few weeks. At this point, they are projecting that the product will hit the warehouses in the middle of November, rather than mid-October as originally forecasted.

Look what just landed on the porch of the ArtOrder office...
Pin samples!!
All pins are approx 2 wide, with butterfly clasps. You can get them as a set or individually. They are available for pre-order on the ArtOrder Store, while quantities last.

We don't have anything new to report at this time, but we just wanted to check-in. Everything is in production and proceeding as planned. All of the printing should be complete around the end of the month and we will start getting things set up for shipping to the fulfillment warehouses.
We will share more as it becomes available.
Thank you,

Greetings everyone!
It's time for us to set final production numbers for our manufacturers, so we just sent out a 48-hour notice for survey lock. Stretchgoal #1 unlocked!- 3 new prints unlocked, plus all physical tiers will get a foiled bookmark!
Stretchgoal #2 unlocked!- All physical tiers will get a notebook!
Stretchgoal #3 unlocked!- All physical tiers will get a hard enamel pin!
Stretchgoal #4 unlocked!- All cards will be upgraded to 330gsm black core stock
Stretchgoal #5 unlocked!- Bonus card designs included: Strength XI and justice VIII making the deck 24 cards!  
Occult Ornithology- A bird themed tarot deck
The aim of this Kickstarter is to fund a 22 card major arcana tarot deck, themed around birds as the tarot trump cards. The structure of the deck is based on the Rider-Waite  tarot deck from 1910, partially because I am most familiar with this deck and because the meanings and imagery in that deck seemed like a natural fit for an ornithological deck. The deck will come with gold edges as well as gold foiling on the front and back of the cards, I also want to beautifully finished guide book to accompany the deck. 
The Moon- Lyrebird, The Sun- Waldrapp, Judgement- Barn Owl
Why birds?  Folktales, feelings and archetypes have been associated with many species of birds across every culture since spoken word. The various associations we make with many species and mythologies surrounding them make them a perfect fit for the tarot. On top of this, the rich biodiversity of birds as well as our own unique feelings surrounding various species lend themselves well to both structured reading of the cards and allow for the personal interpretation of the reader allowing for a rich deck. 
Book cover idea
Many of my previous backers and people who follow me across various social media are aware of my affinity to birds and fascination with the species both from a spiritual and biological standpoint. Creating this tarot has given me the space to explore various species and allowed me to let my passion shine through in every card. In the accompanying book for the deck, you will not only have the meaning of the card for every tarot, but you will also have an explanation of why the bird was chosen and also a small piece about the depicted species. 
The Chariot- Canada Geese, Temperance- Lesser Flamingo, Strength- Kea
Why a tarot deck? The tarot have always fascinated me, I bought my first deck when I was 15 and made my own velvet bag for the cards. Going through the cards and studying the art and meaning in each one was always a great pleasure and comfort to me.  In later years, developing my styles and interests i've had many requests form people to design a deck, it wasn't until I sat and thought about the kind of deck that I personally felt was missing from my own collection that I realised that I would love to create a bird themed tarot deck!
Justice- Carrion Crow
What's in the Deck? The deck will consist of the 22 major arcana only, I made this decision because I wanted to create quite a simple deck with more streamlined meanings. I also felt that the iconography of the birds would be watered down in a traditional 78 card deck, I wanted the 22 birds to speak for themselves. The deck will have beautiful gold foiling on both the front and back of the cards, as gold edges and will be printed onto high quality 350gsm card stock. When designing this deck I decided that I wanted the finish to be a luxurious as possible, the deck is both designed as a working tarot and as a beautiful item to own. The box will be be book shaped with a magnetic lid to keep your deck secure and stored beautifully.
The cards
Birds represented in the deck:
 The Fool-White Stork
 The Magician- Satin Bowerbird
 The High Priestess- Great Crested Grebe
 The Emperor- King Vulture
 The Hierophant- Onagadori Rooster
 The Lovers- Rock Doves
 The Chariot- Canada Geese
 Justice- Carrion Crow
 The Hermit- Grey Heron
 The Wheel- Cuckoo and Wood Thrush
 Strength- Kea
 The Hanged Man- Ring-necked Pheasant
 House Sparrows- Death
 Temperance- Lesser Flamingo
 The Devil- Eurasian Magpie
 The Tower- Great Black-backed Gull
 The Star- Mistle Thrush 
 The Moon- Superb Lyrebird 
 The Sun- Waldrapp (Northern Bald Ibis)
 Judgement- Barn Owl
 The World- Wandering Albatross 


The deck is also accompanied by the 48 page guide, this 15x15cm book will be perfect bound with a foiled cover and full colour throughout. This book will serve both as a detailed guide to each of the cards, but also as a guide to birds. All of the cards will have a detailed explanation to what the card is, what it represents, why the bird has been chosen and information about that bird species. I want to bring together my natural love of both art and the natural world. 
PLAY


Rewards
There are several rewards available to those of you who would like to back the project! Note: all reward tiers receive the digital files of both the deck and the book 
£5- This is the tier for those of you who want to support the project but don't want physical rewards in return. For £5 you will get:
The PDF of all the tarot cards
The PDF of the guide book 
£15- You will get receive one A4 foiled print of 3 tarot designs available. The print will be on heavy stock paper with gold foiling on the details. This tier is ideal for those of you who appreciate the artwork but don't want and entire deck of cards. 
Judgement, The Empress and Justice available as prints
Stretch goal #1 unlocked more prints to choose from
£22- You will receive the full 22 card deck complete with decorative box! 
The Lovers- Rock Doves
£30- You will receive all 22 foiled Occult Ornithology cards along with the 48 page full colour foiled tarot guide book!
Mockup of the 48 page book
£40- As well as the full set of tarot cards and book, you get a choice of foiled a4 art print as well. 
£200- This reward is limited to 5 people. In this tier, as well as the set of  cards and the book, you will also get a custom designed animal themed tarot card by myself. If the project is funded give me details of the animal you would like and what card you would like to represent and I will create it in the same style as this deck! You will receive a digital file of the design to do what you wish with (non commercial use only) and you will also receive a foiled copy of the design with the rest of your rewards. 
PLAY

So, why £6000?
To date this is the most i've ever asked for in a Kickstarter, with previous projects i've started by asking for the baseline to what I would need to bring the basic product to backers! In this case, while it would be tempting to ask for £3000 and scrap the Foil fronts and backs, and do a small booklet to accompany the deck I feel that I want to bring out the deck exactly how I envisioned it with the detailing that I personally love in other decks and pieces of art that I own. Because of this,  the cost to print 500 copies of the deck will be £3200 alone, the book will be an additional £1020, . The additional £2000 will cover Kickstarter fees, taxes and postage and packaging. I feel that this number is exactly what I require to bring the best version of the deck that I can. 
As with all my Kickstarters, any extra funding will go back directly to my backers in the form of stretch goals. 
The Devil- Eurasian Magpie
The fun bit, Stretch goals:
£8,000- I will design another exclusive print for all backers-  UNLOCKED- backers preferred more choice in prints so now there are an extra 3 prints to choose from, all backers also receive a foil bookmark!
Foiled phoenix bookmark
£10,000- All physical backers will receive a foiled notebook - UNLOCKED!
£11,000- All physical backers will receive an exclusive 30mm Occult Ornithology pin! - UNLOCKED
Enamel Pin design and mockup backing card
£13,000- All cards will be upgraded to 330gsm black core stock- UNLOCKED!!
£17,000- alternative versions of Strength XI and Justice VIII included in the deck, bringing the deck up to 24 cards 
Strength- Emperor Penguin and Strength- Kea


The Artist
At MCM comic con Birmingham last year!
My name is Katie and i'm a Liverpool based illustrator. I regularly attend comic cons and sell my wares, I have met many of my previous backers at these events! My artwork is mostly nature informed horror art, but I also dabble in scientific and conservation art, as you can see from my picture, the 2 subjects very much go hand in hand! 
Memento Mori
I've been combining the occult and nature for a while now, my previous artwork was a collection of my horror artworks and the connection between my interests was clear throughout the book. The project also allowed me to dabble in foiling and other print techniques which I will be applying to Occult Ornithology!
Owllustrations, pidgeonary (previously on kickstarter!) Seagulls: a cliff note and Baneful Herbs zines!
I've always been interested in educating people about nature, but also trying to represent the beauty in it. As you can see from the zines i've worked in over the years there is a big emphasis on birds especially, chances are if you meet me in real life i'll probably roll out a ton of bird facts at you! Compiling that knowledge and applying it to the tarot has been so much fun for me, i've not only picked birds that I adore but i've also picked birds that I felt get little attention in media but still represent so much. 
Bird nerd!
Occult Ornithology is a dream project for me, I feel that the artwork and content of the cards is an accumulation of knowledge and skill from years of practice and exhibiting my work. I hope my personal connection to birds and love for creating shines through the project! I can't wait to share it with you all :)

Risks and challenges
MwA major risk at the moment is production during Covid. i have a factory lined up got make my cards as well as 2 others for back up. I have also given quite a long estimate for project delivery in case of manufacturing taking longer. 

As for social distancing, I have invested in a label maker at home so trips to my local post office are limited and I can fulfil orders from my own home without having to come face to face with anyone. 

If the deck isn't funded, then I will release the guide book by itself or a scaled back/lower quantity of packs of cards. 

The artwork for the deck is 100% ready to print, I am finishing the last touches to my tarot guide, all that is left to do is fund the project and send to manufacturers :) 

I have to date completed 6 successful kickstarted and successfully fulfilled my orders, I am confident in my ability to deliver quality rewards to my backers!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
☕Teas of Fodlan is a self published Fire Emblem Three Houses Zine project, painted by myself as the sole artist, in watercolor. All illustrations feature two portraits and a tea blend unique to each character matching their favorite teas from the game. The zine is readable right to left or flip it for a left to right secondary experience. This campaign is to help me bring it into physical existence! 
The base goal of $400 will be used to manufacture and ship the zine and all its additional rewards! Kickstarter won't charge you until the campaign is over, and you can change your pledge anytime during the campaign!
All of the prices through kickstarter are offered at a discount! The zine and rewards will be made available after the kickstarter, but the costs will be higher!
 ☕The zine features 32 characters across 40 pages, all of the students from the Blue Lions, Black Eagle, and Golden Deer houses, and some additional favorites from around the Monastery. 
 ☕Includes both .PDF and physical copies of the zine. You get your choice of any 3 unlocked charms, any 8 unlocked print designs, and all 6 sticker designs. All tiers include a free digital icon pack! This Tier includes a FREE Byleth Charm and a FREE Gatekeeper of my Heart Print on top of the other rewards. Rewards are scheduled to begin shipping in August of 2020. You will be able to choose the designs in the backer survey sent after the Kickstarter ends.
☕The .PDF will be emailed to you when the physical rewards start shipping out. The physical zine is scheduled to begin shipping in August of 2020 and also includes a .PDF version of the zine. All tiers include a free digital icon pack!
 ☕Includes both .PDF and physical copies of the zine. You get your choice of any 1 unlocked charm, any 2 unlocked print designs, and any 3 sticker designs. All tiers include a free digital icon pack! Rewards are scheduled to begin shipping in August of 2020. You will be able to choose the designs in the backer survey sent after the Kickstarter ends. 
 ☕Includes both .PDF and physical copies of the zine. You get your choice of any 3 unlocked charms, any 4 unlocked print designs, and any 3 sticker designs. All tiers include a free digital icon pack! Rewards are scheduled to begin shipping in August of 2020. You will be able to choose the designs in the backer survey sent after the Kickstarter ends. 
  ☕Includes both .PDF and physical copies of the zine. You get your choice of any 3 unlocked charms, any 8 unlocked print designs, and all 6 sticker designs. All tiers include a free digital icon pack! This Tier includes a FREE Byleth Charm. Rewards are scheduled to begin shipping in August of 2020. You will be able to choose the designs in the backer survey sent after the Kickstarter ends. 
  ☕Includes both .PDF and physical copies of the zine. You get your choice of any 3 unlocked charms, any 8 unlocked print designs, and all 6 sticker designs. All tiers include a free digital icon pack! Rewards are scheduled to begin shipping in August of 2020. You will be able to choose the designs in the backer survey sent after the Kickstarter ends. 
 ****Shipping costs are extra. Canada and US rewards are sent with tracking. International orders please add $8 to your pledge if you want your order to be shipped with a tracking number.
 ☕The charms are 2 inch acrylic charms. They're double sided, featuring pre and post time-skip designs, with a gold heart shaped clasp. Backers can choose between Claude, Edelgard, and Dimitri charms. More options will be available upon reaching stretch goals! You will be able to choose the designs in the backer survey sent after the Kickstarter ends. 
 ☕The prints are 5x7 inches printed on heavy cardstock. Backers can choose between Claude, Edelgard,Dimitri, F!byleth, M!Byleth, Hilda, Felix, and Ferdinand. More print options will be made available if we meet stretch goals!
☕ The stickers are two inches, printed on glossy vinyl. Backers can choose between Bernadetta, Sylvain, Ashe, Lysithea, Linhardt, and Seteth. You will be able to choose the designs in the backer survey sent after the Kickstarter ends. 

☕ADD ONS
Some have asked, so ye shall receive: to add additional items to your rewards if you want just an extra charm, print, etc. Adding Extras will not change the chipping costs.
☕If you would like to add Extra Stickers to your pledge, add an additional $2 CAD to your current pledge per extra sticker
☕If you would like to add Extra Charms to your pledge, add an additional $10 CAD to your current pledge per extra charm
☕if you would like to add an Extra Print to your pledge, add an additional $5 CAD to your current pledge per extra print
☕if you would like to add an Extra Zine to your pledge, please add an additional $20 CAD to your pledge

With any project, there is always a risk of manufacturing issues or delays. I will keep the campaign updated with any manufacturing changes. 

While this is my first kickstarter, I am no stranger to large scale projects or zines, or with shipping and filling orders. Most of the art is complete and compiled and timely completion will not be an issue.

Project Macaron
Project Macaron is created here in Hong Kong by Tim & his team. We want to change the way people preceive mask via Project Macaron, that mask can be beautiful and functional at the same time. We are seeking your help to push this project forward, and I hope you will enjoy our creation and our mask can be useful for your daily life!

campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
We carefully choose a durable and water repelling fabric, to ensure our mask can be reuse over 60 times or more.
In order to make the design united, we choose to use fabric ear loop instead of rubber loop, This actually significantly extend the durability as well as comfortability. It won't stretch your ears and you will feel quite comfortable even with a whole day wearing.
Reusability and recyclability
We plan to use bio - degardable plastic to fulfill the shipment.
Environmentally friendly factories
We choose Eco-friendly printing facility that use water base ink, so this mask is safe enough for baby to wear.
Sustainable Distribution
we will use bio-degradable plastic for fulfillment.

With the COVID-19 crisis arising all over the world. The importance of social distancing and protection has also risen. 
 A group of amazing artists has come together to design and produce reusable medical masks with pockets for interchangeable filters.  We need your help to produce 1000+ masks made from 100% cotton in a short period of time.  By pledging for a mask you help us fund the supplies ,production of the masks ,and the filters. The excess stock will be sent to hospitals in need and are suffering a shortage of supplies. The more pledges, the more masks we can produce.
 For Part 2 of this project our focus is on CHILD designs and sizes.  
BOTH ADULT AND CHILD SIZES ARE AVAILABLE FOR EACH DESIGN!
Excess masks will be donated to children's hospitals and essential workers.  
 This Campaign project only runs for 1 week!
There will be no preorders afterwards.  So if you are planning to add masks, remember to do so during the week.  If you add masks, don't forget to add shipping(see update).
 This is the construction of the mask itself and how it looks.  Note the key features that help protect and shield the wearer . 
 Adult Mask Dimensions:
Length:  22 cm 
Height:  15.5 cm
Child Mask Dimensions (Ages 3-9):
Length:  18 cm
Height:  12.5 cm
 The backside with the pocket for a filter 
PM 2.5 Filter (comes with 2)
What is a PM2.5 Filter?
This filter is used to filter out particles around 2.5 µm.  These are mainly for pollen and pollution.  We do not guarantee 100% protection with them.  The order comes with two of these filters and you can change it out for any filter you would like.  Many hospitals are providing the filters to their employees, but need the masks.
 BOTH ADULT AND CHILD SIZES ARE AVAILABLE FOR EACH DESIGN!

Wearing masks (no matter the type) puts strain on the ears and causes them to hurt. The artist community has exploded with creative ideas and solutions on how to resolve this with the materials we have available.  There are different styles and materials that can be used to make these, but we decided to stick look into acrylic cut ones.  We could try to manufacture these elsewhere, but the group has decided to try and support a local artist and independent business from the U.S. The amazing  @milky.rainbow.deco  has joined our team to help provide mask clips to add to our donations to children's hospitals.  By adding one to your pledge helps us fund the materials in bulk.  That means you would ultimately be helping us provide not only masks, but mask clips to donate.  CHECK OUT THE EXAMPLES BELOW!
 Each mask clip is $0.50.  To add one to you your pledge, return to the campaign page and click on the tier you pledged on.  There you can manually change the amount you pledged for.  Add 50 cents for every clip you would like to add on.  These are so light that they do not affect shipping costs.  Currently we only have red and mirror acrylic, but if there are enough orders we can expand the color options.
Starts: May 2nd at 10:00 am Eastern Time
Ends: May 9th at 10:00 am Eastern Time
We send out surveys
We receive the Kick starter funds and order masks (this will take  2 weeks).
Production time: 10+ days depending on the size of the order
Shipping to us: 10-12 days
We send you your masks and donate the rest
 Disclaimer:  If you are buying internationally, check that your country is allowing imports at this time.  Be aware that even if they are there will be delays and your package might sit in customs for a while. Please understand that if it goes missing, we won't have another to send you because the remainder will be donated.  Same thing goes for refunds after the campaign ends and items are shipped we will have already used all extra funds to buy more masks. We are carefully calculating the funds to order the most masks we can in order to have more to give away.  Thank you for understanding.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
These are not medical standard N95 masks, but in the current situation, they are still needed and usable. For non-medical workers these are appropriate and protect enough for what we need to do and when we leave the house. These masks will not prevent you from catching the virus. Due to the lack of medical supplies, hospitals are asking for donations from the community. This includes washable reusable cotton masks with pockets for filters. Many medical institutions cannot provide enough disposable masks, but they have access to hepa filters and fabric. These filters can be used in this mask design. Remember, by not buying up all the disposable mask stock, you are providing medical personnel on the front line more equipment and supplies. Thank you.

campaign.story:
6/12/2020 
Thank you for supporting us! If you missed the campaign, you can order the deck in our Etsy shop. 
Love and Light,
Shela and Sonia
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Cute Cat Tarot is a tarot deck created by two sisters, Shela and Sonia, who live across the world from each other. Fueled by their love of cats as well as passion to create something magical and special during mandated self-isolation due to the COVID-19 pandemic, they worked together to create a tarot card deck filled with adorable and whimsical cats.
This 78-card deck will include the classic 22 major arcana and 56 minor arcana. They will be printed on 70mm x 121mm/ 2.75" x 4.75" 350 GSM Standard Smooth paper. The illustration for the major arcana cards are completed and we are currently working on illustrations for the minor arcana cards. 
The project is currently fully-funded. However, there are still a lot of stretch goals that we haven’t reached. With only a few days left, we hope that you will back us or help us spread the word about the project so that we can unlock all our remaining stretch goals and create the best possible version of this deck! 
-$10,000 stretch goal- one print per pledge, this stretch goal is not included for the wholesale tier
Bonus card for the $4,000 stretch goal - The Alignment 
The Alignment
Preview of the Major Arcana
Preview of the Minor Arcana
Tuckbox design
$15,000 Stretch Goal design
$10+ Postcards 
You will receive a set of 5 postcards: The Lovers, The Empress, The Emperor, The Devil, and one with our logo. This is great for postcard collectors or to send to friends. You can also frame it and hang it on your wall as decor. 

$17+ The Sun, The Moon or The Star Print 
The Sun, The Moon, and The Star
You will receive one 8 x 10 print in a matte finish. You can pick between The Sun, The Moon, or The Star. 
$35+ Early Bird: The Cute Cat Tarot Deck 
 Get an Early Bird Copy! This is limited to the first 50 people to back our deck. We will also include a handwritten thank you note with your order!
$40+ One deck 
You will be rewarded a deck of Cute Cat Tarot at a slight discount. To be exact, you will receive a magical and special deck of cards that celebrate the cuteness of cats all over the world. Thank you for helping us make our designs come to life! 
$47+ Cute Cat Tarot deck & Postcards 
You will be rewarded a deck of Cute Cat Tarot plus a set of 5 postcards at a slight discount.
$55+ Cute Cat Tarot deck & Print 
You will receive a deck of Cute Cat Tarot plus one 8 x 10 print in a matte finish. You can pick between The Sun, The Moon, or The Star.
$75+ Two decks  
Is one deck of Cute Cat Tarot not enough? Then this tier is for you! You will receive two decks of Cute Cat Tarot at a slight discount each and an extra discount for bundle pricing. This is perfect if you also want to gift the deck to a friend or family member!
$100+ Put your cat(s) in the deck
Want your cat to be part of this deck? In this reward tier, your cat will be featured in a card in the deck and you will receive an 8 x 10 print of the card your cat is featured on. You will be able to pick which Minor Arcana card you want your cat to be on (First come first serve). You will also receive one Cute Cat Tarot deck.
$250+ I want everything!! (and a little more)
Are you a super cat lover? And a super backer? You will receive 4 decks of cards, a set of 5 postcards, on a handwritten thank you card, an 8 x 10 The Sun, The Moon or The Stars print, a custom 8 x 10 print (we will draw anything you want in our art style) and send you the digital file too in png and jpeg so you can use it as your profile picture on Instagram. And last but not least, free shipping!
$250 Wholesale Tier
This Tier is meant for independent shops to get their hands on our deck and share it with their community. This will include 10 decks of Cute Cat Tarot.
$300+ I want everything + put my cat in the deck!
You will receive everything in the I want everything!! (and a little more) tier and we will put your cat in the deck. And of course, you will get an 8x10 print with the illustration of your cat. This is limited to 10 backers!
Build your own reward tier! 
Build your own perfect reward tier with add-ons! What is an add-on? An add-on is an optional item that can be added to a Kickstarter pledge without changing pledge levels. All add-ons require a based pledge to be at the $35 tier and above. When the campaign is over, you can tell us which add-on you picked in a survey!
How to add the add-ons:
1. Click the “manage your pledge” button on the project’s page.
2. Increase your pledge by the amount needed to claim the add-on(s). 
3. Save your pledge. Do not change the tier that you originally pledged at. 
4. Send us a message with which add-on you want so we can keep track.
That's it! 
Delivery will be through USPS (United States Postal Service). Every parcel we send out will have a tracking number. This is currently the cheapest and the best option we can find. However, if we are able to find a better option, we will notify you and refund you the difference.
For US backers: 
We will be sending the packages through First-Class Package Service- Parcel 
For International backers: 
We will be sending the packages through First-Class Package International Service® 
Please check whether or not your country allows the import of tarot cards (some countries ban the shipment of tarot and playing cards) 
The backer is responsible for any customs fees or VAT taxes that might incur 
Please also check whether or not USPS is suspending shipping to your country due to COVID-19. You can check here.
@yep_its_sonia
Hi! I'm Sonia (@yep_its_sonia) and I am a freelance Graphic Interactive Designer living in Jakarta, Indonesia. I am very passionate about tarot cards (and cats!) and have been reading tarot cards for the past 5 years. Like many of you, my life has been affected greatly by COVID-19. Working on this project has really helped me cope with feelings of grief and the loneliness of self-isolation in the once-bustling city of Jakarta. Thank you so much for your support!
@shelativity
Hello, my name is Shela (@shelativity) and I am a Healthcare IT professional in Minneapolis, MN. I live here with my two cats, Vincent Van Gogh and Missy, whose amusing and strange antics inspired many of the cards in this deck. I graduated in Finance and Risk Management from the Carlson School of Management in 2016 and will be managing the business aspect of Cute Cat Tarot. This project has been a wonderful creative endeavor and I am very proud of the work we've done so far. Thank you for helping our vision come to fruition! 
Vince and Missy
Thank you again for your support! Making this project come true would mean the world to us. Please follow us at @thecatoracle for cute cat pictures, silly puns, and updates on the Kickstarter!

campaign.story:
In a land where a dark curse has consumed all color, an abandoned orphanage hides a terrible secret. After 9 years of living in the shadows, a brave warrior will rise: Europa. A battle hardened maiden who carries the fate of the world on her shoulders. 
Equipped with little else than her parent’s mementos, her task is daunting - venture inside the missing orphan’s memories to vanquish the curse that has been tormenting the people, and restore peace to the lands.



A giant mechanical castle was left by an ancient king to protect the country's orphan youth. From time to time, its halls are known to move almost as if they have a life of their own. Now only a shadow of its former glory, the orphanage Talos lies corrupted with darkness..

Lose yourself in a dark 2D side-scrolling adventure with an emphasis on emotional storytelling, exploration and combat.
  Slash your way through the immense mechanical Castle known as Talos and visit exotic places through the memories of its missing orphans.
  Lift the laments that darken the map by defeating hidden bosses.
   Transform into different elemental armors that will allow you to experience the game’s design in surprising ways.
Gain power-ups to access varied locations and expand your combat skills to survive.
  Find collectible secret treasures scattered throughout the castle.
  Modify the difficulty curve by choosing what challenge you will tackle first.
  Discover a wide array of references to classic games like Castlevania, Mega Man Zero, Super Metroid and Demon’s Crests.





We are pleased to announce that the soundtrack will feature the participation of legendary composers Michiru Yamane and Manami Matsumae, of Castlevania and Mega Man fame respectively.
But that’s not all, by request of Ms.Yamane herself, healing music will play a very important role in our game.
As big fans of video game music, we have decided to implement a mechanic dedicated to showcasing the nurturing and soothing power of music in the game. By finding music notes scattered around the castle you will be able to visit the Degollado Theater and give those notes to two mystical composers that are said to wander there. In exchange you will get to see the characters perform exclusive melodies tuned to 432Hz designed to soothe your soul (and expand your health and magic meters).
And as an update, we are also pleased to announce that Norihiko Hibino, Metal Gear Solid legend, is joining the A-list of composers in the soundtrack.
Here are some words from Mr. Hibino himself:
"It's great that I can collaborate with  Yamane-san! We're good friends and I know she's quite into healing  music. I'm so glad to find out she can incorporate healing into games.  The game will be something special along with wonderful visuals and  music."

What is home? What tastes and smells and experiences conjure up these wistful thoughts? The familiar relationship between family, memory, and food is universal, yet unique to each person; so we asked 16 artists to explore what "A Taste of Home" means to them!
From left to right: Sarah Davidson, Mariana Mora, Ansley Earle, and Jessica Jiang
A Taste of Home: A Cooking Anthology is an all-ages collection of comics, and the first anthology by a new grassroots publisher, Level Ground Comics! We started as a bunch of students looking to create opportunities to publish, edit, and create comics for people early in their career. Our goal is to level the playing field between beginner artists and professionals and help new creators break into the industry. The result of this collaborative effort is our first anthology, which brings you "A Taste of Home" in all sorts of settings, from fantasy, to slice-of-life, to myth, to autobio!
In addition to providing paid opportunities to up-and-coming artists, Level Ground Comics was founded to give young editors experience. Meet the team!
