I’m Nova (she/they; twitter @admiralquinn) and I’m working with my wife Mali (they/them; twitter @blkdistraction) on a collaborative project by LGBT women and nonbinary artists for LGBT women and nonbinary people (absolutely trans inclusive and POC inclusive!).
We are making a tarot deck - 78 cards featuring women and non-binary people on each card! Each card is unique and digitally illustrated by one of 44 artists from across the globe, and printed by AdMagic (the same company behind the production of Cards Against Humanity and Exploding Kittens). Our deck is loosely based on the most famous Rider-Waite tarot deck and re-imagined featuring LGBT people. This deck has it all: lady knights, lesbian lovers, and non-binary queens.
Our cards will have silver gilded edges and come in a sturdy tuck box with a clear window to feature the card back by hattersarts (or your favourite card). Each card will be 7x12 cm / 2.75x4.75 inches. 
Card examples and information
UPDATE 28 April 2020
With our project funded over 2/3 the way in less than a week, we've upgraded our tuck box to be fully printed and featuring ErenAngiolini (twitter) 's full Magician card. Check out the mock-up design below!
working card box design
OUR ARTISTS
We have 44 artists on board! Our resident artists are creating the major arcana cards and merch, and the guest artists are joining them to create the minor arcana cards.
Resident artists and their twitter handles
Guest Artists and their Twitter handles
Guest Artists and their Twitter handles
Our resident embroidery artist and her instagram handle
REWARD TIERS
Each deck will come with a digital booklet with all of the art, card descriptions, and artist information. The booklet will also be its own reward tier.
Our merch kit includes a vinyl sticker (sketch shown here) featuring a tarot themed embroidery from concentriccookies (insta), your choice of an acrylic charm of the four suits, and three random postcards from the major arcana illustrations.
One of our stretch goals is to unlock the full design of the sticker from concentriccookies (insta)! There's more information below.
Merch kit and information
Pledge levels and rewards
One additional tier features limited edition hand signed prints of some of our major arcana cards - they will be 8.5 x 11 inches on a heavy cardstock with silver foil finished details. Each one will be hand signed by the artist! We'll be announcing which five pieces will be available and once the project is funded, you'll be able to indicate which you would like. 
Blackdistraction's Moon card with foil finished details
Our highest tier comes with the original embroidery piece from concentriccookies! This one of a kind tier comes with free shipping.
STRETCH GOALS
At $26,000, we'll unlock silver metallic ink printing on the front and backs of the cards! The card frames on the front and details on the card back will be in silver metallic ink.
Metallic ink printing on card front and back
At $28,000, we'll unlock a hard enamel pin designed by Mayticks featuring the three goddess spread of cards - the High Priestess, the Empress, and the Moon, representing the Mother, Maiden, and Crone. Each pin will be 2 in / 5 cm, and have hard enamel, base metal, and engraved details (including our project name on the back!). The spread represents hopes and dreams, where we are now, and potential outcomes.
This pin will be included in every merch kit if unlocked!
Maytick's enamel pin design
At $30,000, we'll unlock funding to have each deck of cards come in a fully printed tuck box featuring art from our cards. UPDATE 28 April 2020, we decided to include a fully printed box with every order, no stretch goal necessary! The details can be found above!
At 550 Twitter followers @ladytarotcards, we'll unlock the full sticker design of concentriccookies' embroidery design! UNLOCKED! Check out the design below!
C's full design and colour palette!
FUNDING
After invoices are paid, shipping costs sorted, taxes and fees saved, the remaining money will be split evenly between the artists based on how many cards they illustrated for us.
SHIPPING
We will ship anywhere in the world.
We are not responsible for loss or damages due to the postal companies. Orders will be sent from Michigan, USA, and may take a while to get to you if you live internationally (I've had things take a week or a month depending on where it's going).
Orders will be sent in bubble mailers, and the art prints will include cardboard inserts to protect against getting bent during shipping.
TIMELINE
Ideally we get funded by the end of May. Throughout the campaign and after, we'll share WIPs and finished cards!
Artists will have their art finished by the end of July, printing in August/September, and orders shipped in October. Depending on how many orders we get, this timeline may need to be extended.
We will of course keep everyone updated throughout the process!

campaign.story:
Saint Louis, Missouri, 1920. Prohibition, the Constitutional ban on the sale of alcohol in the United States, comes into effect.... And business couldn't be better at the Little Daisy Cafe.
But things aren't what they seem. Atlas May, proprietor, uses the charming little restaurant as a front for his real cash cow; the Lackadaisy speakeasy, where flashing the club symbol from a deck of cards grants everykitty in-the-know access to more moonshine than they could ever drink. Life is good... Until Atlas is murdered in cold blood.
Now, it's 1927. Mitzi, Atlas' widow, struggles to keep Lackadaisy afloat, as the patrons drift away and a skeleton crew of staff sticks by her side. Scrappy young musician/rum-runner Rocky Rickaby, his wide-eyed but tightly-wound cousin Freckle McMurray, and the endlessly resourceful and sharp-tongued Ivy Pepper, heiress to the quickly-dwindling Lackadaisy fortune, are forced to make do in a world of increasingly unfriendly competition, intent on shooting, smuggling, and conspiring their way back to a successful bar, against all odds. 
Lackadaisy Cats has been running online since 2006, immersing its readership in a world of sepia-toned crime, adventure, action, and comedy. And now, it's ready for its next big move... to a screen near you.
Why a cartoon? Why now?
There's never been more interest in adult animation, with shows like Bojack Horseman, Big Mouth, and Primal capturing the attention and imaginations of millions of viewers. 
Lackadaisy is an exceptional webcomic, but in her mind, Tracy has always pictured it as an animated film. It’s a side effect, perhaps, of a childhood nourished on Looney Tunes, Disney, and Don Bluth features; a dream of sharing that living, breathing, musical version of Lackadaisy with its dedicated readership. But the when-and-how something like that could ever be achieved has always lacked an obvious ingress.
As the 20s dawn upon us again, with new animation tools and techniques available, with talented and excited artists on deck an raring to get to work, and with the internet eager for more independently-created media, the auspiciousness seems writ-large - splashed across an art deco picture palace marquee, if you will. 
Now’s the time.
The Lackadaisy animated short proposes a 10-minute, fun-and-action-filled adventure, full of car chases, shootout, sass, and  un-requested violin solos. And with your help, we can make it happen!
The finished short will be available for everyone to watch!
Meet the people in charge of (and contributing to) the project! 
A former game dev, illustrator and graphic designer, Tracy Butler began Lackadaisy after researching the history of her century-old Saint Louis home, and being inspired by her love of jazz music and 1920s aesthetics. Boasting over 1,600 backers on Patreon, Lackadaisy has been her full-time job for years, garnering a dedicated readership of thousands. As the creator of the comic, Tracy will play a role as co-director on the animated short, as well as overseeing art direction.
Fable Siegel is a veteran animation professional, boasting a resume that includes Titmouse, Starburns, the internet phenomenon Hazbin Hotel, and two Game Grumps Animated shorts, along with storyboard work for Cartoon Network (Ben 10), Stoopid Monkey (Adam Ruins Everything: Reanimated History), Warner Brothers (Wacky Races), Shadow Machine (F is for Family), and more, as well as being a board artist, animator, and designer for Six Point Harness (Like Share Die).  Brought onto the Lackadaisy animated short as a production manager, director, and producer, they'll be overseeing the project utilizing their years of professional experience and skill.
 Our awesome line-up of talent, in no particular order:

and SungWon Cho (@ProZD) as Mordecai Heller!

Wondering what awards await you if you decide to back the project? Look no further!
Lackadaisy Essentials is the primary means by which we intend to fund the animated short, and Iron Circus Comics' part in this incredibly ambitious project! Planned as a hardcover volume of about 100 pages, Lackadaisy Essentials contains never-before-published minicomics, one-offs, sketches, and other creative work by Tracy, delving into the world and details of the Lackadaisy webcomic.
 Lackadaisy Volumes 1 & 2 ebooks are the collected Lackadaisy webcomic! Grab the tiers including this reward to read the comic offline at your leisure, at a beautiful, high resolution!
Want to see the finished product in its snazziest, most high-quality form? Back a tier that grants access to an HD download of the finished animated short! The Lackadaisy short will be a fully-polished final product, professionally animated, voice-acted, and scored by musical and animation professionals!
 There's so much that goes into making a cartoon. Storyboards, animatics, a soundtrack, 3D models! Back at the Goodie Bag level and higher to grab all these cool bits 'n' pieces. The perfect backer level for folks who wanna see how the sausage is made. Higher levels even grant special thanks in the credits!
 ALL IN! Really wanna become an indispensable part of the project? Maybe even make animation history? The very highest tiers of support grant in-story cameos, personalized Lackadaisy-sona designs, original art from Tracy and the crew, and MORE. 
 There's something available at practically every level of support!
 $85,000 is the minimum we would need to make sure this one-of-a-kind project comes to fruition. But in case we overfund, we already have some awesome plans to make this Kickstarter even better.

And our final two stretch goals...

Whatever you may decide, thanks for getting this far down the page, and reading all about this new venture! We hope to see you on the other side in 2021, with the very first Iron Circus Animation!

Sea of Stars is a turn-based RPG inspired by the classics. A prequel story set in The Messenger’s universe, it tells the story of two Children of the Solstice who will combine the powers of the sun and moon to perform Eclipse Magic, the only force capable of fending off the monstrous creations of the evil alchemist known as The Fleshmancer. 
Promising the Sabotage touch in every system, Sea of Stars aims to modernize the classic RPG in terms of turn-based combat, storytelling, exploration and interactions with the environment, while still offering a hearty slice of nostalgia and good old, simple fun.
Coming to PC and Consoles in 2022.
 Key ingredients :
 Engaging turn-based combat. Combat gameplay includes active player input during attack animations (timed hits), multi-character combo attacks, boosting, and strategic defense options to hinder enemies while they are channeling powerful attacks or spells. For a more immersive experience, there are no random encounters or transitions to separate battlefields, and no grinding. Both navigation and combat happen in the same environment.
 Unshackled traversal. Swim, climb, vault, jump off or hoist up ledges as you run through the world with a navigation system based on platformer expertise that breaks free from the classic bound-to-the-grid tile-based movement.
 Prequel story set in The Messenger’s universe. Dozens of original characters and story arcs will take you on a captivating journey. Sometimes epic, sometimes silly, and other times emotional, Sea of Stars does its RPG duty of exploring classic themes of adventure and friendship, while also being chock-full of the unexpected twists and events you’ve come to expect from a Sabotage production.
 Full-on dynamic lighting our custom-made render pipeline allows the creation of a breathtaking world coming to life by pushing the limits of 2D pixel-art games.
 The Sabotage treatment on the turn-based RPG genre. Every system has been deeply analyzed to create an experience that pays respect to retro classics, while reworking some elements in order to offer a modernized experience free of irritants and overly lengthy sequences.

   A prequel to The Messenger 
The story takes place long before the flood, where many islands are waiting for you to explore. As a full-fledged RPG, the adventure promises intrigue, perils and wonders . Those familiar with our previous work may recognize a few faces and get meaningful insight on some origin stories, as well as hints towards the bigger picture of the universe we aim to develop more with each of our games.   
The Messenger - Sunken Shrine
That being said, newcomers should rest assured that Sea of Stars is absolutely enjoyable as a self-contained experience and doesn’t depend on having played The Messenger. In fact, it will even work the other way around should you choose to play our platformer second!
Turn-based combat
No random encounters, no separate battlefield: Considering immersion a top priority, combat is initiated by physical contact with an enemy, and battle takes place in the same field as navigation, seamlessly, with no loading or transition.
No grinding: Character progression in Sea of Stars flows naturally along with the story, without the need for any grinding. This concept is supported by a combat system which relies mainly on strategy and skill rather than statistics. That being said, you will very much be leveling up, increasing your stats and unlocking new special moves.
Synergies: During battle, everything is based on building up momentum and effects over a few rounds, to eventually unleash massive damage by cashing out on your build up. Featuring six very distinct playable characters, and a lot of synergies between each of them, there are a lot of ways to take down opponents.
Timed hits: Celebrating the greats of our childhood, we top it off with a ‘timed hits’ mechanic, where precise player input will increase damage done by your characters, or mitigate incoming attacks. Losing a battle doesn’t mean you should go back and grind, but rather that it’s time to apply what you learned from the enemy’s attack patterns and improve your execution the next time around. With skill and strategy as your main weapons, there is always ample room for improvement when a particular encounter proves challenging.
Spell-breaking: Making a point to break the potential linearity of turn-based combat, enemies can mount especially strong attacks or spells. While a good use of timed hits will always remove a good chunk of the damage dealt, even the smallest minion can be lethal if left unchecked while casting. 
Enemies in a casting state display a bar with what we simply refer to as “locks”, each with an icon representing the damage type required to break it. For every broken lock, the ensuing spell’s efficiency is reduced. Break all of them, and the enemy’s action is entirely cancelled. This spell-breaking gameplay mechanic truly comes to life when groups of enemies demand clutch reactions and choices as more than one is preparing a spell, coupled with playable characters capable of combo attacks and multi-hit special moves.
Boss fights: No RPG would be complete without big bosses, and of course Sea of Stars is no exception. For bosses, we are also looking at breaking the potential linearity of rinse and repeat for x amount of rounds to win. Each boss will present different attack patterns to learn, evolving through manually scripted phases and special events.

Banking on the synergies, timed hits and spell-breaking mechanics, bosses will offer ample room for longer-haul strategies, giving players the freedom to see how much damage they can really deal in a single round with enough preparation time.
Boost: To shake things up even more, performing a regular attack generates “Eclipse Orbs”, which can later be absorbed to double the effect of any action (regular attack, special attack, healing, spells, etc...) 
Depending on the situation, it may be wiser to save your orbs for later, perhaps to quickly get rid of an enemy that begins casting a spell with too many locks, or, in the case of longer battles like bosses, to dish out as much damage as possible once everything has been put in place for damage to be increased during a short window. 
Unshackled traversal - no rigid tile-per-tile movement
Putting our platformer experience to good use, we make a point for moment-to-moment gameplay to present satisfying controls, micro challenges, and varied traversal opportunities. In other words, venturing through the rich environment should be accompanied by a feeling of freedom. While multiple paths and approaches can lead to your objective, leaving the main road and exploring less accessible (or hidden) areas will be rewarded. 
Climb, jump, run, swim, vault and dive as you progress through villages and dungeons of all kinds. Anytime it feels like you can interact with something, the odds are that you can. Hoist up on rooftops, or jump off ledges into deep natural pools to explore underwater tunnels. Stick to the main objective, or follow your curiosity and see for yourself what wonders lay hidden.
World Map
Traveling between points of interest takes place in a classic World Map view where adventurers can roam around, free of enemy encounters. Those who like to go off the beaten path will find many optional areas concealing upgrades, vanity items, and side quests. 
Sailing
Since traveling between islands is a key part of the adventure, the party naturally gets its own boat. With full analog control, you will be invited to negotiate waves, and take advantage of the upwards and downwards formations to optimize for speed. While it isn’t anything that will ever block the casual sailor wanting to get to the next objective, we expect a lot of adventurers will be spending extra time sailing the world to play around with waves, look for sunken side-areas, secondary islands, or simply take a break from the hardships of heroism. 
The boat also acts as a mobile base of operations, which can be explored in close-up character view, where the party is fully settled in, and available for banter and guidance in-between major story beats. 
If you ever find yourself struck by the infamous “haven’t played in two weeks” RPG curse, you can rest assured that someone on your boat is ready to offer clear reminders as to what you should be doing next. 
Full-on dynamic lighting and shadows
To truly convey the story of warriors using the power of the moon and the sun, we had to go hard on the lighting system. Spectacular spell effects thus being a given, the game also features real-time dynamic day and night cycles, which the player eventually gets to control with full granularity.
Focusing sunlight through a prism in order to open some secret area may only be possible at high noon, while a magic flower blooms exclusively in the evening. You may want to follow a trail of glow-in-the-dark aquatic plants only visible at night, while some monsters like to sleep during the day.
All of this ties into properly telling the story of Solstice Warriors , while also allowing for multiple puzzles and mechanisms dealing with light, shadows and reflections. Oh, and to make sure this world truly comes alive, we are also throwing in weather variations! Please back us.

Six unique playable combat characters
Sea of Stars features six unique playable combat characters, each with their own backstory, personal objectives, play-style, special skills, and synergies with the rest of the party. In this multi-layered story, motivations sometimes align in unexpected ways. In the interest of allowing you to go into the game without any major spoilers, we will only be revealing the two main protagonists here. 
Born on the Summer Solstice, Zale is optimistic and bold. He wields a sunblade, through which he can absorb Eclipse Orbs whenever his attacks need an extra kick.
As a blade-dancer, he walks the path of the Guardian God Solen. The Elder Mist foretold that, in order to find his light and achieve his full potential, he will first need to “stare at the night inside of him”.

Born on the Winter Solstice, Valere shows curiosity and balance. Gifted with Lunar Magic, she can absorb Eclipse Orbs in her moonstaff to dish out massive damage.
Trained in the martial ways of the monk, she walks the path of the Guardian Goddess Luana. The Elder Mist sees great potential in her, believing she might one day be the one to “create paths on water”.
 Garl was born a regular kid devoid of any special powers. Along with his training as a cook, his innately strong constitution makes him a capable defensive fighter, giving him the tools to support his two best friends in their Solstice Warrior duties.
The Elder Mist saw something peculiar in the stars about him, as it seemed his heart just may be warm enough to “soothe a long tormented soul”.
Even though we will be keeping our favorite ideas under wraps for the foreseeable future, we’re happy to show you above a few of the things we've been working on for the protoype!
For the sake of your enjoyment once the game releases, we want to be very careful with spoilers. However when it comes to mentors, villains, villagers, critters, pirates and abominations... as a full-fledged RPG, you can rest assured that Sea of Stars will have it all.

Sabotage’s award-winning composer Eric W. Brown, AKA Rainbowdragoneyes, is back to rock your socks off yet again. He was so delighted to apply his musical genius to a full-fledged RPG production that he even built his own studio at home!
In Sea of Stars, the music and SFX include instruments from all over the world, blending the catchiness of retro music Eric is known for with modern sound design’s best practices. Taking full advantage of the Wwise engine, all things audio are dynamically layered and adjusted to transition seamlessly through day and night cycles, indoor and outdoor areas, weather variations, and, of course, battle. 
Sea of Stars is built in Unity, the engine which our technical team has been working with for over 8 years. It is our best companion for fast iteration, as well as the development of the specific tools we need to bring this new world to life.
Even though the game might seem simple at first glance, a closer look reveals visual effects seldom seen in 2D pixel-art games. Notably full-on dynamic lighting, which was mandatory given the narrative emphasis on the Sun and Moon.
Scalding desert suns, unsettling blood moons, lush underwater bioluminescent reefs, foggy swamps and dark caverns. We have the tools necessary to ensure each environment is brought to life with the utmost attention to detail to take you on a gripping adventure full of wonders.
For those interested in the technical aspect, here are a few of the components we are working with to tailor our own rendering pipeline based on URP (Caution : buzzwords ahead!) :
Post processing effects such as Bloom, Color Correction and Ambient Occlusion
Pixel perfect rendering
Fully dynamic lighting of sprites including normal mapping, pixel depth writing and shadow receiving
Shadow casting sprites from multiple angles and punctual/directional light sources
Volumetric lighting
Screen-space indirect lighting
Animated Height fog
Water shading including transparency, refraction, reflection, absorption, subsurface scattering and contact effect
Water simulation for rivers and oceans
  Languages
The Messenger is known for its quality localization that keeps the story intact, and we won’t settle for less when it comes to Sea of Stars. Everything will be localized by finely selected external partners who have a track record of excellence. Extra care and resources will always be directed towards ensuring that every language our games release in lets their player base enjoy the stories and events at the same level of quality as everyone else.
At this time we expect to release with full support for the following:
Platforms
The game should be completed sometime in 2022, and is designed to be played on PC and console. For specifics, rest assured that we are in touch with the key players of our industry, and that the game will be wherever the players are.
It is hard to predict platforms as we seem to be at the dawn of a new era, but we are keeping close watch, have extensive porting experience, and fully intend on supporting all current generation platforms with Sea of Stars.
Not only is the entire team that brought you The Messenger working on Sea of Stars full time, we also doubled its size!
We’re a studio that bets on focus, meaning once we enter production all hands are on deck working full time on a single project. Our team now counts 16 cherry-picked members, all cut from the same cloth and working from our studio located in downtown Québec City, Canada.
Operating with minimal management and completely open work schedules, our team is composed of self-driven artisans who seek to be unleashed rather than controlled.
Even though the vision for the game is clearly defined, everyone is given the tools and encouraged to express themselves in bringing everything they want both to the company’s culture and to our games. 

Campaign Stretch Goals
Neither incomplete nor bloated - A stretch goals philosophy.
Whatever happens with the stretch goals, the game will get made in its full vision. We won’t tack on features that would bloat the game to add more incentives, or remove systems that would make the game incomplete if we didn’t reach objectives. 
The Crypt : an in-game memorial site for backers
Found on a seemingly uncharted island, The Crypt is an underground area built to pay homage to our fantasy world’s founders, or to be more precise, top-tier backers. Keeping things as spoilers-free as possible, it is still worth mentioning that the place is not disconnected from the world’s lore, and will plays some role in the overarching story.
Supporters of the campaign who commit to a pledge in relevant tiers will be immortalized in the game as a unique interactive object within the crypt. 
There are 3 tiers:
Commemorative stone (Level 1)
A stone in the first room of the crypt, displaying the name of your choice when interacted with. Get it for yourself, or for someone dear to you!
Statue (Level 2)
In the second room, which is a bit more luxurious, you can have your own statue displaying the name of your choice, along with a short body of text. A great place to leave a positive message for other adventurers, or to immortalize your positive intentions for someone special.
Claiming your statue will be a simple process of selecting how you want it to look by customizing its parts, sort of like in a character creation menu. Body type, hair, height, weapon of choice, clothing, etc.
Monuments (Level 3)
The final room, which the crypt was built around, looks especially beautiful at night, as a sunroof lets the moonlight shine on an array of mirrors, filling the air with magic and peace.
For monuments, our artists will get in touch with you to create a fully customized character of your choice. Whether you want to be there as yourself, see the hero you envision taking form, invent a fantasy creature, or show the world a special pet. 
Also interactive, monuments will display the name of your choice, along with a lengthier body of text.
Whether you choose to leave a message for the world, pay homage to a loved one, or  write a backstory for your fantasy character, our team will work with you to ensure your immortalized presence in our world is meaningful to you.
The Cryptwalker
In debating whether or not to add an NPC to The Crypt, we opted to leave it up to the community! It is said that this mysterious character who roams the halls may actually come from a different time, and certainly a different place. Could this mysterious presence be … you?
Should someone choose to take it upon themselves to ensure The Cryptwalker is added to the game, they will play a key role in defining the character’s personality. This fully animated character’s appearance will be directed by said backer, and will be quite the conversationalist, telling stories and touching on philosophy, to make sure adventurers who enter The Crypt take some time for introspection.
Rest assured that while your input will be considered to the extent you want it to, we’ve absolutely got your back should you not have many dialog subjects to contribute. We are the studio that brought you The Shopkeeper, after all, and there is certainly more where that came from.
The vinyl
Sabotage is excited to partner with iam8bit, who were integral to the vinyl renaissance since their first release in 2010. Since then, they've minted nearly 100 videogame soundtracks on wax, and always do so with a premium ilk, from mastering to design to packaging. We previously collaborated on The Messenger vinyl soundtrack and were super happy with the results.

Why Kickstarter
Let us be direct : it would be risky to base the funding of an ambitious project like this on Kickstarter alone. As always, we want to remain fully transparent with anyone who wants to support us : 16 people over 3 years is intense budget-wise for a small studio. Taking the bulk of risks ourselves by reinvesting the gains from The Messenger, all we ask for is to hear a big "YES" from our fans and other potential players, enough to feel confident Sea of Stars is a game enough people want to see releasing.
Of course, it is now common knowledge that the value of a Kickstarter goes way beyond the amount of money raised during the campaign; it also makes for the best early feedback loop a game studio can hope for. Again, we are committed to this project. All we ask for is confirmation that Sea of Stars is something you want to play.
On a final note we absolutely want to thank everyone who has been supporting us since the beginning, especially our wholesome Discord community.
Within The Messenger was the hope for some connection, that some would “get it”, and choose to share their own experiences so that the values portrayed in our fantasy might, to some extent, live, if only within the hearts of those it touched.
Inspired by the overwhelming response, we chose to trust in our fanbase completely, and were thus compelled to create a crowdfunding campaign to reveal our next project as early as possible. Being so engaged with our community both in chat and through the Alternate Reality Game we run on the server, it would have been truly annoying not being able to discuss what we were so excited about on a daily basis. 
Now that everyone’s in the know about Sea of Stars, the fun can begin, unhindered once again!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are aware that Kickstarter projects often come with a certain level of risk for the backer, but we want to reassure you that this game will be completed no matter what happens during this campaign.

Our team has extensive experience shipping games of all scopes, and we are surrounded by veterans from other studios who we can always rely on for sanity checks and feedback. 

It is our promise to every backer, that to the best of our knowledge and experience, the Sabotage team will always make sure the finances are aligned with the vision, that this vision is clear, shared by the team, technically feasible, and validated by players. Challenging each other is embedded in our culture, and no stones will be left unturned.

It's a wrap for the demo, and what a month it has been! Despite a few distribution hiccups at first, thousands of backers played and replayed it inside and out, and we couldn't feel more blessed with the response.
We received more feedback than we could have hoped for, and had discussions with players from all over the world who offered their perspectives and hopes. The one thing that seems to come through unanimously is that the core of the vision works. There is no way to overstate how happy this makes us as we make the transition from pre-production to production.

campaign.story:
Hello friends! As so many of us worry about the future and yearn to return to the glorious spring unfolding outside our quarantined windows, we're excited to bring you our newest, most enchanted project...

Created by illustrator Kevin Jay Stanton, this 78-card deck features traditional paintings rooted in classical tarot interpretations that delve into the lore and mythology of the plant kingdom.
For over five hundred years, humans have used Tarot cards as a tool for divination and meditation. Their archetypal symbols have mystical, philosophical and psychological implications that allow us to understand our past, our future, and ourselves. But even older than that is the symbolism we've always assigned to the plants that grow around us. Hermetic, alchemical and scientific traditions explore flowers as tools for making meaning, medicine and magic. 
BOTANICA marries the tradition of Tarot to a lexicon far more ancient: the natural vocabulary of life on Earth. 

BOTANICA takes all of the major and minor arcana of traditional Tarot and reinvents them in the language of flowers. The Queen of Swords is Red Oleander. The Hermit is a Chinese Lantern. The High Priestess is the Elderflower. The Devil is Nightshade.

The deck features  the complete set of 78 Tarot cards, illustrated with acrylic and ink paintings. The Major Arcana are defined by single plants and flowers, and the Minor Arcana are plants combined with the objects from their suit, with regalia on the court cards.
The cards are 3.25" x 4.15", printed on premium heavyweight card stock and emblazoned on the back with gold foil. Each deck will come with a booklet naming the plants and objects on each card, and explaining the symbolic meanings of each card. 
The set comes in three editions: THE HERBALIST, THE ALCHEMIST, and THE ENCHANTER. The details of each set are listed further down.
Divination is the process of finding meaning in symbols or patterns, and similarly the act of reading tarot is finding patterns, meaning and visions in the symbols. A larger picture is created when a story is formed from how one card interacts with the next, as a bouquet is created from the harmony between many flowers.
BOTANICA can be read in many ways, depending on what you’d like to get out of it. To start, you’ll want to familiarize yourself with the deck. Light a candle, play some evocative music, and think about how you respond to the cards you’ve drawn. Without looking at the meanings, what’s the first card that really resonates with you? What plant strikes a chord in you on first sight? 
 After you know the deck a bit better, it’s ready for use. Plants have always been a foundational part of how we treat our bodies, and Tarot can be a tool to help sort our thoughts. Consider drawing a card in the morning to guide you throughout the day. Ponder a question and draw three cards to meditate on the foundation of a problem, what it looks like currently, and how to handle it in the future. Or lay out a full ten-card spread and really get to the root of it all. 
Here is a small sampling of the cards included in the deck, with notes from their creator.


THE LOVERS represents emotional decisions and the union between independent and equal partners. I chose peonies because they have flamboyant blooms that are "perfect flowers" -- a botanical term for flowers with both reproductive parts --  and for the generosity they exhibit in their symbiotic relationship with ants. I think it’s important for modern decks to capture the essence of The Lovers, and for me it’s about people being their whole selves and sharing that with others, the way peonies share their dew with ants and are protected from predators in turn.
 Like the floating seeds of a dandelion, THE FOOL sets out on their journey full of hope and with the promise of new growth. It’s a common plant, almost ubiquitous, and carries with it a naive quality I find appealing - I love the idea of making a wish by blowing on its seeds.
Tarot is sometimes described as the journey of the Fool through the deck. That’s why I picked a weed that could weather all of that and still come out on the other side with a feeling of charm and whimsy to be the major symbol of Botanica.
THE SEVEN OF WANDS is represented by Datura, or Thorn Apple -- a highly poisonous species of flowering shrubs pollinated by bats. I picked it for this card because the Seven of Wands is about being ready for a battle and having the endurance to see it through, and the fruit of datura reputedly have the ability to heal wounds as much as they can cause harm.
I picked Japanese vajra (a Buddhist ritual object) for the wands because they’re a symbol of enlightenment that embodies the balance between the five poisons to one’s purity and the five wisdoms that help one attain it.

THE FOUR OF COINS is a card is about being trapped by comfort. Honeysuckle bears flowers with a sweet aroma that wafts through the summer air, attracting all manner of creatures. It can be an extremely invasive species, and in those cases its vines can take over native plants and literally choke them. The Four of Coins is a warning to avoid excess, to take time to smell the flowers.
The coin symbol I picked for this card is wampum, a beaded Native American currency, as the Common Honeysuckle is a species native to the eastern coast of North America. The shells of this protocurrency were harvested off the coast and prized as much for their value as decoration. Their beautiful swirls of purple and white were often woven into belts by tribes like the Iroquois.
 Here are the  three editions in which we're publishing BOTANICA.

The standard BOTANICA deck will include all 78 cards, and a booklet explaining the symbolic meaning of each card and each plant. Each deck comes in a sturdy tuckbox, blocked with gold foil.  Everything you need to read fortunes in the flowers.
 ***SOLD OUT***
THE ALCHEMIST is a collectible version of BOTANICA, limited to an edition of two hundred fifty. This edition is housed in an elaborately embossed tin with antique brass finishing, wrapped in the embroidered silk altar cloth. Each copy is signed and hand-numbered by the artist Kevin Jay Stanton. You will be thanked by name in the informational booklet that accompanies the deck.
THE ALTAR CLOTH
The ALCHEMIST, DARK ALCHEMIST and ENCHANTER editions include a 24x24" silk altar cloth to be used for readings (or as a stylish neckerchief). In addition to being a beautiful way to encase your deck, each cloth is embroidered with symbols of the Arcana and imbued with the wishfulness and tenacity of dandelions.
THE COMPENDIUM
The ALCHEMIST, DARK ALCHEMIST, ENCHANTER and HERBALIST AND COMPENDIUM tiers will come with a a compendium detailing the research, process art and theory that went into the creation of BOTANICA. THE COMPENDIUM is 96 pgs, roughly 4.5 x6.25", blocked with gold foil on the cover. If you wish to add the book (or an extra book) on to any existing order, just add $20 to any US order or $30 to any international order.  (NOTE: a digital PDF edition of the book will be included with all versions of the deck, as well as the A GLIMPSE and A READING tiers.)
THE DANDELION PIN
A 1" hard enamel dandelion pin, to be included with all ALCHEMIST, DARK ALCHEMIST and ENCHANTER editions, as it's own rewards tier and add-on. If you'd like to add on a pin to an existing order, just add $18 to any US order, $25 to any Canadian order, or $30 to any other international order. You'll be able to select the pin as a bonus through BackerKit later, when answering your shipping survey.

If you'd like to add on a pin to an existing order, just add $18 to any US order, $25 to any Canadian order, or $30 to any other international order. You'll be able to select the pin as a bonus through BackerKit later, when answering your shipping survey.

The terrarium, designed in tribute to the Wardian Cases used to transport living plants to England from around the world, is filled with stone, bark and moss. If you scroll down the campaign page you'll see that it's already been depicted, tho not yet announced.
We've unlocked so many stretch goals, it may have become a little confusing to check exactly what comes with what tier. So we've outlined each tier below!

KEVIN JAY STANTON is a freelance illustrator with a green thumb and penchant for creating more work than one person can handle. He spent his childhood playing a healthy dose of video games, as well as reading a ton of fairytales, mythology, and books on nature. Nowadays he does basically the same thing, but draws them too. With Annie Stoll, he co-created, curated, and art directed the 2nd Most Funded comic anthology project on Kickstarter: 1001 Knights.
BEEHIVE BOOKS is a Philadelphia-based boutique press founded by the artist and designer Maëlle Doliveux and author and editor Josh O’Neill. They create book art editions of great prose & pictorial works with a special emphasis on graphic art, design, and comics. Their line of books currently includes monographs on Harrison Cady and Herbert Crowley, illustrated novels with art by Yuko Shimizu, Bill Sienkiewicz, Dave McKean and Paul Pope, and the ongoing experimental periodical LAAB Magazine, curated and created by Ronald Wimberly.
In addition to being a three-time Eisner nominee, Beehive Books has won two Bronze Cubes from the Art Director’s Club and had two winners in the Communication Arts design competition. Their Illuminated Editions line has recently been exhibited at the Society of Illustrators in New York City.
We build paper worlds. Learn more at www.beehivebooks.com, or find us on Instagram @beehivebooks.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As the veterans of a dozen fully funded and fulfilled Kickstarter campaigns, Beehive Books founders Josh O’Neill and Maëlle Doliveux know well the challenges associated with funding, printing, and distributing beautiful oversized art books. Between our various ventures, we have raised nearly a million dollars on Kickstarter, and rewarded backers of every campaign with many beautiful books and other rewards.

We've carefully priced out expenses for domestic and overseas shipping, as well as printing costs for all rewards. We’ve arranged for the logistics of reward fulfillment. We know exactly how much money and how much work are required to get this project across the finish line. All we need is the funding necessary to finish the job. To be honest, our biggest risk is that in these turbulent times people won't have the funds to spend on art projects like these.

Still, there are more risks and challenges involved in making things with such high production values than I can realistically list here. Don't believe anybody who tells you this stuff is easy. Problems can and will pop up in ways we can't predict. (For instance, despite our considerable epidemiological expertise, we didn't see this global pandemic coming.) But our team has the knowledge, experience and commitment to persevere through difficulties and deliver a product that meets and exceeds the exacting expectations of our audience of discerning readers and collectors.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
“Dark Decades” -- What is it?
We are creating an art zine based on the Castlevania series. Backers will receive a fully bound book copy of the zine, along with varying other rewards, including an enamel pin, a screenprinted poster, and a sheet of stickers. The zine will contain 30+ pages of art, each based on a different period of artistic history. From the art of Egyptian tombs to modern anime stylings, our zine is a must-have for any fan of the series!
Pictured art by Vaska Tsiolkovsky, Nicole Arriaga and Raquel Mancebo
What We’re Doing
While we’ve been so impressed by all the other fan projects cropping up since the beginning of the animated series, we wanted to do one that touched on what we felt was an underrated aspect of the series. Spanning from the 1400’s to the near-future, Castlevania is a big story with many moving parts, so it seemed fitting to create a team of artists that would each represent their favorite part of the series.
After getting together our artist team, we focused on the creation of pieces for the book, including full two-page spreads, and eye-catching rewards that our backers can choose at their own leisure through our various backer tiers.
Depicted art by Jennifer Tamochunas, Alejandro Luz and Ekaterina Fedorenko
What You’re Getting
Our backers will have access to three different rewards besides the zine itself! We’re proud to have produced rewards that are just as carefully made as every piece within the book. You can get a sticker sheet, a poster, and an enamel pin (pictured below) in varying combinations alongside your copy of the zine!
An 8.5 x 11" sheet of stickers, illustrated by Z (@snackeaterz on Twitter) and refined/colored by Tiff
An 8.5 x 11" poster, designed and illustrated by Mari (@thistle_designs on Twitter)
Our varying tiers work as follows:
Speaker Magician: A physical copy of the zine and a digital PDF copy - $17
Sleeping Soldier: A copy of the zine, a PDF copy and a printed poster - $18
Vampire Killer: A copy of the zine, a PDF copy the exclusive sticker sheet - $19
Forgemaster: A copy of the zine, the stickers and the screenprinted poster - $20
King of the Night: A copy of the zine, a PDF, stickers, poster and an enamel pin - $23
Draft of our enamel pin, designed and illustrated by Z (@snackeaterz on Twitter)
Our Creative Team
This project was created and has been headed by Tiff and Mari, the artists behind Scorpionfish Designs. We’re two illustrators and designers from Houston, TX, who’ve been working on this project remotely with an international team of artists.
Our artists applied to join this project and were put through a short portfolio review before being brought on board. All their names have been shared on our Twitter and will be printed in the back of the zine.
We were all brought together by our love of Castlevania and have been pouring our hearts and souls into this project for over six months. We’re sure that our effort and passion shines through and can’t wait for you to see the results!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest risk with this project is funding. We attempted this same project once before, and decided to end that and begin again with new manufacturers that are bringing you the same great product at a lower cost. Our emphasis is on quality. 

We're still learning, but we've taken the months of production on this project to account for as many things as possible, to the point of pushing back our launch date to ensure things will operate as smoothly as they can

updates.update_content:
Backers,
Get excited; bundles have been dropped off at the post office! We are so excited to send the packages on their way to everyone! 
Obviously, folks within the US can expect their packages sooner than those outside, especially overseas backers. In addition, we are nearing the holidays (on top of USPS delays due to COVID-19), so we greatly appreciate everyone's patience and understanding as your items make their way to you.

Hey there everyone!

First things first, we ship out tomorrow! How exciting! We absolutely cannot wait for you to have everything in hand and see how it turned out for yourself; we can't be more proud of the job being done.

Backers,
Great news: first off, our co-creator is COVID-19 negative! Second, the books have arrived! Expect some photos on social media! They came a bit later than expected, which is understandable given all the delays lately.
Speaking of delays, we're sure everyone is very aware that the US just had a major election that overwhelmed our postal service. While our original plan was to bundle and ship in October, COVID-related delays on top of election-related delays changed those plans.

Backers,
Great news! The zines are expected to get to us this week. We cannot wait to bundle and ship everything out!
However, we want to be totally transparent with the news that one of our creators has been exposed to COVID-19 and is in quarantine as of today. As many of you know, it's necessary to wait a few days before a test would show accurate results. Obviously, this is not something we take lightly. We will not risk contaminating any packages or endangering each other, so . Your rewards will remain untouched by us, safely in their manufacturing packaging until then, and when the time comes to bundle, we will obviously practice the best possible safety protocols.

Backers,

All orders are finalized and everything is underway!

Thank you all so much for your support and patience with this project! None of this would have been possible without your backing of this project. If you have been following along on our social media, you may have seen our progress on production! Thanks to the ship dates provided to us by our manufacturers, we can now estimate that Backers will receive updates if there are any changes (such as delays due to COVID-19).

Thank you all again for your continued support so far!
We're happy to say we're in the final stages before manufacturing, and making sure you guys all get the best possible product possible. We've had a few slowdowns due to personal affairs in the wake of COVID-19, unfortunately, but things are well underway!
We've posted some mockups on our Twitter and Instagram, and are prepping the book for print, while putting the finishing touches on the rest of our rewards. We should be able to be placing orders by the month's end, hooray!

updates.update_userinfo: WE DID IT! But what next?

First of all, thank you all so much for your support.
We simply wouldn't have been able to get this far without you! 
You should have received an email with a survey asking you for your information on where you want your chosen bundle to be shipped to. Get that filled out as soon as you can! On our end, we're waiting on the funds to come through. In the meantime, we're getting everything polished up and finished, so that it'll be ready for manufacture.

Good news—we hit 40% funding! 
We couldn’t have made it this far without all your support, and we’re so thrilled to see the enthusiasm you’ve all had for our project! 
Now we need your help to spread the word!

campaign.story:
What Are We Doing?
Ever feel like your favorite ship/ route(s) doesn't get enough love?  So do a lot of us!  Which is why we've banded together to offer amazing edeleth and CF merchandise at a fraction of the cost.  How? We're volunteers using our skills, time and passion to bring more wlw goodness to the world without breaking the bank.  We have done extensive research to get the most affordable and most awesome loot for this groundbreaking wlw power couple. This is a zero profit lootbox meaning every cent poured into this kickstarter will be used to bring the best merchandise into your hands.
What Are We Offering?
Our goal is to reach as many Black Eagle and edeleth fans as possible and share our love for our emperors.  To that end, we're offering a variety of items that we think people can use and would like, including lanyards, enamel pins, patches, acrylic charms, and other goodies.  This is strictly a non-profit project run by several volunteers, which is why the pricing is outside of MSRP.
Most of the art is done, some items are in production and some are even here!  Here's some of the merchandise featured:
 And lots, lots more....
Meet Our Team
Leading the organization of this huge project are Zanz (@zanazibar on Twitter) and Aubie (@auburnorganic on Twitter) assisted by Imani (@edvleth)
The following artists and writers are also joining us:
Mado @madocactus

What We Will Use The Money For:
Manufacturing of the items.
Shipping materials.
Coffee and donuts for Zanz & Minions while they put the boxes together.
A thermal printer so Zanz doesn't get half the boxes misdelivered with their awful handwriting.
Kickstarter fees and transaction fees from banks and/or credit cards.
The inevitable SNAFUs that will happen.
Let's Talk Stretch Goals...
Every dollar funded into this kickstarter will be used to put more items into your lootbox.
At 6,200$, we will add a popsocket to every loot box-all tiers!
When we hit 6,500$, a 3x3 vinyl sticker version of @pastelpuffin's patch will be added to all boxes.
At 7,200$, all tiers at 45 and above will include a standee featuring art from Cluniies!
At 8,000$, we will add an awesome square badge featuring Petra to all boxes. 
At 9,000$, an embroidered key-chain will be added to all boxes featuring delightful Hubert propaganda courtesy of @Rascally_Rose.
What if we hit 10,000$? We'll add TWO matching enamel pins, courtesy of Mari, to all loot boxes.
 15,000 means everyone gets a 3x3 Constance PVC Keychain featuring art from Robyn
 17,800 we will add two enamel pins designed by Auburn inspired by the Imperial couple.

At 20,000, a standee featuring Shao's art will be added to all boxes.
When we reach 20, 800, everybody will get a PVC patch with a Velcro backing done by Mogiberii
21,100, and everyone will get a Bernadetta magnet done by Mari.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Common risks in this type of project include issues with procuring art, manufacturing delays, shipping delays from either the manufacturer or from us to you. We have tried to circumvent these issues by addressing them preemptively: we have invested out of our own pocket in order to get some of these items done ahead of time (so yes, we will have finished products to show you before the pledging period is done! However, please note this isn't as to all items), we have waited until we had sufficient artists and done art to proceed, all the manufacturers have been selected and items quoted, other than the stretch goals. While there may be some delay with some items due to the current situation with the Coronavirus, we do not expect it will impact our delivery time of the final project to you.

updates.update_content: Greetings to all of you.  This has been a hell of a ride spanning almost a year, but I can finally say it has concluded.  All lootboxes have been shipped and except for a few international ones, they should be home by now. If you are missing your lootbox, please contact me immediately to check into it.  Those of you who received yours, I hope it has brought you much joy.  Especially in 2020 and 2021, we could all use some extra joy.

Hi everyone,

Another week, another update.  I wanted to inform you about the challenges and the triumphs we've had along the way.  I'm pleased to say with the shipping of the last of the international 200s and the 999 tier this weekend, we'll have all of the backer lootboxes shipped.  It's the end of a long process, and I'm extremely pleased to see it come to fruition, especially in light of all the challenges we had.  What challenges?  Well, yours truly learned that being one ounce over 2 lbs in our lootboxes brought the international cost up from 25 ish to 40 ish- per box.  The mods brainstormed ways to get around this, including options to reduce weight (ultimately we chose against it as we're concerned having a mailer instead of a box when the busts are pretty fragile is just begging for trouble); we considered asking international backers for the difference in shipping (and decided that was unfair since, well, it was my fault and my mistake that in my zeal to make the project truly zero net profit, I cut too close and didn't give us enough leeway for all the hiccups on the way) and some other stuff.  Eventually, we decided the best option was to sell (with the permission of the artists) some of the leftover loot as grab bags to recoup some of the red the shipping charges presented.  When we initially started the project, the idea was to _not_ have any sort of post-KS merch outside of whatever the individual artists decided.  But, in the interest of delivering on what we set out to do, everyone's willing to assist in fixing Zanz's fucky-wucky.  You'll see we'll make the announcement on Twitter for the grab bags later tonight.

Hi guys,

First of all, I want to update you: I'm alive, I'm recovering. Thanks to all of you who sent me well wishes.  Your support means more than I can say. At this point I'm (seemingly) mostly done with the worst of it.  I still have some cough, fatigue, and whacky sense of smell and taste, but everything else seems in order. I'm back to shipping the leftover boxes and again, I cannot thank you enough for your patience and grace during this time.  There were hiccups I definitely did not account for and the whole thing has been one huge learning experience.

Hi, Sonny here. I would like to thank you - our backers, who without - we would have not pulled this massive project off.  I bring unfortunate news in that our Head Mod, Zanz has tested positive for COVID-19. In this past year, Zanz pulled the monumental work, shipping every box out and overseeing the entire project. Our priority is Zanz's health and wellbeing, and hope that they make a full recovery.
What this means for the project: There will be delays in shipment, updates and response times. Our mod team will do our best to respond to your concerns and questions but issues dealing with refunds and shipments will be heavily delayed.

Hello everyone,

Zanz here. As you've surely noticed, the other mods have taken the lead in providing you with updates recently.  That is because, there's no way to say this nicely: it's been a bit of a shit show since October here.  Everyone's alive, no limbs were lost (merely broken and operated upon) and I'm still hanging on, but 2020 really is the gift that keeps on giving.  Seriously, if you haven't added a white card to your Cards Against Humanity set that just says "2020", what are you even doing.

I'm in a bit of a weird place, in that I don't want to go too long without an update, but I don't have much to update on for the first box until our army of Tiny Hresvelgs is here.  How long will the lil Els take, anyway?  Excellent question.  The first 10 are shipping to me tomorrow.  That means they should arrive here come Tuesday or so.  I will start shipping out 200s in backer order next week.  If you've changed address or something, now is the time to address that.  This is different from prior operations.  So far we've been able to get things to all backers of the same tier at relatively the same time- this time, we'll have to use our the run numbers to prioritize shipment.  Among this first batch, we're getting a couple of our prototypes. If you'd like a prototype as the bust on your order, please comment below!  If no one takes us up on it, no problem, you'll get your regular red El asap.  I'll be sending these out as I get them, and I'll be getting them as Dragon finishes the batches.  I'm sorry you've had to wait longer, but I hope the extras in the 200 tier make that extra wait justified.  We'll additionally be going over returned parcels, boxes with no survey and the like, and troubleshooting those. I want everyone to have their lootbox and to enjoy it as much as possible!

I'm sure at this point most of you are tired of hearing from me.  Hopefully you won't keep getting updates for long because we'll be able to finish this project soon!  With a lil bow and everything, hopefully!

So far all 20s, 45s and 70s have been shipped.  The exceptions are the ones that had no address, the ones that got returned to sender, the ones that customs refused, or any other number of SNAFUS.  Those are all the ones I can think of though.

campaign.story:
THE BOOK
Josh doesn’t know what he wants to do with his life, which is exactly why he’s taking a fifth year of high school while his girlfriend goes to university. (Well, that and the fact that his best friend basically forced him into it.) The only thing he’s sure about is the love of his life—who promptly breaks up with him.
High school senior, Kiki, quietly started transitioning over the summer to an audience of herself, her best friend, and her vaguely unsupportive parents. Now she has to deal with coming to her school as a new person, and when she’s partnered with Josh in Writer’s Craft, she finds herself developing maybe a little bit of an enormous crush.
Everyone just wants to make it out of high school in one piece, but Josh and Kiki’s last year might not be so simple.
Victory Lap is an own voices young adult novel about growing up in a world that expects teenagers to have everything figured out by the time they leave high school.
Victory Lap was inspired by the likes of modern YA authors such as Rainbow Rowell, Becky Albertalli, and John Green. If you like their works, chances are you’ll find something to like here.
Add Victory Lap on Goodreads!
Cover art by Ursula Gray
SAMPLE CHAPTERS
PDF Sample of Chapter 1
PDF Sample of Chapter 2
THE AUTHORS
If you don’t know, own voices means the identities of the main characters in the novel match the identities of its authors. K.A. Mielke is cisgender and bisexual, though when he was Josh’s age, he hadn’t yet grown comfortable with the label and went by straight, then heteroflexible for a while, which makes Josh’s sexuality during the event of Victory Lap fall somewhere under the “questioning” umbrella. Riley Wood is a transgender woman and is extremely pansexual. While this is their first book together, the two have been writing stories together since childhood.
CONTENT WARNING
Teens need a variety of books that represent them. And while some teens probably lead wholesome lives without trauma or substance use or sex, that was not our experience, or the experience of many of our friends. Because of that, Victory Lap contains some heavy language, drug and alcohol use, sex, mentions of self-harm, gender dysphoria, homophobia and transphobia, and an uncomfortable sex scene where partners fail to communicate their needs and end up in a place of grey-consent. The book’s audience is between the ages of 16-19, but we fully believe that the reader determines what type of content they are ready to read. If you are a teen who has questions after reading our novel, please talk to an adult you trust about Victory Lap’s mature themes. Similarly, if you are an adult in charge of raising teens, we encourage honest and open communication with kids, even—or especially—when it’s difficult.
FUNDING
Funding for this Kickstarter campaign will go toward printing, shipping, and processing fees.
STRETCH GOAL
If we raise more than the requested amount, we will write a bonus epilogue.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our first Kickstarter campaign, and we run the risk of making newbie mistakes. The novel has been completed and suffered through several revisions. There is the chance that there will be printing complications and physical copies of the book will take long than intended to ship. Additionally, we have not recorded the audio yet and that may also take longer than we’d like. But we are confident in our ability to fulfill the promises of our Kickstarter campaign.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Barring some late and sudden 2020 catastrophe (are murder hornets gonna make a comeback?), this Tuesday, December 22nd, I'll be back with another update including links. But for now I've attached a sneak preview of the physical book's full cover, again masterfully designed by .

I would like to thank every one of you for backing our campaign. Sure, it’s disappointing that we did not reach our funding goal, but I’m still absolutely blown away that we had so much money pledged to the campaign at all. I truly appreciate it.
Now, on to the next steps! We will still be self-publishing Victory Lap in the coming month or two. When I have more information, I’ll make another update with links, if Kickstarter allows that. If not, more updates can be found on my and Riley’s twitter profiles, and respectively.

campaign.story:
A tale of cultural discovery and coming-of-age in a nocturnal civilisation watched over by mysterious masked priests, set on a solitary island surrounded by a dark and endless sea...
This Kickstarter is to raise the printing costs to collect the second volume of this ongoing webcomic in a lavish 112-page hardback book, and to make Volume 1 available to backers again!
"Paul Duffield is a magician of light and line, and THE FIRELIGHT ISLE is a jewelled dream of a brighter, harder world." - Warren Ellis
Sen and Anlil are childhood friends about to be parted as Sen starts down the path of priesthood, and Anlil creates a sacred offering that could save her household's reputation. As the unseen consequences of their choices unfold, Sen is drawn deeper, towards the intrigues at the heart of the priests' palace, whilst Anlil is pushed outwards, towards the boundaries of society.
Both risk their souls, and perhaps even their lives, as they uncover the secrets beyond the dark shores of the island that feels like their whole world.
The story is available to read on my site, on Tapas and on Webtoon Canvas, and will be complete in three volumes.  Volume 1 contains episodes 1-18, and was printed thanks to a successful Kickstarter in 2018. Volume 2 will contain episodes 19-47, which are around 95% complete as this campaign launches.
Currently, The Firelight Isle: Volume 1 has a 4.59/5 rating on Goodreads, and the webcomic has a 9.47/10 rating on Webtoon! 
In order to preserve the original web format, I printed Volume 1 in portrait, with the spine on the short edge of the book, reading from top-to-bottom. The format has already received some great feedback.
For Volume 2, I'll be taking the quality to the next level by using a stitched spine instead of a glued one, allowing the pages to open further, and providing for an even more natural reading experience. In all other respects, Volume 2 will match Volume 1 as closely as possible so that they can look like part of a complete series.
That includes the bookmark ribbon, the Spot UV and the foil which were all unlocked as stretch goals for Volume 1, and will be available as standard this time round!
This is a difficult and strange time for all of us, and I want to make sure that this campaign both reflects that fact, and offers something back to people who have been badly affected by the coronavirus prevention measures worldwide.
To achieve this, I've included some special reward tiers - the first allows people who have been hit hard by this situation to get a book for just £1 with free shipping. This is limited to 25 slots initially, which I'll be paying for and have included in the costing of the project.
This operates on an honour system - I won't ask anyone to prove their circumstances, so please respect other backers and only select this tier if your finances have taken a significant hit.
If you want to get involved too, you can offer a helping hand to others by choosing the "DONATE A BOOK + free digi rewards" tier! You'll be covering the cost of a book, plus the postage for someone else, and you'll get all the digital rewards for free. As people donate books, I'll make more copies of the Pandemic Support Edition available.
If you want to donate a book AND choose another reward tier for yourself, you can pick the "DONATE A BOOK + any reward" tier, and follow the instructions on the tier description. You'll also get a place in the credits for the Volume 2!
This pin features a design based on the cover for Volume 2, made with glittery enamel to simulate the starry sky. It will come mounted on a special card, and is available on a number of reward tiers!
These two illustrations will be a pair of matching prints on high-quality heavyweight card stock that use gold foil and rainbow holographic foil on the background patterns and stars! They'll be printed at the same size as the book itself so they can be placed inside for extra-safe shipping.
The holographic sticker, drawn by Kate in her own incredibly cute style is an unlocked stretch goal, and will be sent to everyone who is getting a book in the post!
All reward tiers featuring digital perks include a high-quality mp3 download of the full version of the music from the trailer, by Jane Aubourg. The full piece is over 6 minutes long, and tells the story of volume 2, using rhythms inspired by the dialogue and the evolution of the plot and featuring percussion straight out of the palace of the Somin. It's an incredible piece of music and truly has to be heard! It will also be the second track in Jane's album, Songs from The Firelight Isle (the first song from which featured in the trailer for Volume 1), which is available to buy and stream on a variety of platforms!
This is the ultimate edition of The Firelight Isle! For a select few backers, I will hand-craft a unique scroll containing the entirety of Volume 1 in one unbroken page. The images above are actual photographs of a scroll that I made for the previous campaign.
 PAUL DUFFIELD
I'm Paul Duffield, the principal creator behind The Firelight Isle. Before I started on this project, I drew the long-running webcomic, Freakangels, written by Warren Ellis, which was recently announced as part of the Crunchyroll Originals slate, with an animated series coming soon on Crunchyroll.
I'm currently working as a designer and in-house illustrator for the brilliant weekly children's comic, The Phoenix. For The Firelight Isle, I'm joined by my long-time collaborator, and life-partner...
KATE BROWN
Kate has contributed a massive amount to the project. Since the beginning of Volume 2, we've been working extremely closely, and sharing the load on every stage of the art, from the thumbnails to the finished page. This is just as much her book as mine, which is why her credit will be on the cover this time, and part of the proceeds from the campaign will go straight to her.
 She just does this part time, though! Her own stories, including the phenomenal Faith Says You and Fish + Chocolate, are profound, inspiring and disturbing by turns, and are full of the kind of creativity that makes me excited about comics. You can catch her on Twitter.
FUNDING & LOGISTICS
I'll be using the same suppliers and manufacturers that produced and distributed Volume 1 successfully, so anticipate a smooth campaign on that front - the backers themselves can attest how well the campaign went, and it was wonderful to see books arriving across the world...
Of the £8500 required for Volume 2, the breakdown is as follows:
60% is for printing costs (based on acquired quotes)
25% is for postage (to cover a worst-case scenario of all shipping being international)
8% is for manufacturing costs of pins and prints (based on acquired quotes)
7% is to cover fees and other expenses.
The costs of foil, spot UV, bookmark ribbon and stitched binding are covered by the campaign goal, which is £2500 higher than the goal for Volume 1 due to both this and rising costs of paper.
None-the-less, with a leaner and more streamlined campaign, I've been able to keep the total cost of books and shipping the same as last time, whilst also reducing the cost of pins and prints.
I've made sure that no tier is loss-making, and that the project scales so that it becomes more economical with more backers.
I've decided not to offer further products as stretch goals to keep the campaign manageable, but may well announce other kinds of stretch goals if the campaign does well.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I've created and fulfilled three successful crowd-funding campaigns in the past, including the Kickstarter for Volume 1 of The Firelight Isle, Small Tales and Fairy Fails and the original Indie GoGo campaign to raise the money required to develop and write The Firelight Isle.

My work with The Phoenix and David Fickling Books has made me intimately familiar with arranging and hitting print deadlines, working with printers, and taking books and magazines from concept to reality.

I've already sourced printers and manufacturers, obtained quotes, mapped out a timeline for delivery with room for delays, illustrated the cover and finished 95% of the interiors. The only other remaining work on the book is proofing and compiling the pdfs for print and download.

THE CORONAVIRUS PANDEMIC

At the time of writing, I've been reassured that the pandemic won't cause a problem with shipping or printing, and I've put back my shipping estimates to allow plenty of time just in case, but this is an unprecedented and volatile situation that has the potential to go on long enough to remain an issue during the fulfilment period.

I'll be keeping a close eye on what's going on, and updating you if any situations develop that could cause a delay.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hi, all! It's been such a joy seeing everyone's books turning up, thank you so much for sharing your photos, unboxings and lovely words about the books! It's made us both feel very warm and fuzzy! :)

This is an update  and request about shipping for anyone outside the UK:

WOO! THEY'RE ON THEIR WAY!
Hi, everyone! Thanks for bearing with me over the last few weeks - in the last update, I said the books would likely be in the post before the end of September, and then (typically) an order of boxes that I needed to put all the packages in to send them to the distribution company was weeks late. Hi, wonderful backers!
A quick update here to say that we've now packed ALL of the books and all that remains is to label and send them. You'll have received a notification that you've got 48 hours left to change your address, after which we'll be creating the labels and sending the books to the distribution company, and from there... to you!

The Books Have Arrived...
...and we couldn't be more pleased with how they turned out! The quality of the print, binding and stock has even exceeded Volume 1, and the two look great side by side. You can see for yourself in the new unboxing video (so many boxes):

Volume 2 off to print!
Kate and I have been hard at work since the end of the campaign to finish the last few episodes of Volume 2, proof the book thoroughly and get it all set up and double-checked with the printer. We're excited to say that process is now complete, and the book is now off to print! It's always nerve-wracking sending a book to print, but we've taken care of every detail we can, and have been really happy with the quality of the samples we've seen from the printer.

campaign.story:
“Dark Decades” -- What is it?
We are creating an art zine based on the Castlevania series. Backers will receive a fully bound book copy of the zine, along with varying other rewards, including an enamel pin, a screenprinted poster, and a sheet of stickers. The zine will contain 30+ art pieces, each based on a different period of artistic history. From the art of Egyptian tombs to modern anime stylings, our zine is a must-have for any fan of the series!
What We’re Doing
Castlevania is a series that spans centuries of human history, and tells a story that captures the nature of humanity. We wanted to reflect both these aspects in our own art-based zine. Part of being a fan of such a broadly spanning series is appreciating the myriad periods and parts of the story as it moves through time.
While we’ve been so impressed by all the other fan projects cropping up since the beginning of the animated series, we wanted to do one that touched on what we felt was an underrated aspect of the series. Spanning from the 1400’s to the near-future, Castlevania is a big story with many moving parts, so it seemed fitting to create a team of artists that would each represent their favorite part of the series.
After getting together our artist team, we focused on the creation of pieces for the book, including full two-page spreads, and eye-catching rewards that our backers can choose at their own leisure through our various backer tiers.
What we’re especially proud of is the fact that after all manufacturing and shipping costs have been covered, at the end, we will be donating all of our proceeds to the Americans for the Arts Foundation! Since everyone involved in this project is an artist, we wanted the end results to go to a foundation that will foster young artists across the United States.
What You’re Getting
Our backers will have access to three different rewards besides the zine itself! We’re proud to have produced rewards that are just as carefully made as every piece within the book. You can get a sticker sheet, a poster, and an enamel pin (pictured below) in varying combinations alongside your copy of the zine!
A sheet full of kiss-cut stickers, drawn by Z (@snackeaterz on Twitter) and colored/refined by Tiff
A final draft of our enamel pin, designed by Z (@snackeaterz on Twitter)
An 8.5 x 11" screenprinted poster, designed by Mari (@thistle_designs on Twitter)

Our varying tiers work as follows:
Speaker Magician: A physical copy of the zine - $34
Vampire Killer: A physical copy of the zine and the exclusive sticker sheet - $36
Sleeping Soldier: A physical copy of the zine and an exclusive screenprinted poster - $39
Forgemaster: A physical copy of the zine, the stickers and the screenprinted poster - $41
King of the Night: A copy of the zine, the stickers, the poster and an enamel pin - $44
A final draft of the zine cover, illustrated by Mari and designed/typeset by Tiff
Our Creative Team
This project was created and has been headed by Tiff and Mari, the artists behind Scorpionfish Designs. We’re two illustrators and designers from Houston, TX, who’ve been working on this project remotely with an international team of artists.
Our artists applied to join this project and were put through a short portfolio review before being brought on board. All their names have been shared on our Twitter and will be printed in the back of the zine.
We were all brought together by our love of Castlevania and have been pouring our hearts and souls into this project for over six months. We’re sure that our effort and passion shines through and can’t wait for you to see the results!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest risk with this project is funding. We understand that there are other zines that have done similar things for less cost, and still had money to donate. But we've calculated and kept our financials in mind this whole time, deciding on our manufacturing partners early on. 

We're still learning, but we've taken the months of production on this project to account for as many things as possible, to the point of pushing back our launch date to ensure things will operate as smoothly as they can.
