campaign.story:
EXCITING CAMPAIGN UPDATE...
Check out all the stretch goals we've unlocked since launching our campaign! Now every single deck includes the following:
Two mystery art cards in keeping with the theme of the deck
Spot-UV printing on the outside of the tuck box
Three A6 prints (one each of The Lovers, Seven of Pentacles, and The Moon)
One eco-friendly tarot cloth (made from reclaimed materials and dyed with plants)
A6 prints included with every deck order
Tarot cloths will be included with each deck (dyed in colours that will coordinate with OAT)
HELLO!
Thank you so much for your interest in Oak, Ash & Thorn - beautiful Tarot cards with roots in the enchanting, natural world.
In folklore, the site of oak, ash and thorn trees entwined on a hillside mark the dwelling of spirits or the entrance to the other world. These three trees come together with a collection of woodland animals to create a stunning and unique Tarot deck. 
Oak, Ash & Thorn is an eco-friendly Tarot deck, printed right here in the UK with FSC accredited/carbon balanced paper and veggie inks (through sustainable farming, these plants also reduce the amount of CO2 in the air, further combating the fight against climate change by reducing air pollution).
For further environmental specs, please read 'WHY YOU NEED THIS DECK IN YOUR LIFE' (below).
It's also a Rider-Waite-Smith inspired deck suitable for anyone on their journey into Tarot (whether this is your first deck, one of many or if you simply enjoy the bespoke artwork adorning each card). 
MEET THE DECK
Within this deck, you'll find 78 Tarot cards (22 Major Arcana, 56 Minor Arcana), plus two companion reference cards, AND a secret bonus card. That's 81 cards in total!
The deck will be printed on 400gsm card stock and protected by matte, anti-scuff laminate. The cards measure  70mm x 120mm, and they'll be housed in a 350gsm tuck flap box.
*Our secret bonus card, called 'POSSIBILITIES', is a preview of our next Tarot deck. If all goes well and this campaign is successful, not only will you be supporting Oak, Ash & Thorn, but you will be kickstarting our next project (and FYI, our next deck will be just as magical, if not more)!
In lieu of a guidebook, we’re opting for two, double-sided companion reference cards instead. They will include card meanings that thoughtfully depict the nature of each card, ultimately allowing for this deck to be read intuitively (with just the right amount of guidance to support you). 
Here's a preview of our companion reference cards which will tuck into the box with the rest of the deck.
*We did A LOT of thinking about whether or not to include a Little White Book - that little guidebook with card interpretations that comes in (almost) every deck of Tarot cards. While we do enjoy these guides, the decision not to include one boiled down to an environmental factor.
CARD BACKS
Look at those card backs (below)...The first thing you'll notice is that this deck isn't reversible; however, it doesn't mean that you can't read it using reversals (a card is reversed when it appears upside down). Since the emblem in the middle of each card is on the smaller side, the reversed, upside-down cards aren't quite as obvious...we feel it's a good, happy medium.
Remember, this is your deck, and we encourage you to use it in a way that fits. There’s absolutely no right or wrong way to read the cards, and that’s what we love about Tarot. 
Oak, Ash & Thorn card back design...isn't is beautiful?
WHY YOU NEED THIS DECK IN YOUR LIFE... 
1) It's stunning! I know we're biased, but it really is. Even if you're not into Tarot, it's a beautiful collectors deck with gorgeous artwork.
2) It's intuitive. We feel that as you work with this deck, you will begin to develop personal associations with the cards. Since it's based on the Rider-Waite-Smith system, the cards are easy to understand.
3) It's eco-friendly. We’re proud to announce that we’ll be using the environmentally-minded Pureprint (based in East Sussex, UK) to print this deck. It was important that Oak, Ash & Thorn be sustainably sourced to harken back to its roots in nature. There are so many reasons we fell in love with this company:
 They're FSC certified. 
 They're a CarbonNeutral company. 
 They offer the Carbon Balanced Paper programme, enabling their customers to offset their emissions through The World Land Trust (an international conservation charity that protects the world’s most biologically significant and threatened habitats acre by acre).
 They're the 1st EMAS certified printer in the UK (EMAS is a voluntary environmental management instrument, which enables organisations to assess, manage and continuously improve their environmental performance).
EXCLUSIVE PERKS
What are the perks of backing our project? Well...
You'll help us get our beautiful deck into print
You’ll get Oak, Ash & Thorn at a special ‘crowdfunding only’ price
All Kickstarter backed decks will include a sticker pack featuring OAT designs
Here's a possible selection of stickers we might include in our sticker pack. The designs will be decided on after the campaign ends.
ADDITIONAL PERKS
1) Available for purchase are limited-edition, B2-sized colour scatter proofs (measuring 19.7 x 27.8 in each). They contain images used to evaluate the production of the deck. These are super rare (only 12 available), absolutely beautiful, and signed by the artist, Adam Oehlers. Each proof is different, so it'll be a pleasant surprise in the post. They're also a great way to contribute to and support the campaign. We've posted a few photos of them below. 
2) We're also offering a limited number of artist originals (see below):
THE MAJOR ARCANA
These cards showcase animals whose personality traits parallel the 22 individual universal archetypes represented in the Major Arcana of a classic Rider-Waite-Smith deck. Here's a sampling of some of the Majors that will be included in our deck. 
THE MINOR ARCANA
The Minor Arcana cards are broken down by an animal representative of each element. We've included images of some of the cards below.
THE CUPS (squirrels) represent feelings, emotions and relationships. They resemble a heart-centred spirit. 
THE PENTACLES (hares) represent the material world. They resemble a grounded and bountiful spirit. 
THE SWORDS (ravens) represent intellect, thoughts, and state of mind. They resemble a logical and intelligent spirit. 
THE WANDS (foxes) represent creativity, inspiration and passion. They resemble a bold and adventurous spirit. 
STRETCH GOALS
Look at all these stretch goals we've unlocked since launching our campaign! 
MEET THE TEAM
Adam Oehlers, the illustrator of this deck, currently works out of Norwich, England. He has exhibited worldwide from Australia, to the UK, Europe and the States. He has worked alongside writers and publishers from around the world, he has worked as concept artist, character designer and writer for animations and computer games.
Adam has always found a great deal of inspiration from the classic illustrations of Arthur Rackham, Edward Gorey and any intricate classic pen illustrations and print work. He has a great love of old stories and fairy tales and aims to tell a story through every illustration. In his work he strives to create a sense of nostalgia to take the viewer back to a forgotten memory, with the goal of reminding them of the soft magic that surrounds us.
The world he focuses on is a strange old place, lamp lit and cobble stoned, trapped in its own time with odd pieces of magic that creep in at the corners.
The Devil card: Progression from original artwork description (middle) to initial sketch (left) to final copy (right)
Stephanie Burrows is the creator of this deck. The West Yorkshire countryside that she now calls home was the source of her inspiration. Some of Stephanie’s earliest memories of Tarot include her mother reading Tarot for friends and family. Her own journey with Tarot came much later in life, after the passing of her father. Now, Stephanie enjoys starting her day with Tarot for inspiration and guidance.
THE HEART OF THE MATTER
Even when using the more common manufacturers, creating any Tarot deck is a significant investment; however, bringing an environmentally friendly Tarot deck to the market, while supporting local businesses whose values align with ours, is even more expensive.
We would love nothing more than to have this deck available for purchase right now, but it isn't possible without your help.
Revenue from this campaign will go towards the production of Oak, Ash & Thorn. It also accounts for the cost of mockups, the manufacturing of rewards, crowdfunding fees, taxes and artist royalties.
SHIPPING

updates.update_content:
Hello everyone! It's been a crazy, hectic three weeks. After sending out all your lovely Kickstarter orders, I've nearly finished getting through my pre-orders (phew! I need a lie-down, lol...and just in time for Halloween night).
The Kickstarter orders (except for a few) have officially been posted. Thanks for being so patient. I'm going to figure out the whole tracking notification for the next campaign. I'm not sure why Royal Mail wasn't sending out tracking messages, but I've been working to answer all your enquires as soon as I can. Some of your packages are arriving quickly, while some are taking a bit longer. If yours hasn't arrived yet, try not to worry. I think it's the state of the world at the moment.

Hi everyone. I just wanted to send you a quick update that the decks have arrived :0) Yaaayyyyyy!
There are lots of orders to be packed up, but I'm working as quickly as I can to get everything sent on their way. Since it's just me doing the packing, I might be very quiet for the next few weeks. You'll still hear from me each Friday, though. In the meantime, if you have any questions, just drop me a line.

Hi everyone :0) I wanted to send an early update due to the decks arriving THIS THURSDAY!!! How excited are you?! How excited am I?!
So here's the plan. On Friday, I will officially begin the packing process. I'll be packing them in order of 'similars' (which means that I'll be employing a method of packing boxes that contain the same items). Since there are so many orders to go out, and it's just me doing the packing, this is the most logical way for me to tackle this. My mindset is that I'll get everything packed up quickly by doing it this way (in theory, lol).

You guuuuuyyyys! Stop what you’re doing because I have a BIG announcement. So I spoke to the printer on Monday, and guess what?! All the decks will be delivered (to me) on Thursday, the 8th of October! Can you believe it? I know the waiting hasn’t been easy, and I want to let you know how much I have appreciated your profound patience.
So this means we’re in the ‘We’re finally getting ready to ship!’ stage, and I wanted to let you know that we’ll be locking shipping addresses soon. This means that

Hi everyone! How has your week been? I’ve certainly been keeping myself busy. It was my Birthday on Tuesday, and I took a day off for once. Hubby got me lots of great gifts, including some walking boots. I’m looking forward to breaking them in (it’s so pretty here). 
So onto the good stuff. My friends over at Generation Press (our printer) informed me that they should have everything done by Wednesday which means that when I check in with them next week, we’ll be discussing a delivery date (to me)! I have to touch base with hubby about his work schedule so we have all hands on deck. I am so excited!!!!

Hello everyone! I hope you had a good week. Recently, we had a visit from my hubby's sisters. It was great to see them (and long overdue). We were hoping we'd see one of his sisters again today, but the area that she lives in has gone into lockdown. Hopefully, it lifts soon. It's a crazy world right now. We usually visit the States to see family for Thanksgiving, and for the first time in seven years, that isn’t happening (and why do I have a feeling it won’t happen next year either?). I hope things change for the better. I know our problems are nothing compared to others though, so I can’t complain.

Hello! I hope everyone is doing alright and hangin' in there. I'm excited because we have some of my husband's family visiting, and it has been soooooo long since we've seen them. 
Over the past few days, I've been working towards finishing typing all the Certificates of Authenticity. They're only small, but they're ever so pretty. Unfortunately, my typewriter grew a bit tired, so I'll be sending her off to the menders. In the meantime, I've added another one to my collection. Look how pretty (below)! Usually, I'm not too fond of the colour red, but since she's a Fox brand typewriter, the colour is perfect (very OAT'esque). I've always had a typewriter in my life at some point. Perhaps it brings me back to a simpler time. Is there anyone out there just like me?

(By pledging to this Kickstarter, you consent that you’re over the age of 18!)
Welcome to the Kickstarter for BLACK KITTEN!
BLACK KITTEN is a 1920s LGBTQ+ romance novel about gangsters working at a gay speakeasy in New York. The story follows Vincenzo, a powerful trans gangster who’s hesitant on showing love, and Sylvia, a defeatist trans woman who works at one of Vincenzo's speakeasies, The Black Kitten. The two realize they want to be together and try their hardest to open up to one another about their feelings, but their very different worlds refuse to accept their love, so it's up to them to try and persuade them and themselves that they can be happy together.
The complete novel is free to read over on my website, but with your help, I can have the story printed into physical copies!
The book will be about 450 pages long and come in a softcover format with a trim of 5.25” by 8” (13.3 cm x  20.3 cm).
Including getting the book, backers can select different tiers to get special digital and physical goods!
If we reach our initial goal, I have exciting stretch goals to add to the Kickstarter!


If you’d like specific merch—extra books, the NSFW artbook—please add their respective amounts to your pledges and write down which add-on(s) you’d like in the comment section of your pledge.

The NSFW artbook will contain 35+ illustrations of the cast of BLACK KITTEN in a variety of different positions with their loved ones. Who likes what in where, their favorite kinks, we have it all! Add $6 to your tier in order to gain access to the PDF.
Before sending out the finished copy of the book to be printed, I'll be sure to go through it extensively, chapter by chapter, to fix any plot holes, spelling errors, and general character inconsistencies that I missed during my first read-through. I've already received many helpful critiques from some of my readers that I'm ready to incorporate into the next round of edits.
If you have any critiques or general concerns with the story or Kickstarter, please email me at makoninah@gmail.com.
Music: Bread by Lukrembo.

campaign.story:
Get a lightweight & rugged gear box and help support critical air pollution research ...
You've likely used and even discarded lots of gear boxes for electronic gear, glassware, picnic lunches, repair kits or survival gear. The hard-shell cases are often too heavy for the backcountry or on a hike, but the lightweight cases are often useless at protecting your most important stuff. From cell phones to cameras to glassware, video game systems, notebook computers and a really nice picnic lunch that you spent all morning making, you don't want your good stuff to get crushed! 
Small Orange and Large Red
Crunchy Case is different. It has the protection of a hard-case, but it's lightweight like a soft case. Pick your case in any one of 7 colors and three sizes! Crunchy Cases are available only on Kickstarter and they are designed and manufactured in Golden, Colorado so you'll get your new Crunchy Case without delay at the end of this project. Even better, the people at Crunchy Case have agreed to donate 100% of the profits from your new Crunchy Case to support air pollution research during the COVID-19 quarantine. If you would like to try a fun and easy home experiment to literally see the impact of ozone pollution in your life, check out our Instructable!
(Check out our two new made-for-Summer colors in the "Crunchy Case's Angry Summer", orange and white with "Creamsicle" and yellow and white with "Granny's Nuclear Meltdown) 
Apologies for the interruption, but these Angry Summer colors are dead nuts money, back to our originally-scheduled programming ... 
Virus bad, chance to clean the air, good! Get a Crunchy Case, even better!
Why Air Pollution research? Because the lack of traffic during the quarantine has created a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to measure the highly toxic PM2.5 particulates. This research can help save hundreds of thousands of lives of children in the USA and around the world, because children are especially sensitive to air pollution. 
Small Red and Medium Black
 Build Quality, Innovative Design, Impactful Results ... 
Crunchy Case boxes are designed like nothing you've seen before, built tough in great-looking colors, your new Crunchy Case is made with stainless steel fittings, UV-stabilized and ozone-hardened materials and a really innovative design that will fit right into your day. Wash them like any other food container, and then use your new Crunchy Case for snacks, cell phones, your notebook computer or tablet, overnight bag, video game gear, vinyl records and sensitive glassware. All Crunchy Cases are designed to minimize waste, built to rugged standards to last a lifetime. They open easily, close easily and they're fully convertible to use as a lap table to eat your lunch or use your notebook computer comfortably.  
Small Yellow, Medium Black, Large Red, and Small Blue
Crunchy Cases are made one-at-a-time in Golden, Colorado. We use custom-manufacturing and careful hand-assembly to make something that is genuinely new and innovative. And when you don't need it anymore, it's designed to comply with U.S. Postal Regulations to use over and over again to ship books, music, records and other media. If you want the protection of a hard case, but also the light weight ease of a soft case, then Crunchy is right between soft and hard. It will protect your lunch from being squeezed into a ball, on a crowded train on under a bunch of books on your way to school. Our smallest Crunchy Case  weighs about six ounces ... less than most cell phones! Your Crunchy Case will protect the fragile things that you carry, and still leave room for your stuff.  
Small Yellow, Small Black
 Over its lifetime, a single Crunchy Case can help to eliminate up to 188 kilograms (!) of toxic material released into the water and air from the paperboard manufacturing industry. And since Crunchy Cases are super light and super strong, they'll save money on fuel for transport. So you'll help to clean the air in two ways. And unlike all those cardboard boxes, you'll never see a Crunchy Case in a recycling bin, because it is designed to be used and reused for a lifetime. 
Technical Notes about the Air Pollution Research
Please check out our Instructable for the home, DIY ozone test.Link here.
Not feeling the quarantine? Yeah, it sucks, but for an air pollution researcher, it's an opportunity of a lifetime, because air pollution decreases considerably when so many cars are off the roads. During the quarantine, we study how air pollution particulate settle out of the air, and then how they begin to accumulate again once the quarantines end. Most important, how do the highly-toxic and tiny PM2.5 pollution particles (particles smaller than 2.5 microns, and smaller than a bacteria) interact with the larger, less-dangerous PM10 particles (big enough to see in the air)? If we can work to solve the PM2.5 pollution problem, we can help to save over 600,000 children who die each year from sometimes invisible air pollution. Link.
But to fight PM2.5, we have to learn about this enemy! The global (and temporary) reduction in air pollution due to the quarantine makes this research possible in a new way. That's because PM2.5 particles can stay in the air for weeks and months, while the larger PM10 particles settle out of the air in just a few days. Even as you read this, and consider backing this project, the air you breath outside is now fairly clear of the large pollution particles due to the quarantine, but you still breathe lots of the tiny particles that have remained in the air from before the quarantine. When you support this Crunchy Case Kickstarter, you will help provide funding for us to measure particles during and after the quarantine and then find ways that industry and vehicle makers can inexpensively change their process to help make the air cleaner and safer for all.
If you want to Guru-Up on the air pollution, here are the basics ... I worked on the problems of submicron air pollution particulates since graduating University of Alabama with my Ph.D. in applied physics about ten years ago. In that time, I developed a particle aggregation model between the large particles (i.e. PM10) and the small particles (i.e. PM2.5) in that "bimodal distribution." (Bimodal just means that in a pollutant stream, there are a lot of big particle and a lot of small particles, but not too many medium-sized particles.) The small particles tend to stay in the atmosphere for months before they settle on the ground, but the large particles settle out within just a few days.
In general, it's a lot easier to remove the large particles from a stream of pollution, than the small ones (like trying to pick baseballs off the carpet, versus trying to pick ball bearings off the carpet). So industries tend to remove the large particulate first, like PM10, because it's easier than removing the small particulates like PM2.5. Research suggests that when we do this, the tiny PM2.5 particles stay in the air much longer without the large particles, because they no longer have the large particles to stick and then settle out of the air. That leaves more PM2.5 in the air for people to breath, to weaken otherwise healthy cardiovascular systems, and to allow bacterial infections like pneumonia and viral infections to make someone sick. Medical research suggests suggests that when these pollutants damage otherwise healthy lungs, bronchioles and sinuses, that viral/bacterial coinfections become worse and mortality rates increase. (This research is pending publication.)
The new research in this Kickstarter looks to characterize the fate of air pollution particulates during and after the COVID-19 quarantine, and then use those results with the bimodal aggregation model to make a simple on-line tool that air pollution researchers can use in their work to help decrease PM2.5 particulate air pollution, and then help industry use these results to make their products in a cleaner, and even less expensive way. For an introduction on how air pollution disproportionately impacts children and people in poverty, this United Nations article is a good start.
The last time an opportunity like this presented itself was after 9/11, when the U.S. grounded most air traffic for days. Researchers wanted to see what difference it would make to daily temperature conditions with the lack of jetliner contrails. With few planes in the skies, there was also few contrails in the sky. Click here to see what they found.
But this opportunity may prove to be even more pivotal in the study of the atmosphere, because the reduction in traffic is nearly global, the timing of these reductions is clearly tied to published events, and the effect is concentrated in the troposphere. We expect this research to continue to suggest simple modifications for industry to use that may help us all breathe easier.   THANK YOU FOR YOUR INTEREST AND YOUR SUPPORT!!!!!
Here is my Google Scholar Research and Publications page: https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=tu40zDIAAAAJ&hl=en

updates.update_content:
Hi All,
Work progresses in air pollution, lately on some pollution control methods for particles down near the 100 nanometer regime. Those are hard to collect with conventional methods.
This is a photo that I took the other day of the current state of particulates in Golden, Colorado ...

Hi All,
Most of the rewards have shipped, thank you for your patience. 
Update on the air pollution research ... I had to get a new particulate sensor, the one I had sh-t the bed with the USB port and would no longer reliably gather data. So I got a new one, which didn't work for some reason. I was prepared to buy a third, but then the second sensor started to work again, so now I can get back to the bimodal research. The point of this research is to find the connection between the way the small submicron particles and large course mode particulate interact with each other. Most of this work is done in a small environmental chamber, which is basically just a glass box with input and output ports for the sensors and the test smoke.

Hi All,
Many of your have your rewards, a few are still waiting. We ran out of the black and green and dark blue materials, but we got in the black, so the rest of those should go out this week, and we are supposed to get the green and dark blue tomorrow.

Hi All,
A few of the rewards were set up as no changes allowed, and the others have changes allowed for another two days. If you need to make a change to your address, and if your reward is locked from making changes, please let me know by email, mike@galaxygauge.com, and I'll make sure it gets in.

Hi All,
I made a test chamber today to get particulate data on the bimodal distribution. Some test chambers are complicated, this one is simple, just a box with plate glass on each side, a little sealed access door on top, and the sides made of the same stuff we use to make Crunchy Cases. I put different gauges inside the box, put in a little puff of air pollution, and then take data for hours. The goal here is to see how the small particles (PM2.5) interacts with the large particles (PM10). And then we run the same experiment different with different types of sample air air pollution. The glass is on both sides, so I can take transmission measurements later if necessary.  Anyway, this is s photo, nothing too complicated, but it keeps a given volume of air from mixing with the air in the room.

campaign.story:
Sketchmark ProRuler is a 12-in-1 bookmark stencil designed with one goal in mind: create the perfect tool for every creative professional. From architects to graphic designers and imperial users to metric users, ProRuler is tailored for creative designers around the world. 
Background
Last year, the Kickstarter community helped me bring The Original Sketchmark to life by raising over 1750% of my initial goal. With the help of backers, I added new features to Sketchmark and improved the quality, material, and manufacturing process to create the best "bookmark stencil for everyone."
After seeing a large demand for Sketchmark from the bullet journaling community, I launched The BUJO Expansion Card. With input from original backers, I designed the BUJO card to complement the the Original Sketchmark with new features designed specifically to help the average person improve their bullet journaling.
Today, I return to the Kickstarter community to launch ProRuler, the largest Sketchmark bookmark stencil yet. Inspired by the many triangle scale rulers I used throughout architecture school, ProRuler's unique design creates 8 edges for rulers and scales while retaining the protractor, bookmark, and compass tools featured in the Original Sketchmark. 
-Jordan, Sketchmark Founder
Sketchmark ProRuler Features
At 6.375" tall, ProRuler is our largest Sketchmark yet. While the design maintains the same width and thickness as the rest of the Sketchmark family, the added length is specifically designed to give creative professionals extra room for creativity and versatility while maintaining Sketchmark's unique portability. Just like previous Sketchmarks, ProRuler has a built-in bookmark and fits inside the most common notebook and sketchbook sizes.
PLAY

Pica & Point (1 pica = 12 points) ruler for newspaper, magazine and other print designers
use the pixel ruler simulated at 150ppi to sketch websites, apps and more
use the architect and engineer scales to sketch drawings, measure drawings in the field, and more

use the built-in bookmark to clip it to your sketchbook, textbook, drawings, and more
Pair with other Sketchmarks (Add-Ons)
Each product in the Sketchmark family is uniquely designed to complement the others, giving individuals the opportunity to mix-and-match Sketchmark products to create the ideal creative arsenal for themselves. Whether they carry a single Sketchmark or find the features of all 3 useful, Sketchmark gives creatives the tools they need for sketching, designing, journaling and more.
As with our previous campaign, we are giving backers the opportunity to add additional Sketchmarks to their Kickstarter pledge. Learn more about the rest of the Sketchmark family below and how to add additional Sketchmarks to your pledge.
Sketchmark launched with the idea to create "the bookmark stencil for everyone" and the Original Sketchmark is just that. With over 15 tools packed into a bookmark the size of a credit card, everyone can find a use for the Original Sketchmark in their daily routine. From simple bullet journaling to sketching your next invention to having a ruler handy at all times, the Original Sketchmark is the perfect creative companion to carry in a notebook, textbook, sketchbook or even a wallet (remember: credit card size).
PLAY

The BUJO Expansion Card was designed for avid and amateur bullet journalers alike. The BUJO Expansion Card features a full set of alphabet stencils, a monthly tracker, and 10 bullet journaling icons designed to complement the features of the Original Sketchmark. Aside from bullet journaling, BUJO's alphabet stencils and icons can be used for annotating and taking notes in textbooks, creating page titles on sketches and drawings, and much more.
PLAY

campaign.story:
When I started making handmade dice in October of 2018, one of the first designs I came up with was a teeny goldfish inside a D20. My original inspiration came from Sylgar, the Xanathar's beloved pet goldfish, and Stephen Q Fisher Esquire, Magnus Burnsides' magical pet from The Adventure Zone podcast.  Once I shared the prototype, it became clear to me that fans of Critical Role had a fondness for goldfish as well, and I too fell in love with the show and Marisha Ray's wonderful OC Keyleth. 
The name Keyfish stuck, and this design has by far outsold any of my others. I have been blown away by the demand for these little fishy buddies, and in an attempt to make them available to everyone who wants them, I am launching this campaign to bring them to life on a larger scale than my tiny studio allows.
 This Kickstarter will allow me to fund the production of an initial run of Keyfish polyhedral sets, as this would be outside of my financial capabilities on my own as a one-person small business. I have partnered with Cerberus Supplies to find a factory capable of reliably recreating my goldfish design on a large scale. These dice are going to be produced in resin, with resin fish, which will result in balanced dice (for those sticklers out there wondering). Cerberus will also be providing fulfilment services for this Kickstarter, and all worldwide shipping will be tracked.
The goal of this campaign is to bring my Keyfish dice design to the world at an affordable price, and with the best quality possible. All of the images you see on this campaign site are of real physical samples from the factory. There will be some small adjustments made on the final product, including a little bit more glitter and a more vibrant aqua colour for the ink.
Pledging at any level will give you access to the pledge manager where you will be able to add other items if you so choose. I understand that things are uncertain right now, and I would hate for folks to miss out because they are unable to afford their desired pledge level in unpredictable circumstances.
The Dice
Each set of Keyfish polyhedral dice will come in an aqua-coloured organza bag printed with my Green Leaf Geek logo icon.  *Since we unlocked the stretch goal, all sets will now be 11 pieces!*  
Factory sample set of Keyfish polyhedral dice
A closer look at the detail in the factory samples.
The factory sample D20 up close and personal.
The Handmade Love
I have partnered with 2 amazing women to produce 2 items you won't be able to find anywhere else! As part of the Handmade Love tier, you'll get a set of Keyfish dice, plus the following items:
Aras Sivad is producing a limited run of Keyfish-themed travel dice bags. These bags are sized to fit all your TTRPG essentials (contents not included)! These cases feature a secure zipper closure and a sturdy swivel clip at the top so you can hang it up or attach to a loop in your bag for easy retrieval. They feature an exclusive custom print and fishy-inspired zipper!
A very close approximation of how the final Aras Sivad pouches will look.
Arielle Milstein of Critical Kits has designed some super handy Inspiration tokens for this campaign. These laser-engraved 1.5" coins are perfect for tracking Inspiration in game, or for those moments at the table when it's all or nothing and a coin flip is needed!                 
Arielle's beautiful laser-engraved wood Inspiration Tokens.
The One-shot
Natalie Wallace (@chaoticrogue on Twitter) has created a fun and excited goldfish-themed D&D 5th Edition one-shot adventure exclusively for this campaign. For only $5CAD, you can get in on the action with a PDF copy. These will be sent to backers within one month of the end of the campaign. The one-shot will also include original artwork from Meg Flynn (@MeggieSue13 on Twitter). Meg is one of my favourite RPG artists and I'm so excited to work with her again!
The Online Sessions
If you choose to back at the "One Fish & a Seat at the Table" pledge tier, you will receive a set of Keyfish polyhedral dice, a PDF copy of the One-Shot, AND you'll be one of the select few who get a spot at the table for an online game with Green Leaf Geek (Leah) and one of 5 incredibly talented DMs to play through the One-Shot! Each session will have a maximum of 4 players (plus me!) and a run time up to 4 hours. We will work together to schedule a time that is convenient for all involved. Safety tools will be in use for each session. The wonderful DMs who will be running these sessions for us are:
UNLOCKED: $25,000 CAD 
 At $25,000 every backer with a pledge of at least $25CAD (before shipping) will receive a Kickstarter-exclusive 3" tall Keyfish D20 sticker. These are high quality transparent matte vinyl produced by Stickermule. They can be used inside or outside and make awesome bumper stickers! If we hit this goal, you'll also be able to purchase additional stickers in the pledge manager later.    
Transparent stickers give a fun fishbowl feel! Stick them anywhere indoors or out.
UNLOCKED: $35,000 CAD
When we reach $35,000 each backer with a pledge of at least $25CAD (before shipping) will receive a Kickstarter-exclusive clear acrylic charm with the campaign icon. Put it on a keychain, or on your dicebag to add a little flair! If we hit this goal, you'll also be able to purchase additional charms in the pledge manager later.   
Crystal clear acrylic tokens with the Keyfish D20 icon. Add to a keychain or zipper pull, or hang from your rear-view mirror!
 UNLOCKED: $50,000 CAD 
At $50,000 the party really starts. Every set of 7 polyhedral dice will be upgraded to an 11-piece set! Each mega set will include 2 D20s, 1 D12, 1 D10, 1 D%, 1 D8, 4D6, and 1 D4.
UNLOCKED: $60,000 CAD
At $60,000 I will be able to have a custom font on all the dice produced. This is the font I use on my handmade sharp edge dice and the same one that's featured in my logo. It's called Be Bright and I love it to bits!  
UNLOCKED: $75,000 CAD 
At $75,000, every backer OVER $25CAD (before shipping) will receive a Kickstarter-exclusive enamel pin. If we hit this goal, you'll also be able to purchase additional pins in the pledge manager later.    
A digital mockup of what the pins should look like.
 UNLOCKED: $87,500 CAD 
At $87,500 CAD, all backers with a pledge of at least $25CAD (before shipping) will receive a beautiful hand-etched glass Glyphstone from MC Etching (@MC_Etching on twitter). If you follow Nix, you know that his etching work is incredible and extremely detailed. These are a custom, Kickstarter-exclusive design. Each backer will receive one randomly selected token in either aqua or orange.
Samples of hand-etched glass Glyphstones from MC Etching.
 LOCKED: $100,000 CAD 
If the campaign reaches an UNTHINKABLE $100,000 CAD, every backer at all levels will receive a pdf of Keyfish-themed D&D 5e content. Bundle may include a subclass, sub-species, NPCs, monsters and magic items, written by the creative and talented Snickelsox (of Lasers & Liches fame, @snickelsox on twitter). These items will come with gorgeous original artwork by Melissa Capriglione (@MCapriglioneart).

campaign.story:
Handmade grimoires are a very personal thing, whether for journaling or making your own spell or 'recipe' book for another use. There are numerous materials involved from special paper to faux-leather, essential oils, felt, clasps, and the mostly figurative blood/sweat/tears and literal time that go into them. 
I made my first as a passion project for myself, and everyone who saw it loved the detail, originality, and smell, so I want to share them with you.
They are costly to make right, but the price is still set to be a better value than many leather-bound journals and grimoires. I appreciate you jumping right in with your support, so I am also including a handmade lava bracelet for the first 25 backers of each type. 
 Backers will also receive updates with pictures and videos showing the process of creating your grimoire. Thank you for considering this project; I am certain you will be happy with your decision to support it.

campaign.story:
The inspiration for this tarot deck comes from the sense of adventure seen in many works of fantasy, plus a touch of The Red Book by Carl Jung. Will you find transcendence on your journey of introspection, or does danger lurk in the darkest recesses of the subconscious? Either way, you will not emerge the same.
Welcome to the launch of the 2nd Edition of The Lost Forest: Tarot! In April 2019, we launched the first edition of this deck on Kickstarter. It was a huge success, greatly exceeding expectations and quickly selling out of its limited print run. We hope to make the 2nd Edition the ultimate version of this deck. Here is a rundown of the upgrades:  
Updated artwork on over 1/3rd of the cards! This is truly a perfectionist vision of The Lost Forest. 
Fully redesigned deck box, striking and sophisticated. Solid black two piece box printed with metallic silver ink, then matte laminated to maximize durability. Gage, my designer, did a great job on the first edition, but this new take is absolutely gorgeous!
Sturdier 360gsm cardstock.
Updated guide with expanded minor arcana descriptions.
Black painted edges are a Kickstarter exclusive add on [see the stretch goals section for details].
In addition, Kickstarter backers get the deck at a discounted price. 
As always, The Lost Forest will be printed locally and certified carbon neutral, making it stand apart from most tarot decks. Being green is very important to us, and to all the forests of the world!
[photo of first edition]
The Fool / King of Earth
Queen of Fire/ Death
This project got its start in May 2018 while talking with a psychologist friend. I showed her an early version of "The Mystic", and she suggested my dark and dreamlike art style was reminiscent of tarot. I recruited award-winning designer Gage Mitchell, and thus began my journey of creating The Lost Forest.
Tarot, like therapy, can be a vehicle of self discovery. A way to bring what your intuitive mind has always known to your awareness. A way to see the path through hard times when everything seems muddy and chaotic. It seeks to unbury the truth.
I've incorporated themes inspired by adventure fantasy such as The Legend of Zelda, Lord of the Rings, and the films of Hayao Miyazaki. An untried hero sets out, naive and optimistic. The four elements representing four cardinal directions on a map to a place that exists only in the mind. This concept is demonstrated by "The Fool", where great rewards may be at the end of a long, arduous journey- or certain death. For some, looking deep into the mind is deeply disturbing, and while many emerge from such difficult introspection transformed, not all will find a happy ending. But no reward is worth pursuing without some risk along the way.
When you enter The Lost Forest, you bring nothing but yourself. But that is enough to overcome any adversity. I hope this tarot deck is the map that guides you through.
-Chelsea Santamaria, Illustrator
Strength / Queen of Skies [Revised]
Page of Oceans [Revised] / The Hierophant
Standard tarot card size (2.75"x4.75"), on 360gsm / 18pt cardstock.
We are working with local and environmentally conscious Hemlock Printers, the pacific northwest's first green e-certified printer. Our project is certified carbon neutral by Hemlock's Zero carbon neutral program. Keeping business local and sustainable is very important to us, despite the higher cost. 
Local printing allows us to be physically on press during production for the best quality control. 
Stochastic lithograph printing with reticulated UV finish gives the cards the highest possible detail and richness of colors, complete with a ghostly alternating matte/gloss effect on the card backs. The fronts are a silky, fingerprint resistant satin. All inks are vegetable based.
Each deck comes in a beautifully redesigned two piece deck box, with metallic silver ink printed over solid black, and finished with a durable matte laminate.
Includes an updated full color folded guide insert.
Stretch Goal #1 *UNLOCKED*: $22,000. Black painted edges available as an add on, for a ghostly touch. To upgrade to this option, add $15 to your pledge for every deck you want black edges on. These will not be available outside of Kickstarter.
Stretch Goal #2 *UNLOCKED*: $28,000. A bonus 79th card will be added to all decks- "The Ascended".  
Stretch Goal #3: $35,000. A bonus 80th card will be added to all decks- "The Faceless".  
Stretch Goal #4: $45,000. All deck boxes will be upgraded to heavy chipboard cores, guaranteed to stand the test of time. 
Larger images of select artworks can be seen at chelseasantamaria.com.

All art and design work is finished and ready for production. Files are due to be sent to the printer after the conclusion of this Kickstarter. This isn't our first rodeo, we have worked with Hemlock Printers before and thanks to our previous Kickstarter experience, we confidently know what to expect. We even fulfilled our rewards ahead of schedule!

That said, unforeseen delays are possible. Hemlock is taking industry standard precautions during the Coronavirus outbreak, but this could still cause hiccups in our production. Our using a local company should at least mimimize shipping delays. We will keep all backers updated with regular posts on our progress post funding.

campaign.story:
Next Stretch Goal! 
A new story is coming… The long-awaited follow-up to Nekojishi is here!
An adventure torn between tradition, animal spirits, and woebegone property owners. Explore Taiwan and uncover the secrets of the spiritual world as you get to know animal gods and spirits who all have their own reasons for messing with you and the world of the living.
Nekojishi: Lin & Partners is an adventure-RPG that combines adventure game gameplay with real-time debate combat!
Explore a wide game world, talk to characters, and help them out in quests— solving puzzles and learning more about local history and traditions. When things come to a head, you'll need to prove the truth and face-off against spirits in real-time RPG debate battles. Make smart use of the information you've acquired to face every rebuttal of your opponents!
Liao, having been awakened to the ability to see the gods and spirits in this world, came into contact with three feline spirits who each wanted a say in his life and his future. 
Three years after the story of Nekojishi, Liao is out of college and strapped for cash and those closest to him, the spirits Lin Hu, Likulau, and Yan Shu-Chi are desperate to help Liao get a job. 
Take the reins at Lin & Partners Architects LLP, an architecture firm specialising in the restoration of haunted locations, and solving the problems of the beast-man spirits dwelling within them.
As Lin & Partners grows, a larger company looms near. Liao and the others must uncover their motives and ideals for tradition in modern society.
The story of Lin & Partners takes place as Liao and the others start up their new business venture. Connect with both old and new faces as Liao finds himself deep within the world of gods and spirits once more!
Also check out the extended version of the trailer on our YouTube channel!
Many characters will join Liao throughout his adventure, humans, and troubled spirits alike. Discover their past and grow close to the ones you care about. 
During the game you'll discover new characters, some of which may even join Liao on their adventure, lending their hand to Liao during debates in order to get the upper-hand.

Adventure Mode
An adventure set in Taiwan, filled with culture, folklore, and the spirits that cause Liao so much trouble. In Lin & Partners you can explore the world, talk to characters, solve puzzles, undertake quests, and more! 
You'll also be able to get to know the spirits you meet in the world by undertaking side quests along your main adventure. The bonds you make with the various spirits that accompany Liao on your journey will make their arguments more powerful in debates!
Debate Battles
When the time comes for Liao to convince a spirit, a debate begins! Debates are real-time RPG battles where the player uses Argument Cards to damage their opponent's credibility (HP). Using cards makes use of Inspiration Points (IP) which are replenished every turn.
In some scenarios, you may even need to use specific clues gathered in the adventure to disprove statements made by your opponent! Choose correctly and you'll leave them wide open!
Make smart use of Argument Cards and their effects to show your opponents your way of thinking! The cards you have access to will change depending on your progress in the adventure, what characters are by your side, side quests completed, and other secrets hidden in the world. 
Every version of the game will contain every language. If you're backing for a Nintendo Switch copy, you'll be able to play in any language regardless of Nintendo eShop region. 
Now that we've hit our base goal, we'll start counting funds towards our stretch goals. We have a lot of exciting things we'd want to include in the game so let's make them happen. 👏
The story of Lin & Partners was first drafted even before the release of the original Nekojishi. In 2017 there was a discussion about what Liao and the cats would do after the story of Nekojishi. From there came the idea of them meeting other spirits, and resolving the conflicts between humans and spirits just like Liao had done with the three main characters of the original Nekojishi.
The context to this adventure would be that Liao is opening up an architecture firm that specialises in design surrounding the principles of Feng Shui— the Chinese geomancy based around the existence of spirits in places. As such, Liao will be called in to help on sites in need of spiritual improvement, such as suspected haunted properties where the root of their issues will really be tied to yaoguai and other spirits interfering with the human world.
Originally the plan was to make Nekojishi: Lin & Partners a comic series, however in 2018 we decided to adapt this into a video game sequel to Nekojishi in response to the demand from our community. (Later we also released a different Nekojishi comic called The Divine Battles which is currently being published by Pawprint Press.)
An overview of our progress between the first and second concepts for the game.
In the beginning Lin & Partners was planned as a 2D simulation-puzzle game in the vein of games like Animal Crossing: Happy Home Designer where the player needs to re-design spaces to meet given requirements and resolve Feng Shui related issues. Your success and failure in do so would influence the course of the story.
By late 2018 we were about to release an announcement for the game. We even released the teaser website linandpartnersllp.com. However, just a few days after this release we assessed that the game we had planned conflicted with the story we wanted to tell.
We threw away nearly everything and started over.
This is where Lin & Partners started as an adventure game. The player instead exploring the world, collecting items, solving puzzles, and completing quests. (Later that would expand into the real-time RPG debate gameplay where your skill in the adventure is tested!)
At this time we also swapped from 2D sprite characters to 3D models to give us more flexibility and make room for the more complex scenarios found in an adventure game. And soon after we switched from our 2D scenes when we realised producing them was both too time consuming for our lead background artist and too restrictive to iteration, especially with our small team.
Cats are easily distracted.
Since then we've been building the framework that will allow us to make Lin & Partners a reality, from scene pipelines, animation tools, gameplay and scripting and we're finally at a point where we feel ready to share our game with the world!
Bringing things right back to where they started.
Additional Information Regarding Early Access: At this time, early access will only be made available to PC and Mac players of the game. Early access will be made available during the final period before the game's launch. The early access period will help us catch bugs and fix up errors before the final release.
Additional Information Regarding Nintendo Switch Codes: You'll be able to give your preferred region for Nintendo eShop codes in your reward survey. We are able to provide US / EU / AUS / and JP codes however the availability of JP codes will be subject to demand. While the game itself is region free, you'll need to have a Nintendo account created in the correct region to redeem the code. You can create and log into any Nintendo account on your Nintendo Switch regardless of what region the console originated from.

Studio Klondike is an indie team of writers, programmers, and artists who have aimed to create heartfelt narrative and gaming experiences ever since we came together to crowdfund and make our first video game Nekojishi in 2016 which we released back in 2017! In September, we released our second game, the short story Beek - Familiar Spirit on iOS, Android, and itch.io!
Nekojishi: Lin & Partners is the biggest project we've ever worked on by far. It's been in planning since 2017, gone though iteration after iteration, and now we're finally ready to share our vision with you all. Throughout the planning of this game we've grown immensely both as a team and in our capabilities. We feel we've come a long way since the visual novel we pored everything we had into back in 2017, and we really want to have the chance to take this next big leap.
Meet Some of the Team

Director - Adam Sheng
Programming & Design Lead - Dylan Wunsch (@compahead)

The following is a general estimate of the planned timeline for the production of Nekojishi: Lin & Partners.
FEB - MAR 2020 - Crowdfunding campaign period.
APR 2020 - Beginning full production.
DEC 2020 - Beta (Playable from start to finish)
EARLY - MID 2021 - Finalise content.
MID 2021 - Iteration and polish.
MID 2021 - Release date announcement and reward fulfilment.
One week prior to release - Early Access for backers.
MID - LATE 2021 - Release
We want to make the best game we can, so we wanted to leave the above timeline open to change depending on how both this campaign and the actual production of the game goes.
Pawprint Press has been our distributor for merchandise and publisher for comic works involved with our team over the past few years. Together with Pawprint Press we've produced and distributed a variety of products based on your games!
For this project, Pawprint Press will be responsible for the production and fulfilment of our physical rewards. 
Find more Nekojishi merchandise at store.pawprint.press and head on over to www.pawprint.press and check out the Nekojishi spin-off comic The Divine Battles.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Right now we've completed the groundwork needed to go into full production. From asset creation pipelines, to scene building, game design, story outlines, and the beginnings of implementation and scripting. The only thing holding us back is the resources required to create everything needed for the project and the time required to make it.

The game is planned to be released in mid-late 2021 for PC, macOS, and Nintendo Switch. While we want to complete the game as quickly as possible, we also wish to be able to take some extra time to make everything perfect. The more stable our income, the safer we'll feel being able to take that time to create the vision we want. No matter what happens, we'll keep you up to date regularly.

To ensure the smoothest release possible, the game has been developed for all three platforms together, while targeting Nintendo Switch first. This is for two reasons. Firstly, this is our first time developing for Nintendo Switch and we wanted to prove to ourselves 100% that we could make it happen before we made promises. Secondly, we wanted to give Switch players the best experience playing Nekojishi: Lin & Partners, so we're authoring all assets for the platform right from the beginning to make the game look the best it can be. While we expect to make plenty of changes throughout the development of the game, we always want to be honest about what we present to players.

The delivery of rewards for this project will be produced and fulfilled by our merchandise partners at Pawprint Press. We've worked with Pawprint Press ever since our first game to produce and sell high quality merchandise for our fans. We're confident in their quality and commitment in making things right for their customers. For the physical rewards on offer we've gone out of our way to either base our production estimates off existing products produced by Pawprint Press or have worked with them to have prototypes made and production quotes on hand. As such we have done all we can do to ensure we can meet the expectations of the physical rewards offered in this project. Rewards will be produced and shipped prior to the launch of the game in 2021.

And as always, making games is challenging. This is the biggest project we've ever taken on and we want to create something that makes our team, our community, and everyone who plays our game proud.

campaign.story:
Alice and the Nightmare is an ongoing webcomic for young adult readers, inspired by Lewis Carroll’s books. Help us bring the first 4 chapters to print in a beautiful, full color, softcover book! 
The comic follows Alice Heart - not as she tumbles down a rabbit hole - but as she starts her first year at the prestigious Phantasmagoria University of Wonderland, where students learn to collect energy from the dreams of sleeping humans. Dreams and the power they yield are the main resource of this magical country. Becoming an oneironaut, learning to harvest dreams, is a job you're essentially born into. Your capacities to become one are evaluated at 7 years old, and the deal is sealed!
After growing up alone in Heart Church, as the protégée of the Red Queen, Alice is eager to make friends and carve a new life for herself. She chose this path, despite never formally passing the oneironaut test.
University life brings up new challenges that Alice is not well-prepared for. It's  a competitive and stratified environment where students are defined by their Suits — Spades, Hearts, Clubs, and Diamonds, mystic symbols anchored on their bodies that define their unique abilities in the Dreamscape and path in life. 
Regardless, Alice is determined to grow and learn, with the help of her teachers, her classmates, and her new roommate, the enigmatic Edith. Add in an odd Trinket salesman, a mysterious cat, and the strange girl Alice keeps seeing out of the corner of her eye, and the school year promises to be an interesting one to say the least!
Alice and the Nightmare is published through Hiveworks and can be read online here!
Book 1 contains the first four chapters, establishing the world of Wonderland and the themes of the story. The book will be a 7x10.5 inch soft cover volume, with 232 full color pages. 
Alice and the Nightmare explores themes of growing up, identity, mental health, family, and fate through symbols borrowed from the Carroll books and shaped to match the dream world of the comic. Among these symbols, readers will find the "Drink Me" bottles and the relationship between Alice and the Red Queen.
In addition to the book itself, backers can select from several tiers that offer a variety of nice tea time treats! Check them out below!
Digital rewards include a wallpaper, a bonus ebook about the development of Alice and the Nightmare, and a digital copy of the book. Physical rewards, in addition to the book, include a stationery set (comprised of a sticker sheet and double sided bookmark), and a bottle creature keychain. 
Limited edition rewards include a bookplate signed by the author, and a limited amount of original illustration commissions, where a backer can request a portrait of themselves, or of a person of their choice, as a Wonderland Suit! 
The stretch goals of Alice and the Nightmare aim to make the book and rewards even prettier! We’ll be announcing them as they’re unlocked!
$25,000 - Foil stamping on the cover!!
$30,000 - ????????????????????????
Thank you for helping us print Alice and the Nightmare! You can find more of Michelle Krivanek’s work on Twitter and Patreon, and be sure to give the comic a read!
Special thanks to Rhiannon R. S. for color correction and pre-press work on the comic. Music used in the video by Grace Mesa - Back to Wonderland.

campaign.story:
Help print the first book of Amongst Us,  a slice of life romance comic about the mundane lives of Veloce and Blackbird - an eccentric couple with strange chemistry, striking personalities, and unhesitating love for each other. 
Filled with snippets of life full of laughs and warmth, I made this comic to brighten the day, mine and hopefully yours as well!
"And they lived happily ever after."
Originally published online in the form of episodes, this story is composed of snippets of the life of Veloce and Blackbird, a stoic cellist, and the brazen conductor she fell for. These lovebirds are already together, and this is their happily ever after: their snuggles and kisses, their food fights, their laundry disasters, their third-wheeling adventures... 
top 10 anime betrayals
Meet the Soulmates.
Blackbird is always in the market for unpredictable fun, though it may be more accurate to say that she is the bringer of that whirlwind to those close to her. Her knack for antics might make her seem a chaser of shallow cheer, but she possesses perception that pierce through facades, and a sharp tongue that is unafraid to speak the truth she sees.
Blackbird: Chaotic Bastard
Veloce is an intimidating woman of few words, with razor sharp instinct honed over the years for the battles of wits that her harbinger-of-chaos of a girlfriend loves to bring for some reason. She isn't always able to succeed, though, perhaps because Blackbird is just too much of a seasoned veteran, or perhaps because her soft spot for her brazen soulmate will forever remain her greatest weakness.
Veloce: Lawful Tired
These two extraordinary personalities collide in this extremely ordinary slice-of-life, driven by their passion for music... and each other. This comic can be read online on Amongst Us's website, or on Webtoons. 
Carciphona?
If these characters look familiar to you, it is because they are originally characters from my comic Carciphona, A fantasy story of 7 volumes 15 years in the running. I have grown so attached to the characters that I decided to imagine how their lives would go n a modern setting. While Carciphona is set in a world of magic, deception and destiny, Amongst Us is about daily fun, growth and love. 
Amongst Us can be enjoyed regardless of whether you have read Carciphona or not!
Book specs:
104 pages
7"x10", Soft cover
Full color
Comprising the first 20 episodes from the original online comic, work on the book is already complete and have been reviewed and color proofed and is ready for print!
Love is its own Reward (but also these are pretty sweet).
Readers of my past 9 book releases know I rarely do bonus merch to go along with books. But this time I've decided to put a little icing on the cake :D
As a digital reward, backers on all tiers will have access to a digital copy of the book. Available physical rewards include a set of two fancy mini prints, a hard enamel pin, and a limited quantity of signed bookplates. Here are the designs of the rewards!
{ Spot-glossed prints of Blackbird and Veloce looking fancy }

{ Disgustingly cute enamel pin }
{ All the bookplates are printed as transparent stickers and signed. }
A Labor of Love.
If we reach our goal to print Amongst Us - Book 1, we have two exciting stretch goals to add to the project! The details of each goal will be revealed only if they're reached.
{EDIT} Our first stretch goal has been reached! A bonus story will be added to the book, adding 6 to 8 pages of never seen before content!
{EDIT} Our second stretch goal has been reached! We have the funds needed to design and produce an acrylic lamp, that will be available for purchase at a later date.
{EDIT} Our third stretch goal has been unlocked - if we reach 90,000, we will add spot gloss to the book cover!
Hugs and Kisses!
Thank you for your taking your time and giving my comic a chance :D Please check out the comic here on its homepage or here on Webtoons if you haven't already, and share the story with your friends who might enjoy it!

campaign.story:
Love is hard–especially when you’re a 100 meter tall, radioactive dinosaur!  Embark on a reckless pursuit of romance as you leave the solitary life behind to travel the globe, meet other kaiju, and break into the dating scene. Don't allow tanks, bombs, and robots to stop your strange and destructive courtship rituals. Let love smash its way into your heart with Kaichu!
Kaiju tales are rarely, if ever, told from the perspective of kaiju since the spirit of such stories is that kaiju are like a force of nature.  Humanity observes and interprets but cannot truly comprehend.   It will be up to our reporting and expert analysis of the kaiju dates to maintain the ethos of the genre--kaiju aren’t big talkers.
Kaiju express their feelings and desires through a complex and destructive courtship ritual.  It will be up to us to interpret that destruction.  Through our expert analysis, we will discuss how the kaiju feel about certain aspects of that location as Gigachu deduces the likes, dislikes, or ambivalent opinions of its dates. The relationship then grows stronger or weaker depending on how well Gigachu’s answers match up.  Each kaiju is different and it’s up to Gigachu (and you the player!) to learn more about the other kaiju and apply that knowledge during each date.
 They are game dev duo from SoCal. They have been making indie games since 2009. Some of their games include Cat Poke, Tick Tock Isle, Merrily Perilly and A Book of Beasts and Buddies.
Also working on Kaichu:
Special thanks to Mark Sparling for letting us use his Kaiju Dating Sim song for the video endcap. Check out his Site and Twitter!
Kaichu is a small game with a fairly simple design system, but even small games require funding to get made! Kickstarter has been amazing for many indie devs and Squiddershins is hoping that a little KS love could be given to them as well.
Ryan and Jason already do the design, writing, art and animation themselves so they are just looking for some funds to pay for the jobs they can’t do.

campaign.story:
As humans, storytelling has always been part of our DNA. From the oldest of myths, to the newest book release, to the memories we replay in our head, the stories we tell ourselves are some of the deepest magic on the planet. 
The Threadbound Oracle is a 50-card deck themed around storytelling, magic, and the craft of bookbinding and manuscript illumination. Alongside it comes The Thread That Binds, an adult fantasy novel in which the cards appear--and whose characters appear on the cards. The Thread That Binds is a story about queer found family, healing from trauma, and keeping authoritarian abusers out of power in the halls of the world's oldest magical library. Together, the cards and novel weave a richer tapestry than when either stands alone, echoing the key theme at the heart of each of them.
Keep reading to see all the cards, find out more about the novel, and read an excerpt!
THE DECK
The Threadbound Oracle comes as a 50-card deck and 100 page guidebook. The cards will be printed on quality 350gsm cardstock with a textured linen finish, and are standard Tarot size (2.75"x4.75"). The guidebook will be the same size and contain interpretations for all 50 cards, as well as instructions and suggestions for using the deck. Both will be packaged together in a sturdy box shaped like a book, with a fancy magnetic closure to keep them safe.
The Threadbound Oracle contains 29 Story cards and 21 suit cards, all originally painted in watercolor and inks. The Story cards feature larger narrative archetypes much like the Major Arcana of traditional Tarot, while the suit cards deal with smaller and more specific meanings. There are three suits: Paper, Ink, and Thread. Each card is titled with three keywords to help you remember its intended meaning, though you're welcome to form your own.
Here's a gallery of the full card set for your viewing pleasure! You can also view them individually on my website or watch the Kickstarter video above for a flip through the whole deck.
THE NOVEL
Official cover art (by me) for The Thread That Binds.
The books are restless. At the Eternal Library, books are more than the paper, ink, and thread they're made from--they're full of spirits. Only a handful of people will ever be invited to the Bindery to learn the craft of etheric bookbinding: the creation of intricate illuminated manuscripts, Bound with a secret that will make them last forever. 
Tabby is a dreamwalker, a witch who escapes into the stories of sleep to avoid a birth family that's never loved em enough. Amane is a cartomancer, a medium who speaks for the Unseen, but doesn't know how to speak for her own needs. Rhiannon is highly psychic, an archivist who can See into the past, but only has eyes on the future.
Their stories intertwine as they discover the secrets of etheric binding, the Library's archives, and those of their mentors--the three of whom are competing to be the next Head Librarian, the Speaker for all the books. How do you know who's truly worth being part of your family? Sometimes we must forge connections in order to heal; other times, those bonds must be broken.
*You can read the first three chapters here to get a taste of the story!*
Some but not all the things you will find inside:
~*FEELINGS*~
Found- and bio-family dynamics
Entirely queer cast of characters
Multiple ace & aro-spec characters (including an aroace narrator)
Queer is the norm in society
Society without gender that's NOT androgynous! Two own-voices agender narrators!
Societies with gender, too!
Magic bookbinding
BIG LIBRARY ENERGY
Dreamwalking
Grumpy mentor with a heart of gold
Magic cell phones and other modern tech
Cartomancy
Pining for your coworker/helpless cinnamon rolls falling in love
Snarky banter
Getting new "adoptive parents" as an adult
Characters in a long term queerplatonic relationship
Cute old married couple who are actually both badasses
Art/writing/craft magic
Book-based religion & spirituality
General content warnings for The Thread That Binds include: emotional abuse and gaslighting (by parents, by a mentor/boss), discussion of emotional child abuse (does not happen on-page), minor character death (off page, peaceful), discussion of toxic friendships, descriptions of anxiety and PTSD symptoms. More specific and minor warnings will be listed at the front of the book.
The Thread That Binds is approximately the length of Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince. I love long books and I hope you do, too!
Illustrations featuring the main characters and their mentors.
Everyone who pledges to the Kickstarter will receive an ebook copy of The Thread That Binds, at a reduced price. The book will be available in all major ebook formats, including epub, mobi (Kindle), and PDF. Print books will be available at a later date through a print-on-demand service, possibly Amazon--I'll keep you all updated. All Kickstarter backers will get a significant discount coupon for the physical book when it's available! 
*The novel is currently in the editing process and this excerpt is subject to change prior to official release.
THE CREATOR
My name is Noel Arthur Heimpel, and I'm the sole creator of both the deck and novel. In 2017 I created and funded the Numinous Tarot, my own colorful queer take on the cards, which is now in its second printing. In 2013, a short story anthology I was published in (The Collection: Short Fiction from the Transgender Vanguard) received a Lambda Literary award. I've been a witch for 18 years, a card reader for 16 years, and an artist and writer for as long as I can remember. 
I am white, queer, and nonbinary. More specifically, I identify as agender, demisexual, and gray-aromantic. I am chronically ill and my experience with mental illness and trauma informs all of my art, writing, and approach to cartomancy. I love hiking and taking on too many craft hobbies at once--weaving, embroidery, bookbinding, spinning...I love working with my hands. Radical self-acceptance, anti-capitalism, and communal values are important to me.
OTHER REWARDS/ADD-ONS
The Numinous Tarot
Gif of different Numinous Tarot cards with flowers and crystals.
If you don't already have a copy of my first deck, the Numinous Tarot, you can get one with your Threadbound Oracle for a special reduced price and save on shipping! Normally, each deck would cost $40, but I'm offering a Kickstarter exclusive tier where you get both decks and the novel for $73. You can view all the cards in the Numinous Tarot here! It's a queer, nonbinary Tarot deck with all gender-neutral card titles and guidebook language.
If you want to add a copy of the Numinous Tarot to a tier that doesn't have it, please add $35 + shipping to your pledge. Additional shipping is: $3 for USA, $10 for Canada, and $20 for everywhere else.
The Numinous Tarot deck and guidebook
Magic Book Enamel Pin/Sticker
Do you like books? Do you like magic? Rainbows? SO DO I! This is my very first sot enamel pin design and I'm super excited for it. It will be approximately 1.5"x1.25" with two rubber pin backs. Here's a photo of the beautiful prototype I received from the pin company:
 If you want to add a pin to a tier that doesn't have it, please add $12 to your pledge (no additional shipping).
Backers who pledge to the very first tier for Just The Novel will get a free, exclusive sticker version of this pin.
Original Card Artwork
Every card in the Threadbound Oracle was originally painted traditionally in watercolor and acrylic inks. If you like, you can own one of these beautiful original paintings for your very own! Each one is 7.5"x12.5" and comes with an 11"x14" mat for easy framing. They are done with artist-grade archival paints on Arches paper, so they're made to last. As lovely as the printed cards are, the scanned colors never stand up to the original, and all of the gold paint gets lost in translation. Now you can enjoy them exactly how they were meant to be!
When surveys go out closer to fulfillment, you will be asked for your top three choices of painting. Choices are first-come-first serve! If you've REALLY got your heart set on a specific card, you can also message me during the campaign to reserve it. Please see the card gallery above or the one here on my website to make your choice.
The following cards are NOT available for purchase: The Artist, The Weaver, and The Song.
Holographic Bookmark
When I was a kid, I dog-eared pages all the time. Even in library books. I was a menace that way! And while I'm not afraid to crack a spine or really wear out a book with love, I have learned to love bookmarks. Everyone who pledges to a tier will get a free holographic bookmark featuring art from the cards. It's shiny!
PROFESSIONAL EDITING STRETCH GOAL!
Currently I am planning on paying for professional editing out of my own pocket, but if we hit the stretch goal of $15,000, I'll be able to use those extra funds instead! Professional editing is not cheap, nor should it be, and I want to pay my editor every penny they're worth.
WHOLESALE
PLEASE MESSAGE ME BEFORE SELECTING THIS OPTION FOR AN ACCURATE SHIPPING QUOTE!
As with the Numinous Tarot, the Threadbound Oracle is available at wholesale pricing for online or brick and mortar shops that would like to stock it! Currently, only the deck will be available, and not the novel. 
Shops can choose either a small order of 10 decks ($20/ea) or a large order of 20 decks ($15/ea), plus shipping. If you'd like to add an additional box of 20 to your large order, please add $300 + the listed shipping for your country to your pledge. If you have questions or would like a specific price quote for an amount of decks not listed here (minimum is 10), please message me!
CONCLUSION
I'm not the first person to connect a work of fiction with a Tarot or oracle deck, and I certainly won't be the last! The storytelling connection between cartomancy and prose is a strong one, and I hope that by offering them together, your experience will be all the richer for it. Thank you so much for reading and for any support you have to offer! I'm so grateful and amazed by the way people continually come out to support my work, and I wouldn't be where I am today without all of you <3.

campaign.story:
Saints’Quarter is an urban fantasy/horror-drama comic series that focuses on an odd little neighborhood between Brooklyn and Queens, NY, and the people both magical, non, or Otherwise, who live there. When two new residents move into the 'Quarter with the help of their witchy cousins, they find themselves in the middle of more and more strange and unusual happenings, even by the standards of their new home. 
The comic originally had a brief premier in 2013 under the name Beyond the Veil but was shelved for a while for rewrites and development until finally re-launching in its current form on October 1st, 2016.
The first two episodes are free to read online and Episode Three is currently in development to begin posting sometime in Spring!  
I've wanted to see Saints'Quarter in print since I started work on it four years ago and I've finally reached a point where I can happily say that it's time to get started! This campaign would pay for the printing and shipping of Episode One!  
The first book will be a 100 page standard trade-size (give or take 6.625" x 10.25") softcover volume. It will include the episode proper in full color, NEW and extended scenes, and never before seen bonus materials! We're talking concept sketches, a new entry into the S.Q. bestiary, never before seen lore pages! 
Not to mention that I've been hard at work revitalizing the original artwork of earlier pages! Long-time readers would know that there was a slight style change in the middle of Episode One when it was posting. I was still figuring out just what I wanted the series to be and how I wanted it to look. The book, however, will follow a consistent style from start to end! 
The Prologue is bright, shiny, and new!
Speech balloons are more organic! Character art is cleaner and more finished! 
And there is MUCH better focus on... well, the important things! 
C.R. Fahey (LotMinx) is a part-time sales associate, independent artist, and recovering Paranormal YA Romance addict living in Brooklyn, NY, with her roommate and small orange demon-child, Chai.
Other work by C.R. includes another webcomic she created, "Avibus", which has been running since August of 2014, and a decade-spanning collection of disconnected fantasy art and stories.
