campaign.story:
I am Eva a.k.a Hievaya, a French graphic designer. It's with a great pleasure that I decided to relaunch my first campaign with a much more smaller print run for those who was interested about the deck during the last campaign. I am so exited to share with you the project that I've been working on for several month and which is particularly close to my heart, since it's a project that links my passion for cards and my lovely job as a graphic designer.
A sneak peek of the 24 cards of The Runic Odyssey Oracle
Why and how did you create the deck?
I wanted to make runes more accessible and use them in another way than with stones or pieces of wood. I found it easier to use, I could use the illustrations on the cards to make my intuition speak, as I would do with tarot or an oracle, which was harder for me to do with classic runes (I have a better visual memory). I have also included keywords on the cards to make them easier to understand and interpret. It is also a good way to reflect on the link between the illustrations and the keywords. So, I thought that this way of using runes could also be useful to you as it was for me.   
Berkano and Raidho cards from The Runic Odyssey Oracle
Why did you choose this style of conception?
Concerning the design of the cards, I wanted to keep an aspect close to the organic matter especially with the color of the cards and the watercolor effects, but also the box with a darker green color which are close to the colors of the earth. These colors are universal and do not relate to any gender. I have integrated men and women and on some cards we cannot clearly determine the gender of the figures, a woman can have short hair,  a man long hair and vice versa.     
Back of the cards and Ansuz card from The Runic Odyssey Oracle
Why did you choose this name for the deck?
The Runic Odyssey... I wanted to make you understand, to you who would hold the cards in your hands, that a journey between you and the cards is about to begin. Sometimes in a draw and through the cards, we travel and have an intense reflection on ourselves and what surrounds us, this reflection, I define it as a spiritual odyssey, an odyssey that teaches us, advises us, and each message we receive from the cards is unique and leads us to meditation. Thus, I found it very symbolic, strong and relevant to give this name to the cards.  
Wunjo card from The Runic Odyssey Oracle
What does the Runic Odyssey oracle contain?
 The Runic Odyssey oracle contains:
25 cards with illustrations corresponding to the meanings of each cards with elegant gold hot stamping. 
8 moon phases cards
1 introductory booklet in English and French on the origins of runes and their meanings, how to use them and spreads methods.
A magnetic box for more resistance with gold foil and a ribbon to remove the cards easily.
A 15x20cm Ivory cotton bag with the logo from the back of the cards.
1 gold enamel pin
1 gold or silver long necklace (see the details down below)
The blank runes (or Wyrd) has been recently added. The card design will be revealed soon!
Using cards is also a sensory experience, having good quality cards is very important. Especially if we use them regularly. That's why I decided not to let this important factor be overlooked, and produce a premium quality deck.
Specifications :
 400GSM art paper A thick paper for a better grip, as the runes are made up of only 33 cards it was necessary to have a superior quality for more solidity.
 Matte UV lamination For a better sensory experience, a matte lamination is applied to the cards. This also ensures that there are no reflections on the cards.
 Tarot size 70mm x 120mm (2.75" x 4.75") size For hands comfort, cards have a traditional tarot size.
 Gold foil stamp For being able to stand out more on the card, symbolic elements (runes, astrological sign,...) is stamped with a gold foil stamp.
 Antique matte gold edge I have chosen this method rather than the usual method of gilding to have a soft matte finish which allows to benefit the touch of the traditional paper. While adding a little more cachet to the cards. Wear and tear is also less on this type of finish, as no gold particles come off when shuffling the cards. 
Minor corrections will be made on every cards, such as contrast, alignments,...
Antique matte gold edge
Magnetic lid hard box
The box also plays an important role in our use of the cards. Sometimes it's difficult to store and organizes large boxes in our shelves (I'm you sure you know what I'm talking about), so I decided to make a box the size of the cards for less clutter.

This little booklet is only an introduction to the very wide and vast universe of runes, when you start, it's sometimes difficult and quite intimidating to dive into a big book full of information and finally let the cards stand beside you by fear of doing things wrong. That's why I wanted to introduce you gently to the origins and explanations of the cards, so as not to overwhelm you with information, but also to leave a place to your intuition. Because yes, if a card speaks to you differently, because the illustration evokes you of something else, do it. Everyone uses the cards in their own way and no one is going to keep an eye on you to check if you are using the cards as the manual teaches you, let your intuition speak to the cards and follow it, you may even be surprised and experience your most telling and instructive spreads. campaign.story:
For every single time an abuser has told me to be quiet, this is the book where I will be heard, vocal, and LOUD. 
Over a year ago I ran away from home due to physical and sexual abuse, along with attempt murder, and a past history of kidnapping, this is my story. "When She Set Fire to My Friends' Houses" is a comic memoir about abuse that is first and foremost, dedicated to all the survivors out there past and present. Sharing my own stories in visually non-triggering manners, this book speaks about: the abuse itself; how it affected me; people's reactions to the abuse; and escaping.
The entire comic is available online to read for FREE on my website (vincylim.ca) in order to make this comic accessible for all survivors and non-survivors. Especially for those survivors who wish to read this comic, but would be in danger for owning a comic about abuse. The kickstarter is to bring the physical copy to life and into your hands! If able to, please consider backing this project to help bring this comic into it's physical form and share it amongst other survivors and non-survivors in order to share the knowledge that healing and recovery is possible and that we exist and thrive despite trauma!
The completed comic book will be around 50 pages, full colour, and saddle stitched (stapled!) I am still in the process of completing this comic and due to the nature of my working habits the page count is an estimate for now! The full comic will be finished around the end of March-Early April! I have been posting progress pages onto my instagram (@kiwimii) as well as onto my website (vincylim.ca)
Drawn in an experimental comic style (No panels! No grids! Absolute freedom!)(Maybe too much freedom?) and naive drawings, I create imagery based on my own feelings rather than direct visuals of what happened, and create non-triggering visuals along with heavy blunt text. This is my most visually experimental comic yet and I'm really proud and happy with how it reads emotionally! 
FUNDING
$1130 for printing
$100 kickstarter fees
That's it! Very simple! If the kickstarter goal surpasses the goal I will use the money to make more books and pay myself for my efforts (Nice!!!)
The cost of $1130 is for 200 copies, in which I will give to you kind folks (!!) as well as sell at TCAF (Toronto Comics Arts Festival) this May (9-10th) !!! 
PHYSICAL REWARDS
 $25 - Vol. 1 + 2 Physical Copies!
Includes my award nominated first comic memoir about abuse! I made it over two years ago when I was still under abuse and it's my first attempt at comics making and memoirs in general!
$25 - Physical copy + Sapphic Charm! (above image is a sample of the charms! for more charms please look at my Etsy! @kiwimii !!)
$28 - Physical copy + pencil case! (Pencil case will be randomized!)
$35 - Physical + Gal Pals Tote Bag 
$55 - Physical + Complete Comics Bundle! (Above is one of the comics! For complete list of comics please look at my Etsy @kiwimii under "zines"!!!)(Excludes "Mickey" and "Froggo")
$70 - Physical + Original pencil/inked page! (Pages will be randomized!)
 $150 - Physical + original thumbnail book!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Since I am a disabled person with physical and mental disabilities, it may take a bit longer than the end of March, early April deadline to complete the entire comic! However I will try my best to give constant updates on the status of the comic as well as any hindrances! I have created a late deadline for backing rewards to give myself a month extra worth of time! Most likely it should run without problems! However if there are problems please be kind to me, since some of my physical disabilities include problems with limb movement (such as with my arms and hands!) and vision loss. Usually my symptoms don't act up for more than a week so it should be alright! 

This is my first kickstarter and first time printing such a long (and full colour!) book so there will probably be bumps down the road! I will try my best to communicate everything the best I can! Before printing I will do a one issue test run with a local printer to make sure everything looks OK. Afterwards I'll print with my printer, so hopefully (fingers crossed!) everything in terms of printing wise should be good!

updates.update_content:
Hello friends!
Just a quick update to inform those who don't know yet, that I'm reading this comic aloud in an event hosted by the Canada Comics Open Library this Friday from 7-9PM along with some other really amazing comic artists!! If anybody wants to stop by and listen to comics read aloud in an accessible manner (we'll be verbally describing the visuals!) then drop by! It's completely free with no registration needed beforehand.

Hello my friends!

Tonight I have finished the new ending of this graphic memoir! It’s been tough I’m not going to lie, to write about such recent trauma that I haven’t had enough time to process yet (aka my abusive ex and what happened during that time). It’s hard because I felt so hopeless escaping abuse, literally running away, and ending back in abuse a month later. But what I realized was, it’s not one month i’ve been free from abuse. It’s 6.5 months now. In this time I have been healing, recovering, and surviving and I’m doing well. I’m happy and I feel good and some days I don’t have a single bad thought in my head. And some days that goes on for weeks on end to the point I feel something is missing.

Hello to you all! Time has flown by a lot faster than I ever could possibly imagine! A backer requested an update (thank you for that! I hadn’t noticed the time at all since I’ve been so busy so thank you thank you!) and I’ll do my best to update you all about the situation at hand, as bluntly and honestly as possible!

About the graphic memoir:

How do you kind folks feel about this comic being risographed?! I have a printer in mind, who I am in contact with, and best of all they're local, a small business, and somebody who I've worked with before to beautiful results! The price per comic has increased a good amount, however, after checking the numbers, it is completely doable to work with them & print the comic in risograph! I'm very excited as risograph is extremely beautiful + eco-friendly (soy based inks + less energy consumption!) Hopefully you're all fine with going from a digital printing to risograph! Personally I think it's a step upwards, however if there are any complaints/concerns please let me know and I'll do my best!

updates.update_content:
Content warning: below contains mentions of abuse + physical & mental health problems + suicidal ideation + extremely long in length (for transparency but also i’m so sorry omg)
Hello folks! It has been a long while and I hope you’ve all been happy and healthy or at least relatively content! I’ve been working very hard to regain and maintain my health. I apologize greatly for the long absence, for a long time doing daily necessities like drinking/eating was immensely difficult, so things like splitting my daily energy usage between necessities and typing up this update had to be done slowly day by day when I was able to afford to. On top of this my situation continued to change and worsen so I had to continuously keep re-writing this update and having the energy and courage to do so, especially after so long. I have been trying my absolute best to walk the fine line of pushing myself without injuring myself for many months now, growing with less success with each day, until recently (2 weeks ago?).

Hello folks! Sorry for the delay in updating, I've been writing, deleting, and re-writing the update trying to figure out how to put my words together for the past week or so. There was also a long long update when the kickstarter was completed, which unfortunately got deleted before publishing due to internet issues, and the whole update was lost (then the events below occurred).
I am going to be 100% genuine and honest about what's been going on the past few weeks because I think that's very important to do! I've been self isolating at home with my partner due to corona virus, and it was fine at first but roughly two weeks ago I relapsed into another suicidal episode. Due to severe abuse, I've been battling suicidal ideation for all of my life. My first attempt was roughly at 6 years old, though might have been younger. The suicidal episode, which I am not fully recovered from, was quite severe resulting in my partner hiding all of the medications, knives, and quite literally anything I could hurt myself with in the middle of the night.

campaign.story:
Three years ago we published a set of Major Arcana based on Lovecraft's stories, magnificently illustrated by Sara Bardi. The deck, composed of 22 cards, was presented in two editions, and since then we have been receiving messages from our beloved backers asking for a complete deck. Sara set to work with the new art... and  today we're proud to introduce you the new edition of the Eldritch Tarot!
This new black edition consists of 78 high quality cards, adding 56 Minor Arcana cards to our original Major Arcana.
Cups, based on Under the Pyramids by HP Lovecraft & Harry Houdini
Each suit is set in a story by HP Lovecraft, where each card represents part of the story, all with unique illustrations, following the outline of the Minor Arcana.  
Pentacles, based on At the Mountains of Madness.
We will offer this deck with the same quality that you found in the Major Arcana edition. The cards will be printed in high quality European paper, in 320gsm with the elegant linen finish that provides a nice texture to the cards.  
Card detail, front and back.
This campaign also comes with extraordinary add-ons: an exclusive bag to protect your cards, a Cthulhu wooden case for collectors and the incredible new Cthulhu Idol in limited edition. Read more below! 
The Major Arcana cards
Card detail, Four of Cups
Such a special deck deserves an equally special bag to carry it anywhere well protected. Following the designs of the deck, we are producing a customized fabric to prepare these bags one by one, hand-stitched by The Sewing Cat. 
Exclusive custom bag for your Tarot deck, handmade
Where do you keep all the power in this deck? 
We have prepared a very special wooden box for collectors, carved with the figure of Cthulhu like a true relic!
These wooden cases will be produced in limited units specially for this project. Note: the color of the wood or the tone could vary in the final production.
Cthulhu carved wooden box for collectors

We have been waiting a lot of time to launch the complete deck, and to celebrate we decided to create a unique idol that would match the designs of the deck perfectly.  
Cthulhu Idol based in the cards design, limited ed.
Hand-sculpted by our collaborator The Monster Box for this project, we are introducing a limited edition of the Cthulhu Idol, produced in resin and painted by hand. 
The idol, different views
The Idol is 15cm high and 12cm wide (5.9 x 4.7 inches). Book a space on your shelf!  
Note: Images not to scale. Some designs may vary in the final product.
Please choose your reward to check the shipping cost for your country. As usual, part of the real shipping cost is subsidized by Cthulhu Project to thank our backers support.
This project has been created with the collaboration of Sara Bardi (art), Marta Lopez ‘The Monsterbox’ (hand-made sculpt and painting) & The Sewing Cat (handmade & custom bags).
The Cthulhu Project has previously produced, with the help of our backers, the Eldritch Tarot-Major Arcana deck, board games like Cthulhu Crusades and The Writer or collector's products like the Cthulhuoshkas, Mountains of Madness statuettes, Whispers from R'lyeh, Innsmouth The Lost Games and more.
All contents are based on the works by H. P. Lovecraft. Cthulhu Project is a tribute to our favorite writer and all our projects are produced with the support of our backers.
All the contents have been created with a lot of LOVE and MADNESS. Thanks!

campaign.story:
Going Steady is a 200+ page comic anthology about solid romantic partnerships. From daring exploits to quiet, intimate moments, Going Steady is about the fun of sharing your life with somebody special. These stories celebrate the romance — and adventure — of loving partnerships, whether your relationship is a brand new spark or an old flame.
From “Failure to Connect” by Dani Chuatico
From “Making Time” by Carolynn Calabrese and Rachel Weiss
Most stories about relationships focus on endings and beginnings. But here at POMEpress, we believe that there are plenty of fun, exciting stories left to tell about the moments in between. We love romance comics, and with Going Steady, we want to show that the excitement of love doesn’t fizzle out the moment you and your partner decide to build a life together. Sometimes the most thrilling adventures are the ones you tackle as a team!
We also know that it takes time to build a strong relationship. That's why we extended the maximum length of the comics in Going Steady, giving you and our creators plenty of time and space to fall in love with these stories and characters.
From “A Mystery for the Morchella Detective Agency” by Ashley Robin Franklin
From “The Teddy Bear” by Cameron Lucente and Bo

campaign.story:
Adventure. Romance. Psyche.
Across the void between the realms, a mysterious bond links Torrin and Becca...
In Issue 1, Becca soon realized that her recurring nightmares were much more sinister than mere dreams.
Hey everybody, welcome to OtherRealm Studio. I'm Paula and this is my project, SoulBound. SoulBound is a ten issue comic series about Becca, a college student thrown from the world she's always known into a realm of magic, myth... and monsters. There, she finds perils greater than she's ever faced – and a love greater than she ever imagined. Though much in this world is beautiful and strange, she must find a way to return home, or risk losing herself in the void between realms – forever.
This is issue two, Escape, in which we get to know the second hero of our story, Torrin. Captured by an insane sorceress who intends to transform him into a monstrous slave, his only hope is to escape before she can complete her spells. But when Becca lands in his prison, he must find a way to save them both.
The SoulBound comic series means a lot to me, and I'm committed to seeing it through. You can preorder issue 2 now through this Kickstarter and once it's printed, I'll package and ship it myself so that it arrives safely. I also still have a limited number of first editions of issue one, so you may be in time to order a catch-up tier! These are all printed on classic newsprint with glossy cover stock, and my artist Mia and I will sign every copy that goes out to our backers.
Issue 2 is nearly complete – all we need now is to go to print. I would greatly appreciate your help. This is an epic story of adventure, romance, and psyche, and it deserves to be told. It's set in the OtherRealm, an alternate universe where lost civilizations, extinct creatures, and mythical beasts have one last chance to survive. I have so many dreams for this world beyond the comic series, but I'm starting here to prove that people still love epic tales of wonder, danger and daring.
Please share this campaign! I'm just one person but I promise I'm creating something great for you.
I've found the best people to help me – my amazing artist, Mia, my awesome letterer Wes, and now, a wonderful musician, Christen, who composed and sang the background music to this video. You may be wondering why a comic needs music, but I'm telling you, this is more than a comic. It's an entire world that I'm trying to express as completely as I can. In issue three, there is a song that is also a spell, that I wrote the lyrics to and Christen composed the melody for. This song develops over the course of the series, recording and affecting the events of the story.
The SoulBound series is truly special. I hope you join me on this journey to make it reality.
And I'll see you in the Other Realm.
(The above is what I was going to say in the voiceover for the video - unfortunately, mic issues prevented that.  You do get to listen to Christen's beautiful composition though!)
Mockup of SoulBound 2: Escape cover - actual fonts will be different
The response to SoulBound 1: Adrift was tremendous, much more than I asked for, and made so many things possible! I've been working hard to get as much done for issue 2 as I can before launching this Kickstarter - art is well underway, and Mia and I are including some special extras for this issue! I fully expect to be ready to go to print by the end of this campaign.  Posters, trading cards, replicas of Becca's amulet necklace, and behind-the-scenes sketches and lore of the Other Realm are just the beginning.
Torrin isn't having a great dream at the moment, either...
The SoulBound series is outlined at ten issues to give the story room to explore the best of the Other Realm. Issue 1: Adrift contained a classic isekai beginning for Becca, and Issue 2: Escape showcases Torrin's skills as a warrior and escape artist - as well as the perils of this strange new world.  With Becca's arrival, Torrin now has her life as well as his own to consider. Will this newcomer be an asset to their survival - or a liability?
If you missed the Kickstarter for Issue 1, you can still jump on board with Issue 2! I thought of this when I wrote it - I know how it is.  I promise you won't be lost - you'll just start the story from Torrin's perspective.  Or if you like, you can still get Issue 1 in the Catch Up reward tiers. You need to hurry though - those Issue 1s are limited first editions and I don't know if I'll be reprinting them.
Let's see what Torrin's made of...
I'm excited to be bringing you the newest chapter of this epic fantasy comic! My greatest goal is to deliver an unforgettable story of hope, survival, and heroics to rival anything else out there.  As an indie creator, I'm free to stay true to my unique vision for this series, leaving in the sort of authenticity that's all too often smoothed away by major media corporations that attempt to make everything fit their brand. 
 SoulBound is an unabashedly heroic tale of good versus evil, where souls can be injured by cruelty - but also healed through compassion.  Courage in the face of overwhelming odds,  clever problem-solving, and sacrifice for the sake of others - these qualities make heroes. Becca and Torrin both must prove themselves according to their unique strengths.
I've taken great care with my characters, and I'm not taking the lazy road by having Becca turn into a great warrior while Torrin suddenly forgets how to survive without her, or vice versa, in order to showcase one or the other character. There's more than one way to be strong, and these strengths spring from each of their unique characters. If you are even half as tired as I am of stories that disrespect what they've established earlier in order to shove in some gimmick, you know what I mean. SoulBound is written to be even better on the reread, when you realize just what seemingly small details truly signify. 
The Other Realm is a massive world of several eras, and the SoulBound series within it is an ambitious project. I'm working hard every day to earn and save the budget to hire my amazing artist Mia and my wonderful letterer Wes. I won't ask them to work for money I don't have ready and set aside. They deserve a reliable paycheck. 
This crowdfund is so my incredible readers can preorder their copies, and to raise the funds necessary for printing and shipping the print run. There's no risk that the comic won't be finished. It's practically done already. Mia's got all the layout done and is sending me the pages to color as she finishes them, and lettering and formatting should go very quickly. 
New! Trading Cards featuring Becca against a Sword & Planet-inspired backdrop
Here's a look at the people behind the project:
Letterer:
 Wes Locher has written comics for Alterna Comics, Titan Comics, Markosia Enterprises, Arcana Studios, and more. His lettering work has appeared in comics published by Alterna, Inverse Press, ComixTribe, and countless others.
Artist:
Mia Pearce is an illustrator with a love for character, comics and creatures! She has earned a Bachelors degree in Fine Arts with a concentration in Illustration as well as over 6 years of freelance experience. Comics have been Mia’s current adventure;  working with client projects such as the inks of SoulBound and scripting a story of her own, ParadoxTheorem. You can check out more of Mia’s work at themiapet.com or check out her Instagram @thisismiapet for more recent art and future comic progress.
Creator/Writer/Colorist:
And then there's me, Paula Richey. I've been told that I spend too much time on some other planet, and if that's not an endorsement for a writer of sci-fi and fantasy, I don't know what is. Also I have a superhero novel coming out this year from Silver Empire Press, set in the Heroes Unleashed universe, and you can get a sample of those characters from my short story in the Paragons anthology, Soldier Out of the Desert, also from Silver Empire Press. I'm also an artist, specializing in digital paintings - which is very different than sequential line art, so I'm thrilled Mia did the art for the comic!
 For Issue 2, I want to take a few precautions and learn from my mistakes on the campaign for Issue 1! You all were so generous for the first campaign, and that turned out to be a really good thing because I underestimated the cost of my new packaging materials a bit - and I couldn't resist adding in a couple extras to the rewards for my wonderful backers. Thank you all so much for your faith in this story! I'll do my best by you, always. 
Limited Trading Cards and Amulet Necklace
This year, printing and shipping costs have increased, so I'm setting the goal for this campaign at $1,500. I want to be sure to use the best packaging so your comics arrive in great shape! I didn't have nearly as many Gemini Mailers left over from last time as I'd hoped and I'd like to buy them in bulk for the best value. I do fulfillment myself, since shipping used to be my job back in the day and I still have the system down pat. This saves all of us some stress - I get to do a final inspection and I also know exactly how far to trust the post office with packages. Instead of shipping via Media Mail, I'm using PirateShip to get the best deal on postage. *Sometimes* the post office has been known to open Media Mail to check if it really qualifies as such, and I'd rather not risk having them repackage it.
Stretch Goals
I want so much to continue this series in style - and also to get started as soon as possible on Issue 3. There's so much to tell! Increasing production speed would mean a lot to me.  So the first priority for funds raised over the initial goal is to get Mia started on the cover and art for the next issue.  Every bit helps and I appreciate every one of you. If we can cover production costs for Issue 3 as well as this issue, you'll all get a digital version of Issue 3 when it's ready!
$2000 - Extra digital swag for everyone! Desktop wallpapers, printables, and more!
$3000 - Posters and extra goodies added to print rewards, and a new digital item for every backer!
$5000 -  Getting close! New poster featuring a special guest colorist! 
$6000 - We made it! Digital Issue 3 for all backers!
$10,000 - This is the point where this page will turn into the official preorder page for both issues 2 and 3! I should be able to print and ship enough of both issues to every print tier backer - a below-retail bargain for you, and a dream come true for me! 
Beyond? Well... I certainly wouldn't object to being able to book my artist for the rest of the year, or even for the rest of the series! I have not done the math this far and there would almost certainly be unforeseen circumstances. I'd make something nice for you but I don't yet know what.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The main risk for this project is if it doesn't fund completely - the art and lettering are paid for, and the only thing left is to get enough preorders to go to print. In that case, Kickstarter would refund everyone, the print run would be delayed, and you'd have to order your copies from my site. If anything I haven't considered happens, I will keep you updated!

campaign.story:
Hello, I'm Crylica, an artist and designer from Sydney, Australia~ I love the Fire Emblem community and all the memes and fan content that comes out of it. I want to give back and share these tea bags with everyone! You may have seen photos from Twitter or Instagram where I share my works and process.


I plan to make all characters from the 4 houses: Blue Lions, Black Eagles, Golden Deer and Ashen Wolves, and also Female/Male Byleth! I have designed the first 10: Dimitri, Claude, Edelgard, Felix, Hilda, Bernadetta, Ashe, Marianne, Linhardt and Female Byleth. The other characters will follow a similar style! Their designs will be revealed during or after the Kickstarter.
Please note designs are not final, and may change.
If you have any suggestions for other characters, fill out this form! Maybe I'll draw the gatekeeper, who knows.







PLAY

Please note the Gazebo will NOT come assembled as it is delicate and will break in the post. I will send the pre-cut paper pieces, so you only need glue to assemble it. I hope it will be a fun DIY project! I will post a tutorial on how to assemble it! There is only a Blue Lions design.

What is Kickstarter?
Kickstarter is a crowdfunding platform. It allows creators to start projects with very low budget. You can change your pledge/unpledge any time while the Kickstarter is live. Once the funding period ends, you will be charged and I will start finalizing the Teatime Charms and other rewards. I will send you a survey through Kickstarter, asking for your address and which characters you pledged for. Please fill out the survey as soon as it comes out, to avoid delays in sending out your reward!
Will these be available outside of the Kickstarter?
Yes! Everything will be available on my online store later but will not have Kickstarter discounts. Kickstarter rewards are prioritised over shop preorders, so I recommend backing the Kickstarter while it is live.
How do we choose which character we want?
I will send a survey once the Kickstarter ends requesting for your shipping address and which characters you pledged for. Be sure to fill it out when you get it!
Help! Did I pledge the correct amount?
Message me what you want on Kickstarter and I can check your pledge for you!  It should be the tier you pledged + any extra rewards (charms/gazebo) + shipping to your country.
I need to change my address!
If your address is changed after the submitting the survey, please send an email to crylicakress@gmail.com as soon as possible so I can reship to the new address. If I am notified after the order has been shipped, the buyer is responsible for reshipping fees or any other costs incurred. If you will be moving addresses at the time of the survey, but don't know your new address yet, please clearly state that in the survey and I will hold onto your order until you notify me of your new address.
 I don't have a credit card, can I still back this campaign?
Yes! You can back this project using a Visa debit card. 

Feel free to ask any questions! If you aren't sure whether you pledged the correct amount, message me on Kickstarter and I will get back to you!

You should treat them the same as a normal acrylic charm, and be careful to not put too much pressure since they can pop.

campaign.story:
first things first...
At the time of this campaign's launch, Kickstarter's employees were in an ongoing fight for unionization. On February 18th, part of the way through the campaign, their efforts were successful, and Kickstarter United was officially certified by the NLRB! They are currently in the process of negotiating with senior leadership.
This campaign stands with Kickstarter United's ongoing unionization efforts. For more info, head to their website or follow them on twitter. 
#RecognizeKSRU
about the game
i'm sorry did you say street magic is a citybuilding storygame, where players collaboratively explore a city that they create together. Each turn, a player adds to the city either a Neighborhood, a Landmark, or a Resident, nesting cards inside of each other to showcase and spotlight the relationship between the city's inhabitants, and the places where they live. These cards are then complicated by Events that take place in the city: festivals, elections, ceremonies, natural disasters, mysteries, or discoveries that change the flow and focus of play. As you play cards, you unearth the city's true names — quirks and qualities that make this place wholly, intrinsically unique. 
what does this game center?
 Minimal prep for GMless gaming: i'm sorry did you say street magic is easy to pick up, and easy to learn; the game can be played with as little as a copy of the rules, a few pencils, and a stack of index cards. You can play the game with a facilitator, but every participant makes equal contributions to the world. Rules-light, guided play makes it easy for veterans and newcomers alike to pick up the game and jump in quickly.
 Genre-agnostic storytelling: A game of street magic can tell the story of a classical high-fantasy kingdom, a futuristic cityship on a galaxy-spanning journey, or a fabulist facsimile of your own hometown with a magical bent. The tone, setting, and content of your city are all established by you and your fellow players!
 Episodic, vignette-based play: Unlike many other tabletop games, i'm sorry did you say street magic doesn't focus on any one specific group of characters. Players jump between the various different parts of the city, taking turns embodying a myriad of different inhabitants. These slice-of-life stories might result in overarching plotlines as the city expands, but they could just as easily be snapshots of characters who only show up once before returning back into the crowd. street magic doesn't have any single group of protagonists; the protagonist is the city itself.
 Simple campaign incorporation: The game can be played as a standalone one-shot, but it was also designed with long-form play in mind. Players can also revisit the same city multiple times, exploring it from multiple angles. A group of players could easily incorporate this game into an ongoing campaign, as a "session zero" one-shot or as an interlude between longer arcs. For Game Masters, playing i'm sorry did you say street magic as part of your campaign is a great way to lighten your session prep workload beforehand, and to help your players feel invested in the world they're going to explore.
The game supports 2 to 6 players, though it works best with four or five; a single session runs anywhere from three to five hours.
The final version of the game will include illustrations by Shannon Kao, from her art zine You Can't Get There From Here, as well as custom art commissioned specifically for the game.
A city in progress as the game unfolds!
what people are saying about the game
"This is not a mapping game, or rather, it does not conceive of the map as a hegemonic concept of spacial relationships. The city this game constructs is a shifting set of relationships and perspectives, arbitrary faces of a far larger body. The magic of the city is not a quantifiable property, but the qualitative relationships it grows between its individual pieces and residents, and how they move and react to each other." — Geostatonary, designer of Battlefield Lovers and Prayers For Wounded Metal
"I'M SORRY DID YOU SAY STREET MAGIC is for answering important questions, like 'What if Brooklyn just ... walked away?'" — Jay Dragon, designer of Sleepaway
"one time I played I'M SORRY DID YOU SAY STREET MAGIC and then we played a different game and needed to do some worldbuilding and accidentally started playing I'M SORRY DID YOU SAY STREET MAGIC again because the framework is that straightforward and intuitive" — Sasha Reneau, designer of Spindlewheel
"the game slaps" — Viditya Voleti, designer of Space Goblins! and Space Between Stars
tier rewards
Backing the campaign at the Tourist tier ($10 USD) will get you a digital edition PDF copy of the game. The final digital PDF will come in both full color and black-and-white editions for ease of legibility. I'll handle PDF distribution through itch.io.
Backing the campaign at the Resident tier ($15 USD + shipping) will get you a physical, printed zine edition of the game. The final sixty-page zine will be 6.5" x 5.5" with staple binding, a full-color cover (front and back), and black and white interior printing. I'll be printing the final zine through Mixam.
This game has been available for purchase on my itch.io page for almost a year now, and I know that many people already have copies of the PDF. For those who have already bought the game on itch.io, the $15 tier will get you a physical zine without paying extra for the digital edition (which will be released on itch when the campaign ends).
Backing the campaign at the Neighbor tier ($20 USD + shipping) will get you both the PDF of the game, and the physical zine! If you don't already have a copy of the PDF, this tier is the best way to get both the digital and physical copies of the game at once.
Please note that the physical zine tier (Resident and Neighbor) prices listed above do not include cost of shipping, which will be added onto your pledge through Kickstarter as you finish backing.
community copies!
I believe in the importance of making games accessible for people who can't afford them! In the past, I've added digital community copies of my work on itch.io so that people who can't afford the game at its current price can still have access to it.
I'm going to replenish the pool of free communal copies once this campaign ends, but I also want to make sure that as many people as possible can claim them. To that end, I'm also implementing a community copies model for this campaign: for every $10 USD you add to your pledge above the minimum pledge cost, I'll add an extra digital community copy to my itch.io page for somebody to claim down the line.
This reward will stack! For example, if you decide to back at the Neighbor + Community Copy tier ($30 USD + shipping) but you also add an extra $10 to your pledge on top of that, you'll be donating not one, but two community copies to the pool.
the campaign
My goal with this Kickstarter campaign is to make a physical print run of the game to turn it into a zine. I'm hoping to raise for $1200 to make that happen! Here's how that money breaks down:
$150 for printing
$200 for shipping and fulfillment
$150 for art (to pay Shannon for the license to use and make minor modifications to her artwork, and to commission a few new small pieces)
$250 to cover the costs of editing, revisions, and layout consultation
$200 to compensate myself for writing and layout
$100 as a buffer
$150 for fees
i'm sorry did you say street magic is proud to be a part of the Zine Quest 2020 Kickstarter Event! For more great zines and other projects, check out Kickstarter's Zine Quest 2 page.
stretch goals!
In the spirit of Zine Quest's scrappy, DIY nature, I initially planned out only one stretch goal: at $2,000, the physical zines will be printed with perfect binding instead of staple binding. [ACHIEVED!]
However, because of the overwhelming success thus far, I'm excited to announce that I'm adding extra stretch goals in the form of a bonus supplement to the game!
street magic’s core ruleset invites players to build their city entirely from scratch, and to craft the world from consensus. I love that process of creating a world entirely from nothing, but I know that it's asking a lot from your table! Sometimes you’re playing a game with folks who haven’t played a tabletop RPG before, or your co-players need a bit of guidance to find an idea that really clicks with them. Sometimes you just want to build off of a foundation that's already there!
easy streets is a supplement to the game that will be designed to help support more structured pick-up play, as an anthology of quick-start city decks! Think of each city deck like a playbook shared communally among the table: it will include some backstory and flavor text, a handful of cards, and a range of open-ended prompts intended to spark your imagination.
The easy streets supplement will be delivered as a print-and-play PDF along with the final digital zine: at the start of a session, you'll be able to just present a copy of the booklet to your co-players. If you all decide you want to use one of the quick-start decks, all you'll have to do is cut up the cards, and jump right in!
At $5,500, worldbuilding masters Takuma Okada, Viditya Voleti, Ben Roswell, and Samantha Day will each contribute a city to the supplement. [ACHIEVED!]
At $6,500, we’ll be receiving one additional city deck apiece from the inimitable Nell Raban, Amr Ammourazz, Pam Punzalan (Pammu), and Sasha Reneau. [ACHIEVED!]
At $7,500, we’ll bring the supplement up to a round dozen, with decks contributed by Ben Chong, Natalie the Knife, Abe Mendes, and myself! [ACHIEVED!]
At $8,500, we'll be adding cities by Manu, Quinn Vega, Geostatonary, and Jamila R. Nedjadi of Sword Queen Games into the mix! [ACHIEVED!]
At $10,000, and for every following stretch goal, every person contributing to this campaign (writing, editing, art) gets a pay bump. This pay raise will happen every $1,500. Pure and simple! [ACHIEVED x8!]
about the team!
Hello, my name is Caro Asercion! I'm a nonbinary, Filipino freelance tabletop game designer and theatremaker based out of the San Francisco bay area. I've been playing tabletop games off and on for several years now, both as a facilitator and a player. I've also written multiple other games that you can find on my itch.io page!
One of my favorite things about tabletop games is the communal creation process: a roleplaying game is a conversation where each person contributes to the story. By the end of a really satisfying game, everyone at the table has built a memorable, shared experience, and each participant has left their fingerprints on a world that wouldn't have existed if any one person had been absent. I designed street magic as a way of placing that ritual of communal creation front and center.
Though I'm handling the layout, distribution, and fulfillment for this campaign myself, I couldn't have gotten this far without the work of my fantastic creative support team:
 Kai Gee is a Taiwan-based editor from California. She will travel the length of the country to cuddle the sweet dog in her photo (as long as that country is under 250 miles long). As an editor and writer, she values a tight sentence, but as a player, she adores games that let her build or inhabit sprawling worlds. You can visit her website at waityouwhat.com for your professional needs, or find her as @alpha3nine on Twitter, where she rarely forgets her "no capital letters" shtick and is almost always excited about something.
Kai has already given a ton of crucial feedback, and will be doing another pass once the game's layout is finished! I couldn't have asked for a more thoughtful, precise editor during the revision process.
Shannon Kao is an artist from Seattle, WA who works in comics and illustration. She's interested in stories about how places—real & imagined—shape the people in them. You can find more of her work at shannonkao.com.
Shannon's evocative, atmospheric art style and fabulist portrayals of urban life make her work a perfect match for the street magic — she was gracious enough to let me use her art in the zine, and she'll also be contributing a few new pieces to the project as well!
Quinn Vega is a queer game designer, graphic designer, and musician based out of Portland, OR. Her games include For The Honor, Lightning Kissed, and cowriting Songs for the Dusk with Kavita Poduri. When she is not making or playing games she works making microphones and leading her band, The Variants. You can find her on twitter @Mx_quinn and her work at mxquinn.itch.io.
Quinn has already offered a ton of support in helping me refine the layout of this book! As I finalize the black-and-white print edition and shift toward making the color PDF, her artistic insight is going to improve the quality of the final digital product immensely!
Final thanks and attribution
Before I wrap this campaign pitch up, I want to give a few final thanks to some folks without whom this project wouldn't have happened:
 i'm sorry did you say street magic was originally published as a hack of Microscope by Ben Robbins.
Thanks to Ross Cowman from Heart of the Deernicorn, who offered me crucial advice on organizing and preparing for this Kickstarter.
To my friends and peers in the tabletop design community, who have offered incredible support to make this game and Kickstarter campaign the best they can be.
…And a very special thanks to you, the person reading this! If you've made it this far down the page, I hope that you'll consider backing this project. Your support means the world to me — thank you!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The text of the game is completely written, and the game's black-and-white layout and illustrations are almost entirely done as well. The black-and-white PDF of the game only needs a few more adjustments to the layout and art, at which point I'll be splitting my focus between adding color to the digital PDF, and getting the black-and-white copy ready for print.

Though I've backed a number of Kickstarter projects and am well and familiar with the process of fulfillment, this will be my first time running a Kickstarter from the production end! In preparing for this project, I've received a lot of advice from other tabletop designers who have run Kickstarter campaigns before. Between the aggregated advice I've received from these designers, and working with a reputable printing company like Mixam, I have confidence that this project will come together cleanly.

All physical packages will now come with Stonehand Badge! The badge is the iconography of the Stonehand Tribe of the Wastes and with Nymeran Calligraphy "Five as One" written underneath the stone hand. 
Approximately 2x2" in size. Designed by Hamm Liu
Glow is an ongoing comic series by Ray Chou and Vincenzo Ferriero with art by Anny Maulina and Dia Jia.
Glow takes place in a world where magic catalyzed both industrial revolution and nuclear holocaust. Half a millennia ago, an ancient and powerful empire known as Nymera developed a means to channel and store magical energy into a sticky blue substance known as anima, storing them into massive Towers across the world.
With the aid of the Towers, the Nymerans brought peace and paradise into the world. Until one day the Towers fell.
The story of Glow takes place two hundred years after that cataclysmic event, and follows the story of those who remain.
Issue One introduced us to Caszy and Koken, siblings scavengers of the Wastes with extraordinary abilities.
Issue Two continues the story as the witch Myra makes a compelling proposition.

Issue Three explores the aftermath of a misunderstanding.
In Issue Four, the town of Shoddai is given an ultimatum. 
Magic in Glow is channeled through the language of ancient Nymera, the former masters of the world. In order to flesh out this cornerstone of the story, we've been collaborating with Niamh Doyle, an Estonian linguist and enthusiastic conlanger.
Nymeran is used a number of ways in the comic, including sound effects.
Each digital edition of Glow comes with a language guide that unlocks the secrets of ancient Nymeran.


Ray Chou and Vincenzo Ferriero are the writers and creators of Glow. Together, they’re the founders of the creative imprint known as Mythopoeia. Glow is their second comic book series after the the dieselpunk airship adventure Skies of Fire. Ray is based in Los Angeles and Vince in London.
Anny Maulina is an artist from Indonesia and creator of the webcomic Raruurien. She also enjoys working on comic and art projects on her spare time. You can find her on Patreon and DeviantArt.
Dia Jamandron was born in Iloilio City, Philippines and moved to California with her family. She currently works for Wild Canary Animation . Check her out on instagram!
Bryan Valenza is an artist based in Jakarta, Indonesia. He currently occupies his time coloring various projects, including Skies of Fire and Witchblade. @bryan_valenza
Born in Barcelona, Cristian Docolomansky Cerda (C.D.C.) is an inker and letterer based in Chile. He's worked with several publishers such as Alterna Comics, IDW, and Ariete Producciones. You can find him here.
Niamh Doyle is a from Ireland and with a background in linguistics and teaching, Niamh works in financial crime compliance. In her spare time she likes to play a board game or two.
Hammond Liang is a self taught illustrator who often goes by the name of "Hammling." Growing up in a tiny apartment in Chinatown NY, he always had a fascination in all things art. From martial arts to dance to illustration, he combines all of his experiences to bring motion and life to his artwork. You can find him on Art Station and Instagram.
Giulia Frontoni is an Italian illustrator based in Rome with a focus on creature designs. She helped bring to life many of the beasts found in Glow, as well as the postcards and button pinups! crocodev
Alexandur Bucur is an architect and illustrator with an interest in history and military hardware of all kinds. When not at his drawing table he can be found standing at attention in a swanky uniform for the benefit of the Military Traditions branch of the Romanian Army. He helped bring together many of the technological designs found in Glow. http://wingsofwrath.deviantart.com/

campaign.story:
My name is Fyodor Pavlov, and I am a queer illustrator and tattoo artist.  In my work, I strive to evoke a sensual and esoteric world in which the past is present, the present is queer, and gender is fluid. The occult has a deeply rooted influence on my art, and tarot is a major part of my own personal practice.  
Photo by M.H. McFerren
The tarot is fascinating as an art object capable of communicating universal experiences through the versatility of its iconic images. It is also a powerful tool for self-discovery, meditation, and exploration of our circumstances and the world around us. Creating my own deck over the course of the last four years has been a revelatory, inspiring, and deeply rewarding experience, and I am thrilled to finally share the results of my work. 
Major Arcana
The Fyodor Pavlov Tarot will be a complete deck of fully illustrated Major and Minor Arcana cards. Each card has been painstakingly researched and delicately hand-painted with ink and watercolor. The cards will have rounded corners and will be printed on 340 gsm paper. The stars on the backing designs (currently white in the mock-up) will be printed with gold metallic ink. The deck and the guidebook will come packaged in a sturdy lidded box, and the guidebook will be perfectly bound.
My deck pays homage to Pamela Colman Smith’s seminal tarot illustrations, and draws inspiration from my own lived trans and queer experience and my personal interpretations of the cards. The result, I hope, is a deck that is accessible, comfortingly familiar, yet welcoming and refreshing to a new generation of diverse querents.
Minor Arcana - Wands and Coins
Minor Arcana - Swords and Cups
Creating seventy eight illustrations rich with history and meaning is an incredibly daunting and time consuming task. I decided from the beginning that I did not want to make future readers wait and for myself to feel rushed while I worked on the art. Though I am still finalizing the layout of the guidebook and the design of the boxes, all the illustrations and writing are complete. All I need is the funds to enable the Fyodor Pavlov Tarot to come to life! 
More information about the creation of my deck can be found on Patreon. You can also find my work on my website, on Instagram and on Twitter.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is my fourth crowdfunding campaign through Kickstarter, and I plan to use my past experience as well as the advice and help of experienced colleagues to ensure its success. Printing a tarot deck independently is a challenge, and I wished to cut no corners on a project so long in the making. After doing my research, I have found an incredible printer for the project - Expert Playing Card Company, who are responsible for some of my favorite decks. I am also working with tried and true manufacturers to create all the special extras I am including in the reward tiers. But covering the costs out of pocket is simply not feasible for a working artist. Which is why I need your help!

Backing the Kickstarter will function as a pre-order system for the deck. The funding goal was calculated based on my estimates to cover all the costs the project will incur - the printing of the decks themselves, the boxes, the guidebooks, the stickers, enamel pins and prints, as well as the price of packaging materials, shipping and handling, and Kickstarter processing fees.

I wanted to keep the project simple and satisfying. Therefore there are no special stretch goals - any money I make over the funding goal will go towards printing more decks to fulfill backer requests.

campaign.story:
Decay. Crawling through the mud and rot for a chance at absolution...
Fungus. Soft roots grow through your body, holding you back from the secrets of life...
Mold. A thin layer of fuzz covers a book of secrets too terrible to bear...
Pollen. Something stalks you on your journey to the temple, choking the air from you with its presence...
This is MYCELIUM and Other Horrors.
It's coming. Can't breathe.
What's All This Then?
MYCELIUM and Other Horrors is a Zine Quest 2 compilation of 4 Incursions for The Gauntlet's fabulous Trophy Dark, based on different allergens that torment us all. Each incursion is a horror adventure unto itself, each one with a different theme: DECAY, FUNGUS, MOLD, and POLLEN. The adventures are horrific, psychologically intense, and likely to end in doom and pain for all involved. They are intended for Trophy Dark, but could probably be played in any system.
MYCELIUM and Other Horrors features artwork by Labjer and layout and graphic design by jim pinto of post world games.
Who Are We?
We are The Eldritch Tomb, a small tabletop RPG publishing company run by Tristan Jusola-Sanders (sometimes known as Sasha De'ath). We are a loose collective of gaming professionals using our contacts and skills to put out high quality RPGs, supplements, and other sundries. Previous efforts from the Tomb include HORRORS FROM THE TOMB and the free supplements DALE: A Background For Troika and Blood and Gold: From The Ashes - Character Race: Lizardfolk for 5th Edition D&D. 
Where Did This Come From?
Allergies have long been a source of pain and suffering for our benefactor When Jason Cordova of The Gauntlet offered small creators a grant for art and layout in exchange for organizing a ZineQuest offering for their Trophy RPG, we decided there was no time like the present to inflict that misery on to others. But, like, in a fun way! The philosophy and psychological horrors of the scenario come from introspection and fears of Tristan Jusola-Sanders, and we hope they will resonate with others.
Besides, of course, the logistical planning, budgeting, and so on, we have completed around 1/8th of the text, all the artwork, and preliminary work on layout. Furthermore, we have an agreement in place with Exalted Funeral for fulfillment, and have contacted multiple printing sources for potential pricing on printed copies. This has given us our approximate budget.
What's The Plan?
If successfully funded, we seek to finish writing and editing around 7500 words in a swift and orderly fashion, over approximately 2-3 weeks. From there, the book will be sent to layout for around 1-2 weeks and made appropriate for the ZineQuest format. Once that is completed, we'll send it to our chosen printer for a more accurate assessment on pricing and begin printing proofs. That's where it gets fuzzy - we have never dealt in physical product before, so we're uncertain on exactly how long that will take.
Once printing is complete and authorized, we'll send the printed books to Exalted Funeral for fulfillment - which, gods willing, will take around a month or less to get all copies sent out.
We're giving ourselves a delivery time of December 2020 to give a generous window to deliver by ("Before Christmas!"), but plenty of time to account for diversions, difficulties, and other detrimental damages to our scheduled time frame.
Why You?
Because we are tremendous fans of everything involved here - of working in RPGs, of grim introspection, of dark fantasy adventures, or rules-light RPGs, of everything. We've backed countless Kickstarters and seen what they can be, and what happens when they fail, and while this is our first project, we have every intention to succeed. We are passionate about delivering a quality product, an evocative set of adventures, and an excellent Kickstarter experience going forward.
Stretch Goals?
As this is our first Kickstarter, we have opted to forego stretch goals in favor of reallocating any excess funds back into the project. Exceeding the goal will ensure fair and equitable wages for the creators and workers involved in the project, as well as greater certainty of fast and successful delivery.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As this is our first endeavor with Kickstarter, we tried our hardest to set everything in stone. However, a few of the budget items are variable - such as printing and shipping costs. We are mitigating risk by relegating fulfillment to our partners in Exalted Funeral, but if costs fluctuate too desperately, we could potentially be put in a bind, especially regarding shipping. Furthermore, we don't entirely know what to expect - if we drastically exceed our goal expectations, our printing prices will rise. This is budgeted in, but it is a complication to be aware of. Essentially, we're expecting the best but prepared for the worst!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

HELLO AND GOODBYE, MYCELIUM ARMY!
Wow wow wow wow f**kinggggg...wow. Just wow. It has been a long and challenging road, myconids. All copies are shipped, all invoices tendered, the barstools are all flipped and the lights are going out. Last call, friends!
This is the end of the road for MYCELIUM and Other Horrors. Copies will be live on in the next 24-48 hours, digital copies are available on and , and this Kickstarter is winding down.

GREETINGS, MYCELIUM ARMY.
I'm sure a pile of you have noticed, but Exalted Funeral has been DELIVERING!! Almost every book should be in people's hands now - I've gotten a note or two about fulfillment mistakes that I'm working to fix up. This mega sucks but we're doing everything in our power to make it right.

updates.update_content:
Hey gang! All but four signed/personalized copies were sent this morning. They should be there within a week or two. If you don't hear anything in a month or so, message me on here and I'll try to get you sorted.
The four copies that did NOT ship are overseas copies. The reason they could not send them is because none of my local post offices have the necessary customs paperwork. This is frustrating. I am so sorry they're going to be yet further delayed, but I'll do my best to make it right.

project_data.project_name: MYCELIUM and Other Horrors: 4 Incursions for Trophy Dark RPG

campaign.story:
The Game
Night Reign is a tabletop roleplaying game of stealth, guile, violence and devilry. You are a member of the Red Right Hand, a disgraced intelligence agency fighting a guerrilla war against covetous noble houses in the streets and atop the rooftops of Laenfendport, an Edwardian fantasy metropolis.
Based on Trophy Gold - which is also Kickstarting right now! - , Night Reign adapts that game's push your luck mechanics, fragile characters and costly sorcery to tales of revolution and vengeance from the shadows, with innovative card based mechanics that to push the theme and feel of stealth gameplay home. As part of Kickstarter's ZineQuest 2 campaign, you'll get a complete RPG in zine form, with a capsule setting of faux-Edwardian urban dark fantasy that will appeal to fans of Dishonored, Thief, and Blades in the Dark. 
The Zine
Night Reign is part of Kickstarter’s ZineQuest promotion, and will be available as a 48 page, b&w A5 format zine. We’re working with Biddles Books (who also printed Quietus) to produce an authentic zine feel, using a cream bookwove paper to give it a nice heavy feel for a relatively small product.
Everyone who backs at the zine level will also get a complimentary PDF version of the zine via DriveThru RPG. The PDF will be available in pure black and white for home printing, and a colour version to emulate the paper and coloured cover of the hard copy zine.
Laefendport
The scabrous, rainslick metropolis of Laefendport was mere decades previously nothing but a collection of hovels and shacks, home to scavengers who scraped a meagre existence salvaging whatever they could from the many ships dragged into the notoriously treacherous waters to its immediate east, and wrecked on shores so jagged and jutting it seems as if the very earth was reaching up in protest. Its name meant Liars Port, a reference to the treachery of both its tides and its residents.
Let me walk through the stinking alleys, to the music of drunken bearings. PJ Harvey, The Last Living Rose
The rain there, black as a moonless winter sky, viscous and inert, falls near constantly and poisons all but the hardiest, most unappealing plants, deforms and drives animals mad, and leaves anything it touches greasy and stained. For centuries, only the desperate or the touched would go anywhere near Laefendport.
Until, that is, the Eisenhart Process, an alchemical process by which the Night Rain can be filtered and made combustible. Suddenly, there was a freely available source of fuel literally falling from the sky. Free, at least, until the noble families arrived to harvest it. The city and the influence of the Nobles grew at a malignant rate, until both seemed to cover everything.
The people call the Nobles' oppressive regime The Night Reign. You're here to end it. By your hand, the Night Reign will fall. 
Stealth
You're outnumbered and outgunned, but the shadows are your greatest weapon. Night Reign uses a modified form of blackjack to model the push-your-luck, tense tactics of stealth video games, and lets you really feel the threat of being caught. 
Freedom soon will come, then we'll come from the shadows - Leonard Cohen, The Partisan
The higher your score, the more stealth tokens you'll gain, which can be used to achieve the goals of the adventure. If the deck ever runs out, you fail your mission, and a perfect score allows you to reshuffle the deck - but go bust and you'll be caught and have to fight your way out! Do you hide and wait for the perfect moment, or make a risky dash for glory? 
Guile
The riskier the action, the greater the reward. When you run up against opposition that can't be totally avoided, it's down to you and your wits to find a way around it. The wilder your plan, the quicker you'll be through, and time is always counting down. 
Threw my bad fortune off the top of a tall building. PJ Harvey, Good Fortune
But the more cautious you are, the more information you'll get before you make the draw. Play it your way!
Violence
Sometimes, things are going to get nasty. Whether you've been caught, or you're more about spilling blood than hugging the shadows, members of the Red Right Hand didn't get that epithet for nothing. Simple to run, but tactically deep, Night Reign's combat system is all about reading your opponent's moves, choosing when to defend and when to strike, and can run anything from a single master swordsman to a rioting mob in just a few rounds. 
On a gathering storm comes a tall handsome man, in a dusty black coat with a red right hand - Nick Cave & The Bad Seeds, Red Right Hand
But be quick - the longer a fight takes, the more chaos tokens you'll accrue, and the harder it will be to go unnoticed - and the messier and darker things will get in Laefendport.
Devilry
Laefendport does not traffic with gods. The sea swallows everything that dares come near, and the sky pisses down black tar onto the land. If ever anyone prayed to a god here, their prayers were demonstrably not answered. Instead, Laefendport has the Sisters. They are not things to worship, they are things to blame misfortune on, to curse, to avoid. If you mutter their names in a prayer, it is to ask that they overlook you for another day.
Well, if you're gonna dine with the cannibals, sooner or later, darling, you're gonna get eaten. - Nick Cave & The Bad Seeds, Cannibal Hymn
At any time, players can draw from the Sisters deck to create an unnatural effect - bursting into a flock of crows, filling a room full of impenetrable shadows, or summoning a swarm of rats to do their bidding, amongst other macabre powers, and gain an automatic 10. But draw the card that corresponds to the sister whose power you are leaching, and they'll turn their eye on you.

UNLOCKED! We'll be getting full page illustrations from Kasha Mika to complement their awesome existing spot illustrations.
UNLOCKED! A new digital scenario for Night Reign from Diana, aka Superdillen, host of the Fem NPC YouTube channel and the Femsplained podcast, author of the 5e Neverland Setting and creator of those D&D TikToks you retweeted!
Here's the pitch for Diana's scenario The Bootleggers...
"During times of hardship, the desperate have sought to buy harvested night rain from unwanted sources. Often those that do find themselves in possession of a poorly filtered and unstable substance, resulting in poisonings, explosions and worse. Rumors have made it to your ears of some peddlers that must be dispatched - and their source of night reign redistributed to the ones that they sought to take advantage of."
UNLOCKED!  A new digital scenario from Sabine V, one of the awesome writers on the core Trophy RPG. Here's the pitch for Sabine's scenario "The Firstborn is Dead":
"One of the prominent noble patriarchs has died, and much to the disgust and distress of his family, without leaving a will, or a (legal) heir. But scuttlebutt would have it that one of The Red Right Hand's own is his bastard... or perhaps even a legitimate heir as he was rumoured to have wed in secret as a foolish young man. Now all you need to do is break into the Palaces of Justice, one of the most heavily guarded buildings in Laefendport, to get the documents that prove it..." 
UNLOCKED! We'll be getting a digital scenario"Down by the Water" from Natalie Ash, winner of the Trophy incursion contest. writer on the core Trophy RPGand one half of Ember and Ash! 
"A month of rough storms at sea has delayed the ships of one of the dynasts fleets, and you’ve learned a shipments of guns is just sitting in a warehouse. You might not be able to take off with a whole ship’s worth, but even a few crates can make a difference. Fortunately, you know a dock worker who owes you a favor."
UNLOCKED! I'll unlock the secrets of Laefendport in the Night Reign SRD, a web based creative commons version of the ruleset that will allow you to build your own stealth based RPGs.
Ruled by Night - sinisterbeard.com
Our final stretch goal at £6,000!  If we reach £6,000, I'll be working with Evan Whakahau (@maori_nerd on Twitter) to create a full alternate setting as a digital supplement for Night Reign, inspired by one of my favourite stealth video games, The Mark of Kri, and Evan's knowledge of Māori culture: Mohtuhoarri, an archipelago on the other side of the world from Laefendport.
The Team
Oli Jeffery - Game Design and Layout
Oli is a games designer with a taste for the macabre. He successfully Kickstarted and delivered Quietus, the roleplaying game of melancholy horror, in 2019. Oli wants to bring the feel and the mechanics of stealth video games to tabletop RPGs and Night Reign is his answer to that.
Oli will also be handling the layout for the book, and is an accomplished graphic designer focusing on RPGs. His layout work can be seen in Quietus, Legacy: Life Among the Ruins 2E, Dust, Fog & Glowing Embers and the first two volumes of The Gauntlet's Codex zine.  Chat with him about RPGs and horror movies at @ojeffery.
Kasha Mika - Illustrations
Kasha Mika will handle interior illustrations for the zine. Their striking limited colour-palette artwork can be seen in previous Sinister Beard Games products Quietus and Videostore, and retweeted across the internet. They enjoy listening to pop-punk music and podcasts, playing tabletop games with friends, discussing gender and sexuality in media, and making art constantly. Check out their work at  kashaprinzing.art.
Harriet Moulton - Cover Art
Harriet Moulton has produced the game's evocative cover art. Harriet's main focus is art and stories about older lesbian characters. She currently resides in Bristol, England and you could not pay her to go live in the idyllic countryside again where she spent the first 18 years of her life. See her portfolio at harrietmoulton.co.uk for more.
Misha Bushyager - Sensitivity Editing
Misha is a longtime gamer and designer working on making sure the next generation of geeks sees themselves represented. She's a panelist, writer, editor, proofreader, and sensitivity reader for tabletop RPGs and larps. Misha is one of the founders of New Agenda Publishing and a curator for More Seats at the Table. Her writing was recently seen in Fate of Cthulhu.
Funding
At the core level, you'll be funding: illustrations from Kasha to help bring the world to life; sensitivity reading from Misha Bushyager, and cover the cost of printing and postage. In short, you'll be paying to make the best version of the book that we can.
Funding for the cover art was provided by The Gauntlet. Thanks to them for the loan and for the licence on Trophy that makes this game possible.
Rooted in Trophy - Fulfilled by DriveThru RPG
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
In line with the ZineQuest spirit, I’ve tried to keep this campaign as low risk as possible. It’s a short, low cost run. All stretch goals aside from the additional full page art will be digital only so there’s no danger of holding the project up.
This is our second Kickstarter after successfully funding and delivering Quietus. All costs should be covered by the budget of the Kickstarter, and I've focused on paying the people I've commissioned before myself.

Printing and distribution will be handled by Biddles Books and KixTo, both of whom I have a good relationship with and who have delivered excellently in the past. PDFs will be handled through DriveThru.

The rules of the game have been written and playtested, but the full text of the zine will be written post Kickstarter. I believe I’ve budgeted enough time to account for this in my delivery goals, based on past delivered projects and commissions.

The UK is currently undergoing some political upheaval as the result of leaving the EU at the end of last month. Fluctuations in the price of the pound are possible and almost all other staff working on the project work outside of the UK. I've allocated a contingency fund in the budget to account for this.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Say hello to Sinister Beard Games!
updates.update_content:
Hey everyone! Just a quick check in to let you know that the profile name for this account will soon be changing to Sinister Beard Games. When I made my first couple of projects Sinister Beard Games essentially was just me so I just used my own Oli Jeffery profile, but thanks to all you wonderful backers I'm now in a position to publish other people's games.
We've got one coming out next week in fact! It's called Extreme Meatpunks Forever and it's written by Heather Flowers and Aura Belle. It's going to be fantastic. But it would seem a bit weird to have a game I didn't write launch under my name so that's why the page will shortly change from "Oli Jeffery" to "Sinister Beard Games"!

The proofs for Night Reign arrived today, and they look fantastic, so we're going to print. With three months grace, that means even the most remote of you should get it in advance of the December deadline! Check them out here! 
(BTW, if you missed the Kickstarter and these beautiful pictures have you cursing your luck, you can still pre order here and be in the first lot sent out)

campaign.story:
What is Paint The Town Red?
For those who may be new to this story: Paint The Town Red is a dark romantic comedy about vampires and werewolves who happen to be very queer!
Volume 1 was Kickstarted last year, and followed a werewolf named Winny as she dealt with running a werewolf shelter with her friend, Odile, while also struggling with issues of the past rising to the surface by another werewolf named Emerson. Her life is turned upside-down when a wounded vampire named Vic ends up at the shelter, but as it turns out, the two hit it off pretty good (maybe more than good). That is, until Vic brings Em home for Winny to meet, unaware of their past.
You can read all of Volume 1 online here!
Volume 2 continues the story of Paint The Town Red as it left off in Volume 1.  Emerson is encouraged by an overzealous Vic to stay at the Barlowe shelter and due to Winny's discomfort and unwillingness to say no to Vic, allows this all to occur.  Add in a new vampire into the mix with a very complicated history and Volume 2 is sure not to disappoint in the area of dramatics.
Volume 2 will be, like the first book, 10x7", with about 120 black & white pages!
Click this image to get a taste of Paint The Town Red by reading the first volume online!
Volume 1.1?  Where's 1.2?
Our initial printing of Paint the Town Red was labeled Volume 1.1, because we were convinced the book would come out a lot more slim. HOWEVER, it turned out to be a hefty and nice volume!  During this Kickstarter, along with Volume 2, we will also be reprinting Volume 1.1, now renamed Volume 1 (the comic content will stay exactly the same, save for that number on the cover & a few surface-value tweaks).
We are still offering Volume 1.1 copies at a discount price on the Kickstarter to deplete the original print run for those who wanted to give Paint The Town Red a try at a bit of a discount! 
PTTR Volume 1.1 final printed copies.
The Rewards
02/14 EDIT: The Volume 1 PDF is now available by adding $10 to any tier. The PDF will automatically be added to the Werewolf tier and up.
02/07 EDIT: Any backers of a physical tier (Baby Vampire and up) will get to pick a monster patch of their choice!
The Goal
The goal of this Kickstarter is to not only raise funds in order to print more stock for both Volume 1 and Volume 2.  We, perhaps, miscalculated the success of this story and have come to the conclusion that our print runs need to be a little bit bigger.  A good problem to have in all honesty!
This is why all of our stretch goal(s) are primarily created to improve upon the books themselves with enhancements:

Any surplus funds made on this Kickstarter will serve to create more stock and help fund more of our LGBTQA-based projects moving forward!
This is also why we chose to keep the reward tiers very clean, concise and simple!

Who We Are
Windy & Wallflower is a collective of only 2 artists: Windy (Tasha Mukanik) and Wallflower  (J. KIakas) who create a multitude of very LGBTQ+ media of varying disciplines.  They are most well known for their work on: The Sanity Circus, Prism Knights, The Myth about Myths and VVVTrilogy.
You can find out more about them on their website here: 
WINDYWALLFLOWER.COM
