campaign.story:
Drown Your Heroes.
The stories we tell are often not of gallant survivors but of the hard-pressed, star-crossed crestfallen. They are the poetry of the broken and the inhuman breakers: haunting things, deep and dark and bellowing things, unfathomable things that consume all that edges to their precipice.
Sunken is a tabletop roleplaying game about these things.
It is a tabletop roleplaying game about these things and the sea.
It is a tabletop roleplaying game about how your characters find their doom among these things while at sea.
Sunken shifts the focus of the world of Trophy onto – and below – the vast and treacherous Salt Sea, expanding "That Silent Howl" from Codex: Void into a full stand alone system that remains rooted in the mechanics of Trophy Dark.
What's It Like?
Return of the Obra Dinn, The Terror, Alien, Bioshock, Sunless Sea, Rime of the Ancient Mariner ... Sunken frames naval and sci-fi horror in a world of dark fantasy. 
How Does It Play?
As a Rooted in Trophy game, Sunken heels toward evocative storytelling over a simple framework – perfect for dramatic one-shot sessions. The original Trophy ruleset has been modified to put emphasis on the themes of dreadful ocean expeditions while keeping the overall structure lean and straightforward.
Character creation is a simple spin of the cypher: Choose your background, your job, your faction, and – if you choose to believe in that kind of thing – a patron saint.
Sunken's magic comes in the form of answered prayers to eerie saints
You might be the estranged heir of a great family, turned marine under the black-skull flag, hoping to regain the worth of your heredity. Or maybe you're secretly a Company automaton, stationed as a surgeon with that crew of vagabonds, ensuring through subterfuge that valuable secrets stay within corporate hulls.
Each voyage is divided into five tides, a series of distinct acts that uniquely raise the stakes and tension of your adventure. As you take risks to weather these tidal terrors, you'll roll dice to determine outcomes. Accumulate dice across three pools:
 The Flesh – For each skill you're able to utilize from your background and occupation, roll a die from this pool.
 The Deep – Decide how much the power of the sea drives your action, but with each die you take, increase the chances that you lose some sanity. As your mind succumbs to the depths, find yourself steered more and more by the call of the sea.
 The Heavens – An icon of hope amidst the torrent. Your fellow players can offer you divine intervention: extra effect applied to a success. If the Heavens rolls low, lose some faith in a higher power and hasten your descent into the deep.
Sunken's design heightens the feeling of navigating a capsizing character, encouraging you to pull power from the void while sliding you down an accelerating slope to your doom. 
What's Included?
Whether digital, print, or both, you get:
 Rules – A standalone nautical hack of Trophy.
 Voyages – Three in total. Inky beasts, bred with dark magic. A utopia built within the carcass of a leviathan. A fateful run-in with a cursed hive mind. 
 Shanties – Splinters of the history and lore of the Salt Sea, useful bits to fill your own voyages with.
The zine itself is:
A 8.5" x 5.5" staple-bound zine in classic zine glory, for print backers.
Gorgeous, with cover art by Gianna Meola, endpapers by Jenny Neale, and historical etchings for good measure.
Accompanied by a second mini-zine called The Drowning Scriptures – one of the campaign's stretch goals.
Sunken's layout blends historical and modern design – evoking the setting while providing clear information design. Chapters will be divided by original patterns. Note: This is mockup and not a final spread.
Which Three Voyages?
 A Covenant of Silence – A prequel/sequel/reboot of "That Silent Howl", where your crew finds itself infested with the East Passage Company's most profitable – and predatory – cargo. Find the nearest friendly face and hug them dearly.
 This Colossus Beneath – A hard-fought tip leads to the rumored dwelling of the Company's missing founder: a submerged utopia architected within the corpse of a leviathan. The timely shock of a breaching insurrection may provide opportunity to poach this belly of the beast.
 Futility's Wreck – Slogging through the icing shawl of the south, the crew of Futility find themselves not half a league from a hulking barge inhabited by cultists adorned in death's mark. This cursed band think and breathe as one, and they collect proselytes unfettered by the hardening sea.
Are There Stretch Goals?
Oh, heavens yes. 
And they've been hit by the generous backers that have come before you.
Richard Ruane (Barrow Keep) and Natalie Ash (Richter: The Rotting City) will be adding their haunting storytelling to the zine's Shanties & Lore section, adding characters, settings, and terrors in the form of found fragments.
A second mini-zine will be included with all reward levels, with a Kickstarter-exclusive print run being delivered to print backers. The Drowning Scriptures explores the eerie gothic faith of Sunken's seafarers, and includes:
More lore fragments, backgrounds, and apocryphal saints
A voyage by Madeleine Ember (Richter: The Rotting City) ... a pilgrimage following the miracles and martyrdom of a major saint
Additional artwork by cover artist Gianna Meola 
Whatever else we can pack in with the final run of backing funds
Who Is Involved?
Our core contributors represent all of America's coasts: the Great Lakes, the Gulf, the Atlantic, and Pacific.
Mike Martens – Designer, writer, creator. I'm a brand and UX copywriter transplanted to Los Angeles, applying the skills of my trade to my love for games and genre fiction.
Gianna Meola – Cover artist. Gianna is an illustrator and cartoonist, currently living and working in Brooklyn, NY. When she's not drawing she likes to volunteer with animals.
Jenny Neale – Pattern artist. Jenny is an artist and illustrator based in The Sunshine State. Shes enjoys yoga, good food and adventures in nature.
Etchings in the public domain, including work by Gustave Doré and John Flamsteed. Ocean recording in preview video by Mike Koenig (CC BY 3.0 US).
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Frankly: This is my first Kickstarter, so there are certainly question marks.

That said, my decade+ background as a professional creative gives me a firm understanding of production processes and the surprises that arise in them. I have experience and support sources across the project workflow. And I've built the scale of this Kickstarter to minimize critical points of failure. 

Sunken's ruleset is complete with refinements already in testing, sped up by its reliance on the extensively tested and played Trophy system.

At this point, you should have access to the digital edition of Sunken in your inbox. For non-backer stragglers, it's also available for purchase here.
Celebrate by downloading it, reading it, gazing lovingly at it, tweeting about it, telling your IRL friends about it from a safe distance, or – heck – tossing a half-full snifter against the ground. (I take no responsibility for the aftermath of this final one in particular.)

updates.update_content:
Time is meaningless, isolation wears at the mind, and mysterious horrors await beyond the walls that hold you safe.
What a time to be working on a game about all that! 
So, how progresses the voyage into this sea of terror? 
It's been awhile, so this'll be a big update. Generally, I'm still pacing for late June. I'm anticipating print copies could push into July, which'll stink if it happens – but maintaining the quality goal will be worth it. Shouldn't be a big shift, and I intend to deliver the digital edition as soon as printing begins.

We Venture Forth, Seafarers
Hi, folks. 
First of all, thank you. It's plainly exciting that so many people are about this concept, and this feels like the start of some big things.
Bonus Announcement!

The time is upon us to welcome the sweet embrace of Death.
In 2011, we the editors, Kelly Phillips & Claire Folkman, set out to create a dedicated outlet for female and femme comic creators to share their experiences with the world. Over the course of 10 issues, hundreds of women from around the globe have entrusted us with works that are insightful, hilarious, heart-warming, compelling, honest, and real.  Through the magic and generosity of Kickstarter and our supporters, we have been able to bring these exceptional comics into the mortal realm, and for that we will be eternally grateful.
Now, the time has come to lay our all-girl comic anthology in its final resting place with our tenth and final issue: Death.
"People living deeply have no fear of death." --Anaïs Nin.
 Dirty Diamonds is an award-winning all-girl comic anthology that features the semi-autobiographical work of female and femme comic creators from around the world. Each issue of this anthology series focuses on a central theme, and for our tenth and final installment will feature comics and artwork from 70 creators from 6 different countries, each highlighting different stories all about DEATH.
What we're trying to do:
We've collected all of the comics, so now we need your help to make this book a reality! This campaign will enable us to publish this book and pay all of the incredible creators who have contributed their work. 
The final product will be a perfect-bound, 8.5" x 11", 252 page book featuring an otherwordly special guest cover by Shivana Sookdeo!
Watch below for a deep dive with the editors into some of the comics that best represent that humanity, vulnerability, and authenticity of the work our contributors created:

Dirty Diamonds is edited and published by Kelly Phillips (Weird Me) and Claire Folkman, drawing buds since the 7th grade. Holding down the fort on either end of Philadelphia, they have been the loving parents of the all-girl comic anthology since 2011. The goal of Dirty Diamonds has been to give the women of comics a dedicated outlet for telling their stories, and artists from around the world have contributed their semi-autobiographical comics over the years. Gathering these personal stories has allowed them to highlight both the talents and experiences of women in comics today.
They won the Philly Geek Award for Comic Creators of the Year in 2015, and the DINKy Award for Best Anthology in 2017 (for Dirty Diamonds #7: Imagination). Copies of all nine of Dirty Diamonds' previous issues have been donated to the permanent comics collection at the Library of Congress, with an open invitation for future issues (including Dirty Diamonds #10: Death!) to also be added to the archives.
Kelly is a cartoonist living in Philadelphia, and the creator of the comic series "Weird Me" about her teenage years as the moderately successful webmaster of a "Weird Al" Yankovic fan site. She likes cats and outer space, and continues to channel her embarrassing personal history into comics as a cheap form of therapy. Twitter/Instagram: @kellypcomics
Claire is an artist living and working in Philadelphia, PA. She creates out of Mercer Street Studios where she makes comics, collages, videos and costumes. Instagram: @clairecatharine
If you have any questions about Dirty Diamonds or would like to reach the editors about anything whatsoever, feel free to message us here on Kickstarter, email us at editors(at)dirtydiamonds.net, or get in touch with us in any of the following places:
Twitter: @DirtyDiamondsYo 
Instagram: @DirtyDiamondsYo 
Tumblr: dirtydiamondscomic.tumblr.com 
Facebook: facebook.com/DirtyDiamondsComic
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have previously published Dirty Diamonds #5: Comics, Dirty Diamonds #6: Beauty, Dirty Diamonds #7: Imagination, Dirty Diamonds #8: Sex, Dirty Diamonds #9: Being, and editor Kelly Phillips' Weird Me: The Complete Collection via Kickstarter with great success! All of the projects exceeded their initial goals, which allowed us to produce the books on schedule, create/send all rewards out to our backers, and pay all of the contributing artists as planned. Visit our creator profile to view our past projects.

With lessons learned from our previous campaigns, we've streamlined and improved our publication process, production schedule, and rewards expectations. We have everything lined up with our printer and have a distribution plan in place, so all we need is you and your support!

The biggest risk involved with this campaign is that if we don't reach our goal, we won't be able to pay our contributors. :(

Note: No part of this Kickstarter's funds will go directly towards the editors as profit. All funds have been budgeted into our artist payments and business expenses. Any extra funds that are raised will go directly toward the production and distribution of Dirty Diamonds.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

ALWAYS SINKING, NEVER SUNK
The Garbage Barge has been slogging up and down the coast for years, putting into port and accepting unwanted things in exchange for gas to keep the tugboats running. It is a towering, leaking wreck, and it’s your home. You are a wizard or a pirate radio operator or a raccoon or a barge worker, or maybe you raise goats in the listing high rise that’s been dumped on the stern. Things grow in the trash. Chemicals are leaching out of rusted barrels, growing legs, and setting off to seek their fortune. Beetles tell you their life stories, raccoons steal your pens. Something in a diving suit disappears into oil-slick bilge water in search of baroque pearls. A forest of rebar sings in the salt wind. Out past the gas lake, there’s a town on fire. It’s been like that as long as anyone can remember. They say that no matter how far into the trash you go, it keeps going.
Most towns will pay just to get the barge to leave. Disposing of objects and people that are too dangerous, embarrassing, or on fire is a bonus. The barge is always hiring, and it’s a great way to get out of town quick. It’s not a great way to make money, but you might find something you never realized you were missing.
YOU GOT A JOB ON THE GARBAGE BARGE is a 30-ish page setting and adventure zine, ready to play with any rules-light osr style system. It includes maps, monsters, 100 kinds of trash and lots of drawings of raccoons.

updates.update_content:
Hello Friends,
The first barge zines are officially in the mail! I'll be sending them out in batches over the next week or so, cause there's too many to carry to the post office all at once. 
I'm a bit behind my schedule on account of having trouble figuring out the postal system and getting lots of the right size envelopes,  but I believe that everything is ready to go now!

updates.update_userinfo: Garbage Barge is about to Ship!
updates.update_content: Hello Friends,

Hi Friends,
I hope everyone is well and all of your friends & families are well. 
I'm super happy to get to share some of the first art by Scrap Princess for the garbage Barge! Here is the Fox Snake.

You Got a Job On the Garbage Barge has funded!
Thanks so much to everyone who has signed up for the zine,  and shared it with your friends, and just generally been willing to take a chance on my work.  I came into this project not even knowing if I could get a page up in time, and I'm so glad that I decided to go for it.  I'll be keeping you updated as things get finished, but my current goal is to get all of the stretch goal content together by end of March, finish the zine layout & deliver .pdfs early April, and then get the zines printed & shipped directly after that.

Hi friends, I have one last stretch goal to announce:  Zedeck Siew will write text (a location/encounter/creature) for the Garbage Barge!  Zedeck Siew's work can be found in Creatures of the Near Kingdoms,  A Thousand Thousand Islands ,  Lorn Song of The Batchelor,  and here.  There's a kind of writing that gives even the most fantastic the subject the texture of reality.  I don't know how how it's done but I know that when Zedeck Siew writes about a crocodile trailing green weeds I can somehow see more details than he put down on the page.  I am so completely happy I might get to put something like that on the barge.

campaign.story:
To you, oh Ancient Mother, 
wonderful yet terrible genesis force. 
And to you, oh Sons of Nature, 
who travel between its fragile balance. 
With my outmost respect and ammiration.
"Little Cruel Ballads" is a 95-pages (22cm x 22cm) anthology of ten short stories, where ancient creatures meet with mortals, often punishing their far too common arrogance and cruelty.
Some tales focus on ethic and environmental issues, while others only show fantasy situations, with a strong connection to original folklore. 
The drawing style represents a pleasant mix of graphic elements with an oriental flavor and visual influences of the European Comics School. An anthology that is a pleasure for the eyes and a balm for the mind, extremely fascinating and magical. A story that combines nature, myth and morality in a way that is raw and beautiful at the same time.
The high-quality visual standard of "Little Cruel Ballads" quickly grabbed the interest of many users on social media, including a consistent group of foreign fans. After our previous Kickstarter campaign for Bianca - Little Lost Lamb, Francis and Dandelion, all successfully funded, your enthusiasm inspired us to accept this new challenge, in order to bring "Little Cruel Ballads" also outside Italian national boundaries with an English version of the book. 
Marga Biazzi, also known as Blackbanshee, is a self-taught illustrator from Milan. In 2005 she started various collaborations with many children books publishers (Raffaello Editore, RL Gruppo Editoriale, Giunti and the english Luma Creative). In 2014 she publishes her first self-productions: the graphic novel "Ballate di MezzaEstate" and the artbook "Ellefolk Mundi". 
An example of personal commission made by Marga
                                       STRETCH GOALS 
First Stretch Goal - Limited Edition Print by LOPUTYN (5000 €)

updates.update_content:
Hi backers,
all over the world SARS-COV-2 continues to cause problems for people and also for industries and transport. We're working to catch up and we want to thank you for the great patience you have shown.
Today, we want to share with you some pictures of the books that are travelling from our Italian warehouse to the United States. They will travel by ship and will arrive at their destination in few days. Once they arrive, they will be sent to all supporters living on the American continent.

updates.update_userinfo: Preparation of shipments to Europe in progress
updates.update_content:
Hi backers, 
first of all, thank you for your patience. As you know, the COVID-19 give us a lot of logistical problems. We had to change our shipping partner and we've cumulate an important delay in our projects.
Now, we are glad to announce that all "Little Cruel Ballads" books are ready to be shipped to all backers in Europe!

Dear backers,

as we have already said to some of you, the shipments of Dandelion and Cruel Little Ballads have started.

First we will deal with the Italian and European shipments, then we will move on to those of the other areas.

Dear backers,

first of all we hope you are well.
We wish you a Merry Christmas and we hope that you will have happy days despite the current world situation.

Hello dear backers,

we recently completed shipments for our previous campaigns, Bianca and Francis.

We are still fixing the problems caused by the warehouse to some backers, but almost all the orders have finally reached their destination.

Hi backers!
We have good news for you: the physical copies of "Little Cruel Ballads" are in the hands of their author, Marga Biazzi, who is taking care of the dedications, sketches and commissions.
Copies will soon be ready to be shipped to each of you.

Dear backers,
we're finally ready.  First of all, we would like to apologize for the delay, it is a difficult and worrying time worldwide, and here in Italy the situation has been especially dire.
As you can imagine, this caused all kinds of delays  in the production and shipping process of all of our Kickstarter campaigns. Luckily,  as the situation is slowly getting better, we can share good news with you all:

Hello dear backers,
as the printing process is in full swing and the physical volumes will soon be shipped, we think we might as well start giving you the digital copy of LITTLE CRUEL BALLADS in the nearly-over wait: you will find soon the link for the download in your Kickstarter dashboard!
We plan to send out all the physical copies with all the sketches and commissions in the next months. Here in Italy the overall situation is still hard, but we are doing all that we can to ensure that everyone receives his or her volume as soon as possible.

Hello dear backers, 
we are 94% close to our goal... and we have a big surprise for you!
To celebrate this great result we decided to give you a special gift: if the campaign reaches its first stretch goal (5000 €) we will send, to anyone who pledged 15€ or more, a limited edition print of the cover variant of "Little Cruel Ballads" made by another great artist: Loputyn!

That Magical Horror Light Show is back with a Sneaky Sequel!
Willow, Georgia and Emma have accidentally wrapped both Tillie and Aaron into their magical girl shenanigans much to their chagrin. However, things seem to be getting even harder to keep quiet as these magical powers have turned from intriguing to infectious.  Between daylight daydreams, tanking a track star, bathroom breakdowns and betrayal from within - our quarreling quintet might be in bigger trouble then they ever thought possible. 
 XII: Of Magic and Muses has been published online as a webcomic since 2016 and after 4 magical years we're headed to print Volume 2: Mischief - before the website hits even the first few pages! It is currently updating 4x a week - Mondays to Thursdays. 
This comic is rated for a Teen Audience due to language, partial nudity, and scenes of violence, as well as content warnings for explosions, blood and burns.  
This will be the second book of the Magic and Muses Trilogy!
Become a part of the ✨ magic ✨ and help Kickstart this project today! 
Ebook of Volume 2: Mischief  - $10 CAD
A digital copy of the book! This will be a PDF of approximately 350 full colour pages which includes our 3 featured spreads by our talented artists: Melissa Capriglione, Ai Yoku and Kristen Lee!   
 Ebook Bundle  - $15 CAD
Get both ebooks from Volume 1 & 2 in this exclusive bundle! 700 full-colour pages to display on any digital device.  
 Magical Girl Standee  - $25 CAD
Missed our last Kickstarter? No worries! Our magical girl double sided standees stand at a whopping 6 inches and are still available! You can choose from our roster of six mahous from Volume 1:  Willow, Georgia, Emma, Tillie, Aaron. From Volume 2: Nana.  
 The Book - Volume 2 Mischief  - $35 CAD
The main event! After some back and forth with prepress we will have approximately 350 pages at a size of 5.5 x 8.5 inches up and out to our digital printer. This will also be the largest time sink in production. All of these pages are completed and have yet to be published online - so the book will be out before the vast majority of these pages go up!
As we progress through the campaign we will be announcing our special guest spreads that will be added to the book!
Be sure to check out these other webcomics: O Sarilho, Rising Sand, Ghost Junk Sickness, Chirault, Heirs of the Veil and Meat and Bone
Standee Bundle - $50 CAD 
Back due to demand from our last Kickstarter, you can now grab a bundle edition of Volume 2 Mischief with a standee of your choice!
Book Bundle - $70 CAD [Limited Amount]
All digital rewards plus print editions of Volume 1: Monsters and Volume 2: Mischief. The previous print run was quite small so copies are limited.  But this way you get 700 full colour pages to binge read!
Ultimate Bundle - $130 CAD [Limited Amount]
All digital rewards plus print editions of Volume 1: Monsters and Volume 2: Mischief. As well as a collection of all six standees and a full set of buttons!
>>Please note that if you would prefer to pick up your physical rewards in person from our conventions this year your shipping fees can be returned to you!<<
Current confirmed convention lineup:

Yeticon, Collingwood Ontario, June 19-21

Don't see anything you'd like? Missing a bundle? Don't hesitate to drop a line and request a reward - we make no guarantees but feedback is welcome! 
 The Breakdown
The vast majority of our funds will go to Shipping and Printing similar to our Volume 1 & standee campaign. These will be printed & shipped out from Canada, so things may take a few weeks depending on your location.
We're pretty close to the finish line, but on the off chance we make more than goal, here's some plans for the future:
 -$7K Artist Bonus Vol 2-
If we break the stretch goal, all the wonderful talent who opted to help give our Volume 2 project a boost will get an extra bonus after rewards are purchased and shipped!

Thank you to Our Featured Artists:
Rachel Ho (Cover Artist)
Rachel Ho is a visual development artist for animated films and illustrator, and is the amazing cover artist for the first and second volume of Magic and Muses! Find her incredible work at rachelhofs.artstation.com or instagram.com/rachelhofs
Melissa Capriglione (Interior Illustration)
Melissa Capriglione (cap-rig-lee-own) is a queer comic artist living in Indiana. She graduated in 2017 with a BFA in Drawing and Illustration from Herron School of Art and Design in Indianapolis. She is best known for self-publishing a webcomic called "Falconhyrste" with co-author Clara W. since 2016. She specializes in stories featuring women who love women, and other LGBTQ+ representation.

AiYOKU is the adorable creator of the webcomic Project Survival, and she’s been drawing for as long as she can remember! AiYOKU is extremely passionate about comics, particularly indie webcomics. When she isn’t busy drawing, Ai enjoys hiking, gardening, knitting and sipping tea. You can read her webcomic Project Survival here: www.Projectsurvivalcomic.net
Kristen Lee  (Interior Illustration)
Feathernotesart.tumblr.com

Portfolio: https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/11TlAjTsrqx7aTkh4eCkYZm4PUiPLgurv?usp=sharing
Kingston ON based freelance artist, Kristen Lee focuses on illustration, design, and inking. Her works surround the technical aspects of nature and machinery as she designs environmental pieces for conceptual art as well as excels in inking. Kristen has graduated from the St. Lawrence College Fine Arts program while pursuing her current career as a webcomic writer and illustrator of  Ghost Junk Sickness, who she is a co-author with Laura Lee.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The Ebooks:
Honestly, goal is our biggest concern! The ebooks are 99% done at this point, so once we have the cover from the artist we can proceed.

The Books: 
After getting to know our printer last year we had a fantastic time with them! Their quality and speed was phenomenal, and with prepress pretty much complete at this point getting the physical copies should be a fairly easy process (though hiccups do happen). Once the cover is received we will immediately go through our printer to get our first proof, and most likely after a few more colour corrections, we may proceed.
Shipping is of course a bigger hurdle. If we're successful, it will allow us to take advantage of a more efficient courier than our local (and tiny) post office - which was our best option for our standee rewards. The courier we've selected is our best option (though requires travel) to keep shipping as cost effective as possible, so if we don't make goal, shipping will be far more expensive.

The Others:
Most of our rewards are also already purchased, but if we get an influx of certain kinds, we may need a bit more time for a second order, and of course, getting them into Canada at an appropriate time. Depending on bundles purchased, this could cause a delay with certain rewards.

updates.update_content:
Hey magical menagerie!
We've launched another Kickstarters to fill out our roster for the rest of the XII. If you'd like to grab yours today to fill out your collection, simply follow the link here!

Hey Magical Menagerie!
Just keeping you up to date on our situation here! Funds have finally rolled over and digital reward coupons have been sent out. If your coupon did NOT work, please let me know so I can fix accordingly. Sometimes I simply check the wrong box on my end! :)
Our packaging supplies are here and we'll spend the next few weeks packing books into boxes and working shipment out with our courier. However our usual standee manufacturer has stalled production of our standees (and all of their orders) due to COVID-19 so there may be a few tiers delayed or mailed out separately until we can find a replacement manufacturer or they open up again!

🎊HEY MAGICAL MENAGERIE🎊
Oh my gosh! I'm so blown away!! After the first campaign it's always a little tough trying to figure out how the second volume will go. The support has been phenomenal and we really could not have done this without you! Seriously, every backer and social sharer has helped us reach the finish line! We're so excited to get this story out ahead of the site!

Here we are folks! Less than a week left in the campaign and less than $2100 to go! Time is running out but we can still make it! We can't thank everyone enough for their support getting this project off the ground - especially after sitting on these finished pages for years. This campaign will end at noon on Friday March 6th.  If you're planning on backing, now is the perfect time to get us that final push before the end!
As for our progress, the PDF is fully completed and ready for distribution, the only thing left is to make goal, receive our funds, and we can start handing out to the tiers. The proof is out, processed and we're waiting on delivery so we can show off some of those beautiful colours in ink! We're hoping to get the proof on Mar 3 but we've been buried in some snow, so there might be a delay or two. As for standees, we simply need to get a final order count and we'll be able to get Zap Creatives to send us a fresh batch. :)

With almost 50% towards goal in it's second week - we're over here getting incredibly excited!! At this point we only need a few more books and bundles to get there. We've also signed off on the sketch work for the cover and it's currently being rendered as we speak! 
A huge thank you to everyone who's been sharing and recommending this little comic! Your help is more appreciated than I have words for!

$2300 and Counting!
With almost 40% towards goal in it's first week! Thank you so much for your support - I'm floored honestly! We couldn't do this without your help, and every social media recommendation, share or post has been a huge boost!

campaign.story:
WE DID IT - NPC Tea Volume 1 is happening! Thank you so much! From here on we'll be aiming for these stretchgoals:
£12000 - FOILS for the hardback! Digital backers will also gain access to an NPC Tea short story!
£13000 - EXTRA W.I.P. PAGES at the back of the volume and issue 8! I'll talk through my writing process and early versions of the story!
-----------------
Thanks to continued support on Kickstarter and beyond, my modern fantasy comic series is coming to its conclusion - pick up the final 8th issue or get the entire comic as a collected hardback volume here!
NPC Tea follows an ex-fire summon, an elf and a human as they attempt to save a failing tea shop in modern day Cardiff. Hannah the human’s life is turned upside down when she stumbles upon Y Ddraig - a little known, failing tea shop in the heart of Cardiff, that just happens to be run by an immortal fire spirit and a stressed out elf. 
Soon a lack of customers, obscure teas and Hanny’s lack of magic are the least of their worries, when an ancient power rises out of obscurity to threaten the entire city.  Bryn, Oz and Hanny must unite if they are to save their business – and ultimately the city itself. The story escalates from slice of life comedy into an epic fantasy, twisting typical RPG and fantasy stereotypes into a modern day setting.
Issues 1-7 have already been published, and the 8th issue ends this story arc for the series. The previous five issues have all been made possible thanks to Kickstarter and Patreon, and volume 1 tells one complete, finished story. 
You can read a preview of issue 1 here, or issues 1-6 are available to read as a webcomic over on Patreon from just $1.
You can pick up either the complete volume 1 of NPC Tea as a beautiful hardback edition, or, if you've collected the single issues, just issue 8. 
As a way of saying thank you for supporting the series from the very beginning, issue 8 comes with a collector's book wrap so that you can store your issues all together on a shelf. You can also add any issues you're missing to your reward, or pick up the volume as well if you want to be a completionist!
NPC Tea is currently running at 230 pages of comic - 248 if you include covers and extras. Issue 8 is 40 pages long, and will completed while the KS is running. The whole volume will be ready for print at the beginning of March.
You can also pick up digital versions of the comic if you'd prefer, which will be sent out as soon as the KS money comes through.
To add on any extra physical issues you might be missing, just add £5 for each issue you need to your pledge, and you'll be able to specify which ones you want in the survey at the end of the campaign.  You can also order back issues on my Etsy shop.
For the first time, you can also commission me as part of your pledge! Your commission will be any size up to a4, and can feature up to two characters with a basic background. I will be colouring them with a restricted colour palette (like the colours in the comic itself) and will deliver it to you as a hi-res JPG, and a print delivered separately to the rest of your rewards. I'll aim to complete your commission by winter 2020. Please be aware that I reserve the right to refuse your commission if it's inappropriate, offensive, or otherwise not possible to do, and in this instance I'll refund you the cost of the commission. I will do everything I can to compromise before this happens, and feel free to clear your commission idea with me before pledging if you're unsure.
As in previous campaigns, I've asked some brilliant artists to provide print artwork for this campaign! These will be available as physical prints for select tiers and included digitally with all tiers.
BRYONY EVANS | website | twitter
SHAZLEEN KHAN | website | twitter
SAJAN RAI | website | instagram
Should we surpass the goal, I have several stretchgoals in mind, including:
£12000 - FOILS for the hardback! Digital backers will also gain access to an NPC Tea short story!
£13000 - EXTRA W.I.P. PAGES at the back of the volume and issue 8! I'll talk through my writing process and early versions of the story!
£15000 - A DUST JACKET for the volume! Digital backers will get the artwork from the dust jacket as a hi-res wallpaper!
£20000 - AN NPC TEA launch party in Cardiff!
More to come!
"The urban fantasy series continues to go off in an original direction, as it seamlessly blends the more traditional fantasy elements, orcs, elves, magic, and magic schools, with the slice-of-life bits like getting to class on time, dealing with a bad boss, and holding down a part time job... I recommend picking up the series in the strongest possible terms." - Bard Brehon, A Place to Hang Your Cape
"With a story full of wonder and intrigue as well as some of the most stiking visuals seen in comics of late, this is an issue worthy of delving into - ideally along with a nice cup of tea." - James Blundell,Pipedream Comics
"This all ends up feeling like a story that would develop if Neil Gaiman took over Saga and added in a tea shop but in Sarah’s hands the story & art blend together like the perfect cup of tea into something just as unique." - Comics Anonymous
I'm so incredibly grateful for the support I've had for NPC Tea over the years, and I can't quite believe we're reaching the end of the series. This wouldn't have been possible without crowdfunding and Kickstarter in particular, and I truly appreciate all the hard work that Kickstarter staff do. Therefore, I wholeheartedly support kickstarter staff in their efforts to unionize. #RecognizeKSRU
I've been publishing NPC Tea since 2016, and while I will be releasing issue 8 whatever happens, volume 1 will be an entirely new kettle of fish! With your help I'll be able to create something truly fantastic, to celebrate the achievement of reaching the end of the series.
The entire amount raised will be put towards the print run for this issue, postage, and commissioning the artists, and any extra funds raised will be put right back into the project, towards larger print runs and any stretch goals we might reach.
I hope you'll join me in the exciting finale to the series!
I'm Sarah - I also go by Milmo - and I’m a comics artist based in Cardiff. I’m known for my indie titles NPC Tea and Heart of Time, and I also work as a freelance artist and writer. I’ve also worked in games (you can see my art and even hear my voice in Master Reboot on Steam). You can find examples of everything I do on my website here.
Thanks for reading!

updates.update_content:
Hi everybody,
There's been a slight hiccup with the printed volumes, which is all sorted now - sorry about the delay! To make up for it, each volume will also come with a book jacket:

Hi everyone,
Just a quick update: I'm still waiting on a few things to be delivered and my living room is already filled with boxes!
I'll be sending out issue 8 first - I spent the last week or so folding slipcases so those packages are ready to go. I'm just waiting for one little extra item to arrive for them, then they'll be on their way.

Hope you're all doing well this weekend! Whether you're celebrating easter or not, I hope you're having a chill, safe time :)
As a quick update - I've spent a week editing the hardback book to fix blocking issues. updates.update_userinfo: Hooray! Digital copies have been sent out!
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone!
Hope you're all taking time this festive season to relax and take it easy - 2020 has been a hell of a year...
Just a quick note to say that things are still progressing with the book, and I'm sorry it's still not in your hands! I'm working my hardest to get everything together - with everything as it is, I'm holding fire on posting and getting things printed until the postage situation has settled down. I expect postage rates to go up post Brexit but I'm financially prepared for that, and I'd much prefer to get everything to you as safely as possible rather than rush things out. Not to worry!

Hi everyone,
I'm streaming tomorrow at 8pm GMT over on Twitch!  I'll be colouring and chatting, or maybe playing some games if you'd like to join me! 
I did plan to launch the book then but I'm still a little behind. I'm very, very close to finishing, but not quite there. Sorry about that, it's been difficult to estimate how long work takes me at the moment. I've slowed down a lot this year, but I'm gradually getting back to normal - thanks for being patient with me.

Hi everyone, just a quick update - unfortunately I've had to postpone the launch and stream till next Saturday at 7.30pm. I didn't want to clash with other events Thought Bubble has on, and I've also recently changed medication and not doing so well. I'm so sorry to disappoint you!
Thank you to everyone who's filled out the surveys - you have an extra few days to get your name sorted now, but if you haven't done it yet, please get it to me ASAP to guarantee you'll be in the book.

Hi friends,
I've just sent out the surveys (very very delayed, sorry!) so check your inboxes! Please make sure you get the names you want in the thank you section of the comic by the end of October - if you're later than that, it won't be in the print editions (but I can edit it into the digital ones).
It's difficult to give any previews of the last issue as nearly every page is spoilertastic:

Hey everyone!
Hope you're all doing well - this is definitely not how I imagined 2020 going, but I'm just very glad to be getting by at the moment.
I know I say this every update, but thank you so much for your patience and I'm so sorry everything's been taking so long! I'm pleased to say that the end is in sight though - I'll be sending out surveys later this week and hope to get the volume wrapped up by the end of September. I originally planned a book launch (way back in April...) with a local tea shop, but 2020 happened - so I'll be doing a digital launch instead, with tea tasting, Q&A, and games! I'll let you know as soon as I have a date set for this.

Hi everyone!
Hope you're doing OK and getting by - I never thought this is how 2020 would turn out, but here we are... 
Just thought I'd give you another update about the book. Thank you so much for your patience with me - lock down hit me hard, and it's taken time to get back to some kind of normal mentally. I'm so sorry about the delay, but I'm finally in a place where I can work in a healthy way and I can find joy in it again. I'll be sure to keep you updated as things progress - I've had a couple of messages about surveys, but I thought I'd send them out nearer the fulfilment deadline just in case your details change.

campaign.story:
There's an ancient curse that's corrupted the land! Just kidding, we just made enamel pins. We have had A LOT of people asking us to make pins and now that we have some free time since The Legend's Cookbook is finished and currently out of our hands and being taken care of by the printers, we decided to do something simple and fun! We made some pins! We also made another apron! Why? Cause it looks cool, that and I, personally, own like 5 aprons so we figured some of you would be interested in another one as well. We also wanted to participate in Kickstarter's Make 100 event. That means that our rewards are limited to 100 and once this Kickstarter is over, we will never make reprint these items again.
I'm a sucker for pins.
If you're unfamiliar with our project, check out our project page from last year. We're small team of game fans who came together to make a really amazing, and unofficial cookbook that was backed by over 2,000 people and raised over $85,000! We never expected that level of success and we've managed to build a really great community ever since our project began. You can join and follow along with the project on our Twitter @LegendsCookbook or our Instagram @legends_cookbook. 
Our wonderful sous-chef, Alyssa.
We started The Legend's Cookbook project and it has been an incredible journey. As we are wrapping up progress on the cookbook, we wanted to do something special and make even more cool stuff. We are so thankful for all our fans and friends and everyone who believed in us. We hope you all like everything we've made, including our new pins and aprons, and we look forward to whatever cooking quest we embark on next. And, of course, we invite you to join us! This Kickstarter is just to make a few cool, niche items for our fans and continue to bring people together, both in the kitchen and online.
 $5 – 5 More Recipe Digital Zine: The curse has been broken and the reward is a new digital zine conatining 5 new recipes! This .pdf digital download will feature 5 new recipes not in The Legend’s Cookbook with brand new illustrations and art. We can’t guarantee we will make this available again so get them before they disappear forever!
Seems legit.
$13 – Golden Skullspatula Token Pin: A cursed item, well actually, it is just an enamel pin but it looks pretty cursed. These are high-quality soft enamel pins gold-plated and come with a gold clutch. There's limited amount of them and we aren't going to make more after this. Rumor has it that they contain a secret power... well actually a digital zine conatining 5 new recipes! Limit of 100.
Made with love and spider curses.
$37 – Hero's Apron + Golden Skullspatula Token: A beautiful forest green apron screen-printed with special golden metallic ink and a new design. Limited in quantity and comes with a Golden Skullspatula Token soft enamel pin. Rumor has it that this special reward also comes with another hidden treasure... a digital zine conatining 5 new recipes! Limit of 100.
Stretch Goals
UPDATE! So! We have completely SMASHED our expectations and goals so we decided to do something special for you all! We are ditching the recipe cards and instead going to send out to all our backers a digital zine containing 5 new recipes that aren’t in the main cookbook! Thank you all for making this awesome!
Thank You!
Thanks for checking out our little project and if you can't back it, that's OK! Just share it on your social media and show it to someone you know will love it.

campaign.story:
Welcome to the SAKANA Volume 3 Kickstarter! The aim of this Kickstarter is to collect chapters 17-24 of the ongoing webcomic SAKANA into a softcover book to match Volumes 1 and 2.   
 WHAT'S SAKANA?? SAKANA is a slice of life romantic comedy (a sli-li-rom-com, if you will) set in Tokyo's Tsukiji Fish Market. Our heroes must navigate a hazardous dating scene, unpack some serious baggage, and wrangle unruly seafood in order to find love, peace of mind, and a paycheck. 
In Volume 3, the much-anticipated Second Date is just around the corner, and our hero, Jiro Sakana, definitely isn't ready for it. To keep his budding relationship above water, he'll need all the help he can get from friends, family...even enemies. Will he ever be able to relax and enjoy himself? And is there more to Chie than meets the eye? Meanwhile, Yuudai and Taisei try to navigate their tentative interest in one another, but complicated feelings and miscommunication threaten to keep them apart. 
Is anyone safe from the dreaded "Sakana Date Vortex"??
WHO'S THE AUTHOR?? Mad Rupert (short for Madeline, she's not angry) began self-publishing SAKANA in January 2010! Since then she's also worked on many other comics, including multiple personal projects, adaptations of popular cartoons like Adventure Time and Regular Show, and an upcoming graphic novel through First Second! Aside from comics, she likes bugs, farms, wizards, her dog Gizmo, and her husband Gannon. She lives and works near Boston, Massachusetts. You can find more of her work on twitter @madelinerupert ! 
IS THIS A WEBCOMIC?? SAKANA is a free to read, strip-format webcomic, updating twice weekly every Monday and Thursday (usually around 7pm, east coast USA time.) Unlike newspaper comic strips, Sakana is story-driven and each strip should be read in order. It's aimed at the teen and older crowd, and contains some swearing, sexual innuendo, and fish guts (they DO work in a fish market). The comic is celebrating its 10 year anniversary in 2020, and is currently over 600 pages long (and still going!) 
You can read it here! >>> http://www.sakana-comic.com/
The Volume 3 book will be over 130 pages long: two strips per page for 105 pages, and bonus material beyond that. Books will only be available in softcover at this time. Here is a mockup and some specs:
The comic has always been traditionally inked with a brush pen. Therefore, the interior of Volume 3 will remain black and white, with a nice colored cover. 
Here is what the strips look like:
Here's a handy list of all the available rewards in this campaign. Bookplates (both signed and sketched) and physical copies of Volumes 1 and 2 are only available in limited quantities.
And here is a breakdown of all the tiers:
For this campaign, we'll be focusing primarily on stretch goals that add value to the book itself! More will be revealed after we've met our funding goal! 
CAN WE MAKE IT TO OUR FINAL STRETCH GOAL??? 
Here's a mockup of the lanyard! 

Thank you so much for checking out my comic and my Kickstarter! :)
SAKANA is a member of Hiveworks! Hiveworks Comics is a creator-owned comics and graphic novel publisher focused on free to read webcomics. You can visit their hub site to read other awesome webcomics at: TheHiveworks.com!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
All 210 SAKANA comic strips, bonus book content, and additional reward items have been finished and formatted, and are ready for print! I will have assistance from Hiveworks Comics in the budgeting, proofing, printing, and fulfillment departments. I have years of experience fulfilling orders through my online stores, and Hiveworks is a creator-owned publisher and studio that supports hundreds of webcomics with many successful Kickstarters and years of general webcomic and print management experience.

Having all the files finished ahead of time will allow us to begin printing and production as soon as Kickstarter funds have disbursed. Hiveworks and I will notify backers immediately of any delays or unforeseen issues that arise during the fulfillment period, and will be on hand to address any questions or concerns.

campaign.story:
About the Project
In 2018, I launched a majors-only tarot deck filled with my watercolor illustrations. At the time, I had no intention of completing the deck with the Minor Arcana, but sure enough, in 2019 I painted what would become the first of the Minors - the Page of Swords.  One year later, I'm excited to present to you the completed 78-card tarot deck with illustrations that pay tribute to my Japanese-American heritage, art nouveau, and the traditional folk stories I grew up with.  This completed deck has been named the Botan Tarot. 
Sparrow, the Pheasant Knight's Apprentice - The Page of Swords
 About the Botan Tarot
"Botan" in Japanese (written 牡丹) means "peony", which is the flower prominently featured on the back design of the tarot deck as well as on several cards.  In Japanese flower language, peonies represent bravery.  Botan is also a play on the word "botanical", as I use Japanese flower language and other plant imagery throughout the deck.
Lastly, Botan is a tribute to the space and memory in which I painted this deck - there is an old-fashioned Japanese candy called Botan Rice Candy, which I remember my grandmother giving to me as a child. The deck was painted entirely in the dining room of my grandmother's home, and the Minor Arcana specifically draws inspiration from the Japanese children's stories that she used to read to me.
Japanese Children’s Favorite Stories, illustrates by Yoshisuke Kurosaki, 43rd edition (1994). Photo of my grandmother. Closeup of the Queen of Coins.
Within this deck, you will find both the 22-card Major Arcana (painted in 2017) and the 56-card Minor Arcana (painted in 2019).  The Major Arcana is contemporary in design, with influences from Art Nouveau, Japanese flower language, and my family history. The Minor Arcana uses the same aesthetic, with folktale characters reimagined, symbolism in elements, plants, and animals, and cohesive color stories.
Each image is hand-drawn and painted by myself, using watercolor paints and colored pencils.  Cards measure 2.75" by 4.75" on 310gsm black core cardstock with linen finish and rounded corners.
Stretch Goals
 UNLOCKED Stretch Goal $5000 - each deck will come with a linen drawstring bag, customized with a black&white design of the Botan Tarot
 UNLOCKED Stretch Goal $8000 - each deck will receive a complimentary small tumbled crystal!
A note for Major Arcana holders
Based on your input and overwhelming positive encouragement on my January 10th update, I've decided not to print a Minors-only supplement and instead focus on printing a quality full deck.
As a thank you for your support, an exclusive gift will be included when you back this project at any full-deck tier: a signed first edition print of the Botan Tarot anthology zine, which gives an in-depth look at the imagery and meaning behind my artwork, as well as short stories written for the Minor Arcana.  You should have received instructions on how to claim this complimentary zine, but please don't hesitate to reach out if you have questions.
Costs and Timeline
The funding goal is set to be entirely put towards the production and delivery of the deck and other rewards. It accounts for the cost of mockups, the manufacturing of the rewards, fees, packaging, and shipping to backers, as well as a small buffer for shipping costs.
 Feb: Kickstarter campaign is live!
 March: collection of surveys and ordering
 April: production time
 May - July: shipping to backers
Other Quantities
If you would like more than what's offered in the reward tiers, please message me on Kickstarter or let me know at amiyakom@gmail.com and I'll see if I can accommodate!

It's been some time - I hope you're safe and well. Thank you to everyone who has so far shared such kind words on social media about the Botan Tarot! I'm happy knowing that my art could bring some moments of joy during these difficult times.
Between the pandemic, California wildfires, and toxic air in my area, it was hard to feel creatively motivated the last two months, but I do have some fun updates!

updates.update_userinfo: Thank you for your patience - all packages are on their way!
updates.update_content: This morning, I dropped off the last of the packages at the post office. With that, all of the Kickstarter pledges are now fulfilled and on their way to backers! You should have received a tracking number (don't forget to check your junk mail!), but if you haven't, please message on Kickstarter or email me with your backer number and I can resend it - please don't DM me on instagram or Facebook, I'm trying to streamline all the urgent Kickstarter comms!

Hello everyone! I'm excited to tell you that the printing of the deck and zine is underway!  Last week I met with the printer over Skype to confirm the e-proofs, go over any questions, and officially give my approval.
One small change to the box
After discussing it with the printer, we decided to change the pull-mechanism of the box from a ribbon loop to a half-moon cutout.  This will make the drawer much more durable in the long run, as there were concerns that the ribbon would fray or pop out eventually with heavy use. I wish I had thought to take a screenshot during our Skype conversation - the printer had assembled a mini mockup box to show me, and it was just so darling!!

campaign.story:
Trophy is a tabletop roleplaying game about a group of treasure-hunters entering a forest that doesn’t want them there. Trophy is not one game, but two: Trophy Dark and Trophy Gold.  We're raising money to create 3 hardcover books. Each book will be: 7"x10" in size, and feature luxurious heavyweight paper, full-color interiors, partial cloth bindings, foil stamps, and ribbon bookmarks. 
Trophy Dark is a one-shot game of psychological horror, where you portray risk-taking treasure-hunters on a doomed expedition. As they get closer and closer to the heart of the forest, it does everything it can to tear them apart, drive them mad, and—if they’re lucky—kill them. Trophy Dark is perfect for standalone games and conventions, or for prequels, flashbacks, and side stories that are a part of a larger game like Trophy Gold.  
Trophy Gold is a campaign-length game of dungeon-delving adventure in the old school model. Unlike Trophy Dark, your treasure-hunters aren’t necessarily doomed, but they are desperate. Their tomb-raiding lifestyle has burdened them with debt, and the near-certain death that comes with facing monsters is nothing compared to the certain death they face by returning home without enough treasure to pay those debts.  
In addition to Trophy Dark and Trophy Gold, we are also creating Trophy Loom: a system-agnostic setting guide. Trophy Loom helps you bring to life your own dark fantasy world for Trophy Dark, Trophy Gold, or for your favorite fantasy roleplaying game system. 
Download the Kickstarter Preview
Trophy Dark is a game of psychological horror. It’s about doomed treasure-hunters exploring an ancient forest that doesn’t want them there. As the treasure-hunters get closer and closer to the heart of the forest, it does everything it can to tear them apart, drive them mad, and, if they’re lucky, kill them. Even if the treasure-hunters survive the incursion and satisfy their personal goals, they will have done so at a terrible cost, and are mostly likely changed forever.
A session of Trophy Dark is organized around an Incursion. Incursions are scenarios that are designed to be played in a single session, making Trophy Dark ideal as a one-shot, a convention game, or a side story in a longer campaign. Incursions have 5 Rings, with each Ring representing an escalation in the horror and danger the treasure-hunters face. The progression through the Rings is linear, but within that linear structure are many opportunities to make the story your own and unveil plot twists no one saw coming.
The Trophy Dark book will contain the core rules for Trophy Dark, expanded and clarified from their original publication in the Codex magazine; tips for running a great game of Trophy Dark; a handy, step-by-step sequence of events for running Trophy Dark; guidelines for creating your own Incursions; advice for using Trophy Dark as part of another fantasy game campaign; procedures for combining Trophy Dark and Trophy Gold into a single campaign; and over a dozen Incursions.
Many of the Incursions in the book move the action from the traditional forest setting into new environments. The Incursions included in the book are:
 The Tomb of 10,000 Dreams, an incursion into the dark heart of the ancient Kalduhr forest.
   Witchwood, an incursion on a road paved in gold.
   To Make My Bread, an incursion into the ruins of a titanic mill.
   Mother, an incursion about trying to go home.
   Shifting Sands, an incursion lost to time.
   The Flocculent Cathedral, a moss-covered incursion to the hidden home of your patron saint.
   Throne of the Forest Queen, a fairy tale-inspired incursion without a happily-ever-after.
   The Forest of Blades, an incursion in which the dead still march on an ancient battlefield.
   Rosenwald, a curiouser and curiouser adventure into the many-thorned home of roses.
   That Silent Howl, a terrifying nautical incursion where no one can hear you scream.
   Regicide, an incursion during the first chaotic hours of revolution.
   The Giant’s Carcass, an incursion in search of eternity.
   The Pit, an incursion where light don’t shine and hate calls home.
   Gift of the Sea, an incursion of ancient rites and secrets kept beneath the waves.
   The Spiral, a space-bending incursion inside the dragon.
  And more that are yet to be announced!
  Trophy Gold is a game of desperation and risk. It’s about penniless treasure-hunters exploring the deep and forgotten places of the world, and the wonders and monstrosities they find there. The longer these adventurers stay on the hunt, the greater their chance of recovering treasures that will allow them to retire in comfort and security. But, should they delve too deep—should they linger in the wilds too long—their chances of survival vanish.
Like Trophy Dark, sessions of Trophy Gold are organized around Incursions. However, unlike Trophy Dark, the Incursions in Trophy Gold are not linear, and often take multiple sessions to finish. The Incursions are divided into Sets. Each Set has a Goal, which represents what the treasure-hunters are trying to accomplish in that Set; Props, which are environmental elements the treasure-hunters can investigate; Traps, which are monsters and other dangers the treasure-hunters might encounter; and Treasures, which are the valuables the treasure-hunters need to recover if they don’t want to die penniless. As the treasure-hunters complete Sets and Incursions, they learn more about (and name!) the monstrosities they encounter—valuable information that is recorded in the Bestiary and passed down to future treasure-hunters.
The Trophy Gold book will contain the core rules for Trophy Gold, as originally published in the Codex magazine; new Journey rules to handle great expeditions and traveling between Incursions; new Hearthfire rules to enrich gameplay when the treasure-hunters are recuperating back home; tips for running a great session of Trophy Gold; an example-of-play transcript; guidelines for creating your own Incursions; guidelines for converting existing adventures to Trophy Gold; new Backgrounds, Occupations, and Equipment; over 100 different Rituals, Sigils, and Saints, based on the classic B/X D&D magic-user and cleric spells; and over a half-dozen original Incursions.
Incursions in the Trophy Gold book include:
 Hester’s Mill. A long-abandoned village with a terrible secret. Can the treasure-hunters uncover the dark history of this place and retrieve its valuable knowledge, or will they become the newest victims of the reaping?
 The Huntsman’s Manor. The politically unremarkable Marquess Niral was a hunting prodigy, building his lodge on the edges of the Kalduhr to hunt the most challenging prey. After his disappearance over a century ago, the manor was abandoned and left to the forest, but what amazing treasures and trophies still remain within?
 A Heart Hums In Darkness. As refugees flee with their lives on their back, word arrives that the bees of The Humming Woods are extending their reach. Journey into darkness to find a new hive’s heart and reclaim a lost city... while scavenging whatever treasures were left behind.
 The Eyes of Time. The Marlack Castle stands crumbling on the edge of the cliff, frozen in time. Strange magic lingers there like a disease, twisting time and shattering realities. Within its walls lies strange and terrible treasure, and a dark promise to remake the past for a terrible price.
 The Stone Seed's Reawakening. If you carry this limestone seed into the stone desert, the secrets of crystal and bone, water and wind, latticed consciousness and transformative music will reveal themselves and their treasures—but beware their price.
And more that are yet to be announced! 
Trophy Loom is a system-agnostic setting book detailing the world Trophy takes place in. It can be used with Trophy Dark and Trophy Gold—and, indeed, details many locations and characters that are only hinted at in the Incursions from those books—or it can be used as the campaign world for another fantasy roleplaying game. It can be used to write new Incursions, or it can be used as the inspiration for the next great old-school fantasy module. Above all, it has been designed with flexibility and usability in mind—open it up and take whatever you need to make your session exciting and dangerous!
We have designed Trophy Loom to be truly unique when it comes to roleplaying game setting books. Rather than presenting great walls of text which detail the “one true way” of understanding the setting, you are given tables that provide rumors, historical details, and myths about each important location and faction. That way, you are able to create your own version of the Trophy world. Locations will have short descriptive texts to establish basic facts about them, but then you’ll choose from (or roll on) the tables to weave a dramatic tapestry unique to your campaign.
Many of the locations and factions in the Trophy Loom book are being written by some of the best authors in the world of tabletop roleplaying games—take a look at the Team section below to see some of the amazing folks working on this book. Other locations, factions, and lists are being crowdsourced on The Gauntlet Forums. You can preview Fort Duhrin, The Rose District of Ambaret, Barsul Prison, Ajino the Debauched Painter, The Sisters, Kormoran’s Wheel, and Elixirs, Tinctures, and Herbal Remedies from Old Kalduhr by following the link below.
The Trophy Loom Crowdsourcing Master List
The following add-ons aren’t necessary to play Trophy, but they might make it a little easier to run the game, and will definitely make the experience more special. To get one or more add-ons, simply add the appropriate amount to your pledge. 
Custom Dice Set (+$20 USD)
The custom dice set contains 16 dice: 4 light dice, 4 dark dice, and 8 gold dice. 
Light dice are rolled whenever treasure-hunters are applying their skills or taking advantage of a bad situation. The custom Trophy light dice are the color of bone, inked with an earthy brown.
Dark dice are rolled whenever treasure-hunters are risking their mind or body. The custom Trophy dark dice are a mysterious blend of black and deep violet, inked with a worn bronze.
To make success and failure easier to read at the table, both light and dark dice feature hollow pips on the 1-3 faces, solid pips on the 4-5 faces, and the Trophy antlers icon on the 6 face.
Gold dice are rolled when treasure-hunters defeat a monstrosity and try to sell its remains. The custom Trophy gold dice are translucent, embedded with luxurious golden flecks and foil, and inked in metallic gold. Five of the faces are blank, with success only on a single face featuring the Trophy Gold sun icon.
Character Creation Cards (+$40 USD)
This add-on includes 5 standard-size decks of cards, one for each of the major aspects of character creation: Backgrounds, Occupations, Drives, Rituals, and Equipment. Each card has original artwork and supporting text. 
The cards can be used to quickly generate whole characters at the table or to randomize certain aspects. In Trophy Dark, they eliminate the need for a character sheet.  You can also use them to build character creation decks tuned to specific incursions. 
The cards are designed to make Trophy easy to play at conventions or as a pick-up game. You can build special decks tuned to specific incursions and then just tuck them in with your dice. For example, if you're running The Flocculent Cathedral, you might construct a deck of religion-focused options. If you're running That Silent Howl or Gift of the Sea, you might choose the nautical options.
In addition to making character creation quick and easy (and focused!), each card has leading questions the players can use to deepen their understanding of the character. What does it mean to be an Oracle?  What does it mean to want to free your brother from Barsul Prison? Why did you bring a box of your grandmother's ashes with you? The questions on the cards help guide those conversations so your storytelling is rich and dramatic.
Hunt Roll Tokens (+$20 USD)
This add-on comes with 12 custom Hunt Roll tokens. Hunt Roll tokens are used in Trophy Gold to track your character's progress in an adventure—they can be saved-up to help complete goals in the game or cashed in to allow your character to find treasure. 
The tokens are made of a heavy-weight zinc alloy, are 30mm in diameter (the size of U.S. half-dollars), and are stamped with the Trophy Gold sun icon on one side, and the face of the Old One of the Forest on the other.

Jesse Ross (@jesseross) is a game designer, graphic designer, and illustrator from Minneapolis. He is one half of the creative team behind Girl Underground, the hit Powered by the Apocalypse game for telling stories like Alice in Wonderland and The Wizard of Oz. He's also a frequent contributor to the Gauntlet gaming community's monthly magazine Codex, where Trophy first appeared. Jesse is the author and creator of the Trophy roleplaying game. 
Lauren McManamon is a game designer, editor, and one half of the creative team behind Girl Underground, the hit Powered by the Apocalypse game for telling stories like Alice in Wonderland and Wizard of Oz. Lauren is also a frequent contributor to the Codex magazine and was that publication's long-time editor. Lauren will be the editor of the Trophy roleplaying game.
Ludovico Alves (@delethiel) is a Mirandês biochemist, writer and game designer. They focus on games that see the cultural hegemony and its assumptions from the outside: they have done games about the biased nature of how history is viewed, budget management, bronze-age post-apocalypses and the cost of prejudice. They are just getting started. Ludovico is the author of the Trophy Dark incursion Regicide. 
Natalie Ash is a lifelong nerd and forever GM. She resides in Porltand, OR with her partner and their two cats and stays up all night writing TTRPG content. Natalie is writing the Trophy Gold incursion The Huntsman's Manor. 
Paul Baldowski is a game designer, business analyst and a fraction of the team behind All Rolled Up gaming accessories. He has been creating games since before the fall of the Berlin Wall. Paul has written freelance for TTRPGs including Symbaroum, Night's Black Agents, Maelstrom, Paranoia XP, and Outlive Outdead, as well as creating and self-publishing the multi-award winning game The Cthulhu Hack. Paul will be writing a location for Trophy Loom. 
Aaron Burkett lives in Houston, podcasting and blogging where he can. His work focuses on crime, opportunity, revenge, self-righteousness, and the sins we did for a dollar waiting for us when we get back home. Aaron is the author of the Trophy Dark incursion The Pit
Linda Codega (@_linfinn) is a queer, nonbinary writer living by a mountain in the Hudson Valley. They are a speculative fiction author and narrative game designer. Their work has appeared in various anthologies, magazines, and blogs, and you can find a selection of their games here: lhcodega.itch.io. Linda will be writing a location for Trophy Loom and a Trophy Gold incursion called The Last Galleon.
Jim Crocker is a longtime retailer and advocate for independent/small press story games and RPGs. He’s a co-founder of Indie Games on Demand at Origins and can be found online at JimLikesGames.com or one of the many conventions he attends as a vendor. Jim will be writing The Flocculent Cathedral, an incursion for Trophy Dark.  
Madeleine Ember is like if a golden retriever and a chihuahua had an excitable, friendly, neurotic human child. She writes and draws a lot of strange, dark things while living with her partner and their two cats. Madeleine will be writing a location for Trophy Loom and the Trophy Dark incursion Clever Fingers.
Dan Felder is a veteran game designer that has been making RPGs for his friends since he was eight years old. He's worked at Fantasy Flight Games, Blizzard, Electronic Arts, and Abrakam Entertainment. Dan will be writing the Trophy Gold journey rules. 
Ira Grace (@iamiragrace) is emerging into the light of sharing his writing with the wider world, in part thanks to the Trophy community. He loves all flavors of the creepy, weird & unsettling writing that has been happening in the indie scene lately and is excited to add to it.
Matthew Gravelyn (@mrmatthew) is a writer and creator that focuses on rules-light, narrative, and weird gaming experiences. He writes games to make people feel things. He lives in Bothell, WA, with his wife and son and also enjoys camping, hiking, and paddleboarding. Matthew is writing the D&D-based character options for Trophy.
James Holloway (@gonzohistory) decided to study history and archaeology at least partly because of role-playing games. His previous writing has covered medieval burial practice, historical wargaming, the fiction of HP Lovecraft, and, of course, monsters and mythology. He is the host of the RPG monster podcast MONSTER MAN (monsterman.libsyn.com). James lives in Cambridge, UK with his wife Allison and their very good dog.
Shel Kahn loves RPGs! They illustrate and write for tabletop RPGs, run them for kids and teens at schools and museums, and mentor new GMs with nonprofit community space Dames Making Games. Kahn’s self-published adventures include Keep on the Shining Isle, The Corruption of Pelursk, and most recently, The Ghost Houses of Phylinecra.  Learn more at portablecity.net Shel will be writing a Trophy Gold incursion called The Stone Seed's Reawakening. 
Mike Martens is a brand and UX writer plying his trade among the fated glory hunters of Los Angeles. A newcomer to RPG design, his current projects include Sunken – a full Rooted in Trophy expansion of That Silent Howl – and Steel Weeds – an innovative Weird West PbtA game.
Nicholas Masyk is a roleplaying game designer and longtime GM from Montreal, Quebec, Canada, and creator of Monkey's Paw Games. His games seek to inject anti-colonial, anti-racist, and anti-fascist narratives into the lens of science fiction, fantasy, and horror through projects such as numerous Trophy Dark Incursions as well as his own works such as UNCONQUERED, Chalice, and SMILE, which can be found at https://monkeys-paw-games.itch.io/.
Tom McGrenery is an RPG designer and translator from Hong Kong. His credits include work on Feng Shui, Heavy Gear, Mutant Chronicles, and Night's Black Agents/GUMSHOE. He is the co-host of the award-winning RPG podcast Fear of a Black Dragon. Tom can be found on Twitter @PorcupineRPG and at porcupinegames.com. Tom will be writing a location for Trophy Loom. 
Blaine Moore is a long time TTRPG player, newly minted TTRPG writer, and all around general purpose nerd. They got their start writing for TTRPGs with Trophy (via the Codex magazine), and look forward to writing more games and modules to be published at playmooregames.itch.io Blaine is the author of the Trophy Dark incursion Rosenwald.
David Morrison (@chapofsteel) is based in Yorkshire, which is still in the UK at the time of going to press, and has been running and playing RPGs following exposure to Heroquest at a formative age. The Trophy Dark incursion Throne of the Forest Queen was his first published piece of RPG writing.
Jamila Nedjadi enjoys playing and creating story games that focus on personal narratives, strong emotions, suspense, magic, connection, and horror. You can find their work at Sword Queen Games temporalhiccup.itch.io Jammi will be writing the Trophy Gold incursion The Eyes of Time. 
Leandro Pondoc plays far too many games. He can be found on twitter @lpondoc where hopefully he'll be sharing more of his work soon. Leandro is the author of the Trophy Dark incursion The Forest of Blades.
Gabriel Robinson (@trollhands) carries memories of dark forests and tidepools from his childhood in the Pacific Northwest. He now lives in Norfolk, VA with his wife and their small creatures, where he writes, works in healthcare, and runs therapeutic role playing games. Gabriel will be writing the Trophy Dark incursions Gift of the Sea, The Forbidden Archives, and Temple of the Sky. 
Alexi Sargeant is an award-winning game designer creating indie roleplaying games under the banner of Cloven Pine Games. When he's not running or playing games, he's a writer and editor living in Princeton, New Jersey. Some of his favorite games are Masks: A New Generation, Dread, and For The Queen. His game 002: License to Eavesdrop was a winner of the 2019 200 Word RPG Challenge. Alexi is a proud new dad to a baby girl. Alexi will be writing the framework for joining Trophy Dark and Trophy Gold into a single campaign. 
Zedeck Siew is based in Port Dickson, Malaysia, and has been a journalist, editor, fiction writer, translator, and game designer. His first RPG adventure, Lorn Song of the Bachelor, was published by Hydra Cooperative / Exalted Funeral in late 2019. With artist Mun Kao, he is creating fantasy RPG zines inspired by the mythistory of Southeast Asia, collectively titled: A Thousand Thousand Islands.
Sabine V (@SabineV5) is a German national and has played RPGs for over 30 years. She has edited or co-edited the translations for Unknown Armies, Fiasco, and Fate Core, and translated Fate Accelerated and Cheat Your Own Adventure. Likes to take pictures of trees. Sabine is the author of the Trophy Dark incursions The Giant's Carcass and The Retribution Tree.
Michael Van Vleet (@signalstation) is the co-creator of DYING IN SPACE, a writer of fiction, and a strong proponent of playing to lose. Michael will be writing the Trophy Gold incursion A Heart Hums in Darkness.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The leads on this project have a significant amount of experience with the logistics involved in producing and shipping tabletop roleplaying game books. Of the three books we are raising money for, one of them (Trophy Dark) is nearly finished, including layout. The other two books are earlier in production, but we don't anticipate any difficulty in completing them on time. We have a lot of experience working with big teams and hitting deadlines via the Codex magazine. The most significant challenge for us will be the fact we are introducing non-book add-ons. We don't have any direct experience producing cards, dice, and coins, and so there may be unforeseen difficulties there. Still, we are going to minimize the possibility of problems by having production prototypes for each add-on created well ahead of our delivery date. The light dice and dark dice are already heading to production, and we should have prototypes for the gold dice and Hunt Roll tokens soon.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
