campaign.story:
Help us print Valor: Cups - the third and final volume of our fairy tale comic anthology trilogy about courageous heroines.
What is Valor? Valor is a comic anthology project composed of adapted, re-imagined, or invented fairy tales. The anthology is aimed at all-age readers, and is LGBTQA+ friendly.
The purpose of the stories contained within Valor is to pay homage to the strength, resourcefulness, and cunning of female heroines in fairy tales. Although fairy tales are often presented as a "feminine" form of literature due to the abundance of princesses, a lot of classic princess archetypes are passive, asleep, imprisoned, or offered as a prize. Valor, and all the creators participating in it, want to give female heroines the roles they deserve, to inspire young and old readers alike.
Valor was planned as a trilogy. The first volume was funded successfully through Kickstarter in 2014. The second book, Valor: Wands, was funded successfully through Kickstarter in 2018. Valor: Cups, is making a splash as the third and final installment of the anthology!
Valor: Cups is built around the theme of water as both a concept and a symbol. As such, the fairy tales chosen for this book dive into the themes of pairs (reflection, doubles), growth, transformation, healing and illusion. The cover features a mermaid, as well as a narwhal and a unicorn. In medieval Europe, the narwhal horn was often sold under the pretense of being a unicorn horn, and having healing magical properties, specifically to cure melancholia - an ancient medical concept reminiscent of depression. As motifs, the unicorn and the narwhal perfectly represent the themes of healing, illusion and promise.
Like the preceding volume of Valor, this anthology is printed in full color. It will have approximately 200 pages of content with 22 comics, 3 prose stories, and 8 illustrations. 
Valor is edited and published by Fairylogue Press, the creative team of Isabelle Melançon and Megan Lavey-Heaton, co-creators of the fantasy webcomic Namesake. Valor: Cups contains the following comic stories:
 Vasya by Isabelle Melançon & Megan Lavey-Heaton.
 The Frog Princess by Isabelle Melançon & Megan Lavey-Heaton.
 Belladona by Kadi Fedoruk.
 The Rougarou by Meaghan Carter.
 The Raven's Strain by Michelle "Misha" Krivanek.
 A New Chapter by ama.
 Labismina by Mari Costa.
 Rhapsodist in Green by Myisha Haynes.
 Lieddi's Redemption by Sunna Kitti & Petra Erika Nordlund.
 Scales of Doubt by Elena Barbarich, Ash Barnes and Laura Mourão de Castro.
 Gerda & Frey by Allison Shaw.
 Golem by Sarah Stern.
 The Guide by Jessica and Jacinta Wibowo.
 The Witch's Apprentice by Kelly Bull.
 The Lion Fairy by Val Wise.
 The Feather of Finist the Falcon by Kate Sheridan.
 The Key to the Kingdom by Birdie Willis and Ann Uland.
 The Queen's Dearest Changeling by Lilly Higgs and Amathy S. Jetton.
 Flux by Maria Capelle Frantz.
 A Castle of Thorns by Ashanti Fortson.
 Swanhilde by Kelly and Nichole Matthews.
 The Lady of Winter by Shadia Amin and Jaime Pineda.
 Valor: Cups also contains the following illustrated prose fairy tales!
 How To Not Be Cursed by Aevee Bee with illustrations by Rennie Kingsley.
 Isobel and the Green Knight by Megan Lavey-Heaton.
 Iromunde of the Silver Tresses by Lin Darrow with illustrations by Ari W. North.
 As well as gorgeous illustrations by Karla Rodriguez, Josceline Fenton and The Gorgonist.
Backers can grab the print or digital versions of Valor: Cups along with a selection of goodies. Here is a list of the available rewards.
Most of the rewards are available within the Stationery Set, which includes 2 die cut stickers, 3 postcard prints, and 1 double-sided bookmark. 
We also have a special Valor Trilogy Print Set for backers who purchase two or three of the Valor books through the kickstarter. Each small print is designed to match the colors and theme of one of the anthologies. As an individual reward, we also have the red and gold Sword and Sorcery Enamel Pin that is included in the higher tiers.
As we did in Valor: Wands, up to 40 backers have the option of commissioning a custom portrait that will be featured in the thank you pages of the book, under the section Patrons of Valor. Each portrait can be accompanied by a name or dedication, and the portraits can be of the backer themselves, of an original character, or of families or friends.
The designs for the physical rewards are all ready to be produced as soon as we hit the goal! 
If we reach our goal to print Valor: Cups, we have two exciting stretch goals to add to the project! The mystery of each tile shall be revealed as we reach a both goals.
$60 000 - Hardcover version of the book is now available!
$90,000 - Second design pin added!
Here are the costs tied to this project, and how we plan on breaking down the funds.
Paying artists: We want as much money as possible from the Kickstarter to land back in the pocket of the artists, and the amount they get depends on how much is raised in the Kickstarter. We are starting out by paying our artists $60 per page, but we want to be able to give them $100 per page, possibly more!
Printing books: Our books are being printed by Marquis in Montreal, Canada, an amazing printer that also handled Namesake book 3, the reprint of Valor: Swords and the printing of Valor: Wands. This cost also includes pre-press work, to make sure our colors print beautifully and that no talkbubble is left empty!
Shipping and packaging: Unfortunately, shipping prices rise every year, so almost half the funds will be dedicated to this, and making sure the books are properly packaged and warehoused.
Fees and taxes: Kickstarter and Stripe will get their cut, so will the IRS.
Rewards: This is the money for paying for all the pretty, pretty swag. We have numerous tested and true suppliers!
Wiggle room: This is for unexpected expenses, such as damaged stock, lost shipments, etc.
We would like to offer special thanks to the Hiveworks team for their continued support, as well as Nicole Chartrand, Gisele Weaver, Michelle "Misha" Krivanek, Kevin Wilson and Taneka Stotts for their design input. And a big thanks to Atla Hrafney and Christina McKenzie for their grammatical and color proofing work.
Additional tip of the hat to all the greats, from Grimm to Andersen, without forgetting Perrault, D'Aulnoy, Jacobs, Lang, Afanasyev, Leprince de Beaumont, Asbjornsen, Carroll, and all the Scheherazades of the worlds. 
And a final thanks to all our backers for keeping fairy tales alive. Working on this trilogy took a total of seven years (Magical fairy tale number!!!). We could not be more proud of our work, and we are thankful for all the wonderful artist contributions and reader encouragement.
The music used in the video is a copyright free track by Olive Musique titled Troubled Waters. The animation at the opening of the video was done by  Michelle "Misha" Krivanek.

We have already worked on ways to avoid issues. Most of the book materials are already in hand and being proofed, reducing production time. Furthermore, our team are Kickstarter veterans, with seven successful ones under our belt. This experience, combined with the support we get from artists and Hiveworks, is sure to help us run this project in a timely manner.

The Five patterns are, 矢羽根(Yabane : Arrow feather), 青海波(Seigaiha : Blue ocean wave), 菱(Hishi : rhombus), 麻の葉(Asanoha : flax leaf), 小桜(Kosakura :  Small Cherry blossom). 
矢羽根, 　青海波, 　菱, 　麻の葉, 　小桜
These traditional patterns were and are used for cloth weaving for a long time in the Japanese textile culture. I am a ceramic craft artist for long time but even for me this is the first time I have seen these Japanese traditional motif ceramic tiles. 
Japanese traditional patterns are used to weave clothes.
In 2020 we have Olympic and Paralympic at Tokyo Japan.

campaign.story:
Hi! I'm Joumana, an artist passionate about natural and historical colours, which I often prepare myself. I'm also a calligrapher specialised in the abandoned early Arabic scripts, and spend lots of time examining ancient manuscripts to unlock the workings of the pen. The meeting of these two areas recently produced a monster Twitter thread where I offered some practical insights into the inks and paints of early Qur'ans. The response was way way more enthusiastic than expected, and encouraged me to bring a long-suffering idea to life: put all this into a book.
The project: a concise, approachable, illustrated manual examining the main materials used in Islamic manuscripts, their qualities, and when safe, how to prepare and use them. The book will be A5-sized and wirebound for maximum practicality, with additional technical info (such as the difference between paint and ink, binders, other additives) and cultural insights (such as the medical uses these materials were put to) — and of course lots of historical recipes! The complete edition also includes reference sheets with painted swatches, so you can have a proper look at the real thing. I like to think that the latter, plus the insight into how the materials are used, can make the book useful to a variety of people, from medievalists and Islamic scholars to practicing artists and historical reenactors.
Sample spread
Why focus on materials from the Islamic tradition? 
There is a large number of publications for traditional and modern pigments in general, all with a Eurocentric focus; there are none about the Middle-East, outside research papers that are neither easy to approach nor intended to be practical. Also, my own usage of traditional materials tends to be closer to medieval and Islamic manuscripts than to European realism, so this is where I can offer more experience. Finally, this reduces the scope of the project to a manageable scale that allows me to dedicate more attention to the material I do cover, namely materials and techniques during the Abbassid period (roughly 750 to 1250 AD). An annotated bibliography will open up further horizons.
Different grades of Azurite
Why am I so obsessed with traditional materials? 
This could be a book of its own, but to put it very briefly, they are what makes art a deeply interrelated and embodied practice. Not only does each natural pigment or dye behave differently, have its own personality; to make and use them involves an understanding of chemistry, botany, seasonal cycles, the materiality of things. Most of them were also used as food or remedies, not to mention associated with celestial bodies. The artist was aware of being at the receiving end of an entire world of different substances with their own lives and interrelationships. The value of laboriously prepared colours was appreciated, and wasting them unthinkable. This entire dimension, which is a way of life, is completely cut out of the equation when the creation process only begins with squeezing paint out of a tube. 
Gallnut ink on paper
What does production of this book involve?
This is a straightforward project where all the work consists in my synthesising my research into a friendly book format, testing/adapting/illustrating recipes, and making the swatch sheets. I am not simply copy-pasting recipes from old sources; I am testing the most promising ones and adapting them to our times (I assume not everyone has access to a glass kiln). I'm giving myself plenty of time to complete this, and will continue to post my experiments on Twitter as well as some backer-only sneak previews here. The pdf version will go to all backers from £10 up, so I'm thinking it would be a good idea to release this one first, in order to take feedback/corrections before printing the paper version. The book is currently looking to be about 80 pages long, and the amount I'm raising will cover printing, the purchase of materials for testing and for the swatches, as well as Kickstarter fees and taxes. The more pre-orders, the more production costs go down, the more material I can include. So do let all your artist and medievalist friends know!
Dangerous beauty: Orpiment
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There's not much that can go wrong with production: the printing is simple and done locally, so once the book is completed, I'll have the hard copies in less than a week. The reference sheets take time but I can start on them as soon as the Kickstarter closes, so I can comfortably spread that process over those few months. The main risk is to get sidetracked and overwhelmed by the amount of material to process, but I've already processed most of the research and have a clear idea of what to include and a plan of action to follow.

updates.update_userinfo: End of one, start of another
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone,
I trust this finds you all well — for some reason it feels easier to breathe today and the sky looks extra blue! This is a a brief and probably last update for this project, unless something comes up. 
First, the pre-launch page for my next project: Wild Colours is online, and you can click the "Notify me on launch" button and share it as you like. As planned, the launch will be in January and more info will be visible at that time.

Hello everyone,
I hope you're all well, physically AND mentally. I still struggle with the futility of making things while the world is ending, but here's the new book idea I've been working on, which would launch on Kickstarter in January.
Expect the same format and layout (different fonts, because life's too short for typographic restraint), but the topic this time is : extracting and working with the seasonal palette offered by nature (and a little bit by the kitchen cupboard). In other words we'll be out foraging for art materials, which is not only a wonderful practice, it's also a deeply reassuring one as the human world becomes increasingly volatile and frankly insane: the cycle of seed, blossom, fruit and back to seed proceeds regardless, year after year. This is another idea that's been creeping up for years but I've been actively working on it since June. It's been keeping me relentlessly on my toes: the seasonal wheel turns fast and if I miss something, I have to wait another year!

Hello everyone,
I'm popping in briefly to let you know I've completed the translations of al-Razi's Zinat al-Kataba, which is the oldest of the treatises I used for the book (and one of the oldest known). As the intention is to make it accessible, it's available as a "pay what you want" PDF. It uh, has a lot of footnotes.

Hello everyone,
All rewards, except the Treasures tier and a few late surveys, are making their way to backers as we speak. As it took me several days to get through them, some of you have already received yours by now. Everyone who's messaging to let me know you got yours safely, thank you! It's really helpful to help me tick boxes and I apologise for not responding individually. Other than putting together the Treasures boxes, I'm working on getting my calligraphy courses online and that's now taking up all my attention. Please consider leaving a review or rating on the book's if you feel so inclined!

Hello everyone,
The pdf is going out after I post this update! If you're in the PDF tier or higher, you will receive a Kickstarter message later today with a download link and some notes.
As for the print version, I received the first proof on Wednesday, made the necessary corrections, and ordered another proof as I want to be quite sure before I order 600 copies! I'm expecting it on Monday, and if it all looks good, I will order the full run the same day. Printing is local and takes only a few days, and I'll start shipping immediately I receive the books.
I just wanted to say WE HAVE A COVER!

campaign.story:
The Adventurer's Tarot is a beautifully illustrated, alternative tarot deck designed for use in 5E and other fantasy role playing games.
Each card is gold-stamped on the front and back, and has been masterfully rendered and designed by artist Brenda Ho.
 Printed at Tarot card size - 2.75" x 4.75" (70mm x 120mm) 
 Unique Gold Foil Embossed designs on each card.
 Anti-Scratch Lamination on each card.
 Ultra-thick cardstock - 130lb (350 gsm)
Instruction booklet
Gold foil tuck box
Important note on the images in this campaign: None of the images above are Photoshop renders, these cards are photographed from a hard copy proof provided by our printer and represent exactly what you'll get if you back our campaign.
What's included?
The base deck includes two cards for each base 5E class and six Adversary cards. We have now unlocked the Artificer, Ally, Mystic, Blood Hunter, Companion and Familiar cards (two each). Plus we have unlocked the Beast, Undead, Aberration, Ooze, Monstrosity, Plant, Giant, Fiend, The Elemental, The Construct, Celestial, the Fey, Humanoid, and Dragon monster cards (4 additional cards each).  Plus two bonus unlocks, one Developer card, and one Designer card. And a bonus new class we're creating to use the deck in 5E gameplay (2 more cards). (102 cards total)
(Unlocked!) While each card will not have a unique design, each card will have color variations to make it easier to tell them apart. Additionally each monster card will have unique gold text in the spirit of tarot "I OF ADVERSARIES", "II OF ADVERSARIES", etc.
The deck also includes a beautiful matching 2-piece box with a luxurious matte finish, and an instruction booklet, so you can use the deck as an initiative system, conduct oracle readings for your friends or their characters in-game, or use the deck as an actual magic item that can be found in the game.
What's not included? 
This is not a traditional "Rider-Waite" Tarot deck. This means the Major and Minor Arcana are not written on the cards and there is no direct one-to-one conversion to every card in the traditional deck. 
Instead, we are including an original cartomancy guide to use the deck for divination (see below for details.) 
The Adventurer's Tarot was originally envisioned as an alternative streamlined, initiative system. 


We've playtested this system extensively in our home games and at conventions, and we think it's a great alternative to regular D&D initiative. While Dexterity players do take a minor hit, there are significant advantages to this system:
 Quicker Setup; instead of players yelling out numbers around the table to determine initiative, just setup the deck for the combat, shuffle the deck, and begin.
 It creates tension; no one knows who will go next in turn order. Will the second group of monsters go next, or will Alechin the cleric be able to cast a Healing Word before curtains close on Rogers the bard?
 More chaotic combat; combat order changes each round, better representing the chaos of combat.
 Player Engagement;  With the future of the turn unknown, players need to actively think about what their character will do if they go next, instead of spacing out until their turn. (Not that we've ever seen a player space out waiting for their turn to come up!)
What about Lair Actions? The Alert feat? Non D&D Classes? We have special rules for all that, and more in our detailed rules which will be included with the deck. You can see our current draft of the rules here:



The Adventurer's Tarot Magic Item 
Additionally, we will include printed rules for using the Adventurer's Tarot as a magic item in 5th Edition Dungeons & Dragons. This item will function in a similar way to the infamous Deck of Many Things, but be less prone to causing major character changes, disastrous backfires, and campaign-shattering alterations.
Click here for the Work In Progress Magic Item Rules



UNLOCKED!

 Instagram 
 Facebook 


Fulfillment
Our hard copy proof
Shortly after the Kickstarter ends, we will be sending you a link where you will be able to complete checkout for your backing. This will include the option to purchase additional Add-Ons. We have signed a contract with PledgeManager to provide our post-campaign pledge management.
We currently have a hard copy proof and a printer lined up for this deck which means we are ready to go to print. However, we have many new card and artwork stretch goals. Based on the number of stretch goals unlocked, there will likely be additional work for Brenda to create the artwork. If we determine that Brenda needs more time to complete the artwork, we will notify you, our backers, in a timely fashion with a new delivery date. 
We delivered our last Kickstarter exactly on time, and we are planning to do so again with this one.
Shipping
Since we are shipping a relatively small and lightweight product, we are able to charge a flat rate for shipping throughout the world.   The price for shipping is for the base deck of cards. 
Thanks to the popularity of the Kickstarter with Europeans, we quickly realized we needed to provide EU-Friendly fulfillment. We have partnered with Spiral Galaxy Games based in the UK to provide us with EU-Friendly shipping.  
We also have Australia and New Zealand-friendly shipping provided by fulfillment partner Unicorn Games. 
Products in the US will be either shipped USPS First Class or USPS Priority depending on the size. All non-US and non-AU/NZ international products will be shipped either USPS First Class International or USPS First Class Priority (for larger items.)
About Weird Works
Weird Works is a small, independent game studio that specializes in creating peculiar products for your tabletop RPGs. 
Brenda Ho (Designer & Illustrator)
Brenda is a freelance graphic designer based in the beautiful & rainy Pacific Northwest, where she lives with her cats Duke and Lilith. She studied at the Rhode Island School of Design where she earned a B.F.A. in Graphic Design. 
Thom Denick (Product Developer & Campaign Manager)
Thom Denick is a programmer/consultant based in Los Angeles, CA. He lives with his wife Ji Young, son Dante, and daughter Giovanna in Culver City. He regularly judges DCC games at conventions around the country. 
We ran a successful campaign for RPG Stamps on Kickstarter in October 2018. You can check it out here: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/smorpheus/rpg-stamps-commemorate-deaths-and-track-accomplish
Our main website is located at  https://weird.works/.  
A Final Legal Note
This campaign is being published for 5th Edition through the Open Gaming License, Version 1.0a, under the terms and conditions set forth in the System Reference Document 5.1 as provided by Wizards of the Coast.
Elements of this campaign including the text, artwork, graphic design and logos of both the product and Weird Works are Product Identity, and are not open content.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have already received a hard copy proof from our manufacturer, so we know exactly what our cards are going to look like (and they are pictured in our campaign.) The manufacturer (Print Ninja) has a fantastic reputation, and has delivered many Kickstarters in the past. They currently hold a 4.9 rating on TrustPilot.

It is possible that if a significant number of art-based stretch goals are unlocked, we may need to extend our delivery date. If that's the case, we plan on notifying our backers well ahead of the deadline (preferable shortly after the completion of the Kickstarter) with our new intended delivery date.

Additionally, we are heavily reliant on Brenda Ho to complete the artwork for the campaign. In the case that Brenda is unable to complete due to illness or other unforeseen circumstance, we have budgeted enough money to pay an alternate artist to complete the deck in Brenda's art style.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Zhelter is about surviving a Zombie apocalypse, saving survivors, building shelter. How long do you think you can stay alive in this nightmare?
Welcome to Zombie Apocalypse
Thanks to all backers for 200% funds!
We'll do our best for over your expectation. For the Vehicles, we'll informed you when we fix the details of development schedule through the Kickstarter updates.
Once again, thanks to all backers.
By unknown causes, the Zombie apocalypse has arrived. They’ve burned cities, and you’ve lost your family, friends.
But, you've been saved by a group – people who have accepted you as a new family member. The world is now filled with these furious Zombie creatures, but your new family is saving people without losing hope.
After the end of world, you built a new civilization and society with these people. It’s not the same as before, but eventually you adapt to a new life with them.
But not for long.
A large scale Zombie horde crushes your shelter. You fight, but it’s not enough.
You’re alone once again.
Do you think you can still find new hope?
Do you think you can still fight, this time alone, against an endless Zombie horde?

The core of Zhelter is 'Intense survival', 'Huge action', 'Shelter', 'Open-world'. You explore ruined cities, fight back Zombies, build your own shelter.
It’s not easy staying alive in a city of Zombies. Gather resources for survival from within the ruins 

 24-hours and weather systems
Experience beautifully changing day-cycle and a variety of weather.
24hr system
Weather system
Living in the city with these furious creatures, filled with hatred, is not easy.
Gather/loot various resources from the ruined city to live for another day.
Item looting
Various type of items
Crafts
You can craft items using collected resources for  many useful purposes
Item crafting
Item recipe
How long can you  run and hide. You can shoot these twisted, abominated creatures. Of course,  you might not always have enough bullets.

Intense action
Pull the trigger, experience the coolest action
Shooting to Zombies
Various weapons
Weapons are ready for you
Weapon list
Various Zombies
Many different types of Zombies are ready to (re)die
Ready to Die!
Overwhelming Boss
Defeat those beyond your knowledge who possess overwhelming hatred. And get a special reward.
Big, Strong and Unique
Two, or three survivors joining forces are better than one. Save other survivors hiding in cities and build a shelter with them. Strong shelters and more companions will increase your chance to survive.

Companions & Shelter
Save other survivors in danger and make them companions. Companions will contribute to making a stronger shelter
Make your shelter more efficient for convenience and to be stronger and attractive.
Shelter and Companions
Farm
If you tire of combat, explore. Or set up a farm. You need lots time and effort, but you'll be reasonably rewarded
Growing plants
Each gameplay will be unique - explore open-world. Try many different ways. It is not the strong one survive, survivor is only the strong.

We're using very experimental pixel-art graphics to present a unique style. We're also trying as much as we can to make this a unique and charming experience for the player.

Creative sound designer Syadeu is directing our project. As a sound designer, he’s participated in many projects, including 'Trick Art Dungeon', 'Battle Sorcerer.' And now he preparing high-quality sound effects and an original soundtracks for project Zhelter.
Listen to the first soundtrack. Focus to the lights by Syadeu
 You can check out more of his work at Instagram, or Soundcloud

We are small game studio, whose motto is "Make unforgettable game"
Our previous game 'Trick Art Dungeon' was nominated for awards in several festivals and contests.   
Trick art dungeon
While we don’t have a large crew or budget, but we do have the ability to produce a creative and remarkable in-game experience. We want to present all that in this project - Zhelter.

Zhelter was started March 2019.
The first step was to build a prototype, proving the basics of the game style and art style. The prototype was greatly and positively received at a recent game festival, with actual players very excited about this project. That was motivation enough to continue developing this project. However, we need more time and resources for the 1.0 build stage. We need your help.  
2019 G-Star

You can meet Zhelter at Steam Early Access first. 
We are currently focused to running smoothly on Windows. We're a small team. We want to fully focus on Windows(Steam), instead of multiple platforms at once and being unfocused.

Steam Early Access enables you to sell a game on Steam while it is still being developed and provides context to customers that a product should be considered "unfinished." Early Access is a place for games that are in a playable alpha or beta state, are worth the current value of the playable build, and that you plan to continue to develop for release.
Releasing a game in Early Access helps set context for prospective customers and provides them with information about your plans and goals before a "final" release.


For those of you who do decide to support our project, it would means a lot to us. We want to thank you with these rewards.
* Design patches, stickers, and Zippo lighter designs will be released soon.
* The design of merchandise rewards has not been finalized yet. Please note that it is subject to be changed.

Digital Rewards can be claimed only once per one person. Physical Rewards will begin shipping June 1, 2020 (GMT +9). Inside the “Zombie Kit”, “Companion Kit” and “Conqueror Kit” there will be Design Tickets and everyone will be able to closely communicate with our development team.

This project was developed using our own funding and labor only. Since the start of development for "Zhelter", the more time and effort we put in, the more we are deeply fascinated by this game. For our entire team, this project became an obsession! We believe our hard work has been rewarded as the basis for an amazing game is now set.
However, development costs went way over the budget we initially created. We had secured some loans to keep development going. It is very important to us that we make the game we originally set out to build, without compromising on content or quality for the purposes of saving money. At this point, we have exhausted our loan funding and need some help to keep going…that’s where Kickstarter comes in!
Please help us to keep going by supporting our campaign. You'll soon get an absolutely unforgettable game!
If we can succeed with our Kickstarter fund raising goal, we will be able to utilize ALL of our creative resources fully on “Zhelter” going forward. Through Kickstarter, we want to get the word out on “Zhelter” in the gaming community and secure the funding needed to see it through. We are very confident that this game will be something that will wow the gaming community and provide hours upon hours of fun for all of our backers!

During these final development stages, we want to use the funds to focus our team on “Zhelter” completely. This will ensure the best game we can make and an expedited final development process.
B. Rewards and Shipping

Thanks for viewing our Kickstarter campaign. It doesn’t matter if you decide not to back us, we are very grateful for your interest and for taking the time to check us out!
Sharing our project with your friends, family and social network would be huge for us; truly, thank you for taking the time to check out “Zhelter”!

campaign.story:
Hello! My Name is kira, and I'm a huge CCS fan. You may have seen me on Instagram and  Twitter . I've always wanted to create something that showed my love for the series, and Inktober couldn't have been a better opportunity. I want to share with you all what I have been working on; A CCS Inktober Fanzine!
With your help, I want to be able to raise enough money to share with you all, a 48+ pages art book, featuring all the cards in the series. I'm planning to have the book cover, gold foiled, and perfect bound.
Brand new, additional Inktober Themed CCS Merchandise will also be available! I will continue adding more merchandise to the rewards once we have reached certain stretch goals.
Unless this campaign reaches its first goal, nothing will be made and you will not be charged. You can increase and decrease the amount you pledge before the campaign ends, meaning you can upgrade to the next tier by pledging more, or you can go down a tier. You can also pledge more and stay in the same tier for specific add-ons (like stretch goal merchandise but that will be explained if reached).
With that in mind, I hope you can all support the project and help me bring it to life! You don't have to pledge to support, if you could share it around with other people, it is very much appreciated.
Please note all the prices are already discounted. Orders outside of the campaign will be higher.
There is also an early bird special, so don't miss out! For a limited time only, the full bundle will be discounted for an early bird offer.
There is also an option for signed copies! I will only sign 40 so do check out the reward if you're interested! 
I've also added 3 slots for commissions. If you do pledge that reward, you can choose the theme (related to CCS) and the characters. The original picture will be mailed to you along with the other merch! Please consider this as a way of supporting the project further.
I will add stretch goals to the rewards once they have unlocked. I will be sending out emails in regards to how you can get those extra merch if you have already pledged!
All physical tiers come with a sticker, design to be announced!

 To add the stretch goals to your rewards, please read this carefully.
If you would like to stay in the current tier but have specific stretch goals, you will need to pledge a bit more money to cover the production costs and the extra shipping money.
The prices for each stretch goal is 10 AUD extra! if you would like multiple of the stretch goals, here are the prices. These prices go on top of the pledge.
2 stretch goal rewards +20AUD
3 stretch goal rewards +29AUD
4 stretch goal rewards +38AUD
If you are confused, heres an example. I order Hard copy only tier for $35, and I want 3 stretch goal rewards on top of that. I will pledge $35 for that tier, and pledge an extra $29 for the extra Pin, standee, and tote bag, and $19 for shipping. Total, my pledge will be $83 dollars, but instead of going into the next tier, I stay in the same tier (Hard-copy only tier).
There may be an option for you to go into the next tier, but if you want the stretch goals, please pledge extra and stay in the same tier. Since you are able to change your pledge any time before the campaign ends, you can decide if you want the stretch goals at a later time.
At the end of the campaign, I will send out surveys and ask you which stretch goal reward you wanted and pledged for.
Please note the designs aren't final. There might be slight alterations or changes during the manufacturing phase. The 3rd and 4th stretch goals will have their designs announced once closer to unlocking.
⭑Book and Merchandise: 70%
⭑Shipping and packaging: 10%
⭑Kickstarter fee: 10%
Prices may seem a bit high due to currency exchange, but please do note my suppliers charge USD, and most of the prices in the rewards are calculated from USD to AUD.
IF THERE ARE ANY QUESTIONS, PLEASE ASK ME VIA KIRABUNNI@HOTMAIL.COM OR USE THE FAQ! THANK YOU!

campaign.story:
For 15-year old Makani Kameāloha, those are her magic words.
When she speaks those words into her aloha-powered magic cell phone, she accesses the powers of her mightiest ancestors and she becomes...
Windsurfer #1
 If that sounds a bit like Mary Marvel, except modern and she's Hawaiian, that's because she is! WINDSURFER is:
EVERYTHING WE LOVE ABOUT SUPER-HEROES...
But with a Hawaiian spin! 
In addition to battling super-villains in the backdrop of modern Hawaiʻi, at the heart of WINDSURFER are stories about the timeless and uniquely Hawaiian concepts of ALOHA, PONO, and KULEANA, allowing us to tell new superhero stories we've yet to see anywhere in the world.
WINDSURFER is truly a comic for the modern and future keiki who can further learn about the values and principles of their ancestors along with the issues that Hawaiʻi, faces today!
Which brings me to...
Like many of their Polynesian peers, much of what's important to Hawaiians were and still are their ancestors, from whom their mana comes from. 
For Windsurfer, this couldn't be more true.
Her father, mother, and grandfather were all superheroes and are descendants of several a lineages of gods and goddesses.
It is through them that Windsurfer derives her abilities:
 AIKAU (Mortal Ancestor) - Flying surfboard and surfing abilities 
 LAʻAMAOMAO (ʻAumakua and Goddess of the Wind) - Aerokinesis 
 OLOPUʻE (God of Maui and of Life and Benevolence) - Invulnerability 
 HIʻIAKA (Goddess of Hula, Chant, Sorcery, and Medicine) - Lua [Hiʻiaka was a fierce fighter and lua, a Hawaiʻian martial art, was often embedded through hula, of which she is a goddess of]
 AʻAHUALIʻI (Ancient Hawaiian Dwarf of Great Strength) - Super-strength 
Windsurfer has great mana, and with mana, comes great kuleana!
TECHNOLOGIES CHANGE, BUT ALOHA IS FOREVER
Like any bulletproof Hawaiian teenage superhero worth their paʻakai, Windsurfer must juggle a secret identity, homework, and her... social media?
The age of social media isn't just for selfies and viral videos of puppies, it is the world's fastest platform for the latest breaking news, so with her proprietary made-with-aloha magical phone, the technology-savvy and kuleana-minded Windsurfer has the perfect tool which alerts her to emergencies beyond the scope of ordinary men and women! 
 Sure gives new meaning to answering the call!
A FIRST IN VALLEY ISLE HISTORY
For the first time in history, a Maui-based super-heroine will be featured in her own comic book. 
From Sistah Shark to Nightmarcher to Kanaka, we are in the midst of what can only be described as the golden age of independent publishers featuring Hawaiian super-heroes, and Windsurfer will emerge as the first Maui-based superheroine to be published.
What a time to be alive!
GREAT! NOW... WHO AM I??
My name is Carl LaniʻKeha Shinyama, and I'm a comic book artist from Maui making his debut.
 I attended The Art Institute of Seattle where I studied Fashion Design, a field where the ability to draw and tell a story about your design and its inspiration before you construct the garment(s) is a must-have skill.
Ironically, it led to rejuvenating my love for drawing and creating superheroes, and I've been doing it ever since.
In addition, I also studied at AnimSchool for 3D Character Design for two years, which... also had the effect of leading me back to drawing superheroes.
Since then, I've been hired to do logo designs and character designs, including a superhero concept for a major shoe company.
But the dream has always been to publish a line of titles featuring Hawaiʻian superheroes, starting with Windsurfer!
WHAT ARE THE FUNDS FOR?
Funds are needed to cover the cost of printing 500 units (possibly more) of Windsurfer #1, plus additional special and unique single copies of variants covers and dozens of copies of what will be the first ever superhero comic book published completely in ʻōlelo Hawaiʻi!
(That's right, Windsurfer #1 isn't just going to be the first time a Maui-based superheroine is getting their own comic book, it is also going to be the first ever superhero comic book that is published completely in the Hawaiian language!)
History is going to be made and you can make that a reality!
On the creative side of things, funds are needed for the cost of a letterer and an ʻōlelo Hawaiʻi translator.
(Note: 2018 Ringo Award nominee for Best Colorist, Jasen Smith, will be coloring Windsurfer #1, and his services have been paid upfront.)
Additional costs include the cost of ISBN numbers, shipping, shipping supplies, and a host of special pledge rewards such as shirts, art prints, and more.
Windsurfer #1, along with other printed reward items, will be shipped in specially designed mailers from Gemini Comic Supply so that when you receive your copy, it will arrive in excellent condition.
 Additionally, while shirts are soft items that are unlikely to be damaged by the rough handling that often is used during shipping, but they will nonetheless be protected by waterproof packaging.
And lastly, also being taken into account is the 5% fee that Kickstarter takes when the campaign succeeds.
HOW FAR ALONG IS WINDSURFER #1?
Character designs are done.
Logos are done.
The cover art is done.
The art for a two-page primer on Windsurfer's origin story is already completed.
The art for the story is already underway.
All that's left to do is finish it, which is 32 pages long, get it colored, and lettered (in both languages). Then it'll be off to the printer and into your hands!
WHAT KIND OF PLEDGE REWARDS AM I OFFERING?
In total, I am offering, these rewards:
Digital and physical copies of Windsurfer #1, prints, stickers, bookmarks, shirts, and here's the best part: Historical copies of the world's first ever comic in ʻōlelo Hawaiʻi!
The higher the pledge reward tier you choose, the more of these items and value you get. These pledge packages have both the customer and the retailer in mind. If you are an educator, the retailer package may appeal to you as well! 
PLEDGE TODAY AND MAKE HISTORY!
WINDSURFER will make history as the first Valley Isle-based super-heroine to get her own title, as well as the first ever superhero comic to be published in ʻōlelo Hawaiʻi, so don't miss out on your chance to be a part of history!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
However, there are going to be challenges with this project.

I do work a day job and I am one person managing a number of moving parts, so it will take time for the comic to be done. Months, to be honest.

However, the expectation is that everything will be completed no later than April 1st. Even then, expectations are just that because even the unexpected happens. To accommodate for the unexpected, the shipping date is set for June on most of the pledges. This is just to be absolutely safe, but most should expect the rewards before then.

And straight talk: I am an unproven comic book creator doing this for the first time, so it is a leap of faith on your part, but I am eager to live up to it because this is my passion and what I was meant to do. I have been and will continue to pour every ounce of aloha into this project.

campaign.story:
Join Book of Travels and become part of a unique social roleplaying experience that doesn’t hold your hand. Inspired by genre classics, this is an online adventure that sets you adrift in an intricate fairytale world... but it’s also an invitation to roleplay without the restraints of linear quests and plotlines. Feel at liberty to travel the free wilds and vivid cities of the Braided Shore peninsula. Wander deep into the layers of this hand-drawn world, stumble upon its hidden places or unravel one of its many mysteries. There is no overarching goal, no real beginning or end, and ultimately you are in charge of shaping your own journey. It’s a land of elusive creatures, lush natural beauty and pastoral calm... but one that has known troubles and where shadows play their part.    
“Might and Delight’s peaceful online adventure could change the way we think of multiplayer experiences.” 
Rachel Watts, PCgamer.com
Right from the start, our ambition was to take the conventional elements of traditional RPGs and use them to make something new – specifically, a world where players can enjoy calm exploration, discovery, and quietly forged companionships. We knew that we wanted to offer the sensation of being a wanderer in a wild, luscious, unexplored world, where you can form friendships and overcome obstacles – alone or together.   
We’re pleased with what we have made so far: an online RPG that focuses more on roleplaying and personality traits than on stats and numbers. There are no linear quest lines built into the game, instead we wanted Book of Travels to be a truly living world, one where you’ll stumble across events and characters unexpectedly. It’s up to you to follow the leads you gather and piece together the stories of Braided Shore.
In making our previous games we found that there’s an appetite for games that allow players to delve deep into a world and to slowly thread together events, moments, and emotions into something that’s all their own. With Book of Travels we’re bringing the same interpretive, creative style of play to a much bigger world.
“This is exactly what we need to challenge what people think when they think of multiplayer games”  
Bree Royce, Massivelyoverpowered.com  
When emotion plays a part
Your interactions and choices will have effects that you might not expect in traditional RPGs. Acting with curiosity and thoughtfulness will evolve your character in the same way as performing tasks or undertaking endeavours. Events that are usually trivialized in RPGs are instead made into strong emotional moments. Witnessing a death, for example, will weigh more heavily on your character for each day that passes, but by visiting the deceased’s resting place, your grief will be transformed into a new energy – one that will remove that weight and strengthen you instead.   
Wordless communication for richer roleplay
When it comes to in-game communication, we’ve found that playing with a limited range of expression makes for more involving interaction between players – that’s why there’s no text chat in the game. In Book of Travels, you’ll communicate with other players using a unique set of emotes and symbols which are unlocked as you experience new things. This means that you’ll gain symbols to express ‘boat’ and ‘market’ once you’ve encountered them. We’ve used this bold kind of game design before, and we fell in love with how wordless communication boosted players’ creativity as they found ways to say a lot with very little. This made for a more immersive kind of roleplay and also had a very positive effect on the culture amongst our community.  
“Book of Travels clearly shows the gaming community’s desire for a fresh concept for an MMORPG”
Marc Marasigan, MMOS.com 
TMORPG – Tiny Multiplayer Online
Book of Travels also differs from traditional MMOs because of its multiplayer design. Instead, we’re calling it a TMO – a Tiny Multiplayer Online. That’s because there really won’t be anything ‘massive’ about the multiplayer aspect of the game. Instead we’re building a game experience where there will just be a few people on each server, and when you cross paths, we want it to be a memorable moment. Should you choose to wander alone you won’t be missing out on any of the world’s wonder and enchantment. But if you do want to form a band of Travellers, the scarcity of other folk will make your companionships special and your group’s bond that much deeper.  
You never know what lies ahead
As you play you’ll encounter countless randomly occurring events. These can be anything from townsfolk that pass you by, a flock of deer, a travelling merchant or an event that tells a story. Some events will inspire you to seek out particular places or follow leads, others will need immediate action and decision-making from you and your group. Events have certain conditions, such as ‘can only appear during night’ or ‘only occurs in x location when raining’. This complex design is what makes the game truly unique: it will present something different each time you play, giving every player a different story to share. Beneath this structure lie multiple large and small plotlines for you to uncover and by sharing your findings (on the game’s Discord server, for example) you can start to peel back the layers of an immensely deep world of stories and secrets. We’ve worked on this part of the game more than any other – making the world ever-changing, and giving it a life of its own. 
”It sounds like nothing else, this could be one of the most unique RPGs I've seen in a very long time.” 
Liam Dawe, gamingonlinux.com 
Collaborate to delve deeper
Book of Travels is meant to be played in many different ways. It’s a game perfect for players who want to adventure alone, because there are no typical linear quest lines, and there’s so much to experience through free exploration. But the game is also tailored to be exciting when travelling with a band of new found friends. There are events in the game that we call Endeavours. These are things that players in groups can interact with, and they can trigger a variety of outcomes. Endeavours come in four categories; Mystical, Physical, Social and Mechanical. A group might find a machine that requires them to collaborate to activate it. They might come across a boat to reach a far away island. They might simply encounter a social situation that demands more than one player. This design is a key part of our intention to create a multiplayer culture based on roleplaying, social interaction and collaboration rather than PVP.  
Braided Shore is a fantasy world that blurs the lines between many things: between civilisation and nature, industrialism and magic, people and beings. It’s a culture in which honour and humanity is celebrated, but it’s not without its shadows. It’s an early industrial society that has one foot firmly rooted in tradition. 
Click to enlarge
The region is inhabited by many spirit beings, but none are more prominent than the Sefra. Sefra are solitary and volatile and live in regions of the peninsula they have chosen to inhabit and protect. This doesn’t mean that they are at odds with humans – they often live peacefully alongside them, sometimes even working with their councils – but they are known for their unpredictability and their tempers can have huge consequences. 
There are two common types of magic in Braided Shore, but they don’t belong to the realm of conventional wizardry. Knots are used as a means of communication but may also be magic. In Knotcraft, binding can be used to conjure magic energies – they are always potent and usually benign. One type of knot may conjure ‘light’ while another may conjure ‘smoke’ or ‘shelter’. Brewing tea isn’t always a magical ritual either (folk love to visit tea houses or sup tea together with friends) but neither is it uncommon to perform a tea ceremony wherein a special tea is brewed to endow the drinker with wondrous abilities, such as invisibility, healing and weather resistance.
The Braided Shore Lore Compendium gives much more detail on these practices, their common use and their history, as well as on all things Braided Shore.   
As this campaign grows we will be populating an area in the game known as Travellers’ Meadow with Night Flowers, one for every backer. Night Flowers are a rare find on Braided Shore and the particular blue of their petals is very unusual throughout the region. What’s more, they become luminescent in warm weather, and in large clusters will illuminate any fair-weathered night.
We can’t wait to see Travellers’ Meadow fill with Night Flowers! And when you play Book of Travels, Travellers’ Meadow will be your special place – a place to rest, meet up with other Travellers. So back us and watch the empty meadow shimmer with the blue glow of Night Flowers!  
7,000+ Night Flowers in Travellers’ Meadow
Many have likened the gameview to a living picture book – a perfect summary! Technically, this is because the game uses a camera that only moves in two dimensions, creating an almost orthographic field of view, and mixing 3D spaces with flat 2D sprites. Regardless of definition, the way the game looks and is navigated is quite rare.
Our inspiration started with classic isometric RPGs, but we wanted to find a way to bring a more cinematic scope to the scenes. Using a unique mix of techniques, we’ve designed Book of Travels to make your character feel small, letting the landscape around you play a bigger role. The experience is much like walking freely inside a page in a book, taking in the richly illustrated world around you.
We’re proud to share some of the art from the development phase below! To see even more pledge for any rewarded that includes the digital sketchbook, which will be packed with lots and lots of sketches and pre-production designs.
Click on the thumbnails to open the full image.
See our updates for the latest on lore and game play:
Update #5: All about knotspells
Update #8: Go’Bad, draisine travel and healing tea
Update #9: Design an island for the game
Update #10: Sefra lore
Update #11: Gameplay lowdown
Update #12: Mementos and artwork revealed
Update #13: Dreams, a minigame, memories, accessories and pets
Update #14: Free Book of Maps (60 pages) to The Settlers and above
Update #15: Play music together + dreams
Update #16: Combat
Update #17: Your knotspells chosen
Update #18: Free games: Meadow to all Travellers and above and Tiny Echo to all Settlers and above!
Update #19: TWO new stretch goals: a portal and a travel journal!
Update #20: Video with Flik the Cat – a new in-game feature (miaow)
Update #21: Thank You for Transformational Campaign 
We’re a small independent game studio based in Stockholm, Sweden. Founded by artists in 2010, the studio is comprised of people from all kinds of different backgrounds. We have released seven games, all of which have a highly crafted visual style and explore emotionally engaging themes such as loss, freedom and solitude. Few of these games fit neatly into genres, but what they have in common is the way they allow players to explore, to speculate and to reflect.  
Our experienced team has worked for leading game studios and has together shipped over 40+ games outside of Might and Delight.
This isn’t our first online game: Meadow, now in its fourth year, connected players who loved the Shelter games allowing them to explore together, communicating with emotes and unlocking magical obelisks. We had no idea that Meadow would go on to bring so much enjoyment for such a long time. We’ve been overwhelmed by the stories and artwork that Might and Delight players have made and shared – it’s really shown us how rich and deep this kind of gameplay can be! Making Meadow and getting to know its community have inspired us to make a TMO of a much different, much bigger kind. 
Might & Delight games wouldn’t be what they are without the input of our community – put simply, community support and feedback help us design better games. We want to invite more people in at an earlier stage of development, so that you can help us make the game that you want to play.
We’re already funded enough to get us through production, but this campaign will mean the game can evolve and expand, because we’ll be listening to your ideas and adding them into the world... Which of course means you get to play a bigger and better game, but also that you’ll know that you helped to create it!
We’ve been working on these rewards for a long time now. developing them to help enrich your game experience and help you get to know the Braided Shore. Please take a look and see which one might suit you best!    
Memento and signed artwork:
We will release Book of Travels in 2020 and we’re also looking into offering an early access launch. When the campaign is over we’ll keep backers updated with development milestones. After release, the game will be available on Steam for $30.00 and wherever you buy Book of Travels, there will be no subscription fee.
We will continue to evolve the world, its lore and its backstory, adding events and levels for years to come. Right now we are committed to updating the project for a five year period, post-release.
Thank you so much for taking the time to learn about our work! We feel much gratitude for having this opportunity to connect with you and would love to hear your feedback and/or questions on Steam.

Might and Delight are experienced developers and publishers and fully aware of the demands and challenges of a busy production shedule. While we cannot rule out that minor delays may occur, we are fully confident that the project (which is part way through developement) will be successfully completed and delivered to all backers without issue.

updates.update_userinfo: Food and Drink in Braided Shore
updates.update_content:
Dear Travellers,
Today we sample some of the culinary delights available to the visitors and denizens of Braided Shore. Among them are the rudiments of sustenance found, foraged and bartered for, as well as more gastronomical delights to be enjoyed at moments of leisure...
When it comes to food, our design is comfortably conventional, with nutrition and nourishment coming by way of breads and vegetables. And … a socio-economic pattern has been applied, with pastoral regions such as Crossroads consuming much grain and bread and coastal areas like Myr enjoying abundant fish suppers (even game designers should pay attention in Geography class).

updates.update_userinfo: SPECIAL UPDATE: A release date for Book of Travels + Watch the trailer!
updates.update_content:
Dear Travellers,
We’ve been journeying together for a little while now, but today the time has finally come to reveal our date for Early Access along with some more glimpses of the world we are getting so close to embarking on. We hope you love it! We know that some of you are as excited as we are about setting foot on Braided Shore, and now we have a date... So circle the calendar and prepare your hearts,

updates.update_userinfo: Sprites and Small Spirits - A look at some of the tiny beings of Braided Shore
updates.update_content:
Dearest Travellers,
In Braided Shore a whole range of encounters is possible; an enraged Sefra might knock you from your path or a happy hearted one surprise you with a boon, or perhaps a meeting with a Malku Su might leave you feeling a little small. But look down and think tiny, because little lurkers are also on the move! Some will come in single spies, and others in battalions, but in most cases these little creatures will cause you no sorrow and are in fact as harmless as rabbits...

updates.update_userinfo: All about Regeants! Explore, Discover and Make Magic...
updates.update_content:
Dear Backers and Travellers,
What word best describes those items used in spell casting? In Braided Shore these ‘ingredients’ are known as Reagents, and as your travels unfold you’ll come to know a great deal about them...

updates.update_userinfo: New schedules + hello Oliver, our new CM!
updates.update_content:
Dear Travellers,
Today instead of our regular post, we have some scheduling news plus an exciting addition to our team, so let’s dive right in...
Tuesdays are the new Fridays

Dear Travellers,
As you may know, the Book of Travels experience is one of immersion and discovery, so it makes sense that in this game, level design is as much the work of the art team as Narrative Designers. Here we’re sharing a little bit about our approach to designing levels and the intended play experience we hope to create.

updates.update_userinfo: Items, Object, Artefacts... and how they'll help your travels
updates.update_content:
Dear Travellers,
In between dev updates we’ve trickled out some of the lore of this land, peeking in on spirits, listening to the thoughts of everyday folk and soundtracking its wilderness. But we want to share how it feels to play a part in this world, so today we cordially invite you to imagine immersion through... stuff. So this post is all about the objects and items that you’ll be able to toss into a backpack as you travel around Braided Shore and how they’ll enrich your play experience. As ever, we’d love you to drop us a comment or two with your thoughts. As always you can access the Steam post here LINK.

updates.update_userinfo: Travel and Transport in Braided Shore
updates.update_content:
Dearest Backers,
As that title suggests, the heart of Book of Travels is about your journey and your stories, threading together as one. Through wandering and roaming your adventures will unfurl, in traversing and trundling your discoveries will enrich them. Mostly this will be done by foot, but respite can be taken on boats and trains, and from time to time magical means might see you travelling in more unexpected ways. Today we’re dipping into these gameplay possibilities, we look forward to hearing your thoughts!

Dear Travellers
There are many ways in which we’d like to bring you closer to the world of Braided Shore - in Music, a travel guide and lore readers of this post have come to know how it feels to live in its woods and wilds and to travel its age old roads. But there’s no better way to understand a land than by listening to its people, and in this week’s post we hear a little bit about life for four of the region’s denizens. Below, a Travelling Merchant, Historian, Farmer and Bandit give us their views on how life is for them. We think you’ll find that there’s much to ruminate on in the hopes and fears that their words reveal.

updates.update_userinfo: Braided Shore: A mini-guide for Travellers
updates.update_content:
Dearest Backers,
There are many layers to the making of Book of Travels, and while we’ve shared a lot about game mechanics, our processes and our team, few posts have touched on the world that will soon be yours to explore. Here we share a little outline of the region - just enough to help a newcomer get their bearings but not too much to dampen the curious spirit. We hope your interest is piqued and we’d love to hear your thoughts!

campaign.story:
The Nameless One (a Tarot & Oracle Deck)
 Exchange not names, only understanding 
From the creator of the Children of Litha tarot
The Nameless One holding the energy of The Fool
If you've been following me on Instagram or Facebook this past year, you already know all about this combination Tarot, Oracle, and Sigil deck I've created. I've been posting teasers for months now. If this is the first you've heard, let me tell you a little bit about it!
 About The Deck 
A Nameless One with the tarot energy of Death (shown next to the The Children of Litha Tarot for scale)
 100 fully illustrated cards (with an additional 8 cards to be potentially unlocked as stretch goals). Each deck will contain 22 cards corresponding to the Major Arcana, 56 Cards corresponding to the Minor Arcana, and an additional 22 oracle cards of my own design, making it 100 cards total. 
 Custom large format size - Dramatic, striking, & unlike any other. The cards in this deck are approximately 89 x 146 mm (3.5 x 5.75 inches) in size. As there are no words, numbers, or titles printed anywhere on the cards, this size ensures the complete attention and focus of the unconscious mind, as it allows us a clear and unobstructed view of the images on display. The messages rest purely in the visual symbolism depicted in each illustration. 
 High quality card stock - 350GSM. Just the right thickness & durability to help stand the test of time.
 Matte finish - protective and smooth to the touch, this finish helps protect the cards & avoid fingerprints & smudges. 
 Black edges - Classy & timeless, with an aura of mystery.
 A sturdy two-piece box - to hold, secure, and protect your cards. (Subject to stretch goal upgrades.) 
A Nameless One holding the Tarot energy of Temperance
The Nameless One Tarot Correspondences for The Moon & The Sun
How might I use The Nameless One?
Instead of titles, each card possesses a unique sigil forged from an affirmation based on the traditional tarot card's positive aspects. This allows one the ability to utilize this deck in countless ways. As each reader seeks to find Truth, so too will they undoubtedly find a special bond with their Nameless cards as they learn techniques and methodologies that suit their specific and individual needs. Listed below are but a few ways to use this deck:
 As Tarot Cards - Use the companion book to separate out the 78 cards corresponding to the meanings of the traditional tarot and use them as you would any other deck. Although it may take more time to memorize each face, once you do you shall possess Nameless companions, you will leave those who are unfamiliar with the deck awestruck by your unique connection to the cards. 
 As Affirmation Cards - Use the companion book to look up the affirmation that the sigil was forged from and carry its positive message with you throughout your day. Let it resonate within your soul and help ground & guide you. 
 As Oracle Cards - Without the words to limit them, one may simply look at, or meditate over each card and intuit a meaning all their own. Use the entire deck or divide it into several smaller ones by picking the cards that resonate most strongly with you on any given day. Even the sigils were made with the intuitive in mind, as they utilize the power of shape language to imply multiple layers of meaning. 
 As Sigils - Shuffle the deck & choose a card or pick one directly with an energy you need to borrow, then copy its sigil on a separate piece of paper. Charge and activate that sigil as you will. The companion book will include many suggestions for charging and activating your sigils, as well as instructions for creating your very own sigils!
This deck is completely yours to personalize with many bonds to forge. The readings and uses are too many to list.  
A Nameless One holding the Tarot energy of The Magician next to The Magician from The Children of Litha Tarot for size comparison.
 I know all about Tarot & Oracle...but what is a Sigil? 
A sigil is a symbol of power that one makes to aid them (or their clients) in manifesting their desires into reality. There are many different ways to make and use Sigils. So what I'm about to tell you is but one path of many. Still, as far as The Nameless One is concerned, a Sigil is a symbol made with a specific meaning & energy drawn from a positive affirmation. By copying the sigil from the card, while focusing on that affirmation, one can trap and then harness its energy to help them manifest a desire that resonates with the sigil's meaning.  
Copying a Sigil from The Nameless One
After copying the symbol onto a separate piece of paper, one can then "release" its power into the universe by "charging" and "activating" it. This will help turn the tides of fate in your favor. There are a lot of different ways to do this, but my preference is to burn the paper (while exercising proper fire safety procedures and while in a safe & calm environment) and focus on my desire as I watch the symbol be consumed by the flame. Some prefer to charge & activate their sigils by staring at the symbol and visualizing their energy pouring into it, like pouring water into a vessel. One is encouraged to experiment and find something that works well for them.  
Burning a copied sigil from The Nameless One
If funded, I will go into this process in a lot more detail with the companion book (which will be available in both physical and PDF format) as well as include other valuable information including but not limited to: The meanings & symbols of each card, it's material world correspondences (i.e., herbs, crystals, elements, astrology, numerology etcetera), a brief history of sigils, how they relate to tarot, and how to make your very own. The book will likely span over 300 pages, and will include full color prints & pictures of the cards in a hard fabric cover (if the full color & hardcover stretch goals are unlocked).
The Royal Court 
Another way in which The Nameless One is unique is that there are no "live" humans anywhere in the deck. It features only plants, animals, insects, objects, and bones. This is so that anyone, regardless of race, age, sex, gender, or orientation might better relate to the images and messages they carry. Instead of focusing on our differences, The Nameless One speaks to our similarities. So it depicts the things we all have in common: the Earth we live on, the animals we share it with, the history of art and design we have created, and the skeletons that carry us through it all. To reconcile this theme with the court cards (which in traditional tarot are used to represent the people and faces in our lives) I have tuned the royal court into Venetian masks. Famous for their intricacy, these masks often bore a strange symbolism all their own, and were admired the world over. Thus, they create an ideal platform for occult symbolism.  
The Court of Blades. From left to right these are in tarot: King, Queen, Princess (or Knight) & Jester (or Page). As an oracle deck they represent the Zodiac as: Libra, Aquarius, Gemini, and the element Air or the Season of Autumn.
The Court of Branches. From left to right these are in tarot: King, Queen, Prince (or Knight) & Jester (or Page). As an oracle deck they represent the Zodiac as: Aries, Leo, Sagittarius, and the element Fire or the Season of Summer.
The Court of Coins. From left to right these are in tarot: King, Queen, Princess (or Knight) & Jester (or Page). As an oracle deck they represent the Zodiac as: Capricorn, Taurus, Virgo, and the element Earth or the Season of Winter.
The Court of Cups. From left to right these are in tarot: King, Queen, Prince (or Knight) & Jester (or Page). As an oracle deck they represent the Zodiac as: Pisces, Cancer, Scorpio, and the element Water or the Season of Spring.
Anyone can wear a mask - and these masks are meant to represent the different metaphorical "masks" and personas we all wear and use to interact with others throughout our lives. Each of the Kings, Queens, and Prince/Princesses correspond directly to Zodiac matches (for example, the King of Coins represents Capricorn, the Queen of Branches is Leo, the Prince of cups is Scorpio, etc.). This enables one to choose a tarot significator based on their zodiac correspondence if they are using The Nameless One as a tarot deck, or separate the court cards and use them as a zodiac-based oracle deck, should the mood strike them. The Jesters of each court may be used as Pages in traditional Tarot, Seasons or elements in oracle, or wild-cards in either! They might also be used as significator card (if one wished to leave all the zodiac correspondences "in play" during a reading). They are a very fun and versatile addition.

These fine 100% silk cloths measure at 20"X 20" and are hand dyed in the USA. The raw silk comes from China, as all quality silk has for as long as as the material has existed. Then they are shipped to a wonderful woman here in the USA where they are hand dyed in small batches and perfectly color matched to The Nameless One. They are truly magnificent and add a real feel of luxury and glamour to your deck. Thank you for your time & support
Being a human being can be difficult, and being an artist can seem a fool's errand, but that's where I'm at. Yet as difficult as things can be, I am amazed time and time again by the unrelenting proof that we are not in it alone. The Children of Litha was my first Tarot endeavor and I learned so much while making it and so much more by sharing it with the world. As scary as it was to show such a vulnerable part of myself, it was 100 times more gratifying to find the warmth, love, support, & Magick of this community. For the first time in my life I truly understood what it was like to be a part of something bigger than myself. I could not have achieved it without your support, and there are no words big enough to convey the scope of my gratitude. And so my friends, I call upon your aid once more to help me breath life into yet another creation and share it with the world. Thank you a thousand times for your time & support!
May love and light bless you on your path,
-Xia

Hello to all my wonderful backers!
I have some news and some housekeeping items to discuss, so please read this update in its entirety. We are nearing the finish line, and I want to make sure everyone is up to date!
Companion Grimoire is Being Printed

Hi Everyone! I am so sorry for the lack of communication for the past month. Honestly, there was not much to tell and I didn't want to send you "filler" updates with the information you already knew. I know it must be frustrating (believe me it's frustrating for me too) but from this point forward, it's pretty much a waiting game as we wait for the manufacturers.  Please trust that if there are no updates it simply means I do not have news to share with you. I care about my backers deeply and make total transparency a priority when engaging with you guys. I draft these updates as soon as I have any bit of meaningful information to share. And it turns out that today, I have very big news to share; I've finally received the official proof of the Nameless One Companion Grimoire! (AKA: The Big Book).

updates.update_content:
Hi, everyone! 
I hope you all had a safe and relaxing holiday and a happy new year. We're hitting the ground running this year and making a lot of progress on the big book. We're deep into the suit of Coins for final edits, and I anticipate finishing the whole thing by the end of the month. Then, it is off to the printers.

Another Quick Update 
The cards, the little book, and the box design are all complete and off to the printers! As soon as I have them from the manufacturer, you can bet pictures and videos will be appearing in updates.  With this goal met, we are now focusing entirely on finishing the final editing for the large companion book, so we can have that sent off ASAP.  The editing process for the "big book" is rather painful, but we are making steady progress. I really, really, REALLY want to be done with it this year, but we shall see. I'd rather it be as perfect as possible since no one likes to read a book with a bunch of typos! Nevertheless, we are hoping to start shipping orders out to backers sometime in March.

But I wanted to wait until I’d finished writing the companion guidebook ("The Big Book"), and guess what? I’ve finally finished! I cannot describe what a relief that is.
