campaign.story:
Imagine  a role playing game where you can sit down at any time, with anyone,  and just play. You pull a character sheet out of your wallet, use a  rolling app on your phone and get to it.  Everyone already knows all the  rules and those that don't, learn them immediately.
Charm is a tabletop Role Playing Game that uses a simple, yet  versatile rule set. The rules can be learned in minutes and offer a  fully immersive game experience. A character can fit on a sheet as small  as a business card.
The 100 page 8"x8" perfect bound book will be fulfilled through Drive Thru RPG via voucher.
Charm uses our intuition about a scenario to help drive the game with  a focus on role playing. The game allows characters to be built so they  are good at what they do. This allows each player to have a unique  experience and have confidence when making decisions.   
Charm uses simple resolution system to determine the outcome of actions that characters take. Rolling high gets you more than you expect, while rolling lower means the GM can take moves against you. In the middle are mixed successes - you achieve your goal, but something bad may also happen to you.
As these benefits or consequences are encountered, it allows the players and GM to build and explore more of the game.
Asylum Reflections: People are being replaced in Victorian London and try not to get thrown into the Asylum.
 Charm is not only a standalone universal system. Included are 7 Scenarios that will get you gaming quickly:
 Action News Team 5: You are the city's most  elite local news team! It isn't easy staying on top. You'll need to pull  together all your guile and charisma to keep the number 1 spot.
 Temporal Raiders: Travel time, seeking the  ultimate heist. Ally with powerful historical figures, change history,  be your own grandfather. What could go wrong?
 Dustbound: Take on the role of a god-touched  gunslinger in a bleak world of dust and decay. Fight Oni, rival  gunslingers and vengeful townsfolk.
 Mystery Solvers Incorporated : Jeepers, guys.  Play as a gang of kids, or possibly a lovable pet, who solve mysteries  using their astonishing meddling abilities.
 The Pact of Night: Small town woes meet big  monster drama. Play a Vampire or Werewolf as you balance your life with  the humans during the day and beasts at night.
 Onitech: You exist in a high-tech world ruled by  demon masters. Civility has superseded morality, leading to a perverted  and deadly state of affairs.
 Victorian Asylum Reflections: In Victorian London, people are being replaced with mirrored doubles. Uncover the duplicitous  mystery in this dark world.  
Mystery Incorporated: You are just a bunch of kids and possibly their really smart pet. How much meddling can you do?
Charm's design is basic, yet functions as an RPG with a much higher  complexity. It's a great game for players of all skill levels. Charm  teaches newer players the ropes of what RPGs are all about. It gives  seasoned players the chance to eschew less efficient rules that don't  add fun during play.
As long as you have one D20, one D6 and a small slip of paper, you  can play Charm. Make and play a game almost anywhere in an instant.  Carry your character sheet in your wallet. 
Dustbound: A brutal world in decay, play a demi-god with magic guns, seeking for a way to save it.
Charm uses a simple set of guidelines to get started:
1. The players and GM discuss the game scenario and genre. The GM  forms a goal for the players and designs threats that need to be  overcome.
2. A power level is selected. This describes how powerful the  characters are in the world, their standard abilities and their  exception powers.
3. All players make a character. Choose an Archetype based on the  scenario, a Nature the character acts with and 3 Aspects. An Aspect  describes a character's talent. Each Aspect gets a small pool of points  which may be used to activate a power, react reflexively, enhance your  skill checks, or reroll your dice.
4. Start Playing! 
Rolling: When a challenge is presented, the player  must roll if they want to pass it. A single D20 + a single D6 are both  rolled at once. After rolling, review the D20 result. If the value meets  or exceeds a check set by the GM, the challenge is overcome. If the  result is much higher or lower than the check value, the character may  gain or lose something. The value on the D6 may be added in to beat the  challenge by spending an Aspect point.
Check Values: Characters must meet a check value to  beat a challenge. The GM sets a check based on how easy it is for a  character of a power level to succeed. 3 is easy, 6 is moderate, 9 is  hard and so on.
Characters have an easier time passing challenges related to their  field of expertise. A gunslinger's check for shooting a playing card at  100 yards is lower than a miner's.
Nature: Nature describes how a character acts or  approaches situations. If using Nature can be justified to help succeed a  challenge, it may be spent to gain a minimum guaranteed success.
Aspects: Aspects each have points associated. You  primary Aspects have more points. Anytime during play, when you can  justify the use of the Aspect as part of a challenge, you may spend an  Aspect point. Spending a point allows you to add the  D6 value to the  D20, reroll either or both dice, activate a Power, or take an action on  another character's turn.
A total of 1 Aspect point per character level may be spent per  action. As characters progress, they can spend more points to do amazing  things each turn.
At this point, you should know enough to be able to play Charm! 
Q and A with Dan Davenport of Random Worlds
Click the link to download!
Click the link to download!
Charm is elegant. It incorporates the things we all know into a roleplaying game and allows us to leverage that during play. This means that Charm hits harder than its small ruleset may indicate. How you interact with the story, what you choose to do are all integrated. It's a game you just play in a better way.
A standard Charm PC Card front and back
Each Scenario get it's own PC sheet
Onitech: The new world exists as walled citied controlled by demons in a high tech future. Civility reigns over morality.

 Games like Charm are a labor of love. They can exist in the digital  world, but truly can't be brought to life without funding and support.  We need your help to make this game and get it in the hands of players.  This means help with funding for editing and art along with printing.
Lets share this game with the world and help spread the word, that there's a different way to RPG.
Budget Breakdown
MORE ART: For every $500 over the initial goal, 7 art pieces will be added to the book. This is one additional piece of art for each Scenario!
SCENARIOS: By hitting $3000 and $4000, we will add a Scenario with two pieces of art for each one!
Bounty Hunter Run - You can take on the role of the  heroes or the  bounty hunters in this scenario. Over an uninhabited  jungle planet, a  group of intergalactic bounty hunters has shot down a  ship of important  heroes and they're on the hunt. The clock ticks as  reinforcements are  incoming. Will the bounty hunters capture the marks  before then? Or will  the heroes win the day?
No Way Out - You're a small, tightknit crew of  ne'er-do-wells  that operate a medium-sized salvage ship. When you get a  distress call  for a luxury liner and no human life-signs aboard, you  think you've got  it made. But once you get on board, you realize you're  not alone. Sci-fi  and survival horror blend together in this scenario.
These Scenarios will be written by Bryan Young and are completely  designed by him to run in the Charm system. Expect excellent writing  with interesting characters and interactions with the world.

 After purchase, when the product is ready to go live, you will receive an voucher for the book via DTRPG. Input your address and pay for shipping to get your copy! We are not charging for shipping in this campaign. 
 Strange Machine Games – SMG – was founded in 2011 as a small Role  Playing Game, POD publisher. SMG launched with the successfully crowd  funded Age Past RPG. Age Past is 400 pages, full color, and rivals much  larger companies production value for layout and art. Since, SMG has  published SuperAge and the Robotech RPG. All the books are beautiful and use top down design to create the best play experience.
SMG aims to make the most dynamic and interesting Board Game &  RPG products on the market, even if it means using strange machines to  get there. In every SMG product, we aim to provide a unique experience. We hope to win over the hearts of those  who give SMG products a try.
SMG products are designed, not just created. Cogent consideration goes into every design decision to help craft a great experience in  every aspect of the game, from the layouts, player interaction, to the  content. We truly endeavor to bring you products that speak to your  soul.

campaign.story:
The Wizarding Cookbook: Year One
First of all, we would like to thank you for checking out our Kickstarter Campaign for the first Wizarding Cookbook of a series of 7!
The Wizarding Cookbook has been a project of ours for over a year - recreating recipes from a franchise that everyone has fallen in love with has been our drive. Testing each recipe dozens of times to make sure it is as perfect as can be.
The "Wizarding Cookbook: Year One" has been designed to look like it has come straight out of the library or cookery class at Hogwarts - It is meant to look worn, from years of abuse by students in year 1. 
This cookbook was owned by the Half-Blood Cook, who you will notice has scribbled out parts of the recipes and made it their own. Each page will have written notes by this mysterious someone to appear as authentic as possible. Make sure to follow their advise, otherwise your recipe might be a disaster!
Each premium cookbook is worn down by hand making each one unique in its own way! 
The cover for this beautiful cookbook!
 This beautifully designed cookbook comes in a few different versions:
Paperback Version - This is a standard A5 paperback version of the book. The cover is printed on thick paper, and the inside pages are designed to look like real parchment paper. The entire book is printed in full colour.
Hardback Version - This is a standard A5 hardback version of the book. The cover is printed on thick board, and the inside pages are designed to look like real parchment paper. The entire book is printed in full colour.
Premium Hardback Version - This is a premium A5 hardback version of the book. The cover is made to look like real worn down fabric, with a gold foil printed design all round. The inside pages are printed on high quality paper to give it a more magical feel. The entire book is printed in full colour.
DARK Premium Hardback Version - This is a premium A5 hardback version of the book. The cover is made to look like real worn down BLACK fabric, with a silver foil printed design all round. The inside pages are printed on high quality paper to give it a more magical feel. The entire book is printed in full colour.
SIGNED VERSION - The signed version is a once in a life-time opportunity. You will receive one of the Premium Hardback Versions of the book (your choice!) and it will be hand signed by an original, major cast member of the Harry Potter franchise! This is extremely limited to 15 books available! 
Each premium cookbook is worn down by hand making each one unique in its own way! 
The DARK version (Black and silver print) and the Original (Green and gold print)
We are so proud of the book we have created, with the 50+ recipes which we are adding onto on a weekly basis! We want to make sure this is the most comprehensive Wizarding Cookbook on the market. On top of this, we want to make sure that it feels like it is straight out of a Wizarding school.   
The limited posters + Proud To be a Wizard Pins (Witch also available.)
Our beautiful Stretch Goals!
We have included some amazing Stretch Goals - once we have reached our target of £5,000, the Stretch Goals (Pictured below) will start to unlock.
Exclusive Sticker Set - Once £5,000 has been reached, these beautifully designed, high quality stickers will unlock. These were custom made for this Kickstarter and are perfect to decorate anything you want! Show off your Harry Potter pride in style!
Exclusive Hedwig Pin - Once £7,000 has been reached, this cute little hard enamel pin will be unlocked! Hedwig is everyones favourite little owl and with this pin you can show off your love! It'll come cardboard backed and ready to pin to your bag, clothing or wherever you like!
Exclusive Pigwidgeon Pin - Once £8,000 has been reached, Hedwigs little friend will be unlocked; Pidwidgeon! A beautiful hard enamel pin ready to put beside the other to make a complete set!
Exclusive Foil Wooden Bookmark - Once £9,000 has been reached, you will also be receiving this real wood, foil printed bookmark to make sure you don't forget your place in our amazing Wizarding Cookbook Year One! 
Exclusive Fluffy Pin - Once £10,000 has been reached, you will receive our favourite pin EVER. Fluffy is at the heart of millions of Harry Potter fans and what more can you want than the cutest Fluffy pin ever!  
Rewards!
Due to the popularity of our Wizarding Cookbook: Year One we have added one last stretch goal!
Special Reward!
Thank you so much for having a look at our Kickstarter campaign. We appreciate the support!
The ForeverMagic Team.

campaign.story:
Hazel is a young witch just starting on her journey of self-discovery, inspired by characters like Kiki in Kiki's Delivery Service, as well as young women I know who have moved far away to find where they belong. Hazel represents our readers, all young women pursuing their dreams, trying to discover how to make them a reality, and cast their own magic on the world. 
What is the Hazel zine all about? 
This issue features the comics, prose, artwork, and how-tos on the theme of Ritual. Each piece interprets the theme in a different way, and all are inspired by finding magic in the everyday, personal growth, and building friendships. About 5.25" x 8.25" (close to your standard digest or manga size), around 70 pages long, and printed on quality paper that brings the artwork to life, Hazel is a beautifully made art magazine on a small scale.
Each artist and writer has created a thoughtful contribution, always illustrated, that brings our reader a little inspiration on how to live daily life a little more magically. Whether it's instructions on a ritual for calming, a relatable story, or a few words about body-mind connection, each piece contributes something special to your day.

We want to be able to pay our artists and writers, and although $50 isn't much for all their hard work, that's what we're starting with. If you want to help us be able to pay everyone closer to what they deserve for their time and skill and their beautiful contributions that help make Hazel give us all the feelings it does, help us spread the word so that we can reach our stretch goals and be able to give more and more. campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Printing is the main challenge for us here. I always want to make Hazel a quality publication that feels good to hold in your hands, and that means having it perfect bound and on a nice weighty paper. This drives up our cost per book, but we hope it makes for an item you will want to keep for years to come.

This year also comes with a new challenge: being able to pay our writers and illustrators. Hazel has always been a fairly small production, so payment has always been given in the form of access to wholesale copies that the contributors can sell in their own shops and at conventions. We have never thought this was enough, but always believed was what was within our means. We know, though, that our readers can see the value of the work that goes into Hazel, and would want to compensate our contributors as much as possible for their incredible talent and hard work, and for the gift of making Hazel happen at all. For 25 artists, $50 each comes out to an additional $1250, on top of our printing costs, which are projected to be in the $1800-2000 range depending on paper type. Kickstarter fees also come into play in our math here, and we always add a little cushion for in case things don't go according to plan. We hope to go above and beyond our commitment to $50 per contributor, and we're counting on the Hazel readers to spread the word and get this wonderful magazine out there so that we can raise enough to make our artists' and writers' lives easier and show them our love. We appreciate anything our readers can do to help, whether that's backing the Kickstarter or telling all your friends. Thank you for being a part of our community and helping us grow!

campaign.story:
Hey everyone, Yaruno here! I’m the writer of the webcomic “Glacias”. The series has been on-going for almost three years and thanks to the support of all the fans and readers we’re finally at the point to try and make Glacias available in print! For the people who don’t know the series yet, you can find out more about it on this page or read it FREE online on Webtoons, Tapas, Webcomics, or Graphite.
Here’s a direct link to  Glacias Chapter One on Webtoons.
This kickstarter is more than just making the series available in print though. We also have a lot of new artwork and collectibles made just for this launch. Most excitingly, if we make our goal, there will finally be a dragon plushy which fans have been asking about for ages!
 Story Synopsis 
Juka is an orphan. Raised by dragons and sheltered from human society, he’s committed to creating a city where both species can live at peace. Together with his dragon, Lyth, he sets out on an incredible adventure...very soon to understand the danger involved in trying to open minds that long have been shut. 
Furthermore, he’ll face much bigger problems than simple prejudice. 
While attempting to teach others that peace is possible, Juka must also evade the Dragon Hunters, whose vow to protect mankind is a pretext for their true motive: obtaining elemental weapons and, with them, power-absolute—enough to seed an age of darkness, dousing the dragon’s flame. 
Can cyclic war be broken by a boy who dares to wish for more? His life, his friend and world depend on ultimate success.
About the Author
A natural storyteller, Yaruno can often be found jotting down ideas for his stories when he isn't studying for college or rock climbing. Yaruno devours manga to sustain his life force, appreciates a strategy game, and enjoys listening to metal music. He started his first story in December 2015 and debuted his first Webtoons story in July of 2016. Since then, he has several published works on Webtoons, Tapas, Webcomics, and Graphite.
About the Artist
Nawa is a building engineer in Finland by day and a comic artist by night. Drawing has been a beloved hobby for Nawa since she was a kid. It was something that eases her mind when she had a lot going on. She remains slightly shy about sharing her artwork, but is so grateful to see people reading and enjoying Glacias, which is the first big art project she's ever worked on. 

PLAY

Random Keychains?

What will we be using the funds for?
Book printing, manufacturing the tier rewards, shipping materials. Kickstarter also takes roughly 8% in processing fees.
Shipping Information and Cost? (MUST READ!!!)
Shipping cost will be charged at the end of the Kickstarter, due to Kickstarter not having a proper system in place for international shipping. We plan to connect with fulfillment carriers at the specific places where products will be shipped. Please be aware, that you will be given a link to Pledge Manager, a platform we are using to organize shipping and fulfillment at the end of the campaign. Also, everyone will most likely have different shipping costs due to distance and location. We are located in the United States, so please put that into consideration when getting a tier. Make sure you have enough for the tier and shipping charges or tax in your specific address. We will be posting a video on this by the next week, detailing the shipping into better detail for transparency sake.

Our goal is to make the shipping as cheap as possible, so we are negotiating with different companies and will have confirmed details soon. 
For international we have found a few solid companies for this and will update very soon on the shipping for those locations. Thank you so much for being patient, we just want to get you the best prices possible and confirmed info regarding it.
Extra details: You can change the amount you have committed to support by adjusting the kickstarter amount, we suggest backers to add the add-on amounts on kickstarter early since it will allow us to hit stretch goals and unlock things for backers to get while the campaign is active.

campaign.story:
Introducing the second volume of Knights of Asherah. Featuring 148 full color pages in a beautiful hardcover binding, the second volume covers several chapters of my graphic novel, which you can read for free, here. However, Volume 2 will feature some brand new artwork and longer chapters than what is currently available to read online. 
Plus it's hardcover and signed, just saying.
As always, this is a project I'm extremely passionate about. Starting  with the  discovery of magic and delving deeper into a dark past, the  story of  Charlotte (AKA Charlie) Ambrose is one about finding  empowerment and inner strength. I have been working on this project since February 2018  and the story has been in the works for several  years now. 
What genre is it, you might ask? Well, it's got a little bit of  everything. Fantasy, magic, a smidgen of action and a dash of romance. 
Magic isn't real.... except that it is.
Charlotte "Charlie" Ambrose discovers that magic is real in the modern world and that she's a descendant of the Celestials; God like beings only known in myths and legend.
Stretch Goal #1 Hit! Page number has been increased to 148!
Stretch Goal #2 Hit! Free gift added to every order. Every physical order receives a free gold enamel pin!
Knights of Asherah Volume #1 specifics:
5.5'' x 8'' hardcover book
148 full color pages
Bonus artwork 
Featuring first several chapters of Knights of Asherah.
Knights of Asherah Volume #2 specifics:
5.5'' x 8'' hardcover book
124 full color pages (this number has been increased to 148)
Bonus artwork 
Featuring several chapters of Knights of Asherah. This is the second volume of many!
The reason the theme of volume 2 is a phoenix is because this signifies the character's first step toward growth. She's been broken down, she's been thrust into a brand new life, and now it's time for her to rise. 
  Volume #1 
 Art Book 
Project Kalopsia, my original art book was our Volume #1 kickstarter  stretch goal. At $18,000 we launched the printing of a 48 page softcover art book. This contains original artwork, behind the scenes content  such as my painting process, sketches and concept art. 
If you missed getting the artbook during the first campaign or you're  a new reader, you can add on the art book to your pledge by hitting  "Manage Your Pledge" at the top. Simply add $12 USD to your total pledge  and it will be included in your rewards!
All artwork and story are by me, Anadia-chan. I'm a one woman show and a freelance artist in Southern Oregon. I'm an artist... so being a little weird comes with the job. I have dedicated every single day for  almost two years toward this project. Art is my passion and I try to  express myself through my stories. I hope you'll enjoy it as much as I  do. Thank you for your support!  
Where are your funds going? I'll break it down for you.

Book printing: $7,277.94 
Rewards (prints, bookmarks, etc): $801.03
Enamel pins: $1,476.53
Shipping materials: $1,120.05

These numbers are based off of the previous kickstarter.
Kickstarter also takes roughly 8% in processing fees. Without the fees I'm estimating it will cost approximately $18,324.51.

Hey everyone! All orders have been shipped out, with an exception of a couple that are blocked due to country border's closing (which will be shipped out as soon as borders open again!) You should have received a personal PM with a tracking number. If you're international, you'll get two tracking numbers. The first is the US number and will track the package until it gets to the shipping facility. The second tracking number is the international number that will track the progress. If anyone has any questions, feel free to message me!

Hey everyone! So far shipping has gone fairly smoothly! About 200 packages have been shipped out in the first batch that went out last week, and I'm seeing that some of you have already gotten them! If you haven't gotten an email with a tracking number from me yet, then your package hasn't been shipped yet and will likely ship within the next 1-3 weeks.
Again, I remind anyone who has an address change to please contact me immediately. Thanks!

It's been a weird and stressful year so far. I hope you're all holding up okay. It's been a perfect storm, everything from manufacturers being shut down to shipping delays due to covid-19. According to the tracking info, the pallet of books has finally passed through customs and will be arriving today!
I'm doing as much as I possibly can to prep for this and get books shipped out as fast as possible. Please note that I'm doing all of this manually and because of the social distancing (which I am respecting, so on that note please know that on my part, I've been in isolation and your books and the insides of the packages are clean) I will be packing things all by myself.

Thank you all for your patience. With the coronavirus outbreak, the entire world is kind of shut down and in chaos. Typically I am told it takes about 3-4 weeks to print over 1,000 books in hardcover and another 6 weeks to ship. I was told that the company I use was already backed up because of the holidays, so when I placed my order back in December they were already backed up. Originally I was told they would be shipped out before January 18th. Apparently they hadn't even started manufacturing them by this given date. January came and went and I was told in February that the government had shut down all factories because of the coronavirus.

I wanted to give everyone a quick update, or rather... the lack of update. I was told by my printer that things would be up and running again by the 10th and have not heard anything from them. They were originally supposed to get my order out by the 18th of January, but everything in China is chaotic and shut down. As soon as I get another update from my printer, I will make sure to let everyone know. Because of all these delays, they timeline will likely be pushed back at least a month or so. It's difficult to say exactly what the timeline will be exactly with this unforeseen tragedy, but I will do my part and keep you all updated and informed on what is happening.

Hey everyone, I wanted to give you all a quick update. I received this from my printer company today and want to keep all of my backers in the loop on what's going on.
"I wanted to write to you with an update about the situation in China and how that will affect the production of your project.
As  a company that primarily contracts with businesses in China, we've been  keeping a close eye on the issues surrounding the Coronavirus. As you  are probably aware the Coronavirus has spread throughout China and the  Chinese government is working to contain the virus and reduce the spread  by controlling the travel of its citizens. We've gotten word from our  office in Shenzhen that the government is not allowing factories to  reopen business as originally planned at the end of the Chinese New  Year, but is extending that date to at least the 10th of February as an  attempt to curb the spread of the virus.

Thank you all so much for your patience. Currently I am waiting as anxiously as you are. Artwork is completed but I'm finishing up the finalized formatting and waiting on my editor to make sure everything flows smoothly. There would be nothing worse than publishing it and finding a typo after printing! 
Since my last project, my editor has picked up a lot more professional work and is editing many projects now. She is amazing, but my project isn't the highest priority for her. So I'm doing everything that I can to get things 100% ready for publishing and doing finalized touch ups on my end. Digital PDFs will be sent out as soon as I get the okay from my editor (and of course after making any suggested edits and fixes my editor has for me!)

campaign.story:
In the late Eight-Hundreds, the human population in Northern Europe drops drastically. This threat only leaves lands of ravaged corpses and is projected to wipe out the Northern Hemisphere in the year 895. Our story takes place in 888 with a young man named Per and his friend Frie as interact with two new travelers who have arrived in a small Nordic town in the middle of nowhere.
     Bluecoda is an R-rated Fantasy comic that takes place in a Fairy tale Sweden that's losing all of its magic, as a dense forest seems to suffocate anything in its path. This issue is the first of three for the Enemy Unknown arc and clocks in at 30 pages. The series is for adults as it contains nudity, language, violence, and topics that may be uncomfortable for readers. I am not going for shock value when I say this it is all part of the story. That said, an uncompromising story like this would NEVER be published by mainstream publishers, so that's why I'm here.  
Per, Frie, Yuan, Aria
    So, who's who? 
     Per is a refugee from the first village to be affected by the threat. He works to better his and Frie's living conditions by trying to track down creatures he knew in his previous village, and to get out of the hostile one his new home has become. 
     Frie is Per's only friend, as he was the one who saved her from the raid of their last village. However, because of the town's disdain for him, she works as a prostitute to pay for his protection. 
     Yuan is a pale traveler with a vast knowledge of monsters and admires Per's vision of coexistence. However, he does question Per's actions, as it seems they contradict his words of peace.
     Aria is another traveler who appears to use magic and has a blunt fondness for Frie. However, she and Yuan seem to have a long history.

Devil's Candy is a horror-themed action/comedy comic for teens by the ghoulish duo of Rem and Bikkuri.  Help us print the first book of the webcomic Devil's Candy--plus a full-color artbook! 
In a world of monsters and mayhem, a young genius imp named Kazu Decker constructs a human-like girl for his 9th grade science project. Naming her Pandora, he introduces her to his hellish high school, Hemlock Heart Academy. 
The comic follows the duo's daily struggles as Pandora becomes more familiar with this surreal locale. Fortunately for them, Pandora's stoic nature and seemingly limitless strength, paired with Kazu's luck, knowledge, and friends, gets them out of trouble almost as often as it gets them mixed up with some macabre mystery.
The sometimes sweet and always strange webcomic Devil's Candy has been published online since 2014. It can be read here, currently published in partnership with Hiveworks. The comic is known for its rich backgrounds and stylistic paneling inspired by shonen manga. Every page is produced on paper with ink before being scanned, making its lavish attention to detail an even more impressive feat.
Rem and Bikkuri form the team behind Devil's Candy. They were summoned forth from the deepest night with botched sorcery, but once on Earth, decided that making comics would be fun. Rem penned the SOULLESS manga for Yen Press and won both the grand prize of Tokyopop's first Rising Stars of Manga contest and the grand prize of Morning Magazine’s International Manga Competition; she currently works as an artist, character designer, and illustrator in comics and video games, including WayForward's River City Girls. Bikkuri is a prolific manga adapter, voice actor, and script writer for Sentai Filmworks and FUNimation who has worked on series such as One Piece and Ghost in the Shell.  
All you boos, vamps, and ghouls out there...it's time for the goods! 
The goal of this Kickstarter is to print two books. Firstly, Devil's Candy Book 1! Assembling the first three chapters + bonuses, Book 1 is to be a 6x9 softcover book with 188 pages in black and white, with a few color inserts. 
Secondly, we'll be printing an official Devil's Candy artbook for the series! Over 100 pages of full color content that includes illustrations, character designs, studies, commentary, and tutorials. A must-have for any fans of the series or aspiring artists!
In addition to the two books, backers can get digital editions, special merchandise, and even original art on various tiers.

Some of the reward designs are not quite completed - but below you will find the designs for the die-cut holographic finish sticker, the bookplate, and the art-in-progress for the front side of the 3 bookmarks, designed and drawn by Judy Jong (aka Juby), author of Cut Time.
Finally, here are the tiers - backers can select whichever one they like! The three highest tiers that include special personalized rewards such as bookplates, original artwork, and demon design privileges are only available in limited quantities! 
Thank you for helping us print Devil's Candy! Be sure to check out Rem's work on Twitter, Instagram, and Patreon, and to give the comic a read.
Additional credit: The music used in the video is Spooky Spook 3 by PeriTune and can be found here. Special thanks to Megan Lavey-Heaton and Rhiannon R.S. for all the color correction and pre-press work on the comic and artbook, and to Hiveworks and Lianne Sentar for preparing and managing the Kickstarter!

campaign.story:
One day, the citizens of Treehollow discovered a small, strange creature wandering alone in Rattleglen Forest. Clearly much too young to be on her own, and with limited verbal communication skills (though she gets by with a little sign language), it’s anyone’s guess how this mysterious being, named Tamberlane, ended up in their care.
Fostered by Belfry, the accident-prone bat with a heart of gold, and guided by a colorful cast of animal characters, Tamberlane’s mysteries continue to unfold. But one question remains on everyone’s mind: who (or more specifically, what) is she?
Chapter 3 Summary
The citizens of Treehollow are preparing to host the region’s annual Sovereign Festival for the first time in 12 years. Belfry and Tess must resolve their fight, and soon, because they have to work a festival booth together. Meanwhile, Oakewood and his godson Milo are deep in the process of learning about Tamberlane, observing her in experimental situations in hopes of getting closer to unlocking the mystery of her origin.
Tamberlane is an ongoing LGBTQIA+ created comic that updates every Wednesday and is rated PG13. Want to try before you buy? Read it here for FREE! 
You’ll love Tamberlane if you also enjoy stories like:
Redwall

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The comic is already done, the files are already completed, and I have ample experience in crowdfunding, having successfully finished 6 previous campaigns. I've also been successfully fulfilling orders for my online shop and Patreon, I've got a streamlined fulfillment process, and a handful of helpers to get through it all.

However, there is always a risk with a crowdfunding project. As I'm hoping to have the books in my hands, fulfilled, and ready to sell before GeekGirlCon (November 16-17 in Seattle!), the turnaround is very tight. My aim is to be sure the rewards are in the mail before I head out to vend, but that may not be possible if there are delays. I've tried to build in a bit of a time buffer, but it's still tighter than I’d like!

In addition, my health goes up and down. I struggle with chronic pain and fatigue that can sometimes kill my ability to work for days at a time. If it strikes at the wrong time, fulfillment may be delayed. Plus, manufacturers can sometimes take longer than I anticipated.

But for all of that, as long as this kickstarter is funded, there is zero possibility it will not be fulfilled. I'm a hard worker with a proven track record. If you back this Kickstarter, you're backing a safe bet.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Cover by Nick Robles!
Death is, truly, the one thing we all have in common. But that doesn't make it easy to talk about.
None of us can agree on what happens after the end comes, or about how much we should think about it beforehand, or even what death should mean to the living. But who says there's anything wrong with that? Not us.
This Iron Circus Comics anthology features a line-up of cartoonists, both new and notable, relating their favorite stories, myths, hopes, and suspicions about death, dying, and even The Great Beyond.
Featuring a foreword from the New York Times bestselling author (Smoke Gets in Your Eyes: And Other Lessons from the Crematory, From Here to Eternity: Traveling the World to Find the Good Death) and founder of death positivism herself, Caitlin Doughty, YouTube's very own Ask a Mortician, YOU DIED upholds the Iron Circus tradition of uniquely intriguing subject matter and artful execution in this frank and honest exploration of what it means to be "death-positive."
We're keeping it simple, because simple is always best with Kickstarters.
 $10 gets backers a DRM-free PDF of YOU DIED: An Anthology of the Afterlife.
 $20 snags a DRM-free PDF and paperback copy of YOU DIED: An Anthology of the Afterlife. 
And JUST 50 BACKERS will get the traditional Iron Circus Comics EARLY BIRD SPECIAL: a DRM-free PDF and paperback copy of YOU DIED: An Anthology of the Afterlife, with FREE DOMESTIC and HALF-PRICE INTERNATIONAL SHIPPING!
Currently slated to appear in YOU DIED:
 Holly Adkins (Agnes and Patsy)
 Ahueonao (Inanna's Descent to the Underworld)
 Oliver Northwood (Ghost Friend)
 Shae Beagle (Herd)
 Luyi Bennett (Here Among the Chrysanthemums)
 S Case (Remember)
 Sally Cantirino & Jordan Alsaqa (The Spark Divine)
Angela Cole & Cheryl Young (I Promise)
 Dani Colman & Maddie Kathleen (Hive Mind)
 Danielle Emile Varona Chuatico (All Souls' Day)
 Rhandi Fisher (Many Happy Returns!)
 Grace Fong & Rhiannon Rasmussen-Silverstein (BONE INK) 
 Casey Gilly & Raina Telgemeier (A Funeral in Foam)
 Ale Green & Fanny Rodriguez (Still Life) 
 Karoline Grønvik (Good Mourning) 
 A. "Miru" Lee (Third Option)
 Laura Ketcham (Peat, Bone, Oak)
 Juliette GMM López (Wreath)
 James Maddox & Jeremy Lawson (Beyond the Cosmos)
 Isabelle Melancon & Megan Lavey-Heaton (The Ankou)
 Nadia Shammas & Lisa Sterle (You Called to Me)
 M. Cat. White (First Law)
 Letty Wilson (What Eats Us)

 This makes for 24 stories, and over 240 pages of comics.
Iron Circus was the first publisher to include Kickstarter-based bonuses as a part of their projects. We're continuing that tradition of rewarding our creators here.
This pre-order event will determine the bonuses of our authors. That bonus is a $5.00 page rate increase every $5,000 the Kickstarter makes over goal. That means the more work an artist has put in, the more they stand to make. This is on top of the page rates they've already earned, and there's no cap on potential pay.
Pre-ordering YOU DIED here on Kickstarter directly benefits the creators and the work you love!
YOU DIED has only one stretch goal: a cover enhancement at $25,000!
We would love to add some gloss or foil to Nick Roble's amazing cover art. But beyond that, we're sticking with what we love to do: pad our creators' payouts.
We have an unprecedented line-up of jaw-dropping talent in YOU DIED. Here's just a small taste of what you can expect!

Beyond the Cosmos, by James Maddox & Jeremy Lawson
Inanna's Descent to the Underworld, by Ahueonao
Good Mourning, by Karoline Grønvik
What Eats Us, by Letty Wilson
Ghost Friend, by Oliver Northwood
Kickstarter graphics by C. Spike Trotman and Matt Sheridan. Cover art by Nick Robles. Interior pages by Casey Gilly, Raina Telgemeier, Ahueonao, Karoline Grønvik, Letty Wilson, AND Olivier Northwood.

updates.update_content:
Happy Saturday, everyone!

We're just checking in to let everyone know: if you have completed our Backerkit survey, you order (barring orders with address issues we'll have to troubleshoot on a case-by-case basis, about 100 orders out of the ~4,000  total we fulfilled across three projects) is IN THE MAIL.

updates.update_userinfo: You have 48 HOURS to fill out your Backerkit survey/update your addresses! Shipping begins SOON!
updates.update_content:
IT'S FINALLY HAPPENING, everybody!
After a long, long wait, for which we are eternally grateful you have all sat through with endless patience and grace:  Fulfillment of this project is about to begin.
If you have yet to fill out your Backerkit survey— and 84 of you still have not— please do so within the next 48 hours. Click this link! Remember to use your Kickstarter-associated email.

Hey, all. Spike here.
Don't get too excited, this is a quick, li'l, Kickstarter-mandated update.
This account was founded in 2009, the year Kickstarter launched, under the name "IronSpike." The name I used everywhere, so that was only natural.

Hello again, everyone. Spike here.
I wish I had better news, but there isn't any.
Our fulfillment agent, Blackbox, underwent a change of leadership in 2020, and things have been more difficult since. The system is different, as is the warehouse location and contacts. This has tacked months onto a process we're accustomed to taking two to three weeks.

Heya, folks. Spike here again. Here's what's going on!
If you haven't filled out your Backerkit Survey for YOU DIED, you need to do that ASAP. You can do it here.
https://you-died-an-anthology-of-the-afterlife.backerkit.com/
We are not using Kickstarter surveys for this! You must fill out your Backerkit survey.  We're still waiting on nearly 100 backers to complete the survey.

updates.update_userinfo: Still waiting on +100 Backers to complete their Backerkit surveys! PLUS: Fulfillment schedule!
updates.update_content:
Hey again, folks. Spike here! Just posting a quick update to make sure we're all on the same page.
Some bullet points:
The books are now scheduled to hit our distributor warehouse March 3rd. 
We will ship them from that warehouse to our fulfillment house, Black Box. Expect that to take a week or two!

updates.update_userinfo: 10% of backers still have not completed their surveys! Are you among them?
updates.update_content:
Hey again, everybody! Spike here.
A little while back, I sent out an email and posted a link to the Backerkit survey that would get everybody set up for fulfillment. However, 1 in 10 of our backers have still not completed their surveys!
No worries! We get it, it's been THAT kind of year.

updates.update_userinfo: BACKERKIT SURVEYS ARE OUT. Have you filled out yours?
updates.update_content:
Hey again, folks! Spike here. And finally, finally, FINALLY, we're ready to begin fulfillment!
Backerkit surveys have gone out to everyone who backed the Kickstarter. If you didn't get the email, Click the link below and enter your Kickstarter-associated email.
https://you-died-an-anthology-of-the-afterlife.backerkit.com/

Hey again, folks. Spike here. Got some bad news incoming.
As everyone knows, we're in the middle of a pandemic, which began in China. Iron Circus prints in China, and a lot, if not all, of the plants we use shut down for several weeks at the beginning of the crisis. Ever since, they've been playing catch-up, trying to get back on top of jobs they've had to reschedule. And, despite our best efforts, despite pushing the release date as far as we thought it would need? YOU DIED is another casualty of that compromised schedule.

updates.update_userinfo: Sneak-peek of the cover effect we decided on! Wait until you see THIS.
updates.update_content:
Hello, folks! Spike here.
When the Kickstarter for YOU DIED launched, we proposed, and hit, a stretch goal for a nice cover enhancement. At the time, we were considering something like embossing or a foil effect, to really show off Nick Roble's already-amazing art. 
But our print tech had other, much better ideas. As this final round of proofs demonstrates!

campaign.story:
Hi there! I’m FopDoodles (or Basil) and I’ve been a fan of a certain angel and demon for five years... I fell in love again recently and came up with a crazy idea to get loads of other creatives together to create a visual love letter to the show. 

This art booklet, or zine, features art, stories and poems depicting Aziraphale and Crowley from Eden to the present day via the War, Magic Shows and more.
The physical copy will be an A5 professionally printed 40 page book filled with gorgeous art, stories and the odd poem, and is being lovingly made by fans for fans.


Final cover image!

Some previews of the art you might see inside... 

The Angels and Demons responsible

L-R
kahahuna art, atarial, ratcork, lightsintheskye, pinkpastelworld, narvinisanangrypenguin, loloztya, smoketart, aiwa-sensai, luxrisart, xinophin, rivars.studio, andycwhite, aivelin, novapt.2, mariemarionnn, _mennelaos, thistlearts, whittledraws, astriloquiis, valmmies, eugiius, bebeezed, findusart, parkinart, lifewhatisthat, Magpie Kina, boneandarrowart, l3earfat, MD_Doodles, laloom0, miamiero, Lillee.nika, purpletealeaf, jahawk1995, lizthefrizzz, rosyabomination, bananacustardcostuming, and me - FopDoodles!

Due to the popularity I’ve added in another 3 brand new contributors!  Check them out!
Magpie Kina, Lillee.Nika and Miamiero!
  You guys are in for a TREAT!
 Some MORE previews!!
Merch available so far...


Merch artists are - bath omens/kahahunaart, eugiius, lightsintheskye, nakatadraws, xinophin, ratcork, lifewhatisthat, astriloquiis, Andy.c.white, _mennelaos, bebeezed, boneandarrowart and Luxris!


If you fancy getting your hands on any of these heavenly bundles of goodness (sorry Crowley) then consider backing us! Or maybe just share the link amongst your fellow demons and we’ll see you all in October.


Important points —
THE ZINE IS RATED A PG.
It ships from the U.K. EXCEPT THE SOAPS WHICH WILL BE SENT SEPARATELY FROM THE US.
SHIPPING OCTOBER 2019.
ZINE IS A5.
ALL THE CONTRIBUTORS ARE ON INSTAGRAM OR TWITTER - GO FOLLOW THEM?

updates.update_userinfo: Donation done, damaged packaging, extra copies and more!
updates.update_content:
Hello!
So good news first- first major donation has been sent across and we're almost the £2k level. I'm going to be selling the last few copies at events up and down the country this year with an "honesty box" where people can donate as much as they're able, so hopefully we'll be well into £3000 by the start of 2021!
Secondly, if you were one of the three people whose packages arrived damaged, I'm finally getting the compensation from the Royal Mail so I will be resending out the damaged books and stickers this fortnight.

Hello!
All tiers have now been posted, howver they seem to be taking up to 6 weeks to arrive in some cases because, well, its nearly christmas and theres a lot of things being posted.

Please be patient and hopefully itll be with you soon!

Hi there guys!
So I thought I'd do a blanket update because everyday I'm logging on to 20+ messages from folks asking where their zines are.
I unfortunately had a pretty bad case of the flu which meant I was bedridden for 10 days so I couldn't get out to post things. Luckily I'm better now but playing serious catch up between this project and my actual job.

Hey guys! 
PLEASE don't forget to peel the paper backing adhesive layers off both sides of your charms, if applicable!

I've had a few of you guys messaging me panicking about the quality- don't worry! It's not ruined- just gotta peel them. I leave them on to protect them in transit, so they get to you not scratched up!

ANOTHER UPDATE- Sorry if im boring you guys, I just like to keep you all updated!
SO- the top two tiers are all going out tomorrow. Most are already on their way but I’ve another 50 in a sack in my hallway ready for me to haul to the post office tomorrow!
The other two tiers I’m working my way through with about ⅓ of them on their way or about to be posted. Sorry it’s taking so long- in the end the most cost efficient way was to send them via Royal Mail but that requires me carrying hundreds of heavy parcels on the train every week, and individually packing up over 500 packages so it’s taking me a while!

SO the zines arrived today and they are beautiful. They've done a great job making the art work look stunning on their thick silky pages. Heavenly.
The charms and stickers are arriving today which is the last of the items I'm waiting for, which means...
The digital rewards will be messaged out this week and into the beginning of Nov- As you can imagine it's quite time consuming having to juggle over 600 orders by myself! This also leads into my next point- I don't drive so I am going to have to send the packages out in small batches because I need to be able to carry them and they are pretty bulky! (Even with roping in my other half to carry a bag or two.) So if you notice people starting to receive theirs towards the beginning of Nov but you still haven't had yours- never fear! They are on their way to you very soon.

So my house is full of boxes, packaging and bubble wrap.. Which can only mean one thing! We are so close to fulfillment!
I’m just waiting for a few more pieces of merch to be sent across and I can start sending out the parcels- they should all be posted out the final week of Oct/beginning of Nov with a very limited run available for purchase through my etsy store- FopDoodles- from Nov onwards.

Hello everyone! Well that was a mad few months. Twelve weeks ago I had the idea and now all these artists have come together to create something marvellous. Seriously, I’ve now seen all the art and it is phenomenal. With thanks to Michael Sheen and the Good Omens teams on Twitter for helping to support this little passion project.
The next step is this- I’m awaiting Kickstarter to take their fees and send me the funds. Then I’ll be sending off everything to the array of printers across the country to get your books, stickers, pins and charms all made up.

Thank you all so much for pledging - I cannot believe we’ve hit 10k! 
I have seen everybody’s WIPs and my gosh you are in for a treat and a half. The art is beautiful, just stunning. I can’t believe how talented everyone is!
Now we’ve reached 400 orders every physical copy of the zine now also comes with a charm AND a brand new postcard on top of everything else in your bundle!
